comment: GOOD RIDDANCE

Started this class with effectively no previous chem knowledge and was able to do rlly well by utilizing SI and recitation. RPC are very generous and can change your exam grade by basically an entire letter grade.
She was my nightmare for the whole year.

Tainting the school & teaching community. Doesn't even have a chemistry degree/background experience. "My background is in the humanities--my PhD is in Slavic linguistics from Brown--but I would say that teaching is teaching." No, do not simplify teaching, effective teaching is complex and takes lots of skill that she clearly does not have.

She's pretty good at explaining Chemistry but she is pretty mean. I did ok in the class and was still met with her coldness and guilt-tripping. Studying infringed on all of my time outside class despite having done well on the AP Chemistry test. The one time I went to her office hours, I was spooked away for the rest of the year.

Dr. Novak does an amazing job at teaching chemistry and cares about her students. The lectures and recitations are engaging and clear. You need to put in time and effort to do well in the class, but you will feel like you learned a lot in the end. If you do all the suggested problems and show up to lectures and recitations, you can easily do well.
She completely ruined my love for Chemistry. Not only is her class impossibly difficult, she does not explain anything. Rule of thumb, don't take it.
Two glowing 5-star reviews both posted on the exact same day?? Seems pretty convenient. The fact that authentic reviews aren't good enough for Dr. Novack should speak for itself.
Yes, her material is tough but she really cares about her students and genuinely wants us to succeed.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: She is literally the only professor that actually taught me something at Brandeis. She does genuinely care about her students even if she shows it through suggesting a huge amount of preparation for learning topics. Her tests are very difficult but she taught the material very well.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment:
"If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough." --Albert Einstein

Enough said

Unlike other professors she very clearly ignores all student feedback during the class and in course evaluations. Her "teaching methods" are always inflexible and just based around the same library of comic sans slides and endless calculations. You don't learn science in this course, because all she teaches is math that happens to be used in chem.

Insanely difficult. Yeah the content is difficult by nature but her personality is more difficult than the chemistry tbh. Definitely not a people person and needs to gain a passion for teaching and learn to stop playing favorites with the SI leaders
Huge pain. Inconsiderate and uncaring. Might know her stuff but has no chemistry degree or actual teaching experience beyond this one class and it shows.

This class is brutal. I would say 95% of my first semester was taken up by studying for this class. While I did receive an A- it was an absolutely brutal experience with many mental breakdowns a week.
She is mean and does not teach. She makes students feel stupid for asking questions.

The class is very hard (at least for me); as soon as you slip, its very hard to catch up bec she never stops for anyone. I did not want it to come to this but I got to a point where I did not have enough time to raise my grade and dropped. It pushed my premed path a year back & now need to do summer classes to stay on track. You're in for a ride.
worst professor at brandeis. avoid at all costs.
don't even waste your time. take this class somewhere else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This is the single hardest professor I have had at Brandeis. She is someone who you need to get to know and establish rapport so that when you are struggling she knows you and can help guide you. I would say that's the biggest thing. But for the first class of college, I would say it is a very big awakening to what college is like.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof Novak is a deeply unpleasant person. She seems to think that students who are struggling are just lazy, and is entirely unwilling to consider the possibility that chemistry is just hard for some people. Her class does have a very generous curve so numerically you should be fine, but be prepared to have a truly horrible time in this class.

lectured were hard to understand as the year progressed. Practice questions were difficult to complete at times, and even with the help of other students, I found this to be by far one of the worst general chem courses ever taken. If you are taking this class, it will not set you well efficiently for organic chemistry for the next academic year.
did not support students, you can tell she had insensitive favoritism and did nothing but complain all year. Made my get chem experience a living hell on earth.

The best professors are those who have a passion for the subject they teach, have genuine experience in the field, and care about their students. Novack has none of these, only her own self-hatred and familial issues that she projects onto the students whose futures she attempts to gatekeep.

If you want to do well in this class, or succeed in future science courses at Brandeis, you absolutely must get yourself into Novack's good graces. Do whatever it takes—pretend to like chemistry, fawn over slavic linguistics, laugh at her jokes that target struggling students. Once she sees her old self in you, you will succeed.

Some students think that the reason their peers do badly is because they skip class, which is something Dr. Novack likes to tell the people who come to her office hours. The fact is that office hours attendance "matters" speaks to who she is as a person, and how prevalent favoritism is in her class. Has serious attitude problems, but doesn't care.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Don't go into this class with the attitude that it will be the worst class of your life. It is hard, but not impossible. Take advantage of every resource she gives you, and attend her office hours whenever possible. Forming a relationship with her early on will work out in your favor. Although attendance isn't mandatory, do NOT habitually skip.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: As someone who did not like chemistry at all, Dr Novack's chemistry class really broke down the concepts in a way that I understood. In terms of assessments, if you prepare and do all the practice assignments & tests, you should be fine. Pro-tip: don't wait till you're struggling/falling before you go for office hours. Also, ask questions :).

she hard as hell. like really hard. you gotta read and do hella practice or just fall behind and have no chance to catch up. There is no break. Her exams are extremely difficult, but she is a generous grader and and even more generous extra credit giver, but she doesn't give free points. You gotta prove you know the material. Prepare to work hard
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Tough

Dr. Novack is an excellent teacher because she pushes you to work hard and earn your grades. She knows what she's doing and while the course is tough and a lot of work, it's worth it for the chemistry and work ethic you pick up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Has a serious ego problem, from the looks of it. Is condescending in office hours and rude to students in class. Has very clear favorites, which tend to be the students who already took AP Chem and who learn best from the textbook. If you don't like to feed her ego and can't learn from reading an entire textbook, then you're in for a rough ride.

Took this class with AP chem under my belt and some self-study so for me the level of difficulty was not so ridiculou, but Novak was. She had to correct me when I called her a professor and not a "doctor". Later learned she holds no chemistry degrees and has her doctorate in Slavic Languages. She is super not kind and not helpful, a bad teacher.
Just awful. All I have to say. The worst teacher I've ever had. Truly unkind.
This is the "Welcome to Brandeis, prepare to grind" class. She will not hold back at all. Whatever you think that you need to do, double it.
Difficult class and material, fast paced, no breaks, sometimes uncaring for students during class but seems to be available to meet occasionally.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: My friends in organic chem have said that that class is easier than Chem 11 which really says a lot. Dr. Novack seems nice sometimes but everyone is terrified of her because she judges of students who don't understand or who are having trouble keeping up. Recitations/SI focus on worked examples and are useless if you struggle with the fundamentals.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: A perfect example of how to poorly integrate new students to college. General chemistry (a class that most STEM majors will probably take) is unnecessarily difficult for an entry level class. The tests are insanely difficult even with hours of study time and students are expected to conform to Dr. Novack's inconvenient schedule.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Although good at lectures and a wonderfully nice woman, Dr Novak makes this course impossibly hard on purpose, as she has even said before in lecture the previous Gen Chem teacher was too easy. A challenging class and teacher but once you get a good grade you know you've earned it (if you ever get one!).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Novack is probably salty that she didn't make it to medical school, so she tries to make Chem as difficult as possible to weed out any students that actually hope to be successful in science. Like a lot of the other reviews have said, she makes it a point to come across as abrasive and rude, and doesn't really seem to be interested in teaching.

Some people (perhaps including the chemistry department) don't seem to realize that Claudia doesn't actually have any degrees in chemistry. As a result, she seems to feel the need to convince students she knows what she's doing, so she grades far too harshly. She fancies her class difficult, and intentionally comes across as rude in class and out.
Really great person, but chem is hard and you will need to work for your grade. It is definitely not an easy course, but she is accessible and wants you to do well if you work hard

gen chem made me question my sanity and my love of science as a whole. Novack is an amazing teacher and maybe the smartest person on earth, but damn did those tests ruin my life. I took the W because I would have died if I finished the class. If you thought it was an easy A, screw you. But, if you can handle it, gen chem will teach you everything
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: She is such a nice person if you are clearly trying. If you put in effort and show her that through attending recitation and SI, she will WANT to help you. Chemistry is hard. Point blank. You wont be handed an A like you may have been in high school. But she isn't mean because of it.

Dr. Novak comes across as a nice lady but she is not. This was one of the hardest classes I've ever taken. You will not catch me ever taking a class with her again. If you have her, good luck. She makes Gen Chem so much harder than it has to be.
Easy A

Dr. Novack is a really great professor. As long as you do the readings and understand the readings, most problems should come intuitively. If you understand all practice problems, skip recitation until the Wednesday of the exam, where she sometimes gives test questions away. Very accessible outside of class, generally biases exceptional students.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Chemistry is hard, and I think that's the challenge for most students, including myself. Dr. Novack teaches a difficult course that prepares you to be a good college student. It helped me realize that if you want to pursue a science career you need to put in the work and that is what this class sets you up for.

Not a very nice person, and her class is very hard. However, her lectures are usually put together pretty well. Her exam averages are usually low, however she will curve the class to have an average of B-. Take honors chem if you have the chance.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Hard Class, great professor! It is easy to mix hard class with bad professor, this is not the case. Novack will knock you down with her exams (many exam averages around 45%), but you have to get back up if you want to succeed. Tough curve. You will have learned so much by the end of the year though. Don't be afraid to pick up exams.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Engaging lectures, but she's not a friendly person to talk to during office hours, she's a bit condescending. One of the hardest classes I've taken. She expects a lot from you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Great class! Chemistry is really hard but Dr. Novack knows that and its as doable as the class can be as a subject. She was amazing in office hours and recitation! Go to recitation and SI sessions. The SI leaders broke down the material and helped me pass at all!
Very difficult class. Quizzes are done in groups out of necessity not because "she's nice". Is often condescending to students in lecture, particularly after a test.
Novack was the toughest teacher I have ever met. She was unkind the tests were impossible.

Amazing professor but demands a lot. Easily the toughest class I have taken at Brandeis. Her lectures are very engaging. One of the best professors at Brandeis. She not only taught me Chemistry, she taught me how to be a good student in college.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: My main problem with her is that her powerpoint presentations/lectures offer nothing new that wasn't covered in the textbook. Wouldn't mind her using powerpoints if she broke down material, not just copy+paste the textbook. Horrible lecturer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I started off the year struggling in this class, but now I am doing so much better! GO TO RECITATION AND SI!!!!!! The more work you put in, the better you will do! Dr. Novack is really motivational too, just get to know her

Great class! Dr. Novack is super approachable and friendly! Go to office hours and get to know her and go to recitation. Study and take weekly quizzes seriously to help keep up with the material on the level tested.

Dr. Novack is an unbelievable professor and person. She is so smart and is able to answer questions both inside and outside of chemistry. She wants every student to succeed and grow whether they will pursue chemistry or not. Go to office hours and get to know her. Recitations help too and go to as many as you can in a given week!
She gives great slides but only answers questions during recitations instead of office hours.....
Good lecturer but not a nice person.

One of the best teachers I have ever had. You will learn an incredible amount of Chemistry in her class. She is most certainly a tough grader, but curves fairly. She knows the names of mostly everyone in our class of 250 students.
Amazing teacher, gets a bad rep because of the toughness of the class but really cares about the success of students
very tough teacher - often unnecessarily so. My friends in Gen Chem at other schools don't have nearly as difficult tests as novack gave us.
Tests are tough but the group quizzes are the best!  You have to study but you can get an A.  And the curve is perfect!

Shes a great lecturer. She really devotes alot of her time to help her students understand. This is a hard course, no doubt but chemistry is a hard subject itself. I am a student that had a very hard time with chemistry but I had to work for the grades. Novack and her slides made it alot easier. Really enjoyed having her.

Helps those who understand and leaves the rest behind. Will bluntly tell you that not everyone is good enough for medical school (though not everyone taking chem wants to be a doctor) and tests are ridiculously difficult. NOT a good professor and not a nice person.
Really good class. You have to be studying continuously. Go to recitations and SI. Her office hours are good for motivation.
The tests are fair, and Novak teaches in a clear manner. Her grading is fair. Attend lectures, and 2-3 recitations a week, and do the practice, and you'll be fine. It is a lot of work.
Class is a LOT of work but Novak is a great professor and if you put in the work you will do well in her class. DON'T get behind or its
She is awful. Least favorite teacher I've had at Brandeis, and worst class I have taken. She picks favorites and her tests are ridiculous. She ruined chemistry for me

She wants you to succeed. Has helpful recitations all the time. Suggest you do practice problems (I didn't). Also partner quizzes really do help you learn. But do try to learn material before you go to the quizzes. Her tests are hard, you cannot just know the material you have to know and understand the concepts. Do not hesitate to get her help.

I think she is compensating for the fact that she has a PhD in slavic languages, and not chemistry. So she makes the test difficult and hard to understand, and the only way you can do well is if you go to recitation, which not everybody can. It's messed up. Some people like her, I cannot stand her or this class.

Sure she's a tough teacher, but she knows her stuff and her information is clear. Just because she doesn't cut you any slack doesn't make her a bad teacher, it just makes you work harder and actually know the material.

She gives really hard tests and quizzes, but she is there to help and does want you to succeed. You will have to work harder than you've ever worked before, especially if you don't have a good background in chemistry in high school. But it is possible to pass and she does her own recitations. GO TO RECITATION!
This course goes at a really fast pace. If you fall behind, too bad because you're not catching up.
AWFUL teacher. Does NOT know chemistry. In fact, she's not even a chemist: she took a couple of Chem courses after getting a PhD on... Slavic languages. Avoid if you can.

She is a fantastic professor who clearly knows her subject inside and out. Her lectures are meant to help understand concepts while the recitation is used to do practice problems. Many people find recitation more helpful because it closely resembles what she asks on tests. Keep in mind that the subject is difficult so expect to work hard.
Awesome lecturer, but her tests are very difficult. Make sure to do the problem sets, and go to recitation. Go to her office hours, she's really cool

She is the best teacher ever!! Her lecture is fantastic. As long as you go to the recitation, you will ace the class. She really makes you to understand the material. If you hope to get As by memorization, good luck with that.

Nice Teacher but exams were way too hard and sometimes even inconsistent with what was said was going to NOT be included in exams. READ the book and DO the problems in book. They help a lot. She is approachable in her office hours.

I loved Professor Novak. She worked with the students and made sure that we understood everything. It was a big difference from first semester Professor Popchapsky. I feel like I understand the concepts of Chemistry. Attend office hours and recitation and you will be fine.

just go to recitation everyday, lecture is useless. exams test you on abstract parts of the material that is unnecessarily detailed. curving to a C+/B- in gen chem is absurd. take this class over the summer at a different school unless you want a C.

Besides doing the homework problems she has assigned and the practice exam, i still feel that it is possible to do well in the class. As long as you do not do your homework last minute before exams,i feel that it is quite possible to do well

I just wanted to reply to one of the comments here so as to not allow readers to get a false impression. Novack's test ARE very abstract but knowing "concepts" won't save you. Go to RECITATION (and class--pop quizzes). She has a terrible, nearly incomprehensible teaching style and has a latent catty side. It likes to come out sometimes.

I did well in the class and her teaching style was okay, but I didn't like the fact that she made attendance mandatory for this lecture-based class. Though recitation was optional, she only taught useful exam info during these sessions, which I find very sneaky/underhanded. It seemed like she only wanted a certain type of student to succeed.

I did well in her class, but didn't like her teaching style. Enforcing people to attend the class by making pop quizzes is ridiculous. We're in college, and people have different study habit; one might do well just by reading the text. If she had time to make like 5 different versions for a single quiz, why didn't her make any practice exams?!?!

People who dislike her did poorly because they didn't come to class or were still stuck in high school-like study habits.  She approaches concepts like a person who learned chemistry, not just a person who was good at it - and this approach is essential for students! If she sees that you are trying to do well, she works a lot harder in your favor.

she is AWFUL. she has CLEAR favorites and her tests are so abstract that they are impossible to study for. Everyone does badly and she just gives good grades to the people she likes. Learn how to suck up really hard!
She tries really hard to be helpful and make the material understandable, but her tests are pretty tricky and abstract. Know the concepts, not the problems, and always come to class! (pop quizzes!)

One of the nicest, most helpful, and most engaging instructors you could possibly ask for. I can't remember the names of the vast majority of my professors, but I was honored to take three courses with Professor Coiner. He is not only brilliant and not only willing to give you the shirt off his back, he made economics interesting and exciting.

Definitely taught some interesting things about the economics of the educational sector and really helped me conceptualize many abstract ideas regarding the education sector as a whole and what problems it faces. He is well liked among the general studentry because his practice exams frequently use actual test questions. You shouldn't do poorly.
Professor Coiner is now retired, and I had the great honor of taking the last section he taught at the university. Unforgettably great experience.

Prof. Coiner is by far my favorite professor. Before college I hate economics, but taking class with him this semester, I look forward to econ class everyday and want to major in it! He approaches complex theories with abundant examples and if you take reading and homework seriously and do the practice problems before test, you will feel at ease.
Coiner is the best professor I had so far, I am grateful for having taken economics 10A with him.
He is dope
Coiner is a great professor, does a great job balancing the work load outside of class with in class coverage of material. Highly recommend his classes

Honestly, I am only three weeks into his class... However, I can already tell that he always comes with a positive attitude and is excited to teach. He keeps the students focused and involved and is not boring whatsoever! Funny guy too! Note taking is certainly helpful, but he makes sure the information gets across with plenty examples!

Prof Coiner is the reason I am an econ major today. Always thought I would have to major in the humanities, but his class showed me that I can do whatever I want to do if I put my all into it. Amazing lecturer, and keeps his students engaged. Must take course for any incoming freshman.

Its too bad he is leaving. He could be considered the face of the economics department at Brandeis. Classes arent difficult at all but very interesting. As an Econ major at Brandeis, his lecture and class is not indicative of what you would be doing if you were to study Econ further here.
For this class, you just have to go to lectures. Professor Coiner is super funny, and his lecture is really easy to follow. Highly recommend!
Great teacher. A quite easy intro course.
Coiner was a great teacher. I really enjoyed the way he taught, he made Economics interesting and easy. His lectures were never boring and never too slow or too fast.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Coiner is amazing. He makes a difficult subject easy and his lectures which could be boring are engaging and interesting.
You are amazing professor Coiner, but your handwriting needs to be improved.
Professor Coiner, simply put, is a legend. Oh, and his class was, as Drake would put it, Child's Play.
Professor Coiner is the reason I majored in Economics.
Professor Coiner is the best Econ professor I have ever met! He is hilarious, kind and dedicated as well.  His gives extra credits a lot! You will never regret to take his class!!!
He makes even the boring parts interesting. Amazing class.

I have yet to find a professor who is as enthusiastic, passionate, and clear as Coiner is! I was never a math person or an econ person, but Coiner completely changed me, and now I'm majoring in econ! He really changes the way you think and makes econ fun! To get the full Brandeis experience, you need to take his class!

Amazing professor. Could not give Coiner enough praise. I was just taking this class mostly for a QR or intro into business, but now I am strongly considering economics as a major. Highly qualified and brilliant professor
HE'S AMAZING
Prof. Coiner is great. HILARIOUS. Easy class if you pay attention.
soooooooooooo cute and nice.
Professor Coiner is awesome. He can be a little bit fast during the lectures but as long as you review after class you will be fine.
Great teacher! Really enthusiastic and organized notes. Would recommend to all majors!

Professor Coiner really sets high standards for all economics professors. His passion for economics is amazing, and makes even those who hate economics fall in love with it mainly due to his constant enthusiasm. He is helpful, clear, and constantly willing to help his students. The only quality lacking is that his TAs don't share his enthusiasm.
Coiner is a great professor. He is a good speaker and has a clear way of describing material. In addition, he is quite the character and his classes are never dull.
He's the bomb for com

Amazing class. I'd be surprised if I find a better Econ teacher. To get good grades, I would recommend previewing the book before class (like 10 mins), listening to his lectures,  revising after class and doing the problem sets he gives. For mid-terms, if you do aforementioned things and do the practice old mid-terms, you should get an A.

Easy Class. Outlines all work. can skim reading go to class and understand. test are not cumulative. Problem sets are graded for effort not accuracy. and if you go to the recitations you get the problem sets answers
Makes the material interesting, and is a genuinely entertaining person. Tests are straight-forward, but the multiple choice can be difficult.
TAKE THIS CLASS WITH COINER IT WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE.
Phenomenal, super clear and enthusiastic. You MUST take his class.
Coiner is great. incredibly clear and straightforward lectures.
He is nice.
Hysterical, great lecturer, do the problem sets, do the readings, attend lectures and you should get a good grade. Tests are straightforward.
He's a really great professor who truly enjoys his job. He breaks down the material very well... but the class/tests in general are hard. Don't underestimate it.

I love this class! I only took it because I've heard good things about him and now I'm an econ minor! Attendance isn't mandatory, but his lectures are incredibly helpful. He makes learning fun and has a passion for the subject. He wants  you to succeed and will help you do so if you make the effort. I recommend taking his class!
Awesome teacher. enthusiastic about the subject. All you need is to show up to class and do the problem sets to get the materials.
He is an amazing and enthusiastic professor. Definitely recommend him. He knows his stuff.
I had Coiner for two classes. He knows his material and will get the entire class to care about it.
awesome
I believe the technical word for someone like him is "champtastic."
Simply put, he's the man. Crystal clear, sincere, and funny. What else could you ask for?
terribad. awful. awful. took it in hs and loved it and he made me hate it
I took four classes with Prof. Coiner while at Brandeis and loved them all. Hats off to the best Econ professor in the school.
Excellent teacher. I once approached him though and wasn't quite comfortable. He's great in front of a class but not the most pleasant one on one. Walks up and down the aisle like a manic penguin.

Great lecturer and very passionate about what he teaches. Exams are not too hard and you get 100% on homework just for doing it! Good class, never boring but I wouldn't say it was the most intriguing either.

They told me he was the man entering his class and they were right. But don't become too obsessed. Remember he is a man, not a god. He presents the lesson well, tests are straight forward although tricky multiple choices. All in all, take this class.
the man
No Comments

Intro to ECON : He will make you fall in love with it ... He's just so awesome ! I love him and he's very funny in class ! His examples are wicked smart and fascinating ! Word of advice : If you want to ace his class , just follow the class, take notes and do the problem sets religiously !

Great educator.  As long as you attend most of the class and stay on top of the assignments, you will be fine.  He lectures and organizes the semester so that you cannot get lost and should get an A with sufficient effort.
Outstanding lecturer.  Lectures are always clear, organized and interesting.  Always willing to help students succeed.  Great, genuine guy.  This class is making me strongly consider an econ major.
Great Professor. Amazingly Organized.

Professor Coiner is the greatest teacher and professor I have ever had in all my years of school.  He is helpful, respectful of students and their ideas, and a pro in his field.  He nurtures his students and gives them invaluable knowledge and advice.  He will go out of his way to help his students.  Simply put, they should all be like him!
can bore u to tears but the guy is still the man
the ****ing man.
I LOVE HARRY MICHAEL COINER SO FRIGGIN MUCH!!! one of the cutest/coolest/chalkiest human beings alive!
No Comments

clear, precise, easy to understand. He's also a sweetheart.  I am an english major, and taking 2a was actually fun, and I actually did well- not because it was easy, but  because he made everything so clear.
Responsible for some of the worst testing bias I've ever seen.
Explains everything really well
an econ god, and one of my favorite teachers at brandeis.

I was super scared about taking an econ class after my lack on interest in economics in high school.  Coiner rocks!  He makes the subject interesting and I am actually even enjoying it.  I am surprised to hear myself say that this is my best class this sesmester.
Good guy and teacher

coiner is a crazy man, he loves to walk up and down the isles of his big lecture hall. if your lucky he might get pretty intense about a certain point and that always makes for good fun with coiner. best prof in the department.
Great Teacher
A gifted prof, and a humane individual. Give him a raise!
Makes lectures more interesting, really drills info. into your head
No Comments
Great guy! I should have gone to class more often.
The best professor I've ever had. Clear, interesting: he makes Economics sound fun.
Its really not that easy of a class.. if you are a humanities major that is.  Science or math or any numbers majors really wont have a problem
he's quirky and crazy...he's coiner!
goes over all the material clearly, fair exams that follow assigned problems

I'm just laughing at the fact that she was forced to resign and yet she's still on here posting good reviews of herself pretending to be a student. Only Novack and her SI leaders would blame students for her bad attitude. I did fine in the class but that didn't change the fact that she was always condescending for no reason.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Most who rate Dr. Novack poorly did not take time and effort to commit themselves to coursework. Those who badmouth her lecturing simply don't keep up with material. Class is well-organized, lectures are fluid, and tests are fair and all-encompassing. Given copious additional resources to help you succeed. Very personable if you get to know her.

Dr. Novack's lectures are purely based on the textbook readings; I learned very little from her as I only focused on the textbook. Her practice problems in class can be helpful at times but a majority of the time it only furthered my confusion. Thus, I stuck to the homework textbook problems instead.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Glad we managed to outlast her lol

It is a tough class but it is very doable. There are many opportunities for extra credit, a dropped exam (including the final), and a lot of practice. Most of her tests are extremely similar to the pretests, which makes it fair and easy to study. Her lectures are okay but the recitations helped significantly more. We'll miss you Professor Novack!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Novack is an amazing professor. Her class is hard, but if you put in the work it is more than possible to succeed. The class is test-heavy, but her teaching style is organized and well thought out.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: If you want a life, don't take this class.

Prepare to eat, sleep, and breathe chemistry if you take this class. Lectures move very quickly without any chance to jot down important notes on her densely packed slides. This course requires you to spend all free time attending recitation or SI sessions. Unfortunately, I won't be continuing on with chemistry at Brandeis for these reasons.
She is so mean! Don't go to her OH. I asked her question once and I feel like she is bullying me!!!
Prepare to self-study if you don't have any chemistry base. No mercy for ppl who haven't learn chemistry in high school. Goes over material super fast and the test is super hard and tricky!
One of the best professors at Brandeis. Truly gives you opportunity needed for success in chem 11 and beyond.
This class is not bad she's a solid lecturer and grades so generous… ppl don't wanna put the effort in

come on guys. Her class is not that insane and after orgo you will realize that she is really generous. She gives up to 10 extra credit as redemption point. So if you get over 77 for each test and make good effort you will get an A. That is definitely not tough.
Her lectures aren't useful most time is spent reviewing outside of class. SAVE URSELF DONT TAKE ITTT
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She's pretty good at explaining Chemistry but she is pretty mean. I did ok in the class and was still met with her coldness and guilt-tripping. Studying infringed on all of my time outside class despite having done well on the AP Chemistry test. The one time I went to her office hours, I was spooked away for the rest of the year.

Tainting the school & teaching community. Doesn't even have a chemistry degree/background experience. "My background is in the humanities--my PhD is in Slavic linguistics from Brown--but I would say that teaching is teaching." No, do not simplify teaching, effective teaching is complex and takes lots of skill that she clearly does not have.

Worst class, has a rep for 1 of the worst teachers. This course was unnecessarily hard, & grading was harsh. The SI sessions were not helpful and sometimes, the information taught was wrong. AP chem or not, you're in for a ride. Luckily I was able to teach myself the information to pass but it cut into lots of my studying time for other classes. GL

Wish the SI leader who is writing the good reviews really change up their wording because its PAINFULLY obvious the same person is writing the reviews...really smart. If you take it during the fall/spring, don't do as you hoped, and it makes you feel bad, dont let this get to you, it gets WAY better from here! Don't let her make you hate chemistry
Excellent class, learned a lot
Only went to a few lectures in person, but Dr. Nocack is nice and know
Dr. Novack is a phenomenal lecturer, professor, and person. Checkpoints/tests are hard, but always within reason.

Dr. Novack's class is phenomenal. I learned so much and she's inspired me to continue with chemistry at Brandeis. She is the best and cares for her students in ways I haven't seen from many other professors.

Dr. Novack is an excellent professor. People don't like her bc they aren't performing well in the class, but Dr. Novack provides every resource needed for success and those who don't utilize them do poorly. This class requires more work than most intro level courses, but is that hard work that sets you up for the rest of your college career.

People who leave bad reviews are not putting in the effort required by chem 11. Dr. Novack provides countless resources and opportunities for you to be successful in the class. Yes, the class is hard, but if you put in the work you will do more than fine. Go to recitation. Do the RPCS. Go to SIs. Go to lecture. SHOW UP!

Dr. Novack is the best professor I've had the privilege of learning from. I came into the class with 0 chemistry knowledge, but through utilizing the SIs, office hours, & recitations, I was able to be successful. Dr. Novack's passion & love for her students is contagious, & while the class was challenging, its made me into the student I am today.

Good lecture, tough grading. SI isn't that useful if u don't know anything, since some of the TAs teach pretty slow, but problem sets help a lot since she always come up with exam questions from there. My only advice is to read ahead, otherwise you will be screwed. For checkpoint don't try to rely on your teammates cuz most of the time their trash.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Novack was not a bad lecturer. I will give her credit for that. I will say though, she is a terrible human being. If you don't love chemistry, you will hate her and she will hate you. Do not go to office hours and do not let her learn your name. She will destroy you in office hours and scrutinize you. AP chem isn't neededto pass btw just grind.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Novack gets a bad rap. This is understandable as she can seem intimidating at first, and the course material is difficult, especially since this is many students first course in college. However, she's actually a fantastic lecturer. Streamlines complex material and gives fair tests. She also cares so much, evident in office hours and recitation

Decent lecturer, horrible person. Would honestly recommend brushing up on chem or taking it over the summer (Brandeis is very strict on counting outside chem classes for credit). Go to SI because you actually learn there!
fw laoshi, very sb. never take it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Like the other reviews said, the only people who succeed are the ones who already mastered chem in high school. No joke. Sure, it's not as if every student is blameless if they perform poorly, but given the amount of students that regularly struggle to pass the course it shouldn't matter, because she should be reevaluating her flawed teaching style

I'm literally failing rn, and yea it's my fault for not studying enough. But she keeps saying it's ENTIRELY our fault. I know people who are working so hard and still not doing well. By the numbers, she should realize her teaching methods are not working. Those who succeed already mastered chem in high school. To pass, study up and START EARLY.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Always says "disappointed" to students after a test, and never thinks of her own teaching style. If u wanna take the course, ready to sacrifice all ur time into chem, not kidding.

By God, if losing a kidney meant that she would stop teaching this class I would perform surgery on myself with a paper clip and dig out both of my kidneys. Her grading is pedantic and objectively just terrible, just like her. She's so stunningly condescending and she'll spend the entire time blaming her lack of teaching ability on her students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Moves very quickly through material, doesn't take questions, always holds class past time

I rated her 1 star not because I'm a lazy student who party 24/7 but I'm actually a try hard, and I don't deserve a grade that is made because of her careless clarification on the RPC grading requirement which waste my 8 hours of hard work and no sympathy toward students. don't take her class. I'm a try hard and I highly don't recommend you to try.

She's a nice person, but a TERRIBLE teacher. She gives information but no explanation, so the information is useless. She moves way too fast and expects you to know information you can't possibly know yet. Even with 6+ hours of studying a day, I still don't know if I can pass the class. For an intro chem class, this is in now way introductory.

Dr. Novack is a really good lecturer and teaches the material well. Content can get pretty challenging and the tests (85%) are definitely stressful and hard. Group work tends to be fine but is only worth 15%. Extra credit opportunities help a lot. She is pretty intimidating and I definitely spent many many hours doing textbook problems + studying.

Dr. Novack has a PhD in slavic studies, not chemistry. She was able to teach the information, but it was sometimes in a convoluted manner. Her tests were incredibly difficult even accounting for her generous grade scale. The only grades you would get are from checkpoints & exams, which were few. If you read everything and study, you might do okay.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: This was the worst class I've ever taken. Novack wants us to learn so much in so little time and the exams are extremely hard. She does not care how much you try, is super judgemental, and makes you feel stupid by not getting what she's saying. This class is supposed to teach basic chemistry, however, she expects that you have knowledge beforehand

Literally 90% of the positive reviews on here are written by the same handful of people who obsess over her because she gives them validation. From an educational perspective, she is a mediocre educator at best who knows her stuff but is very inflexible and bad at simplifying. From a human perspective, she is cruel and judgemental.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Novack's Class is really tough and her tests do not reflect what is taught in class. Always do the redemption challenges after the tests and take the final :) People say the honors gen chem class is easier than Chem 11 so take that into consideration when choosing classes
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Novack gets a bad rap, but it't not all true. Gen. Chem is an insanely hard class, so be prepared to spend a lot of time studying, but if you work hard, you can do well. It's obvious Dr. Novack cares about her students and wants them to do well. There are a ton of opportunities to improve your grade. Going to SI and recitation really helps.

Prof. Novack is no-nonsense, but if you respect her and the class, she'll respect you. She does a good job of making difficult content accessible and easy to understand. Genchem is a hard class, but if you put in the effort, take notes, and actually do the practice problems, you'll do well. Super generous grade ranges.

It is absolutely the toughest glass I had freshman year. It is super important to get to know her in office hours early so that when you do struggle she knows you and where you are at to then be able to have her help you. She needs to know early on that you care and work hard as is alluded to by many of the previous reviews.
Her tests come directly from HelI.... like .. I'm trying to girlboss on this B-word but it ain't working you hear.

Most traumatizing class I have ever taken. I was experienced in chem (from Highschool) and when coming to that class I felt so out of place and stupid. Great lecturer but terrible teacher. Expected us to be experts in things we just learned. Just all around terrible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Novack may be a good lecturer, but she is the most unapproachable and pessimistic professor I've ever had. She blamed students for getting covid or close-contacted during a surge of cases on campus and did the bare minimum to accommodate students. Overall does not seem to care about students' mental health.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Novack is a challenging professor, and it was definitely a wake-up call when I got to college. That said, the study strategies I developed last year really made me prepared for future courses that were all so much easier as a result of starting off with the challenging ones. Attend SI and recitation for most success.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Attitude problems
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Just know that if you didn't take AP chem in high school or don't have a good grasp of chemistry coming in, you're about to struggle. Overall, I didn't find her to be mean, I just thought the way she taught was catered to one type of student and if you weren't that, she came off as very intimidating.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Has openly admitted to students that she gets drunk before grading tests and reading course evaluations. If "Dr." Novack put as much effort into drinking alcohol and playing favorites as she did into making sure more than a few AP chem alumni did well in her class, Brandeis would be a far better place and the country would have far more scientists.

Melissa needs to stop leaving reviews like the one below to hide the fact that Novack is an awful professor with no empathy and horrific personality issues. The course has rampant favoritism, but could actually be manageable if only the professor actually cared about the success of students that weren't future SI leaders.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Novack is a wonderful professor who has her students best interests in mind. She is extremely knowledgeable about Chemistry and clarifies material that is initially elusive. Dr. Novack understands how to communicate effectively with students and inspires them to be dedicated to the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Novack majored in music and then realized it wasn't a lucrative career, so she used her failed experience as a pre-vet student to vicariously live off of the happiness of the favorite students she turns into SI leaders, and use the rest of the class to feel better about her failure by deliberately destroying their mental health and self esteem.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: If you're a math person, not a visual learner, and have a high tolerance for hundreds of slides with chintzy animations, you're probably one of the people who leaves Novack good reviews. Otherwise, get ready for an unnecessarily difficult course, uncalled for favoritism and sass, and virtually impossible tests based around a monotonous textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Prof Novack is a nice person, but her class really killed me. It developed a serious reputation for being absolutely awful. Just staying afloat in her class took up ALL of my free time. There were days when I'd spend 5 hours in her Zoom sessions, not even including time spent on homework. Ugh.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Novack's lecture is so inspiring and clear. If you read the textbook beforehand and attend her lectures, you will understand the logic. I have to admit that her tests are hard. But as long as you do the problems she assigned and attend recitations, you will do well. Chemistry is inherently hard, Dr. Novack made it so much simpler
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Just straight up tough
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Novack seems to take it upon herself to punish students she thinks are lazy. If you perform poorly because of her inflexible teaching style and don't learn best the way she wants you to, she will assume you don't care and are being lazy. Not sure why she assumes the worst of every student unless they suck up or get an A. Extremely disrespectful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She gives very inspiring lectures. But with this big amount of coursework, the lecture time is not enough for you to get an A. Much more time needs to put into preview, textbook problem, and other materials.

Unkind and a terrible teacher. Material made tricky but for no reason. Took orgo and realized I am very good at chem and learned literally nothing from her class except how to deal with her unapproachable personality.

I know Dr. Novack means well, but she seems to expect more from us than she can deliver. She isn't necessarily mean, just intimidating, but comes across as condescending sometimes. Even when I thought I studied enough, I hadn't. The course is geared towards a specific type of student that 1. genuinely likes chem and 2. is on top of things.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The curriculum revolves around the textbook (her lectures even use identical analogies), and the class in general seems to be designed for a very specific type of student. If you don't get things on the first try good luck catching uponly extra credit will save you. She tries to be nice but must not really mean it because she's openly judgmental.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Novack is condescending and has very grandiose delusions about giving students a larger perspective and seems to build her brand around making students do more than just memorize rules, but the strategies she seems to want students to apply are never actually taught or explained, only demonstrated in passing as topics she describes as "easy."
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Novack might show you slides talking about how Chem 11a isn't a "weed out course," but everyone who has taken the class (including her TAs, university BUGS tutors, and previous students) knows it as such. She claims she doesn't want to focus on memorization, but then expects students to have memorized large portions of content to succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Teaches very well. But go to the SIS (or whatever it's called) sessions and do all the textbook problems. Just taking notes won't prepare you for the sheer difficulty of the questions on the tests / quizzes.

She's a great lecturer and really helped me get a solid grasp of chemistry! You have to work hard to be prepared for the exams. However, I don't like how gossipy she is about other students! She picks favorites and good luck ever getting her to listen to you if you're not one! Reminds me of a mother who I'm always trying to impress, but to no avail
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: It is impossible to deny that Novack knows the content inside and out. The only problem is that she is very unapproachable. Her recitations are a life saver as they are the only times when you can get your questions answered. If you do the practice sets, go to recitations, and review the quizzes, you should be fine.
She really cares about her students! The class is very difficult, but is definitely doable. She is amazing and is very useful outside of class too
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Great woman. Hard subject matter, but if you show genuine interest she will help you. Dont be lazy.
Does not make accommodations for athletes. She makes it really hard to be successful in her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Novack is not a compassionate teacher. If you ask a question she feels is below her, she will simply stare at you for a moment then tell you to read your book. She is very much set in her ways so if her years old slides don't do it for you then youre in for a wild ride.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Novack takes the time to get to know each every one of her 250 students and is truly concerned with seeing you succeed. Although she may be condescending at times and hard to approach, she is very helpful during office hours. Make sure to attend recitations and lectures! Tests are difficult! Try to begin studying at least a week in advance.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Dr. Novack is a really great professor. As long as you do the readings and understand the readings, most problems should come intuitively. If you understand all practice problems, skip recitation until the Wednesday of the exam, where she sometimes gives test questions away. Very accessible outside of class, generally biases exceptional students.
Extremely hard class but she knows the material and teaches it well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Approachable outside of class. She gives funny and amazing lectures.

While Novack has some personality flaws (i.e. huge ego, superiority complex), she does know chem and teaches it well. In class, her abrasive personality may be considered rude by some, but in one-on-one settings like office hours, she is very understanding albeit intimidating at first. Easily one of the most accessible professors I have had so far.

Favorite class of freshman year! It was a lot of work, but if you follow through with it you can do very well! Dr. Novack is very smart and friendly! Office hours are really great chances to get to know her.

Professor Novack is very knowledgeable in her field. Her tests can be tough but she grades them fairly well. If you keep up with the reading and the practice problems you should do fine. However, that is a lot of work that is not to be underestimated.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: The absolute worst professor. She has a huge ego about the difficulty of her Gen Chem class and makes it nearly impossible to succeed just to be able to say how difficult her class is. Honors is less work, so save yourselves.

Despite the fact that the class took place over Zoom, Professor Hirsch maintained lively (enough) discussions and explained the text(s) with great enthusiasm that fostered engagement. He also responded very thoroughly and promptly to every email requesting clarification. Already signed up for his class for the upcoming semester!
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Very knowledgeable about the subject matter and passionate
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Eli himself is very funny during lecture, but intimidating to ask questions to during class because he will always question you back. Also, the undergraduate grading is based on your TA, so good luck if your TA is a picky grader (mine was). You also have to specifically email him for lecture recordings. Overall, funny guy with interesting lectures!

I took his Introduction to Biomedical Ethics class at Harvard and loved it. Prof Hirsch is entertaining and his class is really easy. The topics were also great. He gives a lot of extra credit opportunities as well.

I took his biomedical ethics class at Harvard Summer School and he was simply amazing. His lectures are long but if you listen they are thought-provoking and eye opening. His class really changed my view on philosophy. His TA grades everything and he isnt very accessible outside of class but overall he is great. Offers a lot of extra credit.

This class is an dvanced course in philosophy, taught by a leader in the field. Eli's lectures require rigorous engagement with the text outside of class, as he clearly tells you at the beginning of the course. His deadlines are strict, but fair,  because he gives abundant notice.
Professor Hirsch is alright. He is clearly passionate about the subject and he is a pretty good professor but he rambles a lot and he's kinda grumpy. Very tough grader.

Professor Hirsch was amazing to have for philosophy. He really will foster a love of the subject in his students. Engaging lectures that make you interested. I found myself a little daunted by the class, having never taken a course for credit before. But I feel I was almost spoiled by his class, and have not had a professor on the same level since.

Eli and his TA teach this course like nobody else does. Eli happens to be hilarious, and incredibly intelligent. He's also a shining inspiration of philosophy in general. He's a real person, a great philosopher, and a regular person--who happens to be a genius. Take his logic course or biomedical ethics at Harvard.
This is a biomedical ethics course he teaches at Harvard. One of the best courses I've ever taken. Brilliant lecturer and philosopher.

This biomedical ethics course at Harvard is one of the best courses I've ever taken. Dr. Hirsch analyses situationspapersideas from multiple angles and he really knows his stuff. His blunt-yet-refreshing personality also make his classes a fun and often hilarious way to spend your afternoon. Would take any class taught by him in a heartbeat.

Ive had Hirsch for several classes at Brandeis. If you want to see him at his best, take a small class, discussion based class with him. He is profoundly intelligent and looks at philosophical issues in a very creative (but intuitive) way. He doesn't seem as disconnected from reality as other philosophers. Also he can be extremely funny.
I took this course a couple semester ago. I think the course was great. I recommend it with the highest recommendation possible. The teaching staff is excellent.
this class was just awesome. you have to at least SHOP it. OMG. i loved it. definitely recommend. three exams. joke. Easy A. :D

i could not get enough of logic; it was my wednesday nights for SO long. i am sad that's it is over. i really enjoyed the teachings. eli, complete genius--and master of his trade--regularly made a boring class awesome. he is patient kind, funny, and a little brooklyn at heart. i cannot recommend the course highly enough. it is the best at harvard.

introduction to logic is the best class of all time at harvard. serious up people. definitely recommend. awesomeness does not capture the awesomeness of the class. formal logic made understandable is a better way to describe it. i LOVED this course. professor and ta, both genius--professor is funnier tho. serius up.

you MUST take this logic class. i cannot believe i waited so long to take it. AMAZING is not good enough to describe. professor is funny. ta is helpful. book is a little expensive, but whatever. i really loved this class. please come and teach full time at harvard!
this was an amazing class. i came to class. i got an a. there's nothing else to it. come to class, and you will get an a. that's it. so easy. so fun. so clear. eli is an amazingly cool guy.

all i have to say is take this class. it will rock your world. it's easy, fun, and exciting. i loved every minute of it. exams are incredibly straight forward. ta sections are highly relevant and awesome. i cannot say enough about the class.

i loved this course. absolutely great. if you can take it, take it. that's all i've got to say about that. as for eli: brilliant, funny, and very approachable. ta is pretty bad ars at logic, too. i think he's like one of those strange math genius like people. but the ta is not as funny as eli. so, that's that.

this is the easiest, and best class, at the extension school. you should take logic. it is an amazing opportunity, and you should not miss it. highly recommend it. eli is funny, smart, and witty. great sense of humor.
Logic is the best subject, and Eli teaches it great. Amazing. Amazing. Amazing. Take logic. It's so worth it.
I loved logic class, but it was not easy. Just go to section, and you'll get an A. That's it. Also do the homework. Nothing to it. Hirsch is funny, TA is a math guy.

This class is summed up by one word: work. You just have to work, outside of class, et cetera, and. On your own. The homework will never be collected, and lectures are funny, so I tended to slack off. I had to earn my A in this course, just be willing to put in the time. Also,  go to section. These are so helpful that it's not even funny.

This course was not a complete joke, as some people would point out. But, for me, it was not super difficult either. I went to every section, and whatever else the TA offered, and I went to every lecture just to be safe, too. I also did the homeworks, but they are not collected. That's a lot of work, but it was not super difficult once I got it.

This was a course that nearly killed me, but not literally. It really takes effort, not too too much, but some. Take this course and you might have to work a little more than you thought, but it really pays off in the end. Great class, just go to section.

I worked my tail off in logic, over at Harvard. I put everything into this class. I got an A, but it was just a ton of work. I went to section every week, and to every review session. Buy the book, do the practice problems, go to section, and go to lecture. Otherwise, the class could be a challenge.

This class was amazingly easy, and I did really well. No studying, no nothing. I just went to section, and that's it. You MUST take this course. ELI is great, and the TA is funny. Take this course, for sure; it's a gem!
This is the best class at Harvard. Take this or biomedical ethics for any easy A.... This class rocks my world every week.
Just plain fun. Take it. Homework is a little too easy, but whatever. I loved this course. Best course at harvard.
Take this course! Eli is a genius! That's what I have to say about it... go to section.

Awesome course. No regrets. Very slowpaced. Happy I took it. Eli and his TA are fantastic. Take the course. TextBook is optional for some, I bought it because I heard the final exam questions are written out of it; they were, and I am so glad i studied. Not an easy A, but close enough. Highly recommend.

Best. Class. EVAR! I loved Eli. He is so funny. This course filled my QR, and it is the easiest QR at Harvard, in my view. I highly, highly recommend it. It totally helped me get into law school as well. I will be going to Columbia. My interviewer loved my rec from the course, and my grade. It also helped with the LSAT games... Just my view.

i took this class, and i have no regrets. eli hirsch is kind, cool, light hearted, and really funny. i enjoy talking to him very much; he's the coolest professor that i have had in a long time. did i mention that he was really smart, too? yeah, he's all around great. take the course, if you can. logic is not that bad.
U do not need 2 b brave 2 take his course, just go to section.... This is a good class. Hirsch is a great professor, and only fools miss the chance to take courses with him.
I highly recommend this course; it is one of the best courses that i have evr taken at harvard. go for it.

There is no better teacher than Eli Hirsch; he is kind, intelligent, and funny. He is everything you would want in a teacher. The course itself is medium to easy difficulty, I thought. I would get tired at the end of the night, and I would be like, what? other than that, I have to recommend with all my heart. Great course. You will do well overall.

There is no better teacher than Eli Hirsch; he is kind, intelligent, and funny. He is everything you would want in a teacher. The course itself is medium to easy difficulty, I thought. I would get tired at the end of the night, and I would be like, what? other than that, I have to recommend with all my heart. Great course. You will do well overall.
Logic was so cool over at harvard. I used this course to transfer back over to Brandeis. I had an awesome time, and I highly recommend the class to anyone... Great QR filler.
Wow! My hard work paid dividend! I got a B+ after failing the first exam, thank god! I recommend this course. There is only one secret: go to section. Good hunting to you!

this logic class is a must. there is no better QR requirement on the planet. it's only three exams, which are not that difficult. this will help you write better and speak better and think better. no joke. have to give the highest recommendation for this course. secret: go to section. you will get more out of it than lecture.
Definitely recommend. Nuffield said.

I got a 65 on the first exam, but I ended the course with an A-, due to the generous extra credit problems. I had to work hard, but it is my fault. If i would have studied for the first exam, i would have had an easy A. I have to recommend this course. Skip lecture and go to section only.

I have no idea how anyone could say this course was a complete breeze or easy A. Although, I did get an A, I did have to work some. Perhaps everyone else is a genius, but I had to go to sections and lectures and purchase the book. That's a lot of work. However, the course was fun and Prof. Hirsch rocked it like no other before him... :)

This was the coolest class ever. I got a B+ but it was my fault. I Never had time for section and worked two jobs. So whatever that means... Still, lectures were hilarious and my TA was the coolest cat since James Earl jones was the king in coming to America. :)

I took this course over at Harvard. I had so much fun. Definitely go to section. The TA is a flipping genius; he's the reason I got an A. I did horrible on the first exam, but he worked with me until I got it. For real, it's more than the grade. I actually understand logic because of the teacher and TA. That's rare.
This dude is the real deal. He knows what he's doing, for real. I loved his class last time. His logic kicks tookus. Take this class, A guaranteed A...

I took him at Harvard, during the evening. I did not think the class was that easy. But I could see why, since the exams were so short and there were only three of those. I actually did all the readings, and the thing that helped me the most was the TA! I got an A, but I do not think it was a complete pushover, but it was not that hard.
Best teacher ever. Had him over at harvard for logic. He and his teaching staff did miracles! I loved every minute of the class, wish I could take it again. :) definitely recommend.

I used his course to fill my QR at Harvard and improve my understanding on the LSAT; it did both and the A grade was a bonus. If you don't take this class, you are missing an experience that has value.

I took him at harvard, too. He's really great as a teacher, but I wasn't there for philosophy. I wanted to raise my LSAT score, and I did. I'm up 10 points from when I took logic, and logic brought me up 12 points. Now I'm going to take test well... Hopefully, I'll get my 168 higher n higher.
Eli rocks! Took his logic at Harvard. No work: three exams! Really!?!? Three exams, for real, no homework! Anyhow, very little work for a very big A, and I did nothing! Yay!
Best class ever. Took him at harvard. Definitely a must take for the easy A. My TA was so cool; he took us all to dinner.
The easiest A on the planet. Three tests, less than an hour. It really covers only what he talks about in lecture: no book purchase necessary. Great TA. Really nice overall experience.
This course was a breeze. I did nothing but read the book. I attended no lectures. :0) Go logic, go logic, go! go! I recommend this class, for realz.

I had to buy the book. I cannot imagine how anyone could get through this class without the book. that's craziness. Other than that point, it was an easy, easy, easy A. Grading was easy, did I mention that?
Dude. Easy A. Take it. Three exams, no problem. :)
well, i don't know about completely easy. but i think it got my lsat up a whole bunch. there are just things that you can learn here that you can't learn anywhere else. go logic!
Take this class at Harvard. I took it for my LSAT. Got my score up for sure. Also, got an A in the class, did nothing.
Easy, easy, easy logic class to fill my QR requirement. I got an A, and I did nothing. The exams are a complete joke. I did not read the book, just followed lecture notes. Complete breeze.
he does it right!

Eli is really nice, likely also a brilliant philosopher, but he doesn't know how to teach a USEM on a basic enough level for a student without prior experience with Philosophy.  He expects you write with a different style than you are used to and does not teach specifically what this means.  He may be brilliant, but sadly this went over my head.

Took this freshman seminar because I had never taken any philosophy. Taught the class like an advanced philosophy class and I was completely lost. Recommend for philosophy majors or someone who knows a lot about it. Not a good prof for a beginner.
this course was so much easier than math, and it required my qr requirement! thank god i didn'thave to take stat! he was funny, too!

I took his evening course at Harvard. He's really, really, funny. Great class, too. Material was amazing. Lectures very precise. The book was not really necessary either. But I bought it anyway. I have to recommend. Besides, he gave me an A, and I didn't do much.
Totally, awesome! I improved on my lsat. He gave me and all my friends A's! It was increidble, and did I mention my LSAt went up 7 points! Ha! That's great! Great course and lecturer. Very funny guy!

Took him at Harvard. His course was a little too advanced for introductory logic. However, the logic pushed my LSAT score up 12 points. His lectures were also funny. Smart kids do better in his class.
I want Eli to be my grandpa. He is the cutest little old man. And it is fabulous that he talks about controversial current topics, despite his being old.

The class is going on at the Harvard Extension at night. He has a TA there for this large class. It is supposed that he is a metaphysician, not a logician, but should be able to teach this introd. class from the superb text. He did do a bit of liberal litmus testing in the beginning, distracting in channeling that through propositions. Great guy!
Had him for 6 classes. Love each one. Funny, Inteligent, I highly recomend him to anything interested in the topics he teaches.

Had him at Harvard; disliked his class immensely. I reached out for help and never heard from him. Obviously he's brilliant and lectures were funny, but also were confusing and contradicted his choice of textbook. Maybe he's too advanced for an intro course, but I ended up taking the hit and withdrawing halfway through the term. Can't recommend.
Very interesting, intelligent, and helpful. Does not always know how to lead a class discussion, though.
My favorite professor at Brandeis. Interesting discussions, always open to student ideas. His best classes are 3-hour seminars with a small group.
Amazing professor, made the course extremely interesting, lectures were great, made the class laugh...
had him for Biomedical Ethics ---Great teacher. Very intelligent and makes you think. But dont take the class if you are not into philosophy

I took Biomedical Ethics and it's an amazing course.  Prof. Hirsch gives short quizzes every few chapters to make sure you're reading the material and that you understand it.  He is a wonderful teacher!

She is a really good professor if you can follow along and don't get lost. People don't like her because the course is hard, but she is very nice and the material is very doable if you apply yourself. Make sure to start the assignments well ahead of time.

Antonella seems a good person in life. She is very energetic and the class is interesting. However, for me, she is very pushy. She will randomly pick up students who don't know the answer to answer questions but seldom pick the student who raise their hands. Very hard PA and PS and very harsh grading. Exam is hard but better than PA.

Antonella is genuinely my favorite professor I have had at Brandeis so far. This class is hard, but that is to be expected because the topic is hard. Her lectures are so engaging which makes it easy to stay focused, she is really funny, knows her stuff, and truly cares about students' success. Cannot recommend her enough.

Antonella is an acquired taste. She doesn't allow computers/iPads/phones in her class, loves to cold call, and regularly tease students who don't frequently attend her lectures. But, she cares about you as an individual, which I can't say about many professors. Once you embrace that you will be cold called on, you're ready for the real world.
Easily gets to the point and visiting office hours was quite easy and helpful.
Absolutely terrible professor. Do not take this course with her, take it with another Java professor at Brandeis.

The worst class I have ever taken. She is a clear lecturer, which doesn't matter as your grade will never be connected to your understanding of the material. No one should go to brandeis for CS as long as she is here. Expect to lose at least 3 letter grades per minor mistake on homework. TAs refuse to answer questions. Accuses everyone of plagarism
One of the best CS professors at Brandeis, really cares about her students

A lot of people think she is a difficult prof, but I really learned a lot in her class. Her lectures are funny and she's a really nice person! I struggled a lot in the beginning coming from 10a, but power thru and you can def get an A. PA grading rubrics are harsh but it's easy to get the hang of what are strong no-nos to get 100% PA grades.

Antonella isn't terrible, but get ready for her teaching style. In class lectures that only really talk about big picture concepts are fine, but she skims over the practical skills you need to complete assignments. Insane workload. Unfairly difficult tests. I'm not a fan, but I can see why some people don't mind her. Almost a self taught class!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Antonella is an excellent teacher who teaches difficult topics in an accessible way. Many people have trouble with data structures but this is no fault of Antonella.

Amazing professor, teaches how to code correctly, difficult work but extremely doable if you follow class instructions and don't take shortcuts. Follow her process and you will be fine. It is helpful if you have a little coding experience though. Very good preparation for later in life. Super funny and caring teacher as well.
She is a tough professor, but it is worth it, it does wonders in preparing you for future classes.

Professor Di-Lillo is an amazing professor and is really cheerful as well as energetic. You can tell she really cares about her students learning the content. While the class itself is very difficult, she tries to teach you as best as she can and gives you all the resources you need to succeed.

Her 21A class is very hard, but not really because of her. Anywhere you look you'll find that data structures is one of the hardest COSI classes. Antonella does her best to make the class as bearable as possible through entertaining and simple to follow lectures. Absolutely the funniest professor I've had and very nice in her office hours.

Because this class is so challenging, it seems that students, in turn, may unfoundedly claim that Antonella is quite harsh. However, while she certainly holds you accountable for your learning, she is very approachable and a super entertaining lecturer... certainly never a dull moment in class! Can't wait to take COSI 130A with her next semester!
Cares about her students' learning experience, truly unique lecture experiences.

Tough but excellent, really makes sure you know compsci by the time you leave her classroom. Engaging lecturer, very knowledgeable, funny, cares a lot about her students even if she can be sassy in class. Some people don't like her because she's a tough professor, but that's because she teaches more than any other prof in the department.
I love this professor
Antonella Dilillo is a great professor, the only problem of 12B is that the grading criteria is quite ambiguous.
Great professor!

People say Antonella is too tough; they're softies. Antonella pushes you hard, assigns a lot of homework, and takes points off mercilessly. However, she is also a complete softie, and she does all of these things because she wants you to leave actually knowing compsci. I've learned a ton, and her classes are interesting & engaging.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Antonella's classes are challenging. But if you raise your hand in class, and are not afraid to make a mistake in class, she will love you no matter your grade. To get a good grade start the PA's the day they are assigned. Also the grading can be a bit wonky, don't be too discouraged if you get a bad grade, everyone does at some point in the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Great person, I think. Has a tendency to repeat part of the previous lecture in the next one, which gets really boring. However, you can't afford to miss much. If you miss one of the algorithm examples, get it repeated to you in office hours or you'll never get it. She also has brutal grading on the assignments. Leave LOTS of time for them.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring
