There are typed assignments (small paragraph) associated w/ each topic, 2 exams, and 5 case studies

Professor Wright is disorganized and totally put no effort into teaching. 
She always arrived late to class and would turn her back to us and read the slides for an hour and 20 minutes. 
I am very unimpressed. Brandeis is a great school and she just isn't good at all. She was un inspiring.

She's boring. Stubborn. Will not update her slides to use more modern terms (refused to use intellectual disability and instead preferred to use 'mental r*' because that's what they used in her time). It's time that she either get with the times or quit. Oh and u have to teach yourself everything.

Textbook is not essential, but is heavily referenced. Has some ableism problems in the content of her presentations, but most of it can be chalked up to her being out of date with the rate change in the psych field. Tests are well-rounded and have extra credit questions. Good variety of assignments, even if the tests are far more heavily weighted.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She's very sweet and caring--might be the sweetest professor I've had here.

She seems like a very good person and her lectures were quite entertaining at times. However, they had no correlation with the material on the exams and you basically had to teach yourself the text book to pass.
Doesn't care at all about this intro class and it showed every single lecture.

she is a little bit boring in lectures, but all you need is read the slides kinda participate in online questions you'll pass. A veryyyy easy grader, like I wrote a mediocre essay, she gave me 100/100. I'm like wut???? I only spent one day reviewing for her midterms (never opened books or pay attention to lecture before) and still get an A

Professor Wright's is a very passionate lecturer. Although she says it's not, her class is very memorization-focused. Follow her study guides and attend the TA review sessions and you'll be fine. The assignments make up a portion of your grade, but they're fairly easy. Lots of extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy A if you study the exam review. She uses Echo360 to take attendance so you don't have to show up to the classes. Often times, you can just read slides and get all the materials. Very very sweet and caring. I'd definitely take her class again.
Not very clear, not engaging. Doesn't even write her own lectures
I took 3 classes with her. One of the best psych professors I've ever had. Obviously loves teaching and cares for her students.
Professor Wright is an extremely nice person, and is very approachable. Her Intro Psych class is super easy; memorize the slides and you pass with an A.

Very passionate about psychology and about teaching. Don't get the textbook; all the info you need is on her powerpoints that she puts on latte. Do the extra credit, it will help balance out for bad test grades. Tests are noncumulative which is a big plus. Pretty easy class.

Nice lady teaching a terrible course. Her lectures are vapid. I literally felt like I was taking high school health, I kid you not. Take if you want a class you can sleep through or want to be dissuaded from majoring in psych.
She was disorganized, all over the place, and not particularly interesting. But the subject matter was good and the textbook was useful! And she seems like a very sweet person.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Wright may not be the best lecturer, but the class content is still interesting. The textbook is helpful, and there are only a few tests and assignments.

I took her flipped methods course. Hearing other people's experiences in research methods, I wasn't excited to take this class. So far, she has made this class fun and interesting. She takes the time to explain the projects and the statistics we should run. Dr. Wright also has a great sense of humor - she came to class as a flamingo on Halloween!

She is really really bad at giving lectures, she is all over the place with random information., She goes off on random tangents frequently. She also does not know how to talk into a mic. Although she comes off as very nice, I would recommend avoiding this teacher.

The class has a ton of assigned reading, between the textbook and additional papers, all of which are necessary for the tests, and were very time consuming for the amount you got out of them. The lectures were dry and did a poor job connecting the topics to real life, making application questions in tests and assignments difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: gave us outdated info and used outdated terminology (ex. r-word) gave no trigger warnings for literally anything. a very stressful class. textbook was a waste of money as she covers the material in class anyway.

She was okay. Lectures were kinda boring, especially at ten in the morning. Could occasionally be funny. I think could have dressed more professionally. Seems like she'd be much better with a smaller class that had less big topics to cover.
very friendly, but not the best professor. her lectures are boring and hard to follow. she obviously knows the material, but she can't teach it.
This course is fine, the lectures are hard to follow, but Professor Wright is very sweet.

She gives so much extra credit its hard to do badly.  Just pay attention in lecture and read the book.  Study it groups for the tests and use the study guide.  Show up to every class and get extra credit, and make sure to participate in experiments.

Professor Wright is a wonderful teacher and has a great sense of humor. She finds a way to make psychology fun and often features clips in her lectures that make them more engaging. The class itself isn't terribly difficult at all. However, DON'T BUY THE BOOK! She covers all the material with her slides and you could save an easy $160+.
Professor Wright is very sweet, but she is not the best teacher. She often shows up to class in pajamas and uggs, and she just reads off her powerpoint slides. Easy class.

Lectures from her powerpoints (which are uploaded to Latte), so I guess it isn't necessary to attend every lecture, although I did. The only tests were the midterm and final. Didn't explain the Case Studies assignment she gave us at all which was very stressful (esp bc it was part of the final). Friendly, but not always clear about assignments

Easy class if you show up most of the time and put a few hours into studying for each of the 3 tests. Plenty of EC. Not such an engaging lecturer, and a lot of the material's very vague, but the tests reflect the PwrPnts basically word for word. DON'T BOTHER WITH THE TEXT BOOK! Not even worth renting one. Not painful, not hard, but not spectacular.

She is a really great professor and her class is super fun. If you go to the class and pay attention, then you don't really need to read the textbook, if you read the textbook, you probably don't need to go to class, but you should because she's an awesome professor.
Ellen Wright is awesome. She makes time for students, and makes an effort to keep her classes low-stress.

Awesome professor.  Keeps lectures interesting with funny anecdotes and the occasional group activity.  Loved the books that we read during the course.  Reading the textbook was definitely not necessary but helped.

Friendly, humorous, and upbeat, Professor Wright was an incredibly effective lecturer who demonstrated compassion for her students. Her use of humor in PowerPoint presentations further helped to generate interest in the subject material.

She is a very fun professor to have. She explains the concepts clearly, and I found the class to be interesting and usually entertaining! I really liked her, and I would deffinatly recomend at least one class with her.
She relied entirely on the textbook and went so fast through the lectures that I couldnt keep up. Prepare to spend hours after class copying the notes you didnt have time to take during class.

Ellen Wright is one of the most lively professors I've had at Brandeis. She is a great instructor of Abnormal, passionate in all of her lectures, and loves to engage with students. She makes a 9 AM class tolerable and facilitate discussion in an 80-person class. Tests weren't too difficult as long as you go to class and read the text. Great prof!

Ellen Wright is so lively and clearly loves what she does. Her adolescent psych class was pretty easy. You don't need to attend class (although I recommend it on a day when you are in a good mood and awake, she always has activities and  cute anecdotes) just study the study guide for exams and you're good. def taking another class with her!
Awesome teacher! She is really nice and helpful and this is a great introductory class!

She's a great professor. She tries to keep things fun and she's very easygoing. The tests aren't too bad as long as you listen in class and read the book. You will get as much out of the class as you put in.

She's a little out there but really knows her stuff. The class was very straightforward and easy to do well in. Make sure you read the textbook and review the power points, she puts them all up online.
Pretty dope teacher.  Will sometimes go on tangential, but still relevant, topics.  Tests are very fair; not hard to do well on. Will actually give you feedback

very passionate about what he teaches. lectures in a storytelling manner which makes for interesting lectures but if you space out, you'll have trouble understanding what is going on. allows essay drafts to be sent so def take advantage of that! class format lacks structure; he doesn't use slides so its a little hard if you're not an aural learner

Prof Breen was amazing, the hype is true take classes with this guy. He is hilarious and thoroughly enjoys what he does. Had multiple essays but every one was interesting and reasonable. Loved this class

This guy is awesome! I was taken aback by the fact that he is everything I would expect from a creative director of a fashion company. Breen is clearly a creative soul. His class is amazing. He is funny, dresses like Kurt Cobain and brilliant. His instruction is clear and his assignments are engaging.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: Breen is incredible. Has quirks and might not be for everyone, but super passionate about his subject. Can be roundabout, but keeps you engaged and helps give background context. Have taken 2 classes with him and hope to take more, would recommend to anyone. Usually graded on essays (3-4), participation/attendance, and final exam (essay).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Very excited about what he is teaching and someone who cares about the material.

Everyone at this school is obsessed with Breen and I really don't know why. He was not entertaining in the slightest. He would take super round about ways to explain pretty straight forward legal concepts. Do not take this class if you have a learning disability, you will spend every lecture online shopping or playing 2048.
Ok he's a very good lecturer, but a bit overhyped imo. He didn't give feedback on final paper which was a bit annoying. How am I supposed to improve my writing without feedback?

Undoubtedly the best professor on campus. Every lecture is extremely engaging, which makes every paper equally fun to figure out. I don't know how he does it but he reads first drafts for papers for all of his classes and always gives such useful feedback in a day or two. He seems to have such an investment in our learning in the best way possible.

I LOVE BREEN!! If you pay attention to his lectures and have a relatively good memory, you will do well in Business Law. He makes lectures entertaining and has a good way of reading the room to make sure everyone is paying attention. His papers were challenging but in a way that helped you learn, and he is always willing to give feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: If you go to Brandeis, take a class with this man. I do not care what you are studying. I talked about him in my law school applications. Seriously, he makes it so much more than just studying how law works. He cares so much about how legal decisions are made and how the people involved were impacted. Brilliant and inspiring man.
I am a proud recipient of a Minor in Breen  One of the best professors at Brandeis.

Delivers really engaging lectures - the hour and twenty minute class twice a week often felt much shorter. The 'point' of the lecture could sometimes be hard to discern, as his style is more free-wheeling (although undoubtedly very prepared). It can be difficult to know what to take notes on. I did almost none of the readings until writing papers.

The best professor I've ever had. His lectures are rich and entertaining, and he cares so deeply about the content it's infectious. He's kind, thoughtful, made me love law. He's a true storyteller, and it's impossible to not love going to his class. 11/10, taking every single one of his classes!!!

Breen is solid. Very interesting and entertaining lectures. Never went to him outside of class but he seems like a nice guy. I was surprised by my grade (was much better than I thought it was going to be). Maybe that's just because it was during the corona semester.
MIND-BLOWING LECTURES! Final was hard because I barely attended class after the first half. But I also took the class P/f. Highly recommend. Prof. Breen is just amazing!

Breen is an amazing professor and everything they say about him is true. Take his class 100%... HOWEVER: Also beware that the TAs do most of the grading, and If you get a tough TA you WILL NOT get an A in the class.

Breen is something of a legend at Brandeis, and for good reason. His lectures are phenomenal  they breeze by, 80 minutes over before you know it, peppered with impassioned speeches and dorky jokes. He is a fair grader, and really wants to help you improve and understand the material, so you can always stop by his office or shoot him an email.

Best professor I've had yet as well as the most entertaining lecturer. He genuinely cares about each student individually and is very accessible and understanding. I found his assignments to be slightly challenging and thought provoking but not at all impossible. His grading is VERY fair if you put in the effort. Take his class!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: His lectures are always interesting. Go to class if you can make it to the 9am! Go out to lunch with him, because he does have a lunch voucher at the Faculty Lounge! Great professor, and he has good teaching fellows. Would 100% take his class again!

AMAZING professor. His education has basically made him a historian lawyer so he has these eye opening and fascinating lectures. The sweetest guy you will meet and absolutely delighted to help his students in any way possible. His TA's can be quite hard graders so beware but overall learned so much.
He's so dorky and adorable and gives really awesome lectures and he's just so caring and he's amazing all around 10 out of 10
Best professor at Brandeis. I am a legal studies minor, and am full filling my minor by taking entirely his classes.
Great professor. His ability to wake up students in his 9am classes rivals that of coffee.

Professor Breen is amazing. Widely referred to as 'the Coiner of the LGLS department,' he is a staple to the department and arguably the school as a whole. Despite his lectures being at 9 in the morning, I was almost always rapt and attentive due to his lecturing skills. Definitely take advantage of office hours and any opportunities out of class.

Breen is an amazing teacher for students interested in law and those who are not. He is an engaging lectures in the format of stories. He speaks quickly, but if you have questions or need him to slow down you can ask him to. He speaks on interesting tops of the law and is the best professor I have had a Brandeis.

Professor Breen is among the most beloved teachers at Brandeis for good reason, and students can't get enough of his classes. He's incomparably passionate, highly knowledgeable, hilarious, and loves to engage students in deep, thought-provoking debates. You've missed out if you've attended Brandeis without taking one of his classes.
Lectures are long, but he makes them as interesting as they can possibly be. He will look over drafts for essays & give you feedback. Kind of a strange man, but in a good way.

Professor Breen was a worldview-altering instructor. He opens eyes to incredible content, and creates an air of enthusiasm around subjects of law, justice, and the ability for individuals to affect positive change. He's quirky, humorous, and incredibly earnest. Very accessible outside the classroom, very willing to work with students. 10/10

Breen is an excellent lecturer and story teller. His class was a good wake-up at 9 am because he was so engaging and invigorating. He teaches the material very well, but the assignments are graded by the TAs, so the difficulty can vary greatly and it be unclear as to what they are looking for, but most will helpful if you meet with them.

Professor Breen is an amazing lecturer! He is able to engage the class for the duration of the lecture. The class grading is done by the Teaching Fellows, but Breen makes himself very accessible to students if they need any assistance or guidance. Overall a great class!

Never did any of the readings (except for one book). He told the cases like stories so made them interesting. Really passionate. TA's graded the final and papers, and they are tough graders. Overall, great experience

Professor Breen's lectures are always informative and capable of turning run of the mill supreme court cases into gripping, funny, and entertaining stories. Classes are more like story time than lectures.

Professor Breen loves what he does! His lectures are entertaining and informative. He is a tough grader, but he gives you really good feedback and you can always meet with him to talk about any concerns.

Professor Breen is an incredible professor and is always extremely enthusiastic about what he is teaching. He is a fantastic story-teller and so his classes are engaging and very clear. He is not an easy grader but is very willing to meet with you and help you to do your best. I am about to take my third class with him!  I recommend going to class

DBreen is awesome and incredibly popular among all his students. He turns 9 o'clock classes and tough legal matters into exciting, engaging lectures - he never gets boring because he's always loud, animated and in constant motion. His passion is obvious and his quirkiness is adorable - I plan to take every course I possibly can with him!
His TAs are all tough graders who only give out few A-. You don't really need to go to class because he will post everything online.
He's super into what he's teaching and it shows! Assignment expectations are a little unclear sometimes though.

Best professor I have ever had.  I've taken every class he teaches just because he's that wonderful.  He makes the subject matter interesting, and he's super enthusiastic about it.  He doesn't talk down to students. Exam isn't easy, but it's really not hard either since you enjoy the subject because of him.  Wish I could hug him right now. Hot too.

Breen is so passionate about his subject. He is a great speaker and makes class interesting. He is very clear and thoroughly explains cases in class. He  grades based on participation and the writing assignments are heavily based on the reading, but the class wasn't too difficult at all. If you have a chance, definitely take a class with him!
Best professor in the Legal Studies department!

Breen is not an easy professor. You don't take him for an easy-A. You take him to learn the truth of law and the realistic, ruthlessness, and ridiculousness of law. He will challenge you and you WILL leave the course as a changed individual. You take this course to gain insight and grasp logic. EXCELLENT professor.

Wonderful professor. Bit of a tough grader, really expects you to know your stuff. Sometimes class got off track because he really let the students direct the discussion, which I found frustrating. That said, he is a brilliant man, and I'm taking another class with him just because he's teaching it! If you have any legal interest, take his classes!

Daniel Breen is by far the best teacher I've had at Brandeis because he is so passionate about teaching.  Plus, he's always there if you ever need help. He even tries to learn each student's name - I'm not an ID number in his class.  DEFINITELY take a class with him.

I took this class for one of my major's requirements and I do recommend it for a basic science course. The main downside is that it's online, and there's not much conversation between the professor and the students. It might get tedious at times but I highly recommend keeping up with the lectures because the projects will make a lot more sense!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the best classes and professors at Brandeis! Highly recommended course!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: It's a bit disappointing that bio 16 is online, but it's understandable with the class size. The grade for fall23 was based only on five projects. Attend classes, follow directions, and just put that into the projects. Professor Morris is really good about making lectures engaging and understandable.

Considering this class is online and has about 400 students total, I think he did a great job. He tries to keep the class entertaining and is very nice. There are 9 assignments and 4 tests, and he drops the worst grade from both. He is a very nice person to talk to and he has a deep understanding of the topic. You won't regret taking the class.

Extremely knowledgeable and tries hard to make every student successful and interested. Has an MD and PhD so he definitely knows his stuff, and he literally wrote the book on college biology (but doesn't at all seem full of himself).

Love this teacher so much. His lectures were informative yet fun and I loved how he managed to make an online course so interactive and engaging. Prof Morris himself was very caring to students and always encouraged students to find him for questions or just to hang out! Just take good notes and the tests and hw should be a breeze!
He's incredibly kind, and I enjoyed going to his office hours just to chat. His class isn't too difficult, but still mentally stimulating. I would love to take a class with him in the future.

Really amazing and caring man, his whole class was online but he chose a time outside of his normal office hours to hang out with students and talk about bio in the SCC. Inspired me to be a bio major.
Professor Morris is AMAZING! My only complaint about him is that he doesn't teach more classes because I've taken all of his. Any student would be lucky to have him!
best professor I've ever had! made human anatomy so fun and interesting! he is very passionate about what he teaches and really cares about his students. I learned so much from this class!

Have you ever wished you could take a class taught by Hank Green? Dr. Morris has the same amount of passion for bio, interest, and humor as Hank and is easily the best prof Ive had so far and makes lectures rlly engaging. Assignments and exams are graded fairly. Watch the lectures and study and your grade will be good
Really awesome professor, very knowledgeable and very kind. Also he has tons of cool fossil collections! The class is not difficult at all if you put some effort into it.
Awesome class and professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Fantastic class! I had fun, enjoyed it, and learned a lot too. Assignments and tests are not difficult if you come to class and do the readings.

Hard to describe what to make of him... he's nice and very knowledgeable, but seems to focus too much on overly specific details on a lot of assignments. Lectures are decent, but a bit roundabout at times, and he often tolerates immature students interrupting him and spamming the chat which gets a bit unprofessional.

Prof Morris is truly an amazing professor. He makes lectures so interesting and makes the students really engaged in the material. I only went his office hours a handful of times but each time, he was so nice and caring and I really enjoyed talking to him. It was an 8am, so I was always tired, but enjoyed waking up for his class.
Absolutely and by far the best lecturer I've ever had. Gets you absolutely stoked on the material, especially for it being a giant intro class.

Fantastic teacher, had fun in the class and learned a lot. Opened my eyes up to a whole area of science (evolution) that I had not thought too much about before. No participation was taken but I showed up to the lectures because they were well taught and enjoyable
Amazing and inspirational professor. Definitely take this class.
Best science class I took at Brandeis. Tests aren't hard if you attend class and do the readings.

I liked this class, and Jim is a really great person. I will say that you have to memorize alot of very small details. Some are important like the timeline of life on Earth, but others seem to be very arbitrary and then are worth quite a bit on exams. Assignments have clear grading criteria, and the content is interesting. He is a nice guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He is really an amazing professor! makes class fun while knowledge stick! really glad chose his class!
Makes bio accessible for non-bio people. I was willing to wake up at 8 am for him. He's super interesting and I feel like I have actually learnt super interesting and relevant information.

If you thought relearning mitosis and feedback inhibition in every biology class you ever took was fun, you'll definitely enjoy actually learning something new for once. If you were never a bio person, prof Morris will change your mind. Great, organized, and clear lecturer. Easy, but interesting and w/ some challenging aspects. Youll never be bored
My favorite class so far, such a great professor.
Professor Morris taught really interesting and important lecture. I cannot read his slides without attending his lecture.
Amazing lectures. It is fun to take his lectures even in the morning. The exams covers all materials he uses in class.
I slept through a test, emailed him when I woke up and he let me take it in his office that afternoon for full credit. Super nice guy, definitely wants to see you succeed.

Truly an outstanding biology professor. Makes the subject matter accessible to non-science people. If you are ever confused, go to office hours and he will definitely help you out. Cares about his students.
Love his classes- even though its at 8am!
It's a really interesting class, although there's a lot to memorize. Show up to the lectures, take good notes, learn them well for the tests, and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is an amazing professor. His lectures are clear and interesting. Reading the textbook is very useful but coming to lectures is crucial. Assignments and tests are not easy but as long as you follow the lectures, you will be fine. Come to his office hour or TAs office hour. They are very helpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Fantastic class! Classes and exams really made me think.
He's a great professor, likes getting the class involved. He does give you outside reading, but I enjoyed it.

Amazing prof! Super smart! Had him for BIOL 16a: Evolution and BIOL 43b: CVA. He loves explaining information in office hours.  He really wants his students to do well! His tests require a lot of memorization.  I ended up making up some of my own tests as well as flashcards for studying.  Your grade will reflect the effort you put into the course.
An Amazing professor who really explains stuff thoroughly and cares about his students!!
Awesome professor. Always available during office hours. Homework is fun. If you come to class you're good because he'll tell a story and you'll remember that story during your exam.

Amazing teacher!!! Take his classes if you can. He's helpful, genuinely cares about students, and tries to make his classes as interesting as possible. Great lecturer, great at answering questions outside of class.
Great class, clear lecturer.
Professor Morris taught me to really think about the material, not just take tests.  I highly recommend this class.  It changed the way I think about the world.

Professor Morris is a wonderful teacher and father figure.  He really cares about his students, and always made sure we understood the chapters and tried to involve us in discussion (and was usually successful).  Highly recommended!
This was the best class I took at Brandeis.
This was my favorite class at Brandeis.  The professor was extremely enthusiastic and caring.  He really brought the information to life.  I highly recommend it.

Jim Morris is a very dedicated, intelligent, and generally kind professor.  Despite the class being larger than 70 students, I felt I could have had individualized attention had I sought it often.  The Biology and Culture of Deafness was fascinating, with many guest speakers, especially when discussing the sociology.  Every Thursday was ASL day!

Professor lamb's course is easy, but dependent on the TA. She is not engaging and talks about her anthropological work in different rural countries in kind of a bothersome manner. She describes it in a way where she places herself higher than those she interacts with. Kinda racist undertones

Professor Lamb was a very interesting lecturer and her class was interesting. She really cares about the course material and incorporates her research. I enjoyed the readings, which I would recommend doing. Papers are easy and graded very leniently. I studied hard for the midterm which paid off.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor talked about her research experience, which I found particularly unsettling. Enabling for harm to those she was observing. Gives tremendous preference to her white students, ironic with her course of study being ANTH. Worst professor I have had at Brandeis. Very boring.
Prof Lamb is very informative and offers a fully unbiased take on any subject she taught in this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Racist professor

Professor Lamb is more laid-back and her lectures are not heavy. She uses her own experience in many lectures, but it does offer a personal touch, as she is very passionate about her research. There are way too many readings, and you have to use them in your work. Overall, not my favorite class but it's very doable.

I literally got 94+ on all of my assignments, 99 on the midterm, and still somehow have an A-.... The class is easy but the grading scale and system makes no sense, and they always take off points for no reason

Professor Lamb is very kind and knowledgeable, however, ANTH 1A is a general overview course of anthropology that can be quite unengaging. I would recommend one of the more specific anthropology courses over this if you want to see if anthropology interests you.

inspired me to be an anth minor, TAs take their job too seriously, readings only need to be done to prep for midterm and final, love Sarah:), so much knowledge about what she teaches, you will get an A if you try the class is not a weed out

Professor Lamb was the best professor I had freshmen year at Brandeis. She made sure to give different perspectives on each topic we talked about and it made me really interested in anthropology. There definitely is a lot of reading and writing, but I found it interesting so it didn't feel annoying to have to read. Highly suggest taking her class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: Professor Lamb is overall great. This class is super interesting and fun! The one page essays can get to be a lot but revisions are always welcome. She loves to chat outside of class and hear insights. Definitely recommend this class :)

She actually teaches in the lectures! Many readings and movies but they are fun to read/watch. Come to her office hours. She gives you genuine feedback & actually cares about your feelings. She will remember your name & your essay topic among a 150 ppl class. However the grades are mostly determined by the TA tho so good luck

As an anthropology major at Brandeis, I have to say that Prof. Lamb is definitely the best. Her classes are inspiring and interesting. I took her class ANTH 111a: Aging in Cross-Cultural Perspective, which is really writing-intensive and reading-intensive. But as long as you put a good amount of effort, you will get a good grade!
I would prepare for a speech for a week in advance, have her read the outline, meet on zoom and present speech to her, to only receive 70's on every speech. Awful teacher, did not learn anything

She is clearly passionate about her research, as she mentions the same crap every day. Literally cant go a week without hearing about the girls she stayed with when she did her fieldwork. I mean good story, but damn is she dry. Also the writing is graded by the TAs and while I liked my TA, the grading is really hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: So kind and helpful teacher. Easy class, but reading is required.
she is just so niceeeee
Interesting and engaging class, taught very well. I was never bored. If you do the readings, you will do well.
Great class, lectures were very interesting and engaging. Material was interesting! Grade is mostly based on your TA.

Professor Lamb keeps the class very engaged during lectures. She assigns a lot of readings but they are interesting. Assignments are very clear and if you go to her for help she's available. There is a lot of material but if you stay up-to-date you can do really well.

Everyone raved about this professor and how easy her intro class is, but I think that needs clarification. Its easy, as in, you won't fail. However, MOST OF THE GRADING is done by the TA's and if you disagree, chances are you'll get a high B, low A. The class has little structure and the tone is very preachy.

She's such a sweet woman, and the TAs were also very helpful in this class.  She's very smart, and the stuff she has done is so interesting to hear about.  The class was a good mix of movies, lectures, discussion groups, and in class discussions. You should really do the readings, you'll be pretty lost without doing at least a good portion of the,.
Brilliant, encouraging, cheerful, and always very, very helpful, both inside the class and out.
terrific professor. very inspiring! opens mind. cares about students.

I enjoy Professor's Lamb class so much that I'm changing my major to Anthropology. She's so caring about her students, and if you take the time to ask her for help, she'll give you the world. I strongly reccomend taking at least one course with her in your career at Brandeis...

Her lectures were great! I loved the class and the more I read the more I fell in love with the subject ! Although her voice seems to dampen in the course of the lecture, the classes were pretty much manageable though. Go to her during office hours. She is dying to help you.Very Knowledgeable and I am looking forward to take another class of hers !

I thought this was the worst Anth class I have ever taken, and I am an anthro major and have taken seven anth classes before this one.  The class was SO boring.  I never attended...which was my big downfall.  If you don't attend, don't expect to do well on the test.  She is a very boring teacher and everthing you do is graded by TAs
Do all of the readings and attend most of the lectures. If you find the topics interesting you'll be just fine

the lecture is pretty helpful, i'd say attend as many of them as you can or you can miss out on some stuff. Also, do all the readings. I read nothing and studied all her lecture notes in class and I got a C- on the mid term. I read my**** for the final and i got a really good grade. So, read your**** and attend as many class to get an A.

Took Anth 1a as a requirement & then "Medicine, Body & Culture", Anth of Gender, and Anthro of the Body, merely b/c Prof. Lamb taught them!Her enthusiasm and approachability sparked my love for Anthropology and I went on to do my Masters, and now my PhD in antrho. She is a very thoughtful, inspiring and inclusive teacher. The best I have ever had!
She was ok.  It was only a required intro course so there wasnt much to be done with the class anyway.
If you are not PC...don't open your mouth in the class, lest you say something that may be minutely insensitive....

Lamb is a fantastic professor.  I intend to take even more of her classes.  She speaks rapidly, but is very helpful in class and at office hours.  She really loves teaching, offers great courses, and grades both fairly and well.
One of the best profs I have ever had- passionate about anthro and teaching, challenging, and accepting of student's ideas and perspectives. Respectful, helpful, and loves teaching.
The best professor at Brandeis! She is enthusiastic and makes the material very interesting. Very helpful and respectful of student's idea. A good discussion leader as well.
A wolf in sheeps clothing
awesome prof, helpful and great lectures...definitely take the class!
No Comments
Very pleasant teacher, passionate lecturer, all-around great prof.
A wonderful professor, always willing to help...the nicest professor I've had.
No Comments

Katz is an awesome prof, always excited to learn from him and left lecture with cool neuro facts to share. Quizzes were very fair and a lot of questions came straight from stuff discussed in class. An epic guy that made learning fun. Content might be more unfamiliar if you're an underclassman psych major vs. neuro but still would highly recommend.

An incredible professor who is passionate about neuroscience and teaching. Always makes lectures fun. The only downside was that your grade was only determined by 6 timed exams, so if you're a bad test taker it's tough to do well. The exams are usually 10 multiple choice and one short answer, so if you make mistakes, there is not much to save you.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Katz lectures are incredibly engaging! I learned so much information and I enjoyed his humorous lecturing style. The class structure involves 9 quizzes only. 1 quiz from each section is dropped, which results in 6 quizzes making up for final grade. Yes, it can be challenging, but it has been one of the most fun classes I have taken!

Not only do I believe that Don Katz is the most entertaining speakers at this university, I believe that your experience at Brandeis is worse off without taking this course. The content is engaging and up to date; he makes content that other professors would find hard to make remotely interesting your favorite class.
Very difficult class, but very very good and interesting class. He is a great lecturer and knows how to keep students attention. I definitely recommend if you don't care if you end up with a B.
Unreasonably tough course! Doesn't worth the effort! Avoid it and have a better life!

He teaches well...But the first several exams are super hard. Also his grades release quite late that you don't even know if you perform well or not before the drop deadline and decide whether to drop or not.

I took this class remotely on my first semester of college. His class is super interesting yet kinda hard for me (esp my first language is not English). I have to study rly rly hard. Watching the recording a couple of times. But after all the hard work, I got an A. And definitely go to his office hours. He is super helpful and funny.

I really liked this class. It's not an easy A, but the workload is manageable if you are not taking too many other difficult classes in the same semester. The way I did well in the class was by attending every lecture and then in the evening re-watching the lecture and pausing constantly to take detailed notes. He's a really nice and fun person!

I am a senior at Brandeis and have taken two classes with Don. He is, with certainty, one of the best professors I have ever had. If you have the chance to take a course with him - TAKE IT. I promise you will learn a lot - not just information, but how to analyze the world from a critical perspective.

Intro to Behavioral Neuro was the hardest thing I have ever done to myself, but it was the class I've learned the most from. I am still thinking about it and it's been a year. The class is only graded by three tests so you have to pass them! Go to his office hours, they're early but he's the funniest and will explain whatever you need help with!
Fantastic professor. Use office hours and let down your ego.

I thought he was being funny to scare us the course is hard. he's not. I drop his class after the first test and y'know why He is an excellent lecturer everything he says is interesting and humorous I wish this is not a mandatory class for my major so I could use p/f for it, but it's not

Where to even start with this man... he acts like he is royalty bc of his knowledge of skittles. All he does is lecture on and on as he uses politically incorrect language. Sure, some classes can be interesting but overall he was a pain in my ass. If I took a shot every time he mentioned how hard his class/tests are, I would be dead. Ya dig it? No.

Don Katz is an incredible lecturer. He knows so much about the material and is always super helpful! I would def recommend going to class, but he does post videos of the lecture. You'll put in a lot of work to study, and the tests are a bit challenging, but not impossible!! Not as difficult as everyone says they are. Don't freak out! Ask for help!

Don Katz is by far the best professor I've had at Brandeis so far. His lectures will keep you engaged, and he shows incredible passion and humor throughout them. class itself is difficult, and is graded on only the two midterms and the final. I have had success with studying by rewatching his lectures (which is quite entertaining) and taking notes.

Best Professor I've ever had. He'll tell you to take this pass/ fail himself and I couldn't agree more. But take this, no matter what your major is. Don is an amazing mentor, Professor and person. Every class is fascinating

First day he scares people away. I was panicked at first. After a bit he becomes friendlier. I respect his teaching style but his class is REALLY TOUGH but also INTERESTING. Only graded by the three exams, which I dislike. IF YOU CAN TAKE IT CREDIT/NO CREDIT DO THAT. DOES care about helping students but I wish I didn't have to worry about grades.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Not only is Professor Katz is a brilliant lecturer, he is also a caring, wonderful person if you go to his office hours. He makes everything so fun and 'groovy.' The exams are difficult but you can do well if you work hard. Dont bother buying the textbook because he proves most of it wrong. Just re watch his lectures, take notes and read his notes.

While I found the class to be very interesting, I believe Professor Katz and his exams are hyped up. The exams are not all that difficult if you go to class and put in the time and effort to study. Also, I believe he is a good lecturer, but nothing out of this world like many other reviews on here suggest. Overall, it was a fairly good class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: amazing. amazing. amazing.  Incredibly witty and knows how to motivate students to study.

Take this class pass-fail if you can. Katz is a brilliant lecturer and his tests, for better or worse, are precisely fair. Grade is only from tests and there's little to no extra credit. I worked my butt off for a B-, but I'm so glad I took that class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Don is the best professor I have ever had! If I didn't want to be an actor, I would switch my major to neuroscience right now. He is always willing and available to help his students, and will answer any and all questions. He makes neuroscience interesting and funny. Wish he taught all my classes. But prepare to study like crazy for his tests!
Don Katz is the best professor at Brandeis. Take this class even if you don't intend to go into neuroscience, or even the social sciences at all.

Professor Katz is probably the best teacher I have ever had in my life, period. I was nervous about this class but ended up LOVING it. Behavioral Neuro with him was the hardest and most rewarding class I have ever taken. I didn't memorize a bunch of crap and then forget it. I really learned. For an optimal education, I would take all of his classes

He is arguably the most amazing professor I've ever had. His lectures were the highlight of my week. He is hilarious. His tests are tough, but they aren't as bad as he makes them out to be. My only complaint is that he teach more classes.
Great professor!

Katz is just a great professor. He really REALLY knows his stuff, lectures are really interesting and he explains things really well. The material sticks with you. He's also funny and nice to look at.
Amazing, funny, engaging, all of the above. Tests are tough, but do-able. Mainly based on lectures, but textbook solidifies and expands on the information presented. Great class, great professor.
Brilliant, foxy, a great lecturer. Don Katz rules in all arenas. *sigh*....

Professor Katz is simply awesome! The material is interesting already, but his enthusiasm and humor make it truly fascinating. Answers every question asked in class, and is easy to reach afterwards if you need more help. He's exactly what a professor should be like.
... and he's a jazzy sax player !
He gives the best lectures of any professor I've ever had. Excellent teacher and dreadfully handsome.

Prof. Katz is very intelligent and great at connecting disparate parts of the course.  If you need help, go to his office hours.  He is more than happy to explain even very complicated ideas any time.  Great personality and jokes also!
I'm not sure if I enjoy Katz or the subject matter more. Coming to class (& taking notes) is important, but with this professor, why wouldn't you want to come to class?
I like professors who swear in class. cool guy, fascinating subject matter.
Awesome professor, definitely makes the material more interesting more than anyone else ever could. I LOVE THIS PROFESSOR.
fun professor- as he would say -"groovy"
Amazing professor...

Unjust! Miara insisted on grading anything beneath a 90% as a 0% and she is an incredibly nitpicky grader. Here is a quotation from her syllabus, "each question in the assignment will be graded on credit/ no credit system. In order to receive credit for your answer you need to demonstrate a 90% correct and complete answer." This is crazy unjust.

Extremely clear and engaging lecturer that made waking up for an 8AM class easy. Physio is a very exciting subject and none of that was lost in this course. Grading almost felt too easy between all the accommodations given to students for the exams (revisions, cheat sheets, 5 points taken from the max, lowest dropped, etc.)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Much of your grade comes from the weekly assessments. She posts answer keys with the criteria clearly explained for each assessment and gives you three chances for each topic, so it's not difficult to write what she wants. Also, you have to pay ~$60 to access the textbook and participation quizzes (10% of your grade) through Macmillian.

Great professor, very nice, very down to earth at office hours. Lectures are engaging and she has great energy. Only annoying thing is the weekly assessments. It seems if you don't write EXACTLY what's on the key you won't get the point, you just have to pray for a good grader.
She is a lovely person! As long as you stay on top of things this class is fairly easy. I wish I went to her office hours more often but I am excited to take BIOL 42 with her!

I had Dr. Miara for BIOL 15B as well and actually hated her in that class, but in BIOL 42B, she was a lot more approachable and helpful in the lab. It ended up being a really fun class and I would definitely take another higher level course with her.

I took the physiology lab course and it was honestly one of my preferred Brandeis lab experiences. The experiments were kinda fun to complete and although the lab reports were kinda tedious, she allowed us to ask her questions and we had the opportunity at the end of the semester to resubmit anything for a better grade. Easily approachable too!

I took this class my first semester at Brandeis honestly just because it was one of the only courses open when I went to enroll (& I had a good experience with biology in high school). Professor Miara is a lovely person and good lecturer who makes an effort to get to know her students, despite biol15 being a huge lecture class.

There are weekly assessments, which you have 3 tries to master each topic which is nice. She goes over everything in the lecture, but using the textbook and reviewing the slides is essential since not everything is explained in depth or is gone over too quickly to comprehend. The TAs were extremely helpful and caring as well.
Easy class. Great lecturer, highly respected, and has many options to meet outside of class. Assessments every week but you get three chances per topic.
At first I hated this class but once you get the hang of it its not so bad. Dr Miara was very helpful in office hours but its up to you to take that initiative
Great professor. Very clear lectures and helpful drawings in class. You're able to comprehend the material from her lectures, and she's really passionate about getting to know her students.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Miara's class was enjoyable and much of the content was similar to AP Biology. Personally liked the weekly assessment format which required about ~2 hours of studying if you stay on top of things. Would def suggest going to lectures/watching recordings as the diagrams she draws are helpful. Very nice person and class didn't require much work.

very strict. go to lectures. you'll thank yourself later. keep up with topics. use the answer keys. often repeats questions on assessments. if you don't say exactly what she's looking for you won't get credit. good luck

Her lectures are  informative and she's a very good lecturer. We didn't have unit tests, we had weekly assessments. I missed one of the assessments due to a family emergency, and even though I told her about it in advance, she didn't let me retake it. If you do not say exactly what she wants you to say, you won't get credit. Very strict grader.

Although it's confusing at first, you can understand the way that she grades things and how to earn an A in her class. Just make sure you stay on top of your work because it's really easy to become overwhelmed or fall behind. The quiz questions can be annoying and sometimes they're looking for specific answers, but they're not bad. Its a good class

Super friendly and excellent at teaching and explaining things to beginners. Tests happen every week and are graded pretty strictly but you're meant to have multiple attempts so it's not too difficult to do well if you study.

She's super friendly and really good at teaching. She goes out of her way to make herself accessible/approachable and draws things out to explain bio in a way that makes sense. Her tests are graded a bit strictly on a rubric, but they're doable as long as you've learned the specifics of every system. Shes honestly the reason I'm a bio major

Really great lecturer and is super knowledgable/passionate about the things that she teaches. Very helpful and loves talking with students. She is a super tough grader and her exams are very difficult. Not much homework but that means that exams effect your grade a lot.

This is the 4th class I have taken with Maria. She was a great teacher for Bio15 and a pretty good teacher for Bio42 and 44. For physio, she takes a VERY long time to grade assignments. She also assigns a lot of busy work like perusall and discussion boards. but overall, I like her a lot, have enjoyed her classes, and have learned so much from her.

She's so nice and so caring! She wants to help all of her students. She is really not a tough grader and marks as per the grading rubric! If you're well-versed with the content you will be fine! She's reasonable and generous with extensions but she expects hard work from her students! Her tests are challenging so be prepared to work!

Professor Miara is very accessible and very helpful when you visit her. She is a great professor who clearly explains what she wants from her tests and from her homeworks. The syllabus clearly outlines what is expected and if you do not study for her class you will definitely struggle. Otherwise, her slides and lectures are very detailed and useful
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Very friendly and goes to great ends to make herself accessible to her students. Her lecture style (interactive and drawing-based) works amazingly well with the content, and if you attend lecture and take decent notes you shouldn't need to study much to do well on tests.

Great example of a wonderful person but awful professor. Very funny, friendly, and reasonable. She's easy to talk to and hard to not get along with. That being said, at least for her online class, her grading criteria is terribly unclear, the class structure is monotonous, and while the textbook is "optional", you don't stand a chance without it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Professor Miara was great for bio15. I really enjoyed her lectures. When lecturing, she took her time teaching to make sure student grasped the information. She is a tough grader through--if you don't write the exact words she's looking for you'll get points off. But, if you listen to lectures and take great notes you'll do more than fine.

Miara was a nightmare for me this semester. Her material is fairly straightforward but her tests are brutal when it comes to grading. I fell ill twice this semester where I had to be hospitalized and every email I sent with proof of hospitalization didnt even get a response from her which resulted in my grade lowering. She is wildly unprofessional

Prof. Miara is passionate about what she teaches and delivers information to the students successfully. The grade you receive is highly dependent on the TA that grades your exam/homework, to the point where some people get points taken off for something and others don't. Go to lecture, pay attention, and complete the study guides before the tests.

I will start by saying that Professor Miara does care about her students. She made certain that each student was aware of test-taking strategies and opportunities for improvement. That being said, her grading criteria is nothing short of brutal, as even exact synonyms of some terms will cost entire points on her exams. Quality of TAs is crucial.

Fair teacher with a fair grading rubric and fair tests. You really only need the textbook to supplement her lectures but anything on the test is coming from lecture. The most annoying part of class was recitation. She was nice during office hours. The final is the easiest thing Ive ever taken (just all old tests put together) - 98%.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: dont let her pre-class music fool you, prof miara is an extremely cold and uncaring person. she behaved very impolitely when i visited her during office hours, & it came off as unprofessional and inconsiderate. dont know if shes an intentionally rude person or if she has no social skills. i thought canadians were nice but i guess not

grades tests exactly to her arbitrary rubric  expects you to include even extraneous details in your response. and if your response rewords or rephrases language from the "correct" answer, you're "wrong." powerpoints are awful  only images and barely any words. terrible oration, so her lectures need to be supplemented with the $$$ textbook

Professor Miara is fantastic. Her grading criteria is extremely clear, lectures are easy to listen to, and tests are fairly graded. Recitation assignment grades for 15B seem to vary wildly depending on your TA. The textbook is "recommended," but literally nobody reads it, so save your money. Also, beware of "THE" pop quiz
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is really a fair professor. Her lecture is also very clear. Homework load are fair.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: This review is for her Harvard Extension courses, BIOS-66 and -18. She is a great professor, easy grader. Courses were overall very straightforward--easy As while still being extremely interesting. Would absolutely recommend to anyone who is looking for an easy course, or with an interest in the subject matter without a deep background in bio.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: Professor Miara teaches a very doable class. If you stay on top of lecture material, you will be fine. Tests are very fair and cover only material done in lecture. Do a good job on recitation assignments, because they are an easy way to boost test grades and are worth just as much! Work hard and it is manageable.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved her Cells and Organisms class. If you study hard and stay on top of the material you will be find.  At the end of every lecture she gives a list of questions that are important for the lecture, make a study guide using those questions and you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Miara is helpful in office hours and very approachable. Material was interesting (esp. body systems). USE THE TEXTBOOK to supplement lectures. Course was manageable and easy to do well in--pending you go to class and follow her lectures. Exams are straightforward and stem directly from her slides/what she elaborates on in class.

Amazing professor. Lectures are so informative, clear and interesting that not once have I fallen asleep in her 8am lecture. Her tests are hard if you don't study. Study the material she teaches in class and you should be well prepared for the exam. Go to her office hours, she's super helpful and really nice.

Memorization.  Tests are all class notes on the slides.  Get in a group with other students to help prepare for the final. Follow the presentation rubric guidelines like they are rules. Fascinating subject!  Great teacher!  You will learn so much from her!  Would definitely take again!
Busy work, a waste of a class, lost some neurons listening to the oafs in the class questions. Instead of this class? READ A WIKIPEDIA ARTICLE you'll probably learn more.

This class is easy and filled with busy work, yet they grade-specific assignments like Econometrics or a class of actual value. The guy yaps endlessly and goes on random tangents about his personal life that often barely relate to the topic. They will not give you credit on certain assignments for no reason, even though it's all useless busy work.

Genuinely, Perlman might be the best professor here at Brandeis. If you're into environmental studies or science, be ready for some super interesting lectures. Even though he has hundreds of students, he still actively tries to connect with you and be down-to-earth. Perlman clearly cares about what he is teaching. 11/10 recommend.

Dan Perlman is the best lecturer at Brandeis. Take tree class immediately! It was interesting and easy if you did all of the assignments. There are a lot of assignments but they are easy and graded easily. You will learn a lot and enjoy it a lot. The TAs are also fantastic. I would highly recommend this class for your first semester.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Easy and enjoyable class. Prof. Perlman is funny and nice.

This man knows how to TEACH! I always felt so inspired and interested in knowing more about specific things after a class. If there were any other classes he taught I would be the first to enroll. There's busywork for sure but considering the ease of the class it's not a big deal. Dan is a caring man, GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS!!! You won't regret it!

Dan Perlman is not only an expert on his subjects, he also teaches effectively. A lot of college professors are trained in their subject but have no clue how to teach; not him! Yes there are a lot of assignments, but they're mostly short, just READ THE ASSIGNMENT SHEET. He wants to get to know you and is super kind.
Prof is a nice guy and tries to get to know everyone. Lots of little assignments and due dates to keep up with but I found them to be fun. Tree walks are great, the class makes you get outside.

Not as good as I thought he would be. Definitely very nice and had some inspirational stories, but a TON of busy work. Many little assignments, hour and 20 min. tree walks in addition to 2 class periods each week. He was pretty disorganized, changed due dates often and what assignments we had to do. However, still an easy class for science req.

Dan is one of the most caring profs at Brandeis, he wants to know every student in a 100+ lecture hall.  His class is an easy A, but you will still learn a lot. all assignments are all or no credit based so make sure you follow the rubric, you will get 0%. so so many little assignments (put them in your calendar).

I love this guy! Awesome lectures and takes the time to get to know everyone in his course despite it having 100+ students! As long as you give his lectures your attention and try on the assignments you'll get a good grade.

This class is very easy, if you do all or most of the work and show up to class you will get an A. The class is a lot of busy work but none of it is particularly difficult. You're never tested on material from the lectures so you can just show up and sit there and receive participation credit.

Dan is THE best professor I've had at Brandeis, super inspirational, and is so passionate about his subject. He also cares so much about his students, I'd say he remembers 95% of the students' names in a 100+ people class. PITW was the best assignment I've ever had IMO. GO TO HIS OH and you can form a strong and positive relationship with him.
He is very knowledgeable and caring. He knows a lot about the environment and passionate about what he is doing. Great tutor.
A very wise man. Go to his office hours and get to know him!
Dr. Dan is a national treasure. Such a caring man who loves his subject matter. Did I fall asleep in most of his lectures? Absolutely. But did I love the class? Absolutely.

Not very helpful when it comes to comments, and seems to pick on a select few people for answering questions. He is an inspirational man though! Has lived an interesting life and makes an effort to get to know all his students. Lectures get boring very quickly, so don't take it unless you wanna go into enviro.

I'm only a freshman so my feedback may not be worth much but Professor Dan is arguably the best professor at Brandeis and many of his students will agree with me. Take his class even if you're not a stem student! He truly cares for his students and emphasizes the improvement of their skills. He is always available and accessible outside of class.

I have never met a professor more dedicated to his students. I bumped into him in upper a semester after taking his class and he remembered who I was even though I wasnt the most active in the class. Tree class is the best class at Brandeis because of him and I hope as many people take it as possible.
AMAZING prof.

Dan really is an amazing prof. Whether you love or hate science, I recommend taking this class. He cares a lot about his students and the environment. I learned a lot and was rarely bored. He's also just an inspirational guy. This class isn't hard -- just study for the quizzes and you'll be fine.

Not only is Perlman incredibly passionate about his subject, but he's also extremely good at igniting this same passion in his students. I took this class mostly to fulfill the science requirement; now, I'm thinking about pursuing Env. Studies as a major or minor. He cares about his students' well-being and values their opinions and thoughts.
I absolutely love Dan P he changed my life if youre not taking tree class youre making the biggest mistake you could make at this school.

Professor Perlman is one of the best professors I've had. He's truly an inspiration to anyone planning on majoring in environmental science. He truly gets to know everyone of his students and knows every single persons name. He is very accessible during office hours and truly wants you to succeed. Just make sure to study for the tree quizzes!

The class is pretty much just graded on quizzes and if you are just one letter off in spelling, you get the whole thing wrong. Marked answers on midterms as wrong just because it wasn't the answer he was looking for but according to Google, it was correct. Lectures are long and boring and he is very unsympathetic to students.

One of the best professors I've ever had in my life. Very supportive and understanding to students. His teaching methods helped me become a better, more obsevant reader and it starting to show itself in my other classes. If your lucky enough to take this man class you will experience nothing but positive things
Hands down the best professor at Brandeis!! His environemtal class is amazing and he's always there for his students!! Changed my life!!
Perlman is awesome and super down to earth. He ties in life concepts in every lecture. Worth it to have him even if you have no interest in Environmental Science or Ecology. Great Professor.
The best professor i've ever had at Brandeis. He cares about his students and uses very progressive teaching methods. For ecology, his exams are take home

Dan's the man.  He's deeply engaged with and knowledgeable about his subject, and he knows how to give a lecture that's interesting and makes you think. He doesn't go easy on his students, but he is fair and generous with his time if you need help.

Had Perlman for animal behavior and Conservation Biology. He expects students to do all of the readings (which are reasonable). Lectures were enjoyable and easy to understand. He truly cares about all of his students and will go out of his way to help you. One of my favorite professors at Brandeis!

Conservation Biology=AMAZING! At times the lectures were a bit bland but for the most part he kept the class engaged and inspired.  I would recommend this class/professor to everyone-it is incredibly relevant to today's issues and Pearlman is the perfect professor for the class.
If you need help he's there for you. He's passionate about what he teaches, so hopefully your interested in learning about it!
No Comments

I certainly wouldn't say Dr. Perlman was cocky, though my final grade was slightly less than I calculated. I realize this fact will send most Brandeis kids into aneurisms but apart from this Dan is freakin awesome. His clsases are fun and interactiveand by the end you WILL care about ecology. Theres a reason he's won so many awards for best teacher
one of the cockiest sons of B*tches i've ever met. was very misleading in how he was grading the course and screwed multiple students over on their final grades.
Great class!
I had this professor for Humans and the Environment. It was REALLY interesting and not hard at all. It was a wonderful course for my last semester in college.
Engaging lectures, fair exams and a lot of assignments but if you manage evenly over time, you'll do well. Would take his class again
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: So many extra credits that really boost up your grade!!

Really good professor!
I wish I could take another class with him.
He cares about his students and even though his class is lecture heavy, he always makes it enjoyable

Prof Clarke is a very nice person. He shows a whole lot respect and caring to students. The grades compose of feedbacks, presentations, and quizzes. It might sound scary but he never tortures his student. He gives lots of make ups so don't panic about messing a presentation or quiz. He is very reasonable. Its a little hard to reach him by email.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Easy A. Simple lecture course.
Best professor so far

He's amazing. He thinks of his students as human beings and I never felt any anxiety about his class. You can talk to him one on one if you ever run into problems and he will work them out with you. He's quite understanding and very caring and kind. I'm so glad I took his class. I learnt so much. The attendance isn't mandatory but I wanted to go.
Amazing Professor. He cares A TON about students and is willing to support them in the subject. Has TA's that also go the extra mile. Very well respected and would 100% take his class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Geoff is a legend at Brandeis and it's for a good reason. Very chill and understanding, no mandatory attendance, and has videos for his course so you don't have to attend lectures. The class does require a $100 textbook tho.

He's a very good person to teach an into class. He makes the lecture rather interactive. Generally you will have a weekly 5 min (2 question) quiz during recitation and a chapter of homework on a platform he requires you to purchase (its $109 which is the biggest downside). Would retake. You get a solid understanding for future classes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Clarke is amazing! He made Intro to Micro feel very accessible. It had a super reasonable workload, and I loved having the option to choose to write two papers instead of taking a midterm and a final. He's a really kind grader if you write the papers. The recitations also rarely lasted very long (which I appreciated).
He is truly passionate about teaching and constantly making sure that every student is being respected.

Despite my sub-par quantitative/math background, Dr. Clarkes clear, engaging and caring teaching style made his class the highlight of my semester. I found his lectures to be knowledgeable, digestible and engaging. He really make an effort to build a personal relationship with every student, even making them coffee at office hours.
He's really nice!

People seemed to really respect and like him all semester.  I wasn't a huge fan to be honest.  I learned practically nothing in his class and found it very repetitive, but he was a good professor.  He was down to earth and real, and 10A is also an intro class, so I don't believe there's much better that can be done.
His teaching makes you like econ and that not very intro-class teaching professor able to do

Geoff is super nice and really cares about how you are doing in class. There is weekly homework, you just need to read the Macmillan textbook online and weekly feedback. You can also choose between a closed book exam and an essay, both are not hard if you go to the class and read the text carefully.
would definitely take his class again. He is chill and caring.
great overall professor for intro classes.
Very chill and understanding, cares for students and genuinely wants you to pass the class. Gives a ton of extra credit. Midterm was a breeze.

intro class so was pretty easy, you just need to read the textbook and take notes based off that. homework based on textbook so it wasn't too difficult. he welcomes students asking questions and encourages discussion. overall good introduction to economics
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a great guy, but assigns way too much. He doesn't know the formulas for algebra 1 and taught a complete different way. His recitation quizzes are impossible.

He gives lots of opportunity for extra credit and is very understanding. The class and the exams follow the textbook towards the first half of the semester. It's helpful to go to him after a test or paper to see how you could improve for the next paper/test.

Not as hardcore as professor Sa but still a great professor. I took Econ 80a when it was the first time Clarke teaches this course so his lecture is a bit unorganized, especially the math part, but now he might be better.
He's everyones favorite, all around super nice guy who really likes to teach and very accomodating. he accepts most to all late work and will grade generously, especially for intro classes
I mean this is an intro course so it's easy A. But Professor talked too much things outside the course. The exam content is unexpected. Be prepared!!!
If you get your work done on time and read the grading rubric, you will do well in his classes. You could not attend any classes and still receive an A in the class.
Very accessible outside of class and fair grader. Just do the readings and you'll be good

He did not teach during online classes. He left all the hard things, reading textbooks and stuff to us after class and does not touch on them unless someone asks him a question. I am very confused with his teaching and this class but still got an A. This class is really boring and meaningless. I learnt nothing but still got an A.

Clarke acts like a nice guy and can have fun with students but he is atrocious at online learning. The least motivating class and teacher I've taken so far. Grading wise-insanely easy to get good grades in this class. Don't need to actually learn economics just do the weekly assignments that he doesn't grade or look at. Group work was terrible too.

Professor Clarke is wonderful. My final policy paper made me feel like I am ready to tackle, write and find solutions to any policy whether it is a tax , healthcare or fiscal policy. His lectures were fascinating. His teachings helped me to grow as a future economist! Remember to do your homework, projects and papers to ensure class success.

Professor Clarke is very engaging and fun and made studying Econ not as daunting as I thought it would be! He made his class relatable and cares to ensure every student fully understands the material. He makes himself as accessible as possible, even holding office hours in the library just to be able to say hi to his students!

Professor Clarke was a very relatable figure in the sense that he studied political science as an undergrad and didn't enter economics because he wanted to crunch numbers all day. He wants you to think critically about what is socially just and morally right, rather than pursuing efficiency without a clear end goal.
The best Econ teacher I've ever had! His practice exams and slides are really helpful. It is easy to get a good grade if you do all the work and pay attention to the class.
He's not the best professor but the class was easy.

Geoff is a great guy - really cared about us as students and did his best to ensure everyone got the grade that they wanted. He's clearly very knowledgable about the subject, and is good at breaking down the material. However, the lectures tended to go off-topic, and it felt like we didn't cover much material by the course's end.

The best economics professor Ive ever had! His course alone convinced me to switch majors. People say that his exams are hard, but if you show up to class and pay attention/use the resources he provides then theyre pretty manageable. He has a policy where he doesnt test on anything that he doesnt say in class and he posts practice exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great person. Terrible professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I came to every class and every recitation, but the thing he taught in class is completely different from the questions in the exam. This is only an introduction course for economics which not even included in the major requirement, and its goal should be cultivate students interest and understanding of economics. He ruin everything !
She is a great professor who is clearly passionate about what she is teaching! Her grading is really harsh and provides little to no partial credit but I highly recommend the course.

Dr. KC is passionate about the subject and seems nice enough. The exams include a fair amount of questions barely related to what's covered in class paired with how she refuses to give any form of partial credit or curving led to overly difficult exams. She's also pretty inaccessible outside of class and I had multiple emails ghosted by her.

Thought Dr. KC was solid and was an engaging + energetic lecturer. Exams were the trickiest part of the course, content would be digestible but some questions loosely related to class or trickier questions. Labs were chill and cool to work with flies + worms. Writing assignments not too bad. An okay lab semester, preferred Fall lab more.

Honestly loved Dr.KC's course teaching and lecture format. The exams were most definitely more difficult than initially expected but still contained all of what was fair to include; she was very understanding in allowing us to complete redemption points. I've taken other classes under her instruction and would most definitely recommend her!

Her lectures are interesting, but she is a tough grader. The exams are extremely tough! If you got a question partially wrong, you would not receive a partial credit. The exam questions were also confusing.

The harshest grader I have ever taken.  She is proud of the fact that she doesn't curve, despite her class average for the midterm being a failing grade.  Her redemption points system gives more points back to those who did well on the exam than those who preformed poorly and need it more. No partial credit on any questions. Ruthless for no reason.

Dr. KC is super passionate and she really cares about her students understanding the information and applying it to the "real world." Very energetic personality. The class itself was easy (as a first year who took AP Bio). She's also very serious, for a good reason, and WILL call you out if u use chatGPT or go on ur phone too much during lecture
