I went into this class without taking AP bio so I was nervous but it turned out great. Professor KC is an incredible lecturer and kept us engaged. Tests, although open note, were extremely difficult. I recommend taking notes online so it is easy to search for topics. She is very knowledgable on the topic and is excited to teach.

Dr. KC is an amazing professor who is chill and is a person who I can talk to without feeling anxious or nervous in a new school setting. She is caring and puts in hard work for her 8:30 am lectures to make them interesting. Definitely one of the best professors at Brandeis
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: The lectures this teacher gives do not prepare you at all for the structure of the tests and the questions given on the tests because they are nothing like what we learn in class. The worst part about this class are the tests she makes which are extremely difficult even though they are both open note and online.

KC is the BEST prof I've ever had. She is the reason why I love science and am interested in going into research as my career. Take advantage of her office hours and get to know her -- she is truly amazing and inspirational. So knowledgable and such a fantastic lecturer.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: KC is the reason I can wake up for 8am lectures. Her passion for teaching is very clear and I wish I could take every science class with her. She is accessible, has clear grading criteria, and wants her students to be successful. Biolab can be hard but she does what she can to make you successful.
Biolab online was interesting. The experience really depends on the UGTA, which mine was great. Dr. KC was incredibly kind!

Dr. KC made me fall back in love with biology after a negative high school experience. She is approachable and truly cares about her students inside and outside the classroom. Her expectations are clear and is very fair in her grading. Go to office hours and take advantage of chances to get to know her.

Has great energy so shes especially good if you can get her for a smaller class than biolab. Lectures are good if not a bit topical, but she has great command of the content and puts great effort into structuring the class in an effective way to help students. A bit of a harsh grader sometimes, but for biolab it depends more on TAs. Very friendly.
Truly ruthless and unforgiving as a grader for literally no good reason, but she seems like a nice enough person. That said, bio lab sucks so so much. -one of her TAs

Amazing teacher! I learned more from her LAB than an actual biology class! She really knows how to teach and makes sure her students understand! She is always accessible! If you ever need help understanding just got talk to her ! Amazing amazing teacher! She really cares about her students

Dr. KC is incredibly lazy as a professor. Questions on the prelabs and postlabs will contain questions about topics that have not been talked about in class. Her explanation to this is that scientists must be able to do their research to find answers, however this is lazy and frustrating as some questions make you dig way too deep into google.

Great lecturershort and to the point, but explains things well. Is very accessible, super friendly and understanding, and responds to emails promptly. Grading can depend on the TA you get, but the course is well-designed and not at all difficult if you keep up with the schedule she lays out for the class.

I wish COVID-19 did not make this class online, because KC was phenomenal and I really found the class engaging. Amazing class discussions and she is really clear about what needs to be done to do well in her class.

I love Dr. KC, and took this class to have her again. That said, I left with a great appreciation for plant biology. It was clear application of biological concepts that I learned in the prerequisite courses. It is really not hard to do well if you follow the grading guidelines! Highly recommend as one of your bio electives for the major.
Really engaging and caring professor. Just go to office hours with an idea of what you need help in and she'll help you with it. Only issue is that the lab manual has a lot of typos.

Dr. KC is one of my favorite professors at Brandeis. She is willing to help you if you make the effort to ask questions and go to office hours. Go to office hours and get to know her. Go to your TA for help. Go to lecture! She is really lively and it is the best 8am class you could take, because she is engaging.

One of the most rude professors I've had, if not the rudest. Has not published any real scientific work, but acts as though the standard she has set forth is the only way to do the work. Would seriously like for Brandeis to completely reevaluate the way the course is taught. Completely subjective, and a waste of all the student's time.
Dr. KC is very good at teaching and knows so much about biology. A real scientist.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: The tests were harder than they needed to be but there were a bunch of little easy homework assignments to keep your grade up. It's an 8am which sucks but she is super energetic and honestly an okay class to have at 8am if you have to have one. Wish I could take this class again, even though it was sad. Hoping to take another Dr. KC class
extremely rude. awful class
Dr. KC is condescending and does not appreciate her students enough. She lectures about one subject and then tests on something completely different. Class is unorganized and unnecessarily difficult.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She goes too fast in lecture and expects too much from her students, even though the classes that are required for the lab don't teach everything that she expects us to know.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Best  professor at Brandeis!

Dr. KC was a great professor to have. I had her for the intro bio labs, and while the material was fairly tough, she did a fantastic job of explaining and breaking everything down. She was very thorough and while grading was tough, the class was curved well enough where in most cases, if you put in the time and work, you would do well.
Just make sure that you attend every single morning class on Tuesday and take every single notes you could during the lecture and lab, and read and study them carefully and you'll be fine for sure.

KC is the best bio teacher I've had.  She really cares about the students, lecture is really fun, and I learned a lot.  Tests were hard, but once I found out how to study (and KC helped me with that) I did really well.  She makes 8am class fun, and no one falls asleep.

She is an awesome lecturer and makes the 8am class time more tolerable.  She also clearly knows her subject.  However, her tests are hard and even if you know the material you may not get as good a grade as you would have hoped.  In addition, some people think she feigns enthusiasm and find this annoying but personally this didn't bother me at all.

A very enthusiastic and efficient lecturer. Teaches in a way that makes the material easily understandable and easy to takes notes for. Her eccentricity makes class more enjoyable and worth attending.
She is perhaps the best professor I have had at Brandeis; she teaches in a way that makes me excited to show up for class despite the fact that class is at 10AM

Total spaz during lectures. She talks to her students as if we are in fifth grade. Also, she definitely lectures with a condescending tone. She is definitely more helpful and down to earth during her office hours. She is very often unavailable.

KC runs a tight ship. Being in her lab programs is a joy because you feel like you're doing real cutting-edge science. Her lectures are fiercely efficient and comprehensive--I've never seen her fail to completely and intelligibly answer a question--and she often answers emails within 20 minutes. I can't imagine a better person to manage the course.

I always have good scores in higher level ECON courses but this class is the only time I got a B+. So many weekly homework, even a long essay, exams are not close to the practice exam. Professor is nice, clear slides, clear homework answers. But I will never take the class again. Not worth it for lower elective
Weird professor
I learned a lot from his class. He is also not a tough grader.
Although the class is a bit boring, Professor Rendius is helpful in terms of answering your questions at any time. The workload of this class is okay, and the exams are not that difficult.

Professor Redenius is knowledgeable and is accessible outside of classroom. Weekly homework are helpful and well-prepared you for the Exams. The first few units of this class can be somehow boring but the class does get very interesting after that.

A very kind, patient man, and I hate to speak ill of him--but his lectures are dreadfully boring. Fortunately, he makes good ppt slides and problem sets, and you can self study pretty much everything using just those.

Professor Redenius is a very nice professor. He cares about his students and wants everyone to do well. Weekly homework that can be tedious, but all answers will be in lectures and slides. Exams are not like the sample exams, so be sure to study and understand the concepts. He is accessible outside of class, so go to office hours. TAs are nice too.
if you attend every class and pay attention to his lectures, you will learn a lot and make you want to learn more about economics.

Tests are mostly math based. Memorize formulas. 
He grades fairly and its the reason behind him being a slow grader. 
I couldnt stay focused in his class but he will be patient and explain things to you during office hours
lectures are super helpful.
This professor teaches very well

As much as I love Econ, Professor Redenius made me despise the subject. Not only is his voice sleepy, but he fails to answer any question you ask him- its better off to go straight to the TA with questions. The questions on the midterms (3 midterms) are worded poorly and graded harshly. No extra credit. I advise taking any other professor for Econ.

Prof.R is very knowledgeable, took 28 with him last year too. There is A LOT OF material in his lectures but not in the slides. His voice is sleepy and it takes effort to keep focused in class , but if you follow his class, it is not hard to do well on hw and tests. slow grader as others mentioned; accessible after class and very helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Redenius is the BEST!!! His Money and Banking teaches you so much about the financial market and the group project about global central banks is extremely helpful to look at world's response to crisis in perspective. I always feel valued as a student and am always able to walk out of his class learning a lot.

I tried hard to pay attention to his lectures, but found his way of speaking impossible to listen to. He is just a bad speaker. If you can manage to listen he actually makes a lot of sense, but I found myself dosing off a lot. I mostly learned outside of class from his slides which were very useful. Class was an intro so it was pretty easy.

The information that Professor Redenius was teaching was quite interesting and he was a solid purveyor of the information which helped me easily pass future classes covering similar material. The exams were fair and I'm pretty sure all of my colleagues felt the same way. He is also an interesting fellow which adds a cool element into his lectures.
Prof. Redenius is super intelligent. I love economics even more because of the way he delivers the concepts.
Scott is amazing. He is very insightful and patient. He would explain concepts in various ways. I find it really helpful when he provides mathematical proofs. He truly brings macroeconomics to life.
Slowest grader I've ever seen
He's a good guy but his lecture is quite boring. Self study may be more effective than attend classes. You can learn most of the stuffs by reading the ppt he uploaded and the textbook.
Amazing lectures. Do all the assignments and group project. Review his PPTs before the exam. You will get an A.

Some people here may be spoiled by Prof Coiner (ECON 10A), which is not necessarily a bad thing. Prof Redenius is no Coiner and is much more quirky, but his PowerPoints are clear and distill the textbook readings very well. Importantly, he also arranges exam review sessions (including for the final), which really helped me understand the material
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This course is hard but his lecture and powerpoint are pretty straight forward. Just simply follow the powerpoint, homework and sample exam before the exam, you would be fine. Besides, he is extremely helpful outside the classroom. Whenever i emailed him about a question or a concern, he will reply to me ASAP and give me some great suggestions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Redenius is a great guy but his lectures are extremely boring. His exams are hard and usually don't have a generous scale.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures are boring that I fell asleep every class. He reads from the slides, but even if you have them ready, he might add a few slides the day before (which totally messed up my mojo). His practice tests ARE NOT ENOUGH. They are so much easier than his actual exams. Homework can be tough, but he drops the lowest few.
Didn't really get much out of the class. Very boring.

Prof. Redenius is a really really nice guy, and his class is clear and well run. His tests can be a nightmare, and his lectures are a bit dull if you're tired, but he's very helpful and I learned a lot.

He's a nice guy but I learned nothing sitting in class listening to his monotonous voice. His H.W.'s suck but they are really the only way you will learn the course material. Advice: Study the book and do the H.W.'s and you'll be fine. Aside from that, you don't even have to bother showing up for class.

He is very nice, but not always clear. Relies too much on powerpoint slides and doesn't do enough examples on the board. However, he is always willing to clarify when someone is confused, and is very nice. His tests are significantly more difficult than his practice tests, and often harder than they need to be.. so know the concepts inside and out.

He is the most boring, unhelpful, and uninteresting professor that I have ever had at Brandeis. He will make you never want to study economics! All the does on the lectures is just to tell what is written in the book, nothing more. And his monotonous speech will make you want to die. He is extremely unconfident and just unable to interest anyone.
Prof. Redenius is extremely responsible and amiable!
He is really nice.

Great guy, really  nice and really helpful if you contact him outside of class. The intro econ class I took with him was boring but it wasn't because of the professor, it was just the subject material.

Such a nice guy. Everything is on his slides so if you study those, you will be fine.He is very helpful when you visit him in his office hours. I can't say he's a really good instructor, but he certainly makes good slides that helps students understand course materials well. For basic econ classes, I thought he was better than any other econ profs.

Who cares about his being nice when he is not a good professor. He needs to embrace it. Was the most boring class I have ever taken. Everything is on his slides, no board work. Lectures are based on boring slides. It is almost impossible to listen to what he is saying. Not helpful at all. Random grading system. Never returns the exams/p.sets.
Very nice guy, means well, but isn't very easy to listen to. Felt like much of the class was learned through the slide shows, after class, rather than from the professor.
Nice Guy. The finals' usually the same as the sample. Bases things from the text book..lectures can get boring though...overall, he's very good

Such a nice guy.  I didn't have a whole lot of interest in the subject myself, but his enthusiasm for the subject kept me interested.  As long as he knows your putting work in and taking the class seriously, he is pretty understanding.

Lots of reading 
fun lectures
really nice professor
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: I would die for her, 10/10, nicest professor alive, did not understand why so many people recommended her classes to me until I took one

Professor McIntosh is an incredibly engaging professor with clear knowledge and excitement about the subject. The semiotic tools taught in this class allow me to see media in a new way and break it down more thoughtfully. If you want an eye-opening, interesting class that isn't going to overwhelm you, take this course!
Lectures are so interesting and well-prepared. TAs are also awesome. I don't want to miss any of her course in the future!
Great teacher. She is very patient and will reply your email in as detailed as possible. Very helpful
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: One of if not the best classes I have ever taken. Prof McIntosh is an outstanding professor. Riveting material that interests both psych and anthro people. Heavy and sometimes difficult material but is so worth it to read. This class will change your perspective on so much! Could not recommend 155b or Prof McIntosh more!

Professor McIntosh is the best professor I've taken a class with at Brandeis. She is a great lecturer and a very established researcher (she wrote one of the books we studied in class and it was amazing). She also keeps the material interesting and is very funny, and she's really kind and accommodating. I'd highly recommend her class to any student

Amazing lecturer. ANTH 26A is lecture based class, and Professor McIntoshs slides and lecture are super organized and cover the readings well. Class participations are encouraged. She and her grading TAs are not easy graders and usually the class grade range is in scale, but grades are reasonable. Need hard work to get good grades.

Prof. McIntosh is by far one of the best professors at Brandeis. Her lectures are as fascinating as they are engaging and she has great stories to tell that come from her time researching! Readings are interesting and manageable. She is also super understanding and approachable if you have any issues, which was very appreciated during Spring 2020!

Easily one of the best professors I had all through college. Came recommended to me immediately freshman year, finally got to learn from her in my last semester and did not regret it. Possibly the largest class I ever had but felt like one of the smallest. Wasn't even an ANTH major but kind of wanted to be after her class.
Has tons of amazing stories from her research.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I adore McIntosh! She is brilliant, knows her field, & can teach you everything you need to know about anthro. This class was no picnic though, since it was half full of grad students and I took it my 2nd semester of undergrad. There were different expectations, but the pressure was high. Engagement is key, be active in class, & go to office hours!
loved it. loved her.

Prof. McIntosh is not your mom or your bff - she is one of the most challenging and inspirational professors you will ever have. Her lectures are mesmerizing and the content is always topical and engaging. The assignments are hard but rewarding as all hell, so don't expect to coast and don't expect to daydream, expect to work hard and think deep.

I loved this class because of the professor. I had no idea about the subject matter except the basic history of Africa that you learn in school, but she made it fun and extremely interesting. It was also great that she had done so much work in Kenya so that we could hear real life experiences rather than just theory. Would take again!

In response to the other 26A poster, yes, the course taken was a large lecture course. Those aren't anyone's favorite when it comes to entertainment value (even Professor McIntosh has said that herself), but McIntosh makes a large lecture the most most engaging it ever could be. More importantly: she is inspiring, life-changing, life-affirming.

I absolutely loved Dr. McIntosh's Psychological Anthropology class. If you want an amazing professor, intriguing subject material, and a professor who will always be there for you in class and outside of class, you definitely need to take this Anth 155b. She is so friendly, and the grading and assignment criteria were always clear. She is the best!

Dr. McIntosh is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. Not only is she the most engaging, approachable, and intelligent professor, but she is always there to help her students. As a biology major, I decided to minor in anthropology, and she makes it completely worth it. Everyone needs to take a class with Dr. McIntosh before they graduate!
She is a decent professor, but not amazing. She reads off of her slides during lectures and nothing she says is quite inspirational. Pretty simple and straightforward material, some parts are boring.
Cognitive dissonance: so charismatic and funny, but then you read her stuffhear her lectures and realize- wait, she's kind of a genius...

I heard glowing things about this prof before taking the course and all were true. So accomplished and super-articulate/smart, but just a great person to talk to as well. She is busy but still pays attention to undergrads.
Take any class with McIntosh, she's great!!
Brilliant, funny professor who is clearly a guru in her field but still down-to-earth.
I want to be Janet McIntosh when I grow up. She's incredibly articulate, brilliant, and down-to-earth. She really inspired me to view the world differently. Take psychological anthropology.

Janet is the best professor I've ever had. Truly just a wonderful teacher. She is interesting, has great stories to tell and will work with you if you are not challenging yourself enough so that you are more challenged!
Great teaching, funny, personable and easy to talk to.
No Comments
she's a babe :) AND she's smart!

Too energizing, generous, precise, surprising and funny to be real. Whoever called Janet a nit might be smart enough to get A's in an intro-level class, but is cluelessly lazy. I graduated at the top of my discipline and did my toughest, most exciting work under her — even sometimes in her soft courses — because one could. Inspiring. She's perfect.

Amazingly gifted lecturer and discussion leader.  She cares about her students, and respects their ideas even if she disagrees.  Plus, she's brilliant (check out her resume.)  Brandeis is lucky to have her :P
She's a nit. The class is far too easy and simplistic and any idiot could get an A. It offers no challenge or opportunity for creative thinking.

Tremendously friendly, interesting and engaging teacher. Wants everyone to succeed - gives out comprehensive study guides/lists before tests and goes over material exhaustively. If you actually do your studying ahead of time, it's an easy A.
No Comments
amazing, intelligent, clear, concise, brought the material to life.
No Comments
No Comments

Amazing professor. Class is fairly easy but the material is so interesting it wouldn't matter if it was difficult. He can ramble at times but if you stick with him he has some very intelligent and thought provoking things to say.

His class isn't as easy as you'd think, only because he's a tough grader and looks for specific things. He will give you an outline ahead of time so barely any reading is necessary-plan it around the topic you choose. He rambles and is unclear, lectures almost useless. In-Class essay based class with a 12 page midterm to do on your own.

Professor Cohen is great! He genuinely cares about his students doing well and makes himself available to help whenever you need it. He's also really funny and has many great stories about historical events he was around for. Sometimes he can be a little repetitive and long winded but it's a great class.

VERY knowledgeable about subject matter. Tends to ramble and go on tangents, but if you can actually follow the lecture he has a lot to say. Light workload, interesting class, Cohen is a lot of fun to shmooze with.

The saying goes for a cohen class, its pretty easy to get an A and nearly impossible to not get a B.  That being said in order to get an A you should go to class, interact with cohen, meet with him.  He is a very interesting guy with knowledge on almost anything.  If you take his classes seriously it will pay off!

You have to take a class with Cohen. He knows the subjects that he teaches better than anyone I have ever met knows anything. Of course, class is not mandatory and you can do well without fully applying yourself, but his knowledge and expertise is an extremely valuable resource. Not taking advantage of it is just foolish.
Professor Cohen is a world renowned expert on the Sixties and JFK. He is an interesting teacher. His class is not difficult.

Yes, his lectures are not as organized as other professors, but that's his style.  Most people think he's an easy professor, which is true in that completing all the assignments on time will probably result in a good grade.  On the other hand, some of the content of his classes is in fact difficult if you care to delve deeper into it.

I really enjoyed this class. I learned a ton and now find 1960s history extremely interesting. Be prepared that it is a very self-sufficient taught class. You take the notes, you read the assigned material, you write the papers. He won't quiz you or make sure you're keeping up. I  got an A and thought he was a very fair grader.
Cohen is the man. You do the work, you get the grade. Grading is straight forward. Follow the directions and you'll do well. He is very smart and appreciates interest in the subject. great Professor
Easily sidetracked, tough grader.  Conspiracy is an interesting class and provides you at least with a lot of sources for info.  Spent too much time on some subjects and not nearly enough on others

Cohen is probably the only professor at Brandeis I really disliked.  I've never had anyone so obsessed with his own work.  We had to read this stupid article he wrote and droned on about.  He also told me that I was pronouncing my last name incorrectly.  And he gave the same JFK lectures multiple times in the same class.

Jerry is a great professor. He teaches on very interesting topics (imo) and is very educated on them. He does repeat himself from class to class, especially if you take multiple classes with him, but he still is able to make it interesting. He is def. the best lecturer I've ever had the pleasure of taking classes with.
Great teacher. very educated and funny. easy class interesting

Take Conspiracy if nothing else -- it's excellent. He also picks GREAT paper topics: you really feel like you're getting what you wanted out of the class. Beware that he goes on tangents -- if you follow them, however, they all actually relate to the matter at hand. Repeats himself occassionally.

He's obsessed with conspiracy theories and loves to talk about how much of a role he played in the 1960s.  It wasn't much of a role, to be sure.  He just knew some people.  Also, he stood me up for two consecutive appointments and showed no remorse when he finally acquiesced to meeting with me and didn't break the appointment.
Very funny, interesting information.  I highly recommend "The Idea of Conspiracy in American Culture."
Best class EVER. I can understand where people taking 10A are a mildly disappointed, but it's a required class, what do you want? A GREAT professor!
Not very accessible to students. Doesn't answer emails or phone messages. Ambiguous grading procedures.  Never quite sure what he is looking for in an assignment.
His class is fascinating and he reminds me of a crazy old man, which I love.
The Best Professor at Brandeis!!!!

He says he's there but doesn't respond to e-mails.You have to beg him for attention.He seems to favor athletes.Getting help from him was like pulling TEETH.Seems great at first&enthusiastic,but he'll say,IE,he will do something for you but never follow through.I agree with what the person said directly beneath me. 2much unecessary STRESS from this
I cannot stand this man, he has a huge ego and his classes are a joke. it is seriously upsetting that brandeis has allowed him to teach for this long.

Probably the most arrogant professor you'll come across at Brandeis (and there are a few) ... His lectures are self-important and he fancies himself the moral authority of the Boston area ... Thoroughly pompous man.

This was an amazingly good course. It teaches you how to think critically about allegations of conspiracy and promotes a logical, reasonable method of addressing intellectual issues.  The course consisted of two 12-page papers and a final exam. He grades pretty generously. Always available for help.

Cohen classes are easy because he doesn't take attendance and you can "phone it in," so to speak. If you pay attention and comment occasionally in class he gets attached to you and is very helpful. Classes are HUGE and often have a lot of baseball team members.

Jerry is a very passionate teacher who really cares about his students.  He's very intelligent and caring.  A once in a lifetime college experience-Jerry is the most well-known prof. on campus.  Definitely take one of his classes.

By FAR the most entertaining professor at Brandeis. If you go to Deis and do not take Jerry Cohen, you have missed out on a classic experience. A fellow alum once said to me, "there are no Jerry Cohen classes in law school." Definitely take this
He has a huge ego, without much to back it up.  The classes were on interesting subjects, but they were cool classes despite him, not due to him
Says terribly interesting things, but lacks clarity of presentation.
excellent at what he does, interesting classes if you choose to go, loves to boast about working at yale- hey jerry, if it was so great, why did you leave?
One of the smartest but oddest people ever. He's spent his whole life discussing and studying conspiracies. Sounds like fun
Easy class, great reading... its conspiracy for crying out loud! good job, jerry

I have taken every single one of Prof Kapelle's classes and he is one of the, if not the, BEST professors at Brandeis. His tests are difficult but he is very forgiving. His lectures feel like a movie. LOVED every minute in his class and hope beyond hope he adds a lecture to his his already AMAZING roster, as I've already taken every one he offers.

Interesting lecturer who paints a great picture of the past. You must show up to class because if you miss a lecture you will be absolutely in the drain. The class is graded strictly through tests, so if you do not appreciate a high-stakes environment then you will not do well in this class. If you love the subject matter you will do well!!!

Excellent lecturer and demands much of his students. Grades are determined by the average of three hour-long written tests. His lectures are witty, engaging, and chock-full of interesting and useful information. He has an encyclopedic knowledge of the periods he teaches. Good, fast accurate note-taking mandatory. Readings are optional but helpful.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Best professor ever!

Don't bother to buy anything off the reading list--everything on the test comes from his lectures. Excellent storyteller, but doesn't use slideshows, so being good at taking notes is a must. He's a fairly difficult grader, but gives plenty of chances to improve your grade. I HIGHLY recommend taking his classes.

Brilliant professor and fascinating man. If you're considering doing anything in history, take a class with him. Lectures are packed with details, I would suggest a study group before tests. Really delves into the "why" of history instead of just the "what". Harsh grader, but not impossibly so. Lots of reading outside of class, but it's optional.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: I love William Kapelle. The first week I was bored, but once you know him, he is amazing. He is funny and easygoing. I always leave his class feeling like I am in information overload but alas, I am already signed up for the second semester of Kapelle lectures, I may get a history major just by taking his classes alone. Take one and you're hooked.
I loved Professor Kapelle! He is really passionate about what he teaches and I really recommend his class.

His exams require you to memorize all the facts and materials that he delivered in lectures. Also, he doesn't provide any notes or slides so you'd better go to every lecture. In addition, don't take this course if you don't have any background knowledge in the subject.

Your grade does not depend on your appearance in class, but miss a class, and you'd wish you never did. His tests are based on your ability to conceptualize what he says in class, and memory is significant. He does not provide material for you to study off of, so you have to take really good notes to pass his exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Very entertaining, but it's all dependent on the tests. I took 2 Kapelle's course this semester, and 1 in past semesters. Though I know exactly what he is looking for and study really hard, that A is not easy. In fact, I believe he gives me a mercy A because I am transferring. Anyway, Kapelle the best prof ever in Brandy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Kapelle is the BEST! TBH, online course is hard, especially for Professor Kapelle. Entering wrong zoom room, forgot to record attendance is not required, but better watch every video, or u won't pass I did not read a single page reading, it's just lecture notes and the tests. If u don't have sufficient knowledge or pure luv for hist, DON'T TAKE IT
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Loved his personality and I learned a lot from his classes. Will definitely be looking to take more classes with him in the future.

I never throught i would major in history, his class inspires me to do so. Wonderful professor fun lecture, the only problem is there is no recording, no slides, you have to show up everyday. I fall asleep in class one time and have no idea what comes in the test.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: A nice professor and an amazing storyteller. His lectures are appealing and his three exams are not too difficult. But he may challenge you in some marginal knowledge points which can hardly draw your attention. He will ask you to recite the map. Taking notes at class and doing the reading is essential. He's not tought at grades.
Kapelle is the best! Such a nice guy!

Took Renaissance for the hell of it. Almost didn't go back to 2nd class but so glad I did. At first thought he was really dry, then realized I was missing his humor. He's a funny and quirky guy (always telling great anecdotes), you'll need to study hard and take really good notes every class but he is SO knowledgeable. Kapelle is the textbook.
Prof. Kapelle is possibly the most brilliant teacher I've ever had. Tough tests - really, really tough tests - but study and you'll do fine.

Love his courses!  Tests are easy and non-cumulative, and the final is literally his midterm but you get 2 extra hours!  You need to show up to class and take good notes, but ignore the readings and memorize your notes and it's an easy A.  Also he is hilarious.

My favorite course and professor! Kapelle knows every detail about Roman history. He teaches the course as a gripping story and is crazy in a good way.I was excited for each class despite its 9am time. He cares about his students and is a fair grader.Tests are tricky, but make a study guide summarizing the topics of lectures, and you'll be fine.
Whether you are a History major or not, you should absolutely take a class with Kapelle. He offers 7 classes at Brandeis, of which he has inspired me to take all of them.
This man is a legend. If you haven't taken a course with him then you have not gotten the best out of Brandeis.
Like the others say, an amazing lecturer. The exams are a little tough, but he is somewhat forgiving in cumulative grading. Most definitely worth the work.

Best professor I took at Brandeis.  I developed a real passion for medieval history because of him.  Any student who does not take him is making a big mistake.  A's are not easy to come by but are very attainable if you are willing to come to every class and study.
I have a new love for medieval history, thanks to him. =)  He's very clever and funny - take every class you can!  (tests are somewhat difficult however - NOT an easy A)
Very funny, very clear, makes history really come alive.
BEST TEACHER AT BRANDEIS... HANDS DOWN
the best prof. at brandeis....without question.
Amazing lectures.  I still have all of my notes from years ago.  The tests were murder to study for, but they were a labor of love.  His classes were a highlight of my college years.
People tell stories about his lectures, no joke.  He is a tough teacher, and he plays grumpy, but he also inspires love of medieval history
One of the best classes I had at Brandeis.
i loved him and his cat stories!
great class, but tough

really sweet and helpful professor if you go to office hours. all tests are open book and online so very easy to do well in. TAs are also really accessible and nice. one of the best science classes at brandeis!
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Lectures long, not very engaging, most people stop going as the semester goes on. Pretty much all grading is based on tests, which are pretty challenging (small details), but they were open note/open book so that helps. He's a friendly guy, answers questions, but not the best at teaching.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had Prof Simister at 8 AM, and let me tell uhis voice puts you to sleep. I'd like to think I'm fairly good at bio (it's my major), but it took a lot out of me to get through his course. A lot of the material is very intricate and his tests are unusually hard. That being said, there are much harder STEM courses at Brandeis and he is friendly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Simister was an awesome professor and very approachable. During lectures he outlined processes in steps which was exactly what exams covered. The quizzes were also important, but this class was very test heavy. Taking notes during lecture was not enough, but the online textbook was very helpful. Attending recitations is also essential!!
Easy to get a A if you work for it.

This class is not graded on much else besides the three midterms and final exam. The tests are meticulous and hard to study for, and his lectures are not super helpful. I would recommend studying diagrams from the textbook or his slides and creating outlines from his lectures (use his speaker notes).
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Lectures are both painfully slow and overwhelmingly dense. Tests are both extremely vague and specific. Rewatch the lectures and make outlines and you should be fine. Don't bother studying from the textbook as the vast majority of content on tests come from his lectures. Be prepared to memorize a lot; he likes to test the minutiae.

Don't even bother coming to lecture. In order to to get a good grade you just need to memorize the recordings of all the lectures a week before the test. He's a nice guy but really focuses on the minute details. He also has a script for his lectures on the powerpoint version of his slides which is helpful when studying.

Professor Sinister is not that engaging when he lectures, but the exams are more based on the lectures than the textbook. However, the textbook has really helpful diagrams. The only thing you are graded on are the exams.
Pretty dry but smart guy. His accent can put you to sleep at 9am but he picks relevant information that you need to know.

Professor Simister is a great person and is there to help his students. However, his lectures are extremely confusing and many students stop attending his lectures. It is also a challenge to take notes during his lectures because they are difficult to follow. I did well solely from previous knowledge and his lecture slides.
He's really hard to hear. Lectures are not very engaging. Really nice guy though.

He starts class late and ends early. He goes through the material too quickly. His powerpoints don't have many words, but I found out halfway through that he has notes in the notes section on the .ppt but not .pdf version of the powerpoints. He test on minutia and likes trick questions. He's hard to hear sometimes. Nice man though.
Easy class, but he'll put you to sleep with his soft British voice. After the first exam most people stop showing up. Exams are easy, just read the book.
His tests were very hard. I woudl study the outlines a lot - more than the text. Make sure to memorize it all!
tests are insanely difficult. average usually around 18/30. fair curve, dont buy the book just memorize his outlines. class is harder than people give it credit for.
He is a good professor. Does his job. His tests are ridiculously hard though...but the curve will save you. You will get a B- for getting 50% of the questions right.
He is adorable! I love this prof and he cares so much about making sure that we understand the material. He is sweet and he makes it very easy to pass his tests.

Nice guy, mellifluous voice that will put you to sleep, runs through in depth lectures very quickly, reviewing/teaching details, not fundamentals.  Tests are absurdly difficult. Huge curve.  You will have to work pretty hard to get a B if you're lucky- unless you have a perfect memory for every word. Outlines are helpful but overwhelmingly detailed
His tests are pretty awful. Unless you're someone who can memorize small details very quickly you're going to spend a long time studying
His accent is cute. But he's deaf, so don't bother asking questions. He really cares about whether or not we understand, and he clearly loves biology. He's boring sometimes, but he's passionate.
Brilliant man, humane individual
monotone
Boring classes - but he has an interesting accent that at least kept me half awake - wait for him to say 'tissue'-- study the notes that he gives out and you are all set
Lectures were boring, but the pre-typed notes were excellent.  Memorize these and you're guarenteed an A.
No Comments
No Comments
boring, but can get notes online
No Comments
No Comments
so boring...  loved having notes online..
No Comments

He's wonderful professor, he cares about his students and makes an effort to get to know students who make an effort to talk to him. I have found him to be kind, funny, passionate about the material, and appropriately accommodating. The tests can be challenging but they are curved and manageable for students who take the time to learn the material.
avoid at all cost!!!!!!!!!

Easily my favorite professor (and class) I've had at Brandeis so far. He is a fantastic lecturer (as he presents material in an understandable and memorable way), very knowledgeable and always willing to meet with students outside of class time (and he adamantly encourages it quite frankly), and an all-around wholesome guy. 1,000% recommend!

Brilliant, brilliant man. Extremely passionate about what he's teaching and it shows. Expects a fair amount of student initiative, so be prepared to keep up. One of the few classes I've had where it felt like I actually felt like I got something out of the final project/presentation.

I admire Prof S for demonstrating passion in the subject and making class interactive, but I also have some issues. The tests (while curved) contained very specific and sometimes ambiguous questions, the practice tests had no answer key, and students were sometimes singled out for not participating or asking questions Prof S perceived as foolish.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Sekuler's test questions are very specific, you need to know the outside readings inside and out to do well, but his lectures are fun and engaging, he is very receptive to helping if you have questions. He WILL NOT CHASE STUDENTS. Your success in his class is based your own motivation and use of resources. You will learn alot from the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: You learn a lot of interesting concepts in this class. In terms of grades, this class requires you to put in work. Make sure to read all the assigned readings for each topic or as much as you can read. I advise you to write out notes for this class. PS: Professor Sekuler is not a bad professor. He was really nice to us during our classes.

Very harsh Professor and may at times lead you to have mental breakdowns but is there to help you succeed. If you try he will be supportive but is not afraid to fail you if you do not put effort in. Do not take if you will half ass his class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Confusing lectures. Ridiculous exams. He puts concepts that you wont find neither in the textbook nor where discussed in class. Rude. He is screamed to a classmate once, and I dont really understood why. He laughed at another classmate for asking a question. He cancels office hours when the exam is the next day. No extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This was the most difficult class I have taken at Brandeis, not because of the challenging content, but because most of the questions on the exams were never taught at all. This in conjunction with the Professor's reluctance to provide assistance outside the classroom rendered us helpless. I would not recommend this class to anyone.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He talks so slowly. His lectures are painfully boring. He's very smart and class content was very interesting.
one of the rudest and disrespectful professors I have ever had
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His tests take some getting used to. Most multiple choice questions have several acceptable answers, and the wording can be tricky. When I was concerned about my first test result, he said (without prompting) that he would treat it as a fluke should I do "much" better on the remaining exams. I improved (50% to 85-90%), but he did not keep his word.

Hardest class I've ever taken at Brandeis. The problem with Sekuler is that he is too smart to teach undergraduates who have no basic understanding of neuroscience. His lectures are impossible to follow, boring and so confusing, you have no idea how to pay attention to the rest of lectures. He doesn't give any extra assignments to boost your grade.

Dr. Sekuler seems to be a very polarizing figure...I think what you think of him depends on the grade you get in the course. He can be funny, snarky, bossy, and fatherly, all in the same 5 minutes. Interesting lectures and material.
His tests were so hard, and covered a lot of material that wasn't discussed in class.  It was all very detailed and nitty-gritty.  He wasn't always a clear lecturer and his TA helped a lot.

he is a good lecturer - he is very animated when he talks. makes sure you make complete use of all the resources on Latte. Large portions of the exam cover details in the textbook he doesn't cover in class (but readings are clearly assigned).

His lectures are disorganized, but informative. All you need to do to do well is do the article readings and take decent notes on what he says. The text readings are suggested, but I did not find them to be necessary at all. He's VERY interesting and outgoing!
Cognitive neuroscience
I have never heard anyone talk so much without actually teaching you anything. Avoid his classes if possible and you'll learn a lot more. Just about any other professor would be better.

this professor should not be allowed to teach. I was on his bad side because I refused to take his ****, and he gave me a C in the class (when my actual grades added up to a B+). His lectures are boring, his slides don't make any sense, and he is not helpful outside of class. Avoid him at all cost!

No nonsense kind of guy. He is a good teacher and has a bit of a sense of humor. He often goes over when speaking on a slide and his computer slideshow begins and projects his family photos until he notices that the class is fixated on the screen. Then he frantically runs to the computer while cursing it to get back to powerpoint.
This prof is a great lecturer! He is also a nice guy if you approach him right, but I would not want to be on his bad side.
beeehhh--- i mean he can at least try
horrible human being
No Comments
I loved this class!  He is very funny and makes lectures interesting.  Tests are hard, but doable if you went to class and did all the readings.
He is an egomaniac - very annnoying-but course material was very interesting
he rants a lot, and was sort of boring
Whatever
ehh, he's alright.  kinda boring, kinda funny.
very animated and engaging lecturer
He is really hard. He is a tad scary, but you will get through it

He is a legend and teaching should be appreciated. His words can be certainly abrasive, but it is not personal. Dismissive of students that do not appear to put any effort into learning. Will answer questions on tests, he wants you to be clear and understand what he is asking. I am a better chemist because of him. Inspiring slicked-back hair.
If you dislike Snider, it's probably because you aren't supposed to be in the sciences. Grow a pair and appreciate the legend that's before you.

Orgo is a tough subject, but Barry is awesome and people give him less credit than what he deserves. He's pretty clear in class and if you read the textbook/go to class you're going to be fine. His practice exams are basically just like his tests and he's always willing to help you out if you go to office hours. HE IS A GENIUS
Barry is the most amazing human being on planet earth. I am pretty sure, that he isn't human at all. He is god. Please take a class with this beautiful man.

A very nice and smart professor.To those who have negative feedback on him I could just say you didn't do your work.He expect you to read the chapters beforehand and preferably do the minimal problems.He always has the humor of a great scientist and loves to throw some trick questions to us.He is the man for those who love chemistry.

He is extremely disrespectful towards his students. He likes shushing students in middle of their questions. His voice is painful to listen to. If a student understands anything in his lecture, it's what I would call a miracle. He makes you feel stupid and is very hard to approach.

He is unable to connect with his students or communicate with them effectively. I did well, but his lectures were unbearable, and his continuous disrespect for his students is unacceptable. He enjoys belittling his students, and he is insecure and insensitive in his teaching. Note his hair and voice, which do not add to his charm.

I love Prof. Snider!! Yes, he can be a little abusive...but that's what makes lecture so enjoyable! To this day, I laugh at all of his quotable quotes. He presents the information you need to know in a mostly clear fashion. Look at the practice tests and you'll be fine.
He tries hard to teach a difficult subject, I think he does a fairly good job for the task at hand.  He could be clearer at times.  Overall, a pretty good science teacher.
I have met very few professors who are as clear as Dr. Snyder.  Yes, he is somewhat acidic, but his ability to explain even difficult concepts more than outweighs it.

He is the worst human being alive. He asks questions he knows we will get wrong in lecture, just so he can point out that we are wrong. And every statement begins with "And the answer is..." He doesn't actually teach the subject, he just sort of reviews it. If I could, I would avoid him at all costs, but I have to take orgo. It's a shame.

Overall, I like Prof. Snider very much. His teaching style if very clear and closely follows the textbook, so if you miss a class, you can just review the book. His tests are all very fair, and he gives you previous years' tests as examples. He does tend to be impatient and somewhat curt with his words, but overall, I really enjoyed his class.
He is fair and knows what he's doing.
I wouldn't recommend him

The reason I hate chemistry to this day. Unnecessarily rude, insulting, on a major power trip. Annoying voice that crawls under your skin. Only take this course if you want to be reminded of how dumb you are...
He is very organized and is a great lecturer. However, he is very rude in person. I heard that he is more respectful to more advanced orgo students.

His incessant "shhushhing" is unbearable. He is so rude to his students; he is a total pig. On the other hand, he does have a vast hold in the knowledge of organic chemisty. Nonetheless, he is a rude and mean human being.
This hot headed teacher likes to zangbang his students.
Meanest teacher I have ever met. Impatient, rude, and chauvinistic. Discouraging, rude, implied I was stupid.
Somewhat challenging course.  Thorough lectures tried to interest students in organic chemistry via biologically/medically relevant examples.
What a brilliant lecturer! Makes organic chemistry simpler. What other courses does he teach? I'll take advanced orgo!
No Comments
Challenging, but fair.
IF he could teach, than his acerbic "personality" might be tolerable...but this is not the case. He is a pompous, condescending jerk through and through.
The biggest jerk I have every met.
No Comments
lectures very well organized, helpful but kinda a jerk
No Comments
No Comments
With orgo he was pretty good, but w/gen. chem he was a JERK!!

Divya is the best 6A professor, by a mile. I took 6A with Hagit and had to drop it. I took it with Divya and did fairly well. She is an excellent teacher. She actually teaches the material, instead of having us watch videos and teach it ourself. I wish I took it with her the first time.

Had to retake this class but Divya wants you to succeed, she also writes the exam for all sections so I think she's the best one to take. If you start struggling, go to her office hours or BUGS tutor or TAs. I found that it's harder to grasp new material if you're not understanding previous concepts.

Divya is a caring person, and although I eventually only got a B+ in this class, I am really proud of myself. I know the test is hard but try it. In her class, she is trying to remember everyone's name and to make sure everyone pays attention and listens, and her TA is absolutely nice and responsible.

Professor Khaitan is the best! I went into this class just to fulfill the prereqs for any other bus classes, but actually loved it. It is really challenging at times but if you study for the tests it's very doable. The workload week to week is not too heavy but doing extra practice problems is recommended.

Excellent class, highly recommend. Professor Khaitan is brilliant. She cares about her students and works hard to make sure they understand the material and feel supported. She reached out to me mid semester as my grades slipped, and helped me get back to course. She is an example of what all teachers should be like. I feel lucky to be her student.

Professor Divya is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is a great teacher, very clear, and super smart. She makes the class fun and exciting. She really is as good as everyone says! We love you professor!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Divya is fantastic! She is clear and entertaining. She makes you fall in love with her and accounting. I will keep in touch with her for career advice for sure. She is so smart. It's great to see a woman have such a great career.
Professor Khaitan is smart, kind and caring. She wants her students to do well. She is clear in her teaching and expectations. Best class hands down!
Has more baseless workload over meaningful lectures, kind of mid. sadly, you have to do all this work to get an A, due to the way the course is structured.

I have mixed feelings on the course. She is a pretty clear lecturer and also keeps the lectures interesting and engaging. Her tests are not hard but they're pretty poorly written and inconsistent. Overall, if you have to take this due to major requirements, she's a fair choice, but honestly an online accounting course has more merits.

Professor Khaitan is the best professor I have had in college. She makes a notoriously boring subject incredibly interesting. Her class quickly became my favorite class, in large part to her hilarious stories and real life examples. She really wants her students to do well. Take this class with her, you will learn a lot and have a mentor for life.

Professor Khaitan is not just a professor for a semester, she is a mentor forever! I took her class a year ago but still speak to her about classes and career advice. She is very caring, super smart and gives great guidance. Take her classes!

Absolute queen. Awesome teacher. Wanted to see her students succeed and was very willing to help. Very accessible outside of class. Tests were tough but she is clear about the material so if you study, you will do well. One group project which is very manageable.
Do yourself a favor and take this class with professor Khaitan. This class is super useful, but more importantly the professor is phenomenal! She is smart, kind and knows how to teach.

You know exactly what to expect from professor Khaitan's class. She is clear with her teaching and expectations. If you do the work, you will learn a lot, do well and really enjoy the class. I think I will use what I learned from this class in my real life. I heard from friends she is the best accounting professor at Brandies, now I know why.
Prof. Divya is AMAZING! She is so fun, interesting, smart, caring and kind. She teaches the material well. I loved her class! I will take more of her classes.

BUS 6a is not an easy class, but the professor made it fun and interesting. She taught the material in a clear way. As long as you do the work and pay attention in, you'll do fine. I would take 6a with her if you can.
Prof. Khaitan is wonderful. She is intelligent, caring, funny and interesting. Accounting was my favorite class this semester, in large part due to her teaching style and passion for the subject.

She is truly amazing. One of the best there is. She made accounting fun! I learned a ton and found a mentor. Love to see women in the business field with real work experience teaching us. Take her class.
She is an absolute legend. Tests are hard, but she makes a really tough subject engaging and understandable. One of the best profs at Brandeis for sure.

This class was one of the hardest classes I've ever taken in college, however, it was also my favorite. I left the class feeling like I learned so much and will actually use the material in my life. Professor Khaitan is a great professor. She is caring and really wants her students to succeed.

She extremely sweet and truly cares about her students and goes out of her way to help. This class is very demanding and challenging, but she provides all the necessary materials for you to succeed. Definitely participate in class and recitation as the only way to truly master this class is by practicing.

BUS6a is typically a difficult and boring class but professor Khaitan does her best to make it interesting and fun. Her effort is clear. Fantastic lecturer and enthusiastic about the material. She tells interesting stories that tie into the material making it memorable. Highly recommend her class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is a nice person and a great professor. I highly recommend her. All of my friends taking BUS6A with other professors didn't enjoy class as much as I did. She is perfect!
Prof. Khaitan is an excellent teacher. She is smart and can actually explain the material in a understandable way. She makes accounting fun! It is easily my favorite class this semester!
She is really nice!!! She is very organized and emphasizes the key points in classes. However, the exams are very difficult, and she is very strict sometimes.

She is a pretty good professor. She makes the structure of every class very clearly and easy for students to follow with. She is glad to offer help for students off class. She makes the lecture interesting by telling some stories about her families. But she is very strict with exam and class and her exam is not easy.

I am currently taking Professor Khaitan's class and I am blown away! Financial accounting had been known to be a tough and boring class. I have found Professor Khaitan's class to be entertaining, insightful and interesting. I have learned so much from the class. My friends in other sections watch Prof Khaitan's lecture recordings! Take her class!!
Professor Khaitan is wonderful! She is smart and caring. Her class is fun and you learn a lot. I would highly recommend her class. It is not an easy class though!

Professor Khaitan is really one of the best professors I have had. She is inspirational! I was afraid to take this class due to its reputation in the past, but everyone I have spoken to cannot stop raving about her. It is obvious she cares about her student. She knows the material and know how to teach it in an enjoyable manner. Highly recommend!
BUS 6a is a very difficult class in Business major and this course is very technical. However, my semester went by quickly with Prof. Khaitan as she is a fun, but still professional.

6a is overall a difficult and boring class but professor Khaitan does her absolute best and her effort absolutely shows. Fantastic lecturer and enthusiastic about the material. Tells wonderful stories and is very honest with students which definitely adds on how enjoyable her class is and how much students like her as a professor.

I had this professor for oral communications and it was the worse course I have taken at Brandeis by a mile. For teaching how to present to an audience she is not very good at it and the little advice she gives is legitimately bad advice. I firmly believe she thinks she is changing students lives when in reality she is just boring them to tears

I took Professor Galit for both ECON 25 (Oral Communications) and ECON 160 (International Trade Theory). In both classes, I found it to be extremely well structured and organized, with each class having a clear objective. As a professor, she is extremely engaging and is always charismatic and cheerful during her lessons.

This is a required Econ class, and although her grading is somewhat strict, this professor cares deeply about her students and wants every student to improve in class. Professor Galit divided the entire semester into many sections, speech structure, body language, tone, and content selection, which helped a lot of students succeed academically.

Absolutely awful professor, lacks basic human compassion, sympathy and empathy. She believes students are below her. I constantly felt like I was talked down to and would've transferred schools if I had to retake this course with her.
Was very inconsiderate and unaccommodating to students. For a required econ major course and being the only professor teaching it, she should be more empathetic and understanding to students.
Very disorganized and chaotic course. She gives extremely delayed feedback on assignments and grades presentations harshly.

the right class to take if one wanna know how to give a good presentation (the course content is useful)

an advice is to treat the class seriously and keep up with her pace (the teaching style is not like any usual class, student needs to get used to it)
Tough course, but good content
Need to work hard and participate well. Bring some interesting topics.
I actually got an A+ last year and I appreciate her class a lot - I'll definitely precede this path and become a leader of my gender

She really keeps the class engaged, learning, and always improving! If you wanna pursue a job that highly requires good communication and presentation skills, this is the best opportunity to learn, hone, and improve. An advice is "don't panic! just Enjoy the class and experience the intellectual thrill she brings".

If you have any other choice, please don't take her class. First of all, she does not give out A+, there's no A+ in her grading system; secondly, she's too busy to offer you any respect. She takes notes and offer you amazing feedbacks, can't deny that. But if there's any alternatives, don't hesitant.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: didnt received any scores or constructive suggestions on all presentation/hw assignments. LOTS of useless homework asking meaningless questions. The most awful experience Ive ever had in Brandeis. Im disappointed because this class couldve been helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very heavy load for a two-credit course, lots of work, and no timely scoring or feedback.

Be prepared to be challenged in terms of oral communication and public speaking skills, especially when you are not native. The course makes me a much better and confident presenter. The instructor's feedback is always to the point. It is very useful in general, and you could definitely take what your learnt into your future career.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I really hope this course would get better in the future since its a mandatory course for major. No accommodation at all. A lot of work to be done for a 2 credit course. Hope the final grade will be better than the course itself

It is really interesting. It seems that this Professor doesn't know it is actually a course for 2 credits. The homework of this class let me feel that I only need to take 1 class to get all 12 credits for this semester.
Worst of the worst. Her lecture is boring and annoying. She can't give a good speech but she is a professor teaching oral comunication. How ironic it sounds.
Worst class I've ever taken. This 2 credit course have much more homework than 4 credit courses. The rubric is a joke and I hate everything about this class.
Ive never had a worse experience with a professor. Ill leave it at that.

Doesn't give a lot of feedback but very passionate about speaking... can be passive aggressive but won't be a problem as long as you stay on her good side and participate in class! Class is kinda bull, but easy 2 credits
Don't take this class unless you have to... You will only get a final grade without knowing your HW, presentation, and participation grades.
didn't learn much from the course yet grading is strict... grading rubric is confusing

Professor Eizmans lectures are very inspiring and she always devotes a lot of energy into her lectures. Her problem sets are closely related to her lectures and at the same time give us space to express our own ideas. She is generous with grading and is the most passionate economics professor I have met at Brandeis.

Eizman is a very passionate professor. She is always energetic in class and encourages students to express their thoughts. Her course includes many classical economic models and their usage, which can help you develop a way of thing as an economist. Her HW are hard but the grades are generous. Also, she will curve the final grade. Highly recommend!

Prof Eizman is great. Her lecture is very intuitional. Homework are helpful for exams and difficulty is reasonable. Curves hard on exams and the questions makes you work for it. but if you try your best and understand class material, you will earn what you deserve.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Exams were extremely hard and become less related to class and hw. Curves heavy everybody got 15+ free points in exams. Lectures are boring and doesnt make lot of sense. She is very passionate but her voice is very loud. HWs were fine. Final presentation were freebees.
Exams are extremely difficult and include materials that are not even covered in class. Her grading is pretty generous, but I just don't see the point of making the exams so unnecessarily hard.

Typical econ professor. Despite missing a few problem sets and putting very little time into the ones I actually turned in (the unexpected switch to distance learning really brought out my ADHD), I still scored right below a 90 on the final and finished with a B. End of semester policy proposal/ presentation is nice if you're stronger qualitatively
She teaches us how to think about trade policy critically and how to analyze issues from scientific perspectives. She invests energy in her teaching and loves what she teaches.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Terrible professor

He is one of the most caring professors I have ever met. He has meetings with his students about assignments and even mental well-being. If you always do your best on the assignments, youre likely to get full credit and possibly extra credit. He also doesnt give tests which is a plus.

Dr. Brettler is one of the kindest people I have ever met. He clearly cares for all of his students and wants them to succeed. Dr. Brettler takes time to meet with every student independently whenever they need advice on projects. Take his class, he is an expert on biblical studies and an all around amazing person.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Professor Brettler is very knowledgeable, especially about the Hebrew Bible, plus he's a great lecturer. Highly recommend his class for getting a taste of critical analyzations of the Bible. He is caring and will make time for his students. Assignments are tough, but put in the effort and you'll be rewarded. Very useful info for future classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Brilliant Bible scholar and dynamic lecturer.  The material is tough and he's not an easy grader, but I think he's fair, and it's worth it.  I learned a lot, and I'd take it again to learn more.

Love this class! Look forward to it all week. Very engaging and knowledgable. only 2-3 papers and final was a presentation. Tough, but fair grading. Flexible with paper deadlines if asked in advance and respectfully. Great experience! highly recommended!

Professor didn't care at all about helping students that weren't graduate students. He thinks that everyone should be as smart as he is and if you have no background at all then he doesn't give a hoot about you at all.

Professor Brettler is very educated, and his lectures were exactly the same as his book (which was required reading).  However, it was probably one of the hardest classes I've ever taken, but also very cool.
don't take his classes. that's all i will say.
nothing impressive, didn't learn anything but somehow spent a lot of time doing it
He is not a good teacher, althout he knows a lot about the bible. Still, this shouldn't be a religious course.
nothing to write  home about
rambles. tests totally different from lectures. didn't like it.
eh...just a bad teacher, thinks making class harder makes him a better teacher.
avarage at best. doesnt make class interesting. sounds like ben stein
No Comments
teaches bible history as if he was reading off a train schedule
I was dying of boredom in his class until I found that the room has wi-fi. Unless you have a wireless modem, don't take classes with this driveling bible-spewing lunatic.
I wish I dropped out. This guy makes everything he teaches boring and i hear he is a hard grader. What's the point?
hasn't smiled once since class started
Exellent! Passionate and enthusiastic about the materials. Intellectual and thought provoking! Allows students to gain valuable textual skills! Definitely take Brettler before you graduate!

I thought Professor Brettler was awesome.  Initially I was a bit put off by him because I thought he was a little too full of himself, but as the semester progressed my opinion of him totally changed.  The class was interesting and discussion was the best part of it.  He really, really knows what he's talking about!

This guy is the head of nejs department...the quesion is WHY??? My guess is that this way he has less classes to teach.  He teaches bible and history as if reading off a train schedule.  Somehow he just manages to make everything so boring that you end up counding minutes until the end of class, and then counting how many seconds that makes.
Unfair grader.  Students do twice the work they do in other classes, and still get Cs.
He hates you already.

His class on the Old Testament was very interesting, but also difficult.  The syllabus was very comprehensive and you always knew what he would be grading on, although if he doesn't like you, you'd better hope the TA is grading your work.
awesome!
Might be the best teacher I've had at this school.
Very good lecturer.
No Comments
No Comments
It was tons of work, but it was worth it. Learned a lot. Really nice professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing lecturer, don't know why so many people are rating him badly. Tests were difficult to study for, but not impossible given good attendance and time spent. Gave great feedback on essays.

Professor Sreenivasan is clearly brilliant in his field and it shines through in his office hours especially, but it can make keeping up with his already fast-paced lectures pretty difficult. The tests and essays can feel really demanding but he was always more than willing to answer questions and help out how he could.

I love how passionate he is, but his way of teaching is absolutely horrible. His lectures are fast paced and include so much information that is not important at all. And he gives little information about content of the midterm and final, merely stating that they include what is to be expected (hint: they do not). Both were curved though :)

Professor S. is an incredibly nice guy and comes in class with a positive attitude everyday. He just has horrible teaching styles, gives no guidance, speaks way too fast during lectures and because of this it is very hard to take notes. This is an elective class and he acts as if this is a class towards your respective major. very boring lectures.

Prof. Sreenivasan is so great, he's such an insanely smart person. His lectures are amazing and so engaging. I would recommend any of his classes because he's so knowledgeable about literally everything. Favorite professor at Brandeis. (Also has GREAT outfits and hats)

Okay... Yes, this is alot of reading BUT totally worth it. This guy can make anything interesting. He is clear, brilliant and takes time to address questions and explain when needed. Always dressed well and has cool hats. My complaint is that he will not detail any of the macabre details of History. SMH.

You will not pass if you don't go to classes!!! Usually around 200 pages of reading per class, but you don't have to actually remember all of it: I just skimmed the text and looked up an analysis on Wikipedia before class and I was able to keep up with discussions well enough. Very hard grader and all assignments are written.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: His class(HIST 66A) was amazing, such a knowledgeable expert which makes his lectures very insightful and inspirational. If you're interested in history, Sreenivasan is the best history professor at Brandeis. He's always willing to chat with students about anything. His classes aren't easy but if you study enough and go to class you'll do fine.

Prof. Streenivasan is incredibly intelligent, excited, and knowledgeable. He is sharp and playful and wears color coded suits and hats.
Lightish workload but you actually need to pay attention and write well, he moves quickly and expects good ideas.
I can't recommend Prof. Streenivasan more if you want to learn history.

Heavily discussion based. Strict grader, is not content with average papers, but makes you turn in a first draft to get feedback on before your actual submission. Take his class for him, not for the grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Sreenivasan is such a great professor who is so knowledgeable and down to Earth, plus gives amazing and hilarious lectures. His class definitely requires you to pay attention and is not an easy A but is so worth it.

Professor Sreenivasan is a fantastic lecturer with a really unique and complex perspective on history. Additionally, he is extremely interesting outside of class and is willing to clarify any questions you may have. Paper assignments are not easy, but not overwhelming and are great for practicing real historical analysis.

Professor Sreenivasan is a really engaging lecturer and really interesting person in general. He makes any topic relevant to current events and we always have such interesting discussions in class. Definitely take a class with him if you get the chance!!

Most interesting class I've taken, this Prof made it such cool class! If you love history definitely take a class with him. We had great discussions and I not only learned things about history but now understand our current society so much more clearly.

If you are at all interested in history, TAKE A CLASS WITH PROF SREENIVASAN! His lectures are incredibly engaging - every time I walk out of class, I feel like I understand a little bit more about the neverending story of this blue dot. Not an easy A (the worthwhile classes never are) but if you do the work, you'll do well. Also a super nice guy!

Brilliant, powerful lecturer. Also a humble and likable professor.  His exams are monstrous, but manageable if you've been attentive to the lecture themes (and not gotten bogged down by details), and his essays are valuable if you want to think like a historian. If you need help, ask; he's very approachable.

Brilliant professor. Will learn more than with any other.  High expectations, tough grader,  open to discuss/give feedback. Interesting, funny guy. Great advisor too. Tons of material on tests, big essays. Need to know how to study/take notes but will learn lots. If you can work, highly recommend him. Don't expect easy A but B+/A- is very possible.
A genius man but unfair assessments and not the best teaching styles.
