However, I give my respects for turning a lab course successfully into a fully online format. He is a great lecturer and generally a good person -- he just likes to make his class tough but it is to be expected for a pre-med course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Dr. P is by far the best lecturer I've had at Brandeis. Bio Lab online was tough and a lot of work, but Dr. P always managed to make the experience worthwhile. He was extremely helpful in office hours and had very clear and great lectures. I definitely would recommend taking advantage of the TAs. A hard class, but one that was great.

Great lecturer, does a good job explaining the concepts with clear diagrams. Do work and put in effort and you'll be fine. Grading depends a bit on the TA you get, but the lowest assignments are usually dropped.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Good professor and good lecturer, but you will not know your grade until its too late to change it which SUCKS. He is a nice person but very blunt. There is a lot of work but his office hours are key to success.

Dr. P is an amazing lecturer. His class transitioned very well to an online format. His pre-recorded lectures were easy to understand and had the right amount of information without confusing you. Be prepared for a lot of work, but you'll do well if you follow the rubric carefully and attend office hours.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Piasta is really a tough person that you have merely zero possibility to let him understand your difficult situations. He is really a professor that can make you learn, but the process is a nightmare.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Biolab this semester (Sept 2020  Dec 2020) was unusual, since Kene tried fitting in all assignments for bio 18b & bio 18a all in one course, in hopes that the pandemic would settle down for next sem when we could actually spend a lot of time doing in person lab stuff. That being said, I didn't learn anything, was just excessive amounts of work.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Terrible human being, does not understand any situation that can occur while studying. He is reluctant to fix his TAs mistakes and furthermore, when you ask for a regrade or question the grading one begins to realize that its purely graded out of principle. If you annoy him, expect a bad grade on an assignment.

Okay teacher, awful person. I took bio lab with this guy and oh my god was that a nightmare. He made us use zoom cloud recordings to submit oral presentations throughout the year. For the first assignment of the year, Zoom took over 7 hours to process my 5 minute recording, making me submit it late, and this guy just had no mercy on me. 0/10
Tough grader and so NOT understanding. Bio lab is hard and work-heavy on its own and he shows no flexibility. However, he is a good lecturer. :////
His way of grading is horrible...

Some people have said that they find him boring, but he is my favorite professor I have had a Brandeis so far! He's an amazing lecturer and even though his style of talking isn't the most engaging, you can still tell he loves what he does and he is genuinely interesting. He really cares about his students and wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Keith is extremely friendly, and his lectures are hilarious. He clearly cares deeply about the subject and about his students' learning process. He takes students' thoughts seriously and loves to hear new perspectives. Probability is not an easy subject, so be ready to participate and keep on top of the material.

I really enjoyed him, and he really goes the extra mile to help you prepare for your exams and build confidence in your problem solving skills. However, do not take his course lightly. As nice and caring as he is, this course is  hard, esp if you are not that familiar with probability problems.

This man is absolutely the best, I didn't have him as a professor but I went to his office hours a lot. He was the one that basically taught me all the class material in office hours time, he is the most attentive, funny(ish) and smart. He believed in me so much even when I didn't. Absolutely fantastic, hands down.

This class is very HARD, especially if you do not put any time into it outside of class. However, overall, Keith made a challenging subject bearable and inspirational, and indeed, he does all he can to help each student realize their full potential. You cannot only rely on him imo, he's only a good lecturer for ppl who do a lot of outside HW.

The class is actually really hard, and it will demand a lot of time if you want to do well. However, you should take it with Keith because he cares about his students' success and also strives to provide clear explanations, while also encouraging you to improve your learning habits in math. Just give him 6 years to teach this class again.
I've never met a professor before who had so many students (hundreds in a single semester) and still cared so much about every single one. Professor Merrill is the best there is.

One time I emailed him at ~1:30am asking a question about the content of an exam the next afternoon.  He responded within 10 minutes.  He is by far the best professor I've ever had at Brandeis.  He's really funny and a great guy, but also really cares about his students and is really understanding and accommodating.  Would 100% recommend.

Keith is a very caring and capable professor, but the way he approached this class was not the most helpful. Lectures were a bit disorganized and homeworks challenging. Also no clear feedback on homework which made it hard to learn. He is very willing to answer questions and help students outside of class; but the way class was taught not ideal.

Keith is the most caring and enthusiastic professor I've had. The class is tough no doubt, but go to his office hours and put in the work, and you'll get an A. Grading scheme is very accommodating and you really learn all of the material by the end. He doesn't respond to emails but will spend hours in his office with you until you fully understand.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: He's very nice and inspirational. Just take his course.

Great teacher cared about the students a lot. I felt like the structure of the class (test) was was hurt me in the long run. Sometimes felt like I had to teach myself how to do certain things. However, he is my favorite professor so far!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Tells us that he's giving us hard problems without ever providing us with the foundation necessary to start those problems. It's becoming excessive and it's impossible to learn unless you are genius who just "gets it". Office hours are a joke since he combines all of his classes into one office hours and only helps the calc students
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Such a sweet man and a great professor! The best I've ever had! He is really good at teaching/explaining math, which not many people are. I was able to follow his lectures without getting lost. Also, he is really caring. There are lots of resources outside of class to help you with Math10a+b which I definitely recommend using.

I took this class because everyone recommended him; however, he practices the flipped classroom method, thus making the student do all the reading. Announces dates and homework in a haphazard manner. Grades homework with meticulous attention to detail, but lack of constructive feedback for improvement makes class impossible to sustain learning.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I love Professor Keith's class. It's so much fun. Just I am not good at math...

Keith is a really nice guy. I took this class as a math requirement and was dreading it, but he made class enjoyable and I actually feel like I really learned something useful. He also is amazing about meeting out of class and talking over problems. He writes HW question a little poorly, but is always available to answer questions and clarify.

KEITH is the man. He is super passionate about math, and even more passionate about teaching math. He will go way out of his way to help his students learn. Great professor. Math is a difficult subject so the class was hard, but Keith made it great.

He was a very nice and charismatic professor, frequently amusing the class. Perhaps it was my poor mindset towards university at the time, but looking back at this class as a graduate student currently, it was the most difficult course I ever partook in. I got the lowest grade I have ever received to date here leaving quite the ignominious stain.
KEITH is the best. He is always passionate at teaching and he is always patience to answer the questions. And he is also very accessible outside class.

Linear is a hard class if you've never done any super-abstract math before, but Keith's available a ton outside of class for office hours, up to 10 hrs/wk. He's fun to talk to fun and his lectures are fun, organized, and useful. Reading the textbook is something you need to do, but it's a good textbook and you can find it online for free.

Great professor who always finds an entertaining and understandable way to teach really boring material. His enthusiasm in the subjects and the occasional group work in class will make you want to stay in class longer.

Keith is simply the best math professor or the best professor I've had at Brandeis. He has incredibly passion on Math. He would respect every student and spend time on helping them. Though the exams and quizzes are hard and tough, but I would definitely take his course again. Take Keith's courses and you wont regret it.

Keith is an amazing professor. He's always available outside of class and willing to help. His classes aren't easy, but you learn a ton. If you just write down everything he puts on the board, with minor notes on what he says to remind yourself, then you can basically reteach yourself from the notes. But also has very memorable lectures.

The most accessible professor I have ever taken a class with. The class was incredibly hard, but I met with Keith twice a week basically every week and he always puts in the time to help students. I ended up really understanding the course and doing very well because of him.

I've been at Brandeis for 3 years now and I have yet to meet anybody as enthusiastic as Keith about their subject. The guy loves what he does and wants you to love it too. The material he teaches isn't easy, but he'll work hard to make sure you understand it.
Great man.

Keith is an all around great professor. He will always back track to make sure that everybody understands a topic and to make sure he's presented it in the best way he possibly can. He's passionate about the material and he almost makes linear algebra SUPER interesting. Great guy, fair tests, enjoyable class.

Took as a requirement for my psych major. It's statistics so of course it's not going to be the most fun class (and he knows this and acknowledges that almost all of us are here because we have to be) I can tell he has a bit of interest in the subject but is just a terrible lecturer. The class was dreadful to sit through very challenging.

Boring as he might seem during the class lecture, he cares about the students and their success. The class is required for my major and the materials, and topic are usually unfamiliar, so the class is promised to be a hard one. However, if you do all the homework, and pay attention in class, you will receive a good grade.

He knows a lot, but he can't teach. he mumbles a lot, the homework is completely different with the textbook. His lecture cannot be understood, you can barely hear him speaking. Don't take this class.
This class made me consider dropping out of college. He is a very nice guy but seriously not a good lecturer. The test questions are convoluted and very difficult.

Clearly knows his stuff, very intelligent, but can't teach. Seems to assume a baseline knowledge of biomechanics that 95% of his students just don't have. Lectures are pretty convoluted: the moment your attention drifts, you're lost. A surprisingly lenient grader (everything's open book with no time limits) so it mostly evens out. Lots of reading.
He is such a nice Professor. The class is boring, but IT'S STATISTICS. He is very flexible with deadlines and he is very willing to help you.
Has a participation grade, curves tests by 10%+, very boring

He understands that stats and math classes are usually no one's favorite courses. He tries to make the online format as accessible and easy as possible. He is very intelligent in his area of study and he is a good professor.

Do you like to leave class more confused than you came in? Enjoy having to inform your professor that they graded your midterm and final incorrectly? How about listening to a mumbling, bumbling lecture where 42% of the word count is um, uh, or buhhhh? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this class is perfect for you!! :)

It's pretty clear that he is teaching as a requirement for his position. I found his lectures really hard to understand. He does curve exam grades so I managed a decent grade. He seems like a really nice man but his teaching skills are lacking.
Good guy, horrible professor. Didn't teach a thing and made a bunch of mistakes on quizzes.

Spring 2020 This is a difficult class and Professor DiZio understands this  Good2communicate with him. Arrange time outside of class to get extra help if you are struggling and dont give up if you dont do as well as you wanted to on the first exam. Taking notes on the textbook is not necessary but very helpful if you struggle w math in general!

Prof. DiZio is very nice and definitely cares about statistics and his students. His lectures are very boring and the powerpoint is often confusing. If you do well on the SPSS reports it is a huge grade booster.

I believe that Dizio is a really great teacher when there is a small classroom environment. His powerpoints are more visual based than anything else. His classes are definitely challenging and you have to pay attention at all times to understand what it going on. The second you look down at your phone or computer, you may get lost.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Truly an awful teacher. He is clearly very passionate about statistics, but is a poor teacher who has trouble keeping his students engaged. He also mumbles a lot and is not always clear. Needs to use powerpoints more efficiently.

Professor Dizio means well and intends for his students to learn the course material. However, his powerpoints are unclear and vague, over-worded. There is the suggestion that we should read the book to ace the class, but only pieces are used and is almost as hard as Dizio to understand.

Professor DiZio means well, and cares about his students, but isn't well-equipped to teach the material or answer questions. He's very nice, but ultimately bumbling and gets distracted easily. He makes consistent errors while teaching and questions must be yes or no to be answered effectively at all. I did not feel like his lectures were helpful.

Doesn't know how to lecture, I relied entirely on the book to understand the information Bumbling and out of touch overall. He wants to help but doesn't understand what's needed. Doesn't know when to move on or how to communicate what we need to know
He's eh.
No Comments
Very knowledgable but sometimes misses the point and beats a dead horse. But most of his concrete stuff is very very interesting.
even while eating breakfast, i couldnt stay awake in that class.  god help you if you have to deal with it!

he makes statistics seem easy and exciting. His lectures are clear. I also took NPSY Motor control class with him, he was a great teacher. His exams are hard though he does give you questions in advance.He is a great guy, he trully cares about students.
sooooo boring!
Amazing  prof!!!  Very helpful!!

Extremely knowledgeable, but doesn't mean that makes you a good teacher. Definitely said more than a few racist/sexist things and can be uncomfortable for anybody who has a conscience. Spent a good chunk of class fawning over Birth of a Nation and actresses from the 1940s. Extremely nitpicky unless you write exactly what he wants.
do not take his course if you want any grades better than B or want to be respected!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment:
I took this class for the subject matter, and to his credit Doherty is INSANELY knowledgable in it (to the extent that I think he's a full rolodex of classic film knowledge)
The class is quite easy however BEWARE the overt misogyny towards the study material/actresses and the unannounced racial slurs he drops (referencing the films and time period)

Easy for an intro course but I wouldn't trust a single thing out of his mouth. We were constantly behind on the syllabus because class was basically him talking about whatever he wanted for an hour and a half. He had... interesting opinions. Easy to pass as long as you figure out what information he wants regurgitated.

This is single-handedly the worst professor I have ever had the displeasure of having in my time at Brandeis University. Not only is this professor rude, he is an incredibly poor grader as he offers little constructive criticism or insight on how to improve your writing. I would not advise anyone attending this university to sign up for his course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Even though he is a good lecturer, there were times when I questioned whether he actually wants discourse in the classroom or just students to agree with him. VERY harsh grader. His personality is generally alright but it sometimes feels tiresome.
(planet hollywood)he holds your attention throughout the lecture, and encourages everyone in the room to participate and really knows his subject

I had thomas in hollywood and am.cult. he has so much knowledge its ridiculous. his class is 100% lecture based and he is not the most politically correct individual.  but if you put in the work he does everything so his students can succeed. only take his class if you are interested enough that you wanna hear about it for three hours every week
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Not accommodating. He was mean to all his students, only nice to those he remembered the names of. Other times, he would totally shut down your ideas after preaching for an "equal discussion." Ask him about mental health accommodation and he'll tell you to just drop his class.
Best professor at Brandeis!

Has a high-strung style that can often seem demeaning and intimidating, but he can also be very funny.  Too reliant on the text rather than demanding active, critical thinking and discussion.  Felt like a 1950s-esque college lecture.  Bottom line: his exams are fair and he's a good guy.  Average course.
Fantastic and engaging professor. Funny and very smart. Don't take the class if it doesn't interest you, but if it does it will be very rewarding.

Phenomenal professor. Knows so much about his topic, classes are interesting and engaging. Tough grader because he expects his students to actually THINK and analyze rather than just spitting back information. Packs lots of info into his lectures, but never tests you on anything not discussed in class, so if you take notes and think you'll be fine.

His unkempt appearance, hair, mercurial temperament, tough grading & 70s attire aside, he really inspired me to develop a passion for a wide genre of film. I was drawn into both the mechanics/ nuances of film & the reactions evoked by directorial techniques. He exposed me to films I NEVER would've explored. A memorable & influential experience.

Doherty's the kind of guy who would hang these cynical comments on his fridge, or better yet, his office door. He is brilliant, a phenomenal lecturer and knows his material better than anyone in the field, so why should he bother with kids who don't put in the work, effort or time? I have so much respect for this man.

Condescending? Well, I can see how some feel that way as I did at first.  Then I realized he just demands more from students.  He clearly despises comments from those who have not done the reading or the viewing.  Not sure about the chauvinist charge, I didn't notice it.  He's GREAT to talk to outside of class, especially if you're into TV and film

He's amazing!! People who complain are people who are not smart enough to write a critical essay. Yes, he's a tough grader because he doesn't accept bull****. He wants his students to actually think rather than spit back information, which is extremely refreshing. He is a very fair man, and respectful -- yet some people tend to misinterpret him.

Sanctimonious and condescending, he thinks he is God's gift to academia. He is rude to students, and unbelievably harsh grader, and takes himself ENTIRELY TOO SERIOUSLY. He teaches a class about TV for christsake. Take a Jerry Cohen class and save yourself the agony. Ugh.

Extremely smart, great lectures. The essays are useless, however. There are few guidelines and nothing seems to be good enough. Might I add, the final is a killer if you can't memorize well or if you don't read the textbooks religiously.

I took two classes with this fruit cake.  Honestly, if you wanna be in film or wanna learn about film (esp. War film) take this dude. He really knows his stuff. I mean, really. He'll encourage you if he sees something in you...but beware..HE IS A DICKHEAD.  But pretty fair. He excused me from an exam once for a broken bone. He's not that bad. **** 'em.
Doherty is possibly the worst excuse for a teacher at Brandeis. If you like to be berated and hear a constant string of chauvinistic swill, then he may be the professor for you. What a joke.

Good teacher with tremendously clear presentation and a lovely sense of filmic construction. Introductory class was very good, lots of solid basic material, and was a lot of fun. He makes rather derogatory remarks about women occasionally, which can be very hard to take.

Class with this professor is fascinating. He is interesting, knowledgeable, and a great lecturer.  The reason some people complain is that they think the class will be easy, and it isn't--he challenges you, and he doesn't baby you if you say something stupid.  The classes are great.
Doherty is conceited and rude.  He makes womanizing comments and is very picky when grading.  I don't know one person that had a good experience.  Avoid!

Professor Doherty can remember the name of every student in an entire lecture hall, has a marvelous sense of humor, is a fascinating speaker/writer, and always has his office door open. Brandeis film buffs - don't miss out: Take a Doherty course!

Gila is one of those professors who can, if you are willing and ready, change the way you think about the world . She is not for everyone and  people self select out if they are not willing to do the hard work, engage, and be open to learning from one of the best.  Her passion and knowledge around social theory is unmatched.she is a shining gem.

She literally covered her ears and started shouting "I cannot hear this" when I startwd saying something that she didn't fully agree with. Then, when we were given the papers to rate her as peofessor, she STAYED in the classroom and started reading what we wrote, and telling us to change the bad ratings. ������

Helps students deepen their understanding of complex social issues & phenomena by masterfully breaking them down to their fundamental parts. Has an unyielding commitment to helping each of her students grow & succeed. Deepens the relevance & meaning of lectures by drawing from her own rich experiences and encouraging students to do the same.
Brilliant woman, very passionate and very inspiring. She expects full attendance, but can be a tough grader.  Good amount of reading, but very interesting.

She really believes what she is saying. Since she is a legitimate genius, sometimes it is admirable and even inspiring. But much of the time it?s like she thinks she?s the messiah. She feels totally comfortable with impossible assignments, because ?I believe you can do it!? and she really does, which can be inspiring or really scary.

Gila is cute, inspirational, and enthusiastic, and extremely knowledgable.  She does a great job integrating her personal expertise into lectures and obviously loves teaching for the love of spreading knowledge.  She expects that you work and attend class, but she is understanding, willing to give help, and her assignments are fair & clear.

I seriously cannot understand those who like her.  From the beginning I thought there was something off and I learned first-hand that it was her personality.  I just found it quite ironic that she would teach a class on morals, etc. Her classes are discussion based which is a problem if you're not good at deciphering accents.

The most overbearing professor I've encountered. As someone already commented, she will call you five times to ask you why you missed a class. She also rambles and goes off on unfinished tangents. She comes off as very egocentric. I dropped the class on the second day because I couldn't handle being treated like a child.

Existential sociology with Gila was a truly a transformative experience for me both as a person and as a student. For those who can  'transcend their own perspective', Gila's passion for the subject  matter and her students makes her classes truly unforgettable. Truly a  beautiful lady, whom I feel privileged to consider a friend and a  mentor.

Challenges you to improve yourself.  more than reasonable workload, and the first and only professor to objectively judge your work on it's quality and the thoroughness of your arguments rather than whether or not you agree with her opinions.  Helpful comments on papers. I was surprised to find i actually enjoyed many of the readings and papers.

She's a sweet old lady who, yeah, is pretty egocentric, but she truly cares about what she does and how well her students do. She's always eager to help in any way she can. I learned a lot from that class.
Professor  Hayim is a caring and brilliant professor. She cares about the progress of her students, and challenges students to engage with the material they are studying.

as an international student she was very helpful to me in becoming accustomed to the american school system. she was always available for conferences after class for further clarification and she made me feel comfortable as a student in new territory

I would not recommend this professor to anyone. She has a two faced personality. One day she decides to hug you and the next she yells as you telling you how horrible you are. I can't say that I didn't learn a good amount from this class, but the experience is not something I'd wish on anyone.

Gila is a professor that cares a bit too much. She takes every students cell phone number down and calls if you miss a single class. She will hug you and invade your personal space in a creepy manner. She is also self-centered and egocentrical and argues with students who slightly disagree with her. Her view is the law if you want to earn anOKgrade
She's egocentric but I found her lectures clear. The highest grade she'll give is a B+ no matter how hard you try...
Difficult to follow her lectures, and not particularly approachable.  Eccentric and intimidating.  Very mercurial persona.
I know she is a difficult person, but I learned a lot from Gila.

I graduated 25 yrs ago and she was the most self centered human being on campus. She offered to write my grad school recommendations and when I went toretrieve said that I picked schools to good for me. Needless to say I told her to keep her recommendations where the sun doesn't shine...BTW I got into the 7 Ivy and top schools I applied to without
No Comments
DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS WOMAN! she can't pronounce the english language, she can't form coherent sentences and she is so damn weird! you'll be sorry!

I just have to say that Gila was the best professor I had at Brandeis.  She has a very, very intimidating exterior, but once you get past the initial shock of her eccentricity and unapproachability and really get to know her, she is honestly the most supportive and caring (and intelligent) professor
Stay away!!! This professor is ****ing crazy. She is also rude and has no social skills to speak of. She isn't crazy in that "oooh I'm eccentric" way either, she's just plain old nuts.

Gila Hayim is not only a horrible professor, but she is a horrible person.  Students who know her best tend to refer to her has a jeckyl and hyde character.  Her accent makes her lectures impossible to understand, she only likes students if they are criminals, and she is horrific to look at.
indescernable speech, confusing paper topics, although the readings are pretty good. but that's about it. also, she is scary.

So great and kind. Really cares about his students and will always want to chat. If you're an IGS major or minor you NEED to take a class with him. Most of his assignments are essays, or readings (but they're interesting readings). Goes above and beyond for his seminar classes especially (took all of us to see a play for example!)

Really interesting personality. Just sit towards the front of the class because otherwise you'll get lost in the sea of students who aren't paying attention. He is embraces student participation. His style of tests is super interesting, despite his grading criteria and test questions being tricky to understand.

The class was fine and the content was very interesting. His voice is a bit monotone and I often found myself dosing off but slides have no info so pay attention. Tests were take home and based on the lectures and readings they weren't too hard as they were open book, but questions were often a bit broad. Attendance was randomly taken. Overall mid.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Rosenberger gives great lectures however the grading scale is not super clear so showing up and doing the readings are important for the tests.

Prof. Rosenberger is very intelligent and experienced with global politics. He lectures the entire class and can be a bit quiet, so I'd suggest sitting near the front to take notes on what he says (since his ppts have few words on them). Readings are really important!! Kinda long but should read thoroughly for lectures/quizzes

Chandler is really smart, has very very long lectures that you need to pay attention/ take good notes to or do the readings. he is really really helpful if you go to office hours but will take an average two weeks to respond to emails even if they are labeled urgent. he has great experience learning and working in different countries
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lecture is really well-structured, and his slides are just little text and images so you definitely should go to the class to be able to answer his exams. The exams are short essays, but there are no clear grading criteria. He only holds one office a week for all of his classes so make sure to schedule beforehand.

Prof Rosenberger was one of the driest teachers I've had. I don't suggest this class unless you have to take it for your major because he lectured the entire time and while the content was interesting at times, it didn't matter because he was so incredibly boring. But we only had one in-class test and a couple of papers so it's not hard to get an A
The tests are not difficult if you follow the readings and lectures. May include some boring topics, but overall is good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: Professor Rosenberger is definitely one of my FAVORITE Professors at Brandeis. You won't regret taking his class. I can tell how passionate he is about the material. The class does require some effort, but it's totally mangeable and WORTHWHILE. The exam is a fair game, if you attend the class and prepare for it.

Soc127 was a class I was super lucky to take. In class lectures were engaging, and you could tell he really enjoyed getting to know students. He was helpful in his office hours, and this course required a decent amount of reading, but it was all very engaging. He grades very fairly with thorough feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I absolutely love Rosenberger. I love how he is passionate about the subject and how easily accessible he is. He is always willing to chat with you about academics or life, so I really enjoy his office hour. Also, he is very caring. Once I messed up with the time and went online when it was supposed to be in person, but he said no worries.
Very helpful, learned a lot from his class.

Only reading homework, which he would go through during class. His voice is calm and low. You will find it hard to stay awake in a big classroom. All tests are take-home except the final test. For normal tests, you have a week to work on three essay questions and some multiple, but only 3hs for the final test. (Not very hard) He's been very nice
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Professor Rosenberger is probably one of the best professors I have ever met. He respected every student and their levels. If u don't do the readings, although he clearly knows by hearing everyone talks, he never criticizes or pressures anyone. However, if u do the reading carefully, you can learn so much from the selected readings and from him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Great and hilarious professor. His amazing lectures cover every necessary fields of international studies, so you may have to work with topics that you do not have prior interests. Yet, pay attention to them as their contents will appear in tests or needed in your essays. His midterm essays can be an overwhelming work, but the final is quite easy.

Professor Rosenberger genuinly cares about our well being and makes accomadation to all reasonable excuses. The class materials are challenging and the class is demanding. However, all the materials are very interesting and condensed with informations that is usful to know. He also gives very detailed comments to the assignments.

He only use the ppt ( only pictures) for classes, which is very ineffective. He gives us textbook, but never use it and believe his lecture is effective, which is not true. He is very very very boring, and the way he tough is terrible.
Professor Rosenberger does not teach. His final exam was impossible and he provides no support for his students. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

class is entirely pro-america, anti-comm, CIA lies. he hates revolution, why does he dedicate his career to studying them? state dept behavior. also very pedantic: students would participate in class, and he would first disagree with them before proceeding to essentially restate their ideas as part of his lecture. embarrassment to brandeis soc dept
regret taking his class

AVOID HIS CLASS AT ALL COSTS! His grading is so inconsistent. He takes off so many points on the tests for no reason. And for the participation part of your grade, it is NOT based on your participation but on how much he likes you. He also changed his grading system at the last minute without even telling his students. I was supposed to get an A-.

If you don't put what he EXACTLY wants in his exams, he would take so many points off. And he doesn't really word his questions very well, so it is very easy to miss some parts of his question. When talking to him during office hours or through email, he would uses specific words to make the student feel belittled/shows that he is irritated.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Rosenberger was probably one of the easiest professors I've had since I've been at Brandeis. He is extremely sweet, accessible outside classes, and fun to talk to. The class was an easy A, just go to the lectures and/or study his presentation slides.

Great lectures, very interesting. Great start for IGS major students. A lot of readings, and expected to read them all carefully because they will be on the tests. Once you read your readings, go to classes, and listen during classes; you will get A.
literally just dont do it lol
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Super sweet and understanding professor. Graded on attendance, HW, and exams and there are only two for the whole semester. My TA sucked but the professor was great. The only thing is she has a thick accent so it's sometimes tough to understand her. It's a required class for psych majors so she understands that not everyone will enjoy the class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Wolf is a sweet professor, however, the structure of the stats class made it challenging to learn. The lectures focused on vocabulary, and the actual math portion of the class you had to read the textbooks to teach yourself as homework which was a difficult way of learning. I would have preferred the structure was flipped.
Great class. Get ready to work.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Great professor

While receptive to feedback, Prof W seemed to have little idea what was going on and would often speak so fast that she only became more confused and sometimes said insensitive things. Group work is okay and the tests aren't awful but I'm not sure if I came out of the class with as much learning as I would have liked. Topics also felt disjointed.

She is a wonderful, caring, and accommodating professor! That being said, she does assign a lot of busy work, as HW and her slides have an overwhelming amount of information. There is a tremendous amount of reading and the tests can be a bit tricky but they aren't impossible. She has a lot of grade protection and is a pretty generous grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: A great class with a clear syllabus and slides and a good way to fulfill the group I requirement. There are a lots of things that the professor cover in the class, but the exam is an open book, online and she posted the slide so if you know where to find the answer, you will be fine.

Very easy professor but so boring and scrambled in her lectures. It's hard to make sense of what she is saying half the time because she jumps around to the point where it's hard to follow. Class is easy but the points add up so make sure to submit everything so you don't get docked for something stupid like missing an easy hw or two.

Shes okay, like if you have to take a class with her, take the class. Shes really nice and understanding but will just talk at you and it's not really engaging so it's easy to doze off. She does participation quizzes in most classes and the final poster presentation doesn't reflect much of what we learned in class. Not terrible but not the best
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Okay professor, her slides are available online and her tests are open book/internet, so pretty easy. The thing that makes her notable are QADs- group project each unit where your group comes up with a question, answers another group's question, and discusses it with other groups. Participation based, but make up a lot of your grade, so DO NOT SKIP

She's an amazing professor. She does have a tendency to go around in circles and rush through the material but, she's really caring, accommodating, and nice. She can be a bit impatient but, she really means well. The class is a lot of fun and an easy A. Great way to satisfy Group 1 requirements for the Psych major. I highly recommend the class.
really interesting lectures and good professor. highly recommend if you're a psych major.

She's an excellent professor and very knowledgeable in her field. There is a lot of grade protection and her assignments really help you dive in and understand how to properly conduct research. That being said, she is extremely fast and her workload is intense. You cannot fall behind otherwise you're lost. But, she is accessible and really lovely!

I agree with the rest of the reviews about Wolf but she is also condescending, we are in 2 hour and 30-minute class and she does not allow students to ask questions. She's always "running out of time" and rushing at the end. She talks in circles and ends up confusing the students but once a student asks a question it is met with passive aggression.

She's a very good professor. For a 5-week course, however, there is a lot of homework and it's extremely fast and intense. She's very reasonable and does reward students with extra credit if they do all of the homework she assigns. SPSS reports are demanding. Her exams are slightly tricky. But, it is definitely possible to succeed in this class!

She's lovely, caring, and accessible. She promptly responds to emails and has a strong, coherent, and structured organization for each class. There is a lot of homework but it serves as solid grade protection and her tests are very easy (only multiple choice). She is fast and overenthusiastic but her class is interesting and highly recommended.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: It's a lot of homework but is mostly for a completion grade. Plus, you get extra credit for doing them all. She's super sweet and is pretty good at returning feedback on time.

Professor Wolf is amazing and she cares for you at every stage of the class. i could tell from the start many of my classmates were worried about the material but ended really liking it because of how clear she is with her explanations and how fair she is with homework despite this being a 5-week (really fast) course. loved stats and her class :)

SO much stuff to read, but she helps you narrow down what you need to understand for papers and exams. Both the TA and Prof. Wolf are extremely helpful. She's really nice about things and is an easy grader. But still gotta work for it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Funny lady, easy class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: final project is a bit rush in time. BUT i wanna say thank you to prof Wolf. For final project, I did most of the works, and my group members are faking data and not prepared to the presentation AT ALL! But the presentation grade is full of mercy, and it makes my final grade 94ish. Not so lucky for my group member tho. THANK YOU SO MUCH!

I don't understand why her rating is so low. She does have accent, but who doesn't. Her psyc statistic in summer is way better than the one in regular semester. At least, what she says makes sense, and she is actually trying to teach us how to use SPSS instead of pure maths. I have to admit it is very practical for future lab courses.

I took Professor Wolf's research methods over the summer and it couldn't have gone better! I was that student who would always be at her office hours and she never ceased to be extremely helpful. I went to get something for at the library one time and got lost. She stopped class and went outside the building and looked around for me: she cares!

There is an assignment every class. The SPSS reports are worth more than the test grades, so make sure to go to a TA, but the TA's suck and are very unhelpful and some don't show up to their office hours, except Cameron, who is amazing and helpful. Jutta tries to be funny, doesn't work out, she has an accent, but not too bad. Test are correctable

Great professor and really interesting class. Everyone comes together at the end and I was able to see how all the topics discussed relate to each other. Your grade is determined by a midterm and a final, but since there is no textbook simply reviewing her lecture/PowerPoint notes should do the trick. Highly recommended!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is very kind and funny! Very understanding and open to new ideas
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Very nice professor

He's a really sweet and caring professor. He tries his level best to accommodate students and is generous with extensions. He's a very easy grader. The class has a lot of reading and quite a few papers so be prepared to work but if you show a decent amount of effort, you will be fine. The class is an easy A. He's very knowledgeable in his field.

Professor Strand is honestly one of the best professors I have ever met. He is an amazing person who cares for his students. He has the best jokes and is a very fair grader/ gives a fair amount of work. I could not say enough good things about him. I want to take many more classes with him.

Prof Strand is super awesome! He's super funny and cares about his students a ton. I love how chill he is and doesn't pressure us. He even says things like, "If you can make class that would be great" but not like If you miss class you're in a ton of trouble. I've taken multiple classes with him and I recommend!
Good prof, funny guy but lectures can be a bit boring. What really inspired the 5 was him telling us that we have desirable eyeballs (I was flattered)
Professor Strand is a great professor. He is super funny and his classes aren't super hard just some simple writing. He cares a lot about the students and what we have to say! He's awesome!
Definitely recommand. His really listen to his student. One of the best prof. at Brandeis

A really sweet, caring, and accommodating professor! He's truly interested in the success of his students! His lectures can be really long and maintaining concentration throughout can be challenging but he's entertaining and welcomes all perspectives! He's a very easy grader and rewards student effort. Overall, a lovely course and a great guy!

Really sweet guy, cares about seeing students succeed. Unfortunately the classroom is just an echo chamber of left-leaning students talking about how they are oppressed, and it's not really a place to go if you want your worldview to be challenged. Sometimes it feels like group therapy, honestly. He's a very easy grader, though, and a nice dude.

If you have to take any fun, intellectual class, take this one. The class covers a lot of interesting topics and allows you to talk about the things you like. The professor is amazing - he is funny, and caring and wants students to feel comfortable in the class. I appreciate him so much and am so glad that I have taken the class taught by him
Very passionate and funny professor but very long lectures that made it hard to pay attention.
Easy grader, easy class, but VERY boring. Most boring professor, lectures were boring, class was boring.
really enjoyed his class, he is passionate and understanding and pretty laid back
Professor Strand is a really nice person. He is patient and has a dry sense of humor. Although there are a lot of little quizzes to check your attendance and participation, it is a great course.
Best professor I've ever seen at Brandeis

Lectures were interesting and engaging, he made good jokes, and the topic itself was really intriguing. Good feedback on papers, and the paper topics themselves were pretty interesting to think about and write. All together a pretty amazing class that I enjoyed. taken fall 2021

took soc100b previously, prof strand ages like fine wine. he always loves to hear students' ideas and provides constructive comments to in-class participation and papers. sylly gets a little repetitive, and there are 3 essays plus a research paper (!), which is a lot of work. but you'll get a lot out of it if you're interested in the subject!
Professor Strand is a great professor
Good Professor

Professor Strand truly cares about his students' opinions and thoughts, and he works really hard to make sure everyone understands the material and is engaged in it. Papers aren't graded too harshly, as he just wants to see that you're paying attention and can apply the material. Probably my favorite professor so far!

great sense of humor! lectures are funny and engaging. readings are always a doable length, and the topics are so interesting they always generate good class discussion. prof strand really cares about students' ideas; he always adds on to our comments to affirm our thoughts and advance the discussion. only complaint  he sometimes speaks unclearly
A really great professor. He cares about students' questions on classes and makes useful feedback to assignments.

He really cares about what your opinion is in the class and gave us lots of time for discussions. The classes are not extremely exciting but still very informational. He seems a little bit distanced but is very warm-hearted and approachable. He tries to add some videos in the classes to make it more interesting. Great Professor.

I randomly decided to take this class and absolutely fell in love with the professor. He is super inviting and the class is basically a large discussion between the professor and the students. Amazing choice of books to read and although there were section papers and a midterm and final essay, the amount of work in manageable. Amazing professor!
Fun class, Professor is really nice

Organized lectures, very smart and understanding professor. More on the boring side, and hard to stay engaged- sit in front few rows to hear because she is pretty soft-spoken. Graded on 2 papers and an easy final. Try to do the reading, but it's not the end of the world if you don't.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Smiley is a fantastic professor! Really interesting discussions. Smiley encourages dissenting opinions, just be prepared to support them.

Professor Smiley is a gem! Her lectures are engaging and she does a great job facilitating discussions. If you talk in the class you will get a higher grade. The class was graded on 2 papers and a very easy final exam (4 short answer questions). The readings are interesting and she explains them well. I would strongly recommend taking her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: It is essential for anyone interested in PHIL to take one of Smiley's classes. She is extremely forgiving with deadlines and her lectures are very helpful for clarifying material. Reading is imperative to succeed in the class and the final is entirely based on pieces we have read (which can be tough) -- but otherwise, excellent class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: She is very nice and helpful with stuff, but the problem is that there is one kid in the class that doesn't stop talking and she will not stop him. Also its graded by like 3 papers and a final, and the final is only on the readings so you 100% have to read for this class. Lastly, she only uses a tiny portion of the board, so half of class cant see.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: super kind. respectable person. grant extensions.
She's really kind to students and patient.

Grade is completely based on 2 essays and 1 final. Each worth 33%. Professor Smiley is good. Very nice. Grading criteria for essay's wasn't quite as clear as it could've been. But "What is Justice?" class was an interesting concept.
Professor Smiley is terrific and really cares about her students. Definitely take a class with her if you're interested in philosophy and you'll learn a lot.
Professor Smiley is incredibly engaging and leads very thorough and well thought out class discussions. She is a truly brilliant woman who knows her field and material immensely well.
Professor Smiley is awesome. And a genius. And awesome.

Smiley is really friendly and content is very interesting.  She offers like 10 different essay topics each time so you're bound to know what to write for at least 1 topic out of those even if you haven't kept up with the course load.  She does ask some thought provoking questions.
A wonderful professor, especially for the ethics class.  Leads fantastic discussions and is very clear in lectures.  Very available and willing to help all students.

Great professor. While her lectures may not be engaging for those not interested, if you like the subject you'll be drawn in. Is very helpful with essay feedback, and is exceptionally open to well-articulated ideas in a class that covers contentious topics (drug use, abortion, assisted suicide). If you're interested in ethics, take Smiley!
excellent teacher. very motivated about material and having students who are not only excited but enriched by lectures and discussion.

Professor Smiley is a really great and intelligent professor. That said, her lecture style is awful and boring for a class as large as Intro to Ethics was. Most people just seemed to play games on their computers and were not engaged in the class at all due to her style of asking questions and only moving on when she had one specific answer.

Very nice, class always felt a bit long and boring, but you can tell she really loves what she teaches. Papers weren't bad and final (a short quiz) was even easier than I thought and I didn't have high expectations. I liked the class.

fantastic professors, one of my favorites. She knows a ton about philo and stimulates class discussions well. LOVES participation and her students. draft option for both papers, no final, just an easy quiz during the exam period. extremely fair grader.
Really, what can be said of a professor like this? Buyer beware.
No Comments
Decent class; not my favorite by a long shot. lots of paper extensions and drafts nothing memorable about the class though.
prof smiley rocks
No Comments

Assigns a lot of readings, but it's okay if you don't understand or don't do them because he goes over them in soooooo much detail during class. I didn't really do them at all, but he was so thorough in his explanations that it was easy to take notes and understand the texts.
Professor's voice may not be too loud, sometimes makes you wanna sleep. But the content is amazing
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Took it Fall'22. He cannot stop talking sometimes. Participation really doesn't matter I slept during his class but it can be useful to keep up with what he's saying. I think he's an intellectual who is better off teaching more advanced topics rather than intro. His essay prompts are really well structured and his/TA's feedback is excellent.

I loved Professor Yack, but beware of the TA. My papers were graded by the TA, and I found that a lot of his feedback was very unhelpful and nit-picky. Professor Yack is a great lecturer, and it's clear to see that he loves to teach. I recommend his courses if you have the chance to take one.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a very nice man who knows/cares a lot about political theory, but he definitely assigns a LOT of work. I know some people who rarely did readings and only got by on the lectures, but that didn't really work for me. You're graded on a few assignments, but you can get feedback on them (at least from his TA, who was great) before submitting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Yack is passionate about Political Theory, so it was really refreshing to be in his class! The course does require you to do a decent amount of reading, and it's essential to take notes. The papers for the class are straight-forward about Professor Yack is more than willing to look at outlines and drafts! Really good class.

POL192b- Nationalism in Spring 2021. Prof Yack is an expert on this topic. Readings were difficult, but he makes them relatively accessible through his summaries. Doing the readings and taking notes on both the readings and the discussion is a must. Graded on 2 essays and participation. Yack is lenient with deadlines and very sympathetic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Great lecturer. He's so good that you don't have to do the readings, but you ought to if you want to get more out of the class. Very funny, kind, and compassionate to students. You will write a fair bit for him, but he is a generous grader.
very smart but can be boring too.
He is very dedicated and educated. I can learn a lot from his class.

Get ready to read. There would be tons of interesting books awaiting for you. On the one hand, the books are amazing and I personally learned a lot from them. On the other hand, the volume of work increased gradually; by the end of the course, I found reading much of suffering. Also, lecture is not so helpful. Come to discussion time.

Prof. Yack is clearly an expert in what he teaches, but he can get a little boring sometimes. A ridiculous amount of reading is assigned but I can't think of anyone that actually did all of it. Take thorough notes because he pretty clearly says everything you need to know. Try to sit close to the front because he mumbles sometimes.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor Yack is truly wonderful, a brilliant political philosopher. Do not graduate without taking a course with him.
love bernie! bernie's the best!

Lectures're decent, but not profound. He's not good at making his lectures engaging for the audience. I'm sure he's a smart guy, just not cerebral enough for me maybe? Or too cerebral that he goes over my head? I don't know. I would recommend you take his intro, but go to him for the essays. He's not clear in what he expects, so be warned. See him.

I didn't think his grading is as tricky as these comments make it seem. You get an A for demonstrating you properly understood the readings and offering insightful ideas. I read only 2 of the books and still got an A. This isn't an easy A class, but he isn't trying to trick you. He's also a really interesting guy and tries to keep lecture engaging.

I totally agree with the person below. Too many difficult theory readings for an intro class, and the lectures are all about the readings so it's easy to fall behind. For papers it is as though he's looking for something specific and it's difficult to know precisely what that is because he's vague in his instructions. Engaging professor, though.

Readings are interesting but we read too many books to really understand every concept. Lectures are boring if you haven't read, but it's hard to keep up with all the readings. You don't need to read to sit in class--never picks on you.  His grading isn't that easy, it's like he wants me to write something specific but won't tell me what.
Discussion seminar, respects student ideas, loved the readings and interaction
Very Good
No Comments

He's an amazing lecturer and unlike many professors remembers why he got into teaching, to talk to students. If you want he's more than willing to discuss the material with you during office hours or just shoot the****. A great teacher.
cool guy, good lectures and discussions. very fair grader. definitely try to take a class with him.

TAs do just about all the grading so if you get a bad one then you are likly not to do well. he's pretty interesting in lecture and not bad out of class and will likly give you an extension. readings are ok. nice guy.
No Comments
Just an amazing professor and wants all her students to succeed. I am graduating now and just wanted to give her props for being a great person.

As you scroll, you will see mixed ratings. This is not due to a quality in the professor, but the difficulty of Fin. accounting. Professor Weihs cares for her students, but if you do not put in any effort outside of lectures you should not expect a good grade. Accouting takes a lot of time, so watch the videos and do the HW and you will be fine.

Bus6a is a hard class for most students, and Prof. Weihs recognized that. She tried her best to explain everything, and was patient with people's questions. She was very nice, but her class pace was a bit too fast. Also it's hard for me to catch up with her use of excel. There were 2 exams and a final. Final was the hardest

The class is important, but I had some condescending interactions with her. I felt like I couldn't really ask questions without fear that she may make me feel stupid. I also feel she relies on the book too but doesn't teach the material well.

Professor Weihs tries to explain everything clearly in class. She is a generous grader and a great person. When you meet with her during office hours, you can just tell how much effort she puts in. What I like about her the most is that she teaches us things beyond the classroom. However, the class requires you to put in effort and time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: BUS 6a is def a hard course but Prof. Weihs tries her best to explain everything and makes it comfortable for us to ask questions. The first exam is the easiest and the second harder, final the hardest. Attendance matters because you have to be actively engaged with the material. Hard to catch up if you miss class. Recommend taking it with her.

Makes her students feel super comfortable with asking questions. Great prof, knows her stuff AND knows how to teach it!  Despite what most say this is not a hard class if you take it with her. If you go to class and watch her videos you will be more than good. She explains everything super well and is always happy to clarify. Kinds & caring prof.

This class was great! Professor Weihs does an amazing job of building on the material learned in lower level classes and applying it to the real world. The class itself was not nearly as challenging as 6a (there's a lot of practice problems) and Weihs made material digestible.

Prof. Weihs is ok. She tells you what to study for the exams but she doesn't really spend time on the material. She rushes through the important topics and wastes time on stuff not on the test. It's an important class, but take it with someone else.

Prof Weihs really cares about her students and if you show that you are working hard for the class, she'll do her best to make you pass. She's very tough, but i now see that that was necessary for me to put in the work to even pass the class and she was very compassionate towards my struggles in accounting. She is a great professor.
She is not terrible, but other professor is better. All my friends that took the other professor enjoyed class more. Good class, but with other techer

Financial accounting is an important class. Professor Weihs could have done a better job with the material. She rushed through the foundation of accounting which made the rest of the material difficult. Other 6a classes didn't have this problem.
Professor Weihs is an amazing Professor with great lectures! Bus 6A takes time and hard work to master however, the Professor was very kind, caring and an excellent teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: BUS6A is an important class. I learned a lot of material that I think I will use for a long time. Professor Weihs is not great. She rushes through important material and wastes time on easy stuff. Take the class, but with a different teacher.

One of the hardest courses I've taken at Brandeis so far. Professor Weihs is amazing and is clearly very passionate about accounting and making sure her students succeed. She provides all the resources you need to succeed. Requires A LOT of work outside class. The tests are really difficult and unlike the homework, so make sure to pay attention!

Professor Weihs is terrible at teaching. She is super condescending. She acts like she is above her students. She is looking to do the least amount of work possible. I would take BUS6A, but with a different professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Weihs is horrible! She rushes through important topics. Her exams are nothing like what she teaches. I basically had to teach myself accounting!
You need to pay attention in class. Exams are very different than the homework.

Professor Weihs is extremely sweet and truly cares about her students and goes out of her way to help. This class is very demanding and challenging, but she provides all the necessary materials for you to succeed. Definitely participate in class and recitation as the only way to truly master this class is by practicing.

You can clearly tell if professors want you to perform well in class, professor Weihs is one of them.  whenever you have a problem with class material or anything related, she's gonna make sure that you fully understand it, and literally won't stop explaining it until you say "yes I totally understand".

This class could not have been taught more perfectly. She takes her time to thoroughly explain every segment of the course, and will thoroughly answer any question that is brought up. She truly wants all of her students to succeed. As long as you answer questions in class, do the homework, go to recitations (mandatory), it's not too hard!

One of the best professors at Brandeis university, a somewhat difficult class for sophomores or freshmen because of its heavy homework/reading. She is very accessible outside of classes in office hours and she has multiple T. As to help. A lot of what she teaches is fundamental and essential to Business, so make sure to study those ratios well!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Weihs clearly knows her stuff and can be a bit tough at times, but altogether, it was easy for me to learn from her. Homework can be time consuming, but studying for exams becomes a breeze if you truly understand the homework. Tiny details can actually destroy your entire grade if you aren't careful, but study if you wanna learn.
Very helpful! Great professor. I really recommend going to her office hours. She never makes you feel stupid. She is very optimistic!

This Professor struggled with teaching and had made multiple sexist comments regarding boys/girls in relations to political ability to lead. Told this to us in a full room of more than 100 students and used wifes work as a teacher for children as evidence to why women have difficulties in leading (also gave us an article to read about that).

This class was hard, but the professor is really respected in the intl pol community and he definitely knew what he was talking about. Graded by TAs, though, who were tough graders. Only 3 grades in the class made it stressful. Boring lectures. Hasn't changed his powerpoint slides in decades haha. Taken Fall 2018.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: One of the most respected professors you'll find. Lectures can get a little distracted by tangents. Definitely read the material. A lot of people suggest going to his office hours because he is very willing to answer questions one on one and the lectures can be hard to follow sometimes.

Art is a highly acclaimed academic (read: good at writing scholarly articles), a nice guy and very smart, but he's a pretty bad teacher. He's lectures are long and deadly boring, and he tends to ramble without clear direction. He's a tough grader, and he gives little feedback so it can be hard to know what he's looking for to get into the A range.
Literally the most boring lectures I've ever experienced - had to take up knitting to get through them. Really nice guy though, and clearly brilliant.

Art is fantastic if you are interested in international relations - great lectures (although the small seminar classes are better than Intro to IR) and he really knows what he's talking about.But if you're not interested in the subject matter, you'll likely be bored. He was my thesis adviser, and I couldn't have asked for a better adviser.

Professor Art may understand the topic he is discussing, but he has zero personal skills. His lectures are tedious and lack any form of structure. I would not suggest reaching out to him for help, his advice boils down to personal insults and directing  you to find help elsewhere. His class left me disappointed with Brandeis academics.

He is SO well read and clearly respected in his field. There's no question that he knows his stuff. And he cares about the subject a lot. However, this does not make him a good lecturer. Lectures were not engaging and completely lacked structure. Beware, he also assigns a great deal of reading that you won't need to know for exams.

My favorite professor at Brandeis, I definitely recommend taking a course with him, especially a small seminar as opposed to a large lecture class. He is the best in his field, a sweet guy, and conducts very interesting conversations.
Best Professor Ever! His lectures are very insightful if you are interested in international relations.

He's a sweet guy, but a hopeless lecturer. This intro level class is buried so deep in theory that students have a hard time taking anything away from lessons. His philosophy is to talk AT students rather than engage or challenge students. Student questions are the only time the lecture lets up a little bit.

Professor Art did a good job with the course; as a former Washington official, it was highly interesting to hear his insight on foreign policy issues. He is a fair grader and invested in the material. However, he could've allowed for more discussion instead of primarily lecturing - he tends to go on long rants. Hard grader, but worthwhile class!
Outstanding professor.  Not for the faint hearted but well worth it.  By far one of the best (if not the best) professors at Brandeis and one of the most respected in the field.

I LOVE Professor Art. A true passion for the subject. Every day I would be astounded by the stories he threw into lectures (which were often boring). Get to pick your own paper topics (only 2 papers) and were normally interesting to write.
ok here's the deal on this guy...he compensates for the fact that he didnt go to vietnam by knowing everything about military**** and by making you know same. BORING AS HELL. Avoid at all costs.

He is underrated because he is such an expert in the field. However, if you are not interested in subject the class will be boring. Bottomline: Take Art if you are interested in subject if not do not take him or you will regret it.
Acts like students should be grateful that the great Robert Art is teaching them.
very very average at best

He is a great teacher. He is truly interested in the topic and lectures very well. I was alrwady interested in the topic, but he made me more interested. Downsides are only that he can assign a little too much reading but is overall fantastic
really knows what he's talking about, but not always the most compelling lecturer. a lot of readings are assigned.

He is a nice guy, and really knows what he is talking about, his lectures can be dry at times, and the TA's are not always very helpful. There is alot of reading and he brags about being the Freshman killer
He was my advisor. He rocks, and is a REALLY nice man and is pretty well known in the international politics field.
No Comments
No Comments

I am going to be honest, the lectures are very long and many times I zoned out during them. I also procrastinated and worked for finals last minute. However, I still ended up getting an A- (no idea how), but I realized the the grading by the TA is actually not harsh. I recommend if anyone is interested in Politics and likes lectures.

I think the professor was nice and a good professor, just his TA was genuinely the most awful TA in the school. He grades unreasonably for an intro course and when asking for an explanation for the grade, he gives excuses that you aren't doing enough. Based off his own grading he wouldn't even get an A in the course, just ridiculous expectations.

Boring professor that you'll enjoy if you love hearing about American imperialism through a series of theories. Tests are largely based on language specificities, and his lectures are not engaging; gets lost in rambles about the various conflicts. Can be a little condescending, but that seems to be just his personality rather than on purpose.

Do not take him. Class was mostly discussion and very limited lecture or any instruction from Chase himself. Was condescending towards students and EXTREMELY particular with his structure and stylistic requirements for presentations and essays. Even the writing center thought his requirements were ridiculous. Had potential but I didn't learn much.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: amazing professor, absolutely loved un&us when i took it. is extremely knowledgeable on foreign policy based stuff and helped me improve my public speaking and writing skills immensely. Not sure what people on here are rating him poorly for, Chase rocks!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Chase is AMAZING, I do not know what everyone else here is talking about. He's a genuinely good guy that teaches well, and the independent work he has us do works to help us learn more. He's one of a select few professors that gives really thorough and complete feedback. If you see a course and he's teaching it, take it.

United States and United Nations is one of my favorite classes I took at Brandeis. It taught me how to do research, and it was definitely very interesting. I would recommend it to literally anyone interested in international studies or American politics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Chase wasn't awful by any means but the class wasn't enjoyable. There are long lectures to do before class along with a LOT of readings (from two textbooks as well as PDFs), and in class he isn't very engaging. There's a challenging final paper, and he gives good help if you seek him out in office hours but overall it wasn't worth it.
He was alright

Professor Chase has high expectations for his students, but is perfectly willing to help students meet them. He tries hard to incorporate multimedia in getting his point across. He gives a lot of reading and lectures are dense, but IMO you can mix and match how much you pay attention to each and do well. Quizzes aren't hard if you pay attention.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Chase is excellent. He was a very caring and helpful professor to your learning, in a way that he will point out your weaknesses and rooms for improvement in detail instead of only praising you. His readings, quizzes and document essay, while can be overwhelming, are very helpful to your learning. TA do most of the grading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Super boring!!!!!! Sooooooooooooooooo many quizzes and readings(homework). The quizzes are super tough and annoying. You need to take attendance or you fail. Readings are more important than lectures.

I legitimately did not need to read at all. The class was super bland and simple. The first half of the class is just a history class. I think that it could've been better, and I don't hold Professor Chase completely responsible for my experience.

Professor Chase give way too much work outside of class (at least online). I would watch 3 hours of lectures a week outside of class (not including the reading), and his weekly quizzes are RIDICULOUS. Also you will never get your grades back. Nice person but as a teacher who does not care if you succeed or fail.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: The worse instructor ever! Under the COVID situation, there is no sign of empathy shown by Dr. Chase. The lectures sound dizzy. Over a hundred pages of readings every week. Students need to go over the slides by themselves BEFORE the class. There is a really difficult quiz every weekend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: In times of COVID professor Chase did not lessen the workload and had weekly reflections and quizes which were very intensive. I expected more compassion from a professor...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Prof Chase is a smart guy, but not a captivating speaker or lecturer.

Definitely one of the more tedious intro courses, but Professor Chase cares about his students and his work. Definitely do the readings, he makes it clear that the readings and lectures are different, but equally important. He's a nice guy and cares about his work, and by the end of it, you'll have gotten something out of it.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: The worst professor I had at Brandeis. He teaches such an interesting topic but manages to make it extremely boring and unbearable. Lectures were dreadful as were the readings he assigned (there were a lot of them too). If you don't want to hate IR avoid this class.
Kerry is an amazing professor, I love that man!!
worst professor on the planet

TAs (PhD candidates) grade everything & were tough graders. Lectures were not engaging but can be if you do the reading beforehand. Topics were interesting. Grade is based off of a midterm, a 12p research paper, and final exam. Can't say I believe grading was fair, especially for an intro course so it was quite disappointing.

he is boring, and not engaging... but he has some funny words like "we will leave things there.."at the end of every lecture... I got a good grade, but that's due to tons of work i did... his lecture did not help AT ALL

The previous post hit it right on the mark. Kerry Chase is average in every way, with one glaring exception. He is easily the harshest grader I have ever had, and he frequently gives assignments in which grading is 100% based on skills not taught in class. Not sure what he's like as a lecturer, but AVOID his small classes at all costs!

I sense a large amount of sarcasm in the previous posting as Kerry Chase is exactly an average teacher.  He covers the material from his golden armchair, but its clear he would never get his hands dirty in the subject matter he is teaching about.  A safe bet for an intro level course.

Kerry is so cool.  I love that man. You will be on the edge of your seat at every lecture. There is never a dull moment. You will not believe what you see and hear; it will blow your mind. He is the reason I am at Brandeis, I came here for him.

The class was Poetry and Philosophy. Laura is a wonderful professor! She engages with students so well in discussions, and makes each student feel heard and valued. There was a lot of reading for hw, and the grade was based on participation/attendance, 2 essays, and submitting your notes 3 times during the semester.

Professor Quinney is easily one of my favorite professors that I have ever had at Brandeis.
