She genuinely made class lectures worth thinking about, and class worth going to (and that is coming from a business major who was originally taking this course just for credit). You can tell that Professor Quinney genuinely loves to teach.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Quinney is really nice! She's a fair grader and always willing to talk about your assignments outside of class. I thought it was a little odd that the class I took with her (Close Reading) didn't actually have a syallbus, but I guess since we were doing poetry, reading ahead didn't matter as much. The class was also super discussion-based.
As long as you do the readings, participate, and start the essays well in advance, you're golden! She is so sweet , kind, and funny and I will definitely miss her class.
Very funny and magnetic professor. She really cares about the content she teaches. You can tell she loves poetry by how careful she chooses her words. Grades fairly.

I really liked Professor Quinney's class. Not only is she the sweetest person, but she's an incredible teacher. As your taking the class intending to work and learn you'll really enjoy it. The readings were difficult, but class discussions/lectures made it much easier to understand. I also really enjoyed how discussion-heavy classes were.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor Quinney is the best professor I've had in four years. Her lectures are engaging and her own passion really inspires your own. She actually changed my life by making poetry genuinely accessible and interesting, and not something that's confusing or too rigorous to be enjoyable. I couldn't recommend her more.

Overall Quinney is not someone I can honestly recommend taking. Her lectures are long, heavy, and boring. A lot of the time during my class people would sneak off to the bathroom and just sit there until class was over. She is fundamentally very nice person but her poetry class is just not worth taking.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very hard class

Prof. Quinney is the best professor I've ever had.  She is brilliant, compassionate, and deeply committed.  The classes are thought-provoking and enjoyable, and the papers push deep consideration of the material.  She is also always happy to continue discussion outside of class and support students in their ideas/projects/goals.  LOVE her!

Professor Quinney is the best teacher I have ever had. She provides knowledgeable and thoughtful analysis of the text, and her enthusiasm and passion are infectious. She's encouraging, yet challenges you to deeply analyze what you're reading. If I could take every class of hers, I would. You'll gain so much from taking one of her courses, please do

Professor Quinney speaks so well and is simply brilliant. She's funny and makes sure her students are engaged in her lectures. She has fun and knows her material. She is a lovable and quirky woman, and a highly recommended professor.

While I do think that she could come down harder on irrelevant comments in class, she's so passionate about the subject and so respectful of students and their genuinely good ideas, I wholeheartedly recommend any class she teaches.  She's the best!

Quinney was amazing! I took three classes from her and bought both her books.  She thinks really hard in class, and your expected to do the same. If I were a Romantic poet I would want her to teach my works.  She made Blake almost make sense.

-Prof. Quinney is a very agreeable person, but, for a member of the all-star English department at Brandeis, she truly lacks the required intelligence and drive. There are many younger and more motivated teachers who would kill for her position and would possibly fill it better.
Passionate professor who loves what she studies and takes care in trying to keep the class interested and focused on great poetry.

Laura Quinney is a jewel, a love, a wonder, a prize.  She is brilliant, passionate, and incredibly helpful. Re: what another student said about being too accepting. Take another look... you'll her rankling every time someone says something dumb, Q's just incredibly subtle about redirecting these comments. Everyone in my class loved her!
love her...she made me remember why poetry is so important in this world...

Passionately commited to what she was teaching and to giving us time and atention.  She made me realize why someone would spend their lives thinking about poetry.  She seemed to know most of it by heart, and made me see why she would.  Take any Quinney class.

Very engaged, but she tends to be a little too accepting of student participation - bizarre interpretations are let slide without comment. Didn't seem too interested in the class outside of a commitment to teaching. Paper assignment was rather vague.

Professor Quinney was wonderful: challenging, amusing, honest, and totally into what she was teaching. She also spent significant time helping people outside of class.  I wonder what's changed? (A student who had her in the mid-90's at Princeton)
She doesn't seem that interested in what she does.
No Comments
No Comments
Guy is a fantastic language teacher and an overall caring person. He is so flexible with whatever you need and offers a Zoom every day if you are sick. His classes are fun and I learned a lot.
Amazing professor! Cares about students and makes learning fun and accessible

I was in Guy's Hebrew 41 class this semester, and I loved it! While there is a good amount of homework, Guy is very understanding and is also accessible outside of class more often than not! One of my favorite ever professors.
Helped me a lot when my depression got bad. I would've failed without his above-and-beyond kindness and understanding.

Guy is one of the most amazing and caring professors I have ever had. He is very accommodating and will do anything to aid the success of his students. Very funny and engaging. His class is a joy to attend every day.

Guy Antebi's classes are easy As, and so long as you complete the assignments and show up to class, you'll do well. Much of the class was spent watching videos (in Hebrew) with a little discussion of them, or reading aloud from a Hebrew play, also with very little discussion. Though Guy is very nice, I learned little in this course.

Guy is an incredible professor. His class is not super difficult and you will definitely learn more Hebrew. Attendance is not mandatory but he appreciates students showing up to class. Highly recommend any class this man teaches!
Show up most the time and participate. he is great you will get an A
Had guy as my teacher as a complete Hebrew novice and now Im fluent a phenomenal teacher. Wish I could take his class again.

Guy is an AMAZING teacher! His class is great you will have fun in his class. He does give extra credit and does not teach directly from the text book so his classes are interesting and exciting. Would highly recommend this professor.

Oh, Guy. I just love this guy. I had him for 10 and 34 and I would never take another professor for Hebrew if I didn't have to. He really cares about his students and wants us to do well. He's really understanding with deadlines and gives you lots of chances to get a good grade. You simply cannot go wrong with Guy Antebi.
Great class. Really fun. I missed 25% of the classes and still got an A, but I did do all of my work (and very well).
Guy Antebi is probably one of the best teachers I have ever had. He makes learning a language fun and enjoyable.
Really nice professor, class was not challenging but fun.
GREAT CLASS

I had Guy for HBRW 10 as well, but this time around he was a much harder grader and spoke much more quickly.  Many students in the class had no previous Hebrew training except at Brandeis, and felt lost. Overall, though, he was understanding and nice, but still a little strict.
Guy is very enthusiastic, especially for a 9AM class 5 days a week.  He kept us awake!
Guy is awesome! it's so enthusiastic about hebrew and he makes the subject fun and easy to learn. He's also really really attractive...:-)
Guy is awesome. He really cares about his students, so he always tries to accomodate us. Really effective teacher.
Guy is the most amazing professor.  He totally cares about his students, and he is so much fun.  I learned so much in his class.  And he's really cute, too!  Definitely take his class!!

Guy is the KING of intro Hebrew. He really knows how to teach a language. He prepares for class a lot everyday, and because of that, class is fun and very effective. Do your part and you will learn alot.
I love Guy!!  He's so funny and animated.  I hated Hebrew all throughout middle school but LOVED guy's fun approach to the subject.  Take his class!!
A very nice and approachable guy.  He really cares about his students and is passionate about his subject.
Really enjoyed this class, epic conversations and really clear grading measures
Great class

She was clearly uninterested in teaching this class. We repeatedly heard her complain about the lack of a TA for the course, adding to the fact that she did not want to be there. The syllabus was not at all accurate to how the course was carried out. Instructions for the assignments were vague and she got frustrated when asked to clarify things.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Awesome prof! cares about her students, and creates activities to do with learned information
Really awesome prof and class, and we got to handle and analyze real artifacts from her site and produce our own research. Seriously good class!
great professor!!!!

I really enjoyed how the prof integrated social justice themes with the archeological record as I think this is extremely important for understanding the colonial history of archeology. She was also really nice, passionate and honestly charming. Really nice accent too, could listen to her talk alllllll day!

Prof Goudge is seriously cool. Great organization and passion for the subject. The writing guides and syllabus made assignment expectations clear and easy to follow and she really listened to us when we said the work load was too much and scaled it back to make it doable. Really interesting topic, great lectures and engaging activities, even online

The class was new this year and you could tell. The concept is fricking epic; learning hands on maritime archaeology and project management using mini shipwreck sites. A sharp learning curve, and Prof was online which wasnt ideal but she did her best. Class is tough/needs adjustment but definitely worth the effort! Give us more classes like this!

Professor Goudge is a nice person and ended up being quite lenient with grading in the end. But, the grading system and expectations were confusing. She either sometimes gave good feedback or none at all. Theres a lot of weekly readings too. The topic was alright.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: Super boring class. Tons of weekly reading. Very unclear expectations on grading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I was really disappointed with this class and the professor. A LOT of reading assigned, confusing syllabus & strict formatting required & a lot of tedious graded assignments. The topic was dry & the professor checked out halfway. The only plus was the extra credits given at the end.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Really cool class, got into real detail about food throughout human history from an archeological perspective. Good lectures, fun class activities (even online) and her feedback on the assignments really helped improve my writing. Goudge was fun (she is the queen of bad (but hilarious) jokes) and kind, giving extensions and help. Great teacher.

I found this class hard but rewarding. Finished today though and she was epic all the way through. Reading was a bit heavy but to her credit after that was mentioned she reduced it a bit. She was also great about giving extensions and gave up loads of time to meet with us for individual help. Great sense of humour, great accent, great class

Honestly, Goudge was great. Gave really good feedback on my assignments and was really positive when I asked to meet for help. In the middle of a pandemic she stayed friendly and easygoing, always gave extensions, and made being online as fun as possible. She took the time to chat stuff through and offered to help me with future plans. Real gem.

Cool class, loads of interesting stuff. Mellow about giving extensions and gave great feedback. Make sure you meet with her, she is good at working out how to frame stuff. If you read the syllabus it's all pretty clear. It was a little heavy on the reading but when I mentioned it to her she canceled some of them and gave us easy weeks/weeks off.

Prof Goudge was really cool, a great teacher, and really interesting classes that mixed up lectures and mini-research projects. While it was pretty hard work, I really found that I have improved as a writer because of it. It was writing intensive but her comments were really useful and covered all angles.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: While professor Goudge is nice as a human being, her grading is strict, harsh, and somewhat unclear. She doesn't give feedback on most assignments, leaving you unsure whether you're doing well or not. The class is extremely reading and writing heavy. Now, this is a writing intensive so I understand being writing heavy, but I'm talking 60+ pages/wk
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: By far one of the most life changing classes I have taken at Brandeis. Prof Goudge works archaeology in with social justice & creates a deep understanding of historic structures of injustice. & suddenly you realise that she is showing how our modern culture was formed in, & still carries, that injustice. Inspirational, heartfelt lecturing & prof.

Prof Goudge was excellent. Lectures with passion on power structures and inequality to explain modern structural discrimination. Linked cool archeology, demonstrations, and conversation/critical thinking which made it really human. Created an atmosphere allowing us to explore different theories & made analysis accessible. Love her teaching style

Really enjoyed the class, she clearly really thought about how to make it rewarding and effective, even online. Feedback was intense but really helpful and caring, it got me to my first A of my UG. She is fun passionate and eccentric (in a good way), I want to take more of her classes and would def want her as a supervisor if I do grad school!

Brilliant lectures. Informative, broad but in depth and with a dry humor. Prof Goudge is smart, wellspoken, and understanding. She is approachable, kind and accessible outside class despite being in a different time zone. Her enthusiasm made for fun classes and discussions. Easily my favorite course this semester, really felt I learned a lot.

123b was awesome. Honestly really rewarding. One of, if not my favorite class at Brandeis, it was a mix of archaeology and social history and I understand more about inequality in America and why. Goudge was passionate in lectures, explained things well, gave great feedback (my writing has improved), and was really accommodating during a tough time

Brilliant, knows her field & is obviously really passionate and that carries over in the lectures. Readings are interesting and manageable. Engagement is key, be active in class, & go to office hours! She is also super understanding and approachable if you have any issues, which was very appreciated during Fall 2020.

Holberg is old and struggles a bit with tech. But he is very funny and clearly passionate about Shakespeare. His lectures are always engaging and get you to think about the material. There's little work outside of a "creative project". If you're looking for an easy but interesting class, take this one.
Very nice professor, you can enjoy movies and follow the lecture, I like it, I like movie analysis. The workload is easy, overall, worth taken!

Some of the lectures in this class were genuinely bizarre. I also had zero readings to do. Seriously. We were graded on participation (I think everyone got an A) and one single project. It was a very weird class. Take it if you need an easy class.

Professor Holmberg is kind of disorganized, but the class I took with him was very easy. My entire grade was based on a creative project and participation. The class was definitely kind of a break for me this semester.
Knowledgeable, witty, easy-going. He can really inspires u A LOT especially if u r passionate about Shakespeare or theatre arts/movies in general. One of THE BESTS professors at Brandeis!

Arthur Holmberg knows so much about theater and wants to share it with students. Don't be dissuaded from the class by the students who chose not to read or participate. You can get a lot of the class if you show up and do the work.

I have no doubt that Professor Holmberg is very knowledgeable. That being said, in short, he's an old man. He very easily loses his train of thought, rambles on, repeats himself verbatim multiple times during a single class, laughs at length at his own jokes. The class itself is easy, but at the cost of being slow-moving and boring.

Professor Holmberg is AMAZING! One of the greatest professors I have ever had. He's hilarious, and he knows more about the subject than literally anyone else. A very easy class but if you want to learn, you will.
TAKETHISCLASS. DONT DROP THIS CLASS. YOU WILL LOVE THIS CLASS
Professor Holmberg is brilliant. He knows a lot about everything, and he is also a very easy grader, which is important to know.

Biggest waste of my time. Yes, the man is a "genius"; he knows his stuff. But he talks like he's telling a story to kindergarteners whilst tangentially talking about BDSM and fallices instead of challenging his students to do in-depth text analysis which THA 100a and 100b are supposed to accomplish. I hate this required course is alwaystaught byhim

Too much of a drama king to be a sociology teacher. Thinks EVERYTHING is about sex. Very simplistic analytical reader. Additionally, misunderstands and distorts students' intelligent comments so that they seem stupid. Well meaning, but if you are not into theatre all the time, butt out.
one of the smartest men I have ever met
Truly brilliant!
Hilarious! The final would have been hard but he doesn't grade too hard.

He's hilarious.  A choice quote: "I was on the train this morning and I saw a woman wearing a t-shirt that said 'men lie.'  I walked up to her and said, 'well, women lie, too!  Just read *The Oresteia!*"  Brilliant and obviously loves theater, very helpful to his students.

Subtext?!? Difficult at first, but only because he wants the best out of you. Humerous and fun and definitely supports theatre in all of its strange manifestations. Yay for coming to the first Latex Show!
he was the best and most important teacher i ever had in my years at brandeis.  a true intellectual who is passionate about his subject.  always treats students with respect.
I LOVE ARTHUR!!! He is one of the most knowledgable, humorous and accomodating professors at Brandeis. Take any and every Holmberg class that you can!
wonderful kind professor - opened me up to the world of theater - loves david mamet :)
This man is a genius and really cares about his students.
Nice Guy...
No Comments
Great professor who truly care for the success of her students

I was shocked of seeing a 2.5/5 from her...I took Econ83 in 2021 spring with her and I think she is truly amazing. She is the person that makes sure you know the class material, and the exams are fairly based on the homework and practices. If you pay attention to the lecture and do the homework carefully, you'll get good grade.

Her grade depends on her mood instead of rubrics or standards, and she really does not know how to teach. She seems to randomly choose the email that she wants to reply to, no matter how many times you send them.

Her exams are very hard. She was hesitant to post review problems before exams. Several students had to ask her multiple times to do so. And she doesn't post solutions to the review problems, which makes it impossible to study for this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I got scared when I saw her rate is only 2.5 with the description of rough grader, nightmare, etc. But when I took her Econ83 class this semester, I think she's caring and pretty clear on the material, examples in the class are really helpful as well. You have to go to class tho, even if its 8am. Exams are pretty similar to her examples in the clas
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Econ80 should be a easy class. But professor Bui makes it more difficult than it should be. She is not really helpful. She gives us practice questions without answers. And her quizzes are difficult. The quiz is 30 points, but the average is 12.5. Anyway, I do not recommend her classes.
Prof Bui's tests are simply nightmares. The hardest class I have ever taken at Brandeis.

Professor Bui is incredibly knowledgeable and is very good at teaching. That being said, her class is the most difficult course that I have taken at so far so be prepared for sleepless nights followed by (generally) 8am classes. If you want to really understand economics (and you are not that worried about your grade) take a class with her.
Poor teacher
her exams are a lot harder than HW and does not explain the materials  clearly  in class. hardest class i have ever took.

Comments on here give the wrong impression of her. I found her to be very helpful, and her tests fair. You just have to put in the effort in her class, and if you do she goes out of her way to help you.

A quite helpful professor in my opinion, and most certainly one for helping out folks who have a hard time understanding.  I had her for econometrics and I ended up liking the class despite its complexity.

Heard she was hard but fair so i took her for econometrics. She was so hard and had no interest in the subject. The tests were significantly harder than the problem sets and her reviews were unhelpful. Extremely hard grader

Stats with Bui is a little bit like having a perpetual nightmare where you get eaten evil dust bunnies. She drones on for the whole class without providing examples and explanations. The notes themselves are impenetrable. She doesn't explain how the formulas themselves are derived and why they work. The class simply formulaic regurgitation butnotEZ

Professor Bui is the the hottest professor ever!  While this Stats class may be rushed, (because there is so much to go through) her exams are basically the same format as the problem sets (study from those) and she's always there for more help during her office hours.  Just make an effort to see her outside of class.  You'll be glad you did :)

Bui is seemingly an intelligent individual who knows economics very well-her MIT PhD is a testament to that fact. However, she is not able to convey the material effectively to the class. She makes things more difficult than they should be, and does a poor job explaining material that can be difficult to understand even when taught by the best.

The math wasn't the issue, it was that she makes simple things complicated, was bitter about everything, and got frustrated when people asked questions (when she was making no sense).  I would leave class confused and after my tutor would re-explain everything it made total sense.  She is a horrible teacher and embarrasment to the school.
No Comments

I don't know what these other guys are talking about.  Bui goes quickly but the only reason people struggle in her class is because they do not have basic math knowledge.  One kid even complained that she made us do fractions!! Those people should not be writing negative reviews of a very good instructor who has extra time for hard working students
don't know how she could be allowed to teach for more than one semester?

the only reason you should take this class is if everyone else on the earth is dead and you have nothing else to do.  she is a miserable teacher who loves to make everything the students' fault.  She should not be employed, and it is disgusting that such high tuition would produce someone like this in the front of a classroom.

worst teacher ever.  worst class ever.  she screwed everyone with everything, was very confusing in class, and would have failed everyone if she could have.  she is a bitter woman who should not be employed by any university.  see her reviews at BU as well which are all the same.  don't take this class with her unless you have to.
Total waste of time. She makes stats more complicated than it already is. The average in class is 60 which shows you how bad she teaches. definately wait to take stats until she leaves

Amazing readings, have read some of my favorite books for this class. The discussions can be a bit dry, and at times she guides discussions in a boring way. Reading can get overwhelming, usually 100+ pages to read per class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Irr is just an OK professor from my experience. She offers very insightful feedback and connects the content of our course to many outside mediums. Though, I often felt that her lectures were only mildly interesting and the overall energy she brought to the material middling.

Prof Irr is clearly interested in this topic (environmental aesthetics) and can go off on tangents, which gives students a bit of a break. There weren't many assignments for this class (2 video essays and an in-class presentation), and you can get away without doing every reading. She also offered extra credit in the form of enviro-themed outings!

We had to watch 3 movies a week which was too many for me to reliably watch alongside three other classes of work. It improved throughout the semester, but the essays were graded on a strict rubric, but we were only given broad guidelines. I messed up the first essay and had to do extra credit because she was too vague originally.

Lovely lady, and the content and her grading is way more lax than some of the STEM classes I've taken. Only problem with the class is that grading rubric is not as definitive and detailed as I'd like. I got best grades on writing prompts when I rephrased a lot of what was talked about during class and added a few of my own twists to it.

She wrote only a few line to explains her assignments then for the actual grading all of those unrequited checkpoint pops out out of no where. What the hell. Be more clear for the grading criteria ok?
The lecture and discussion session in this class is drier than my grandmothers ashes
I really enjoyed this class. As long as you pay attention and get the reading done it's not that bad at all. I found her to be a fair grader, and she gave me an extension easily on one of the papers.

When I saw the Disney class show up in the course catalog, I thought it would be horribly easy and I would hate going. I loved her class. She made the material more analytical and showed us other sides to the films. The only problems with the class were the size and the video viewer system. It's a big class, but worth your time and effort.

She's very sweet, and really cares about what she's teaching. Her lectures can get a bit dull at times, but she also has these wonderfully silly/dorky moments that are fantastic. Great about extensions - gave me 5 extra days on two different papers. I didn't find her to be a very tough grader. Does take attendance, so be sure to go to class.

I think Professor Irr is a well-prepared, intelligent professor. As long as you put effort and show interest, you will do well. She does make you work for your grades, but I consider that to be a good professor. We are here to learn, aren't we?? I think her shyness (when not lecturing) is what is being misinterpreted as aloofness.

Man, you guys are whiners.  I really like Prof. Irr, I thought while she was a tough, challenging professor, she was also really good.  I enjoyed more than half of the readings in the 3 classes I took with her.  She can also be funny - but you do need to do the reading in her class - she will be sad if she thinks the class isn't reading.

i loved this class and thought it was great that she assigned only 2 papers and we could choose which books to write on. this allowed me to just read the books that interested me and write about them. i'm not an english major but i loved this class.

I didn't like her style of teaching or most of the readings. It felt like a high school English class with tepid discussion about a period that could have really been interesting. The TA was annoying as hell. She's sweet but I didn't like her as a professor at all.

I liked some of the books in this class, but most of them were pretty worthless and boring. Her lectures are incomprehensible. I love English, but I have no idea what she's talking about. She barely explains or talks about the books at all! I would definently stay far, far away...
Irr is completely self-interested and condescending towards her students.  There are so many good teachers in the English dept. at Brandeis, don't waste your time taking Irr.

I happen to love the class and the readings. This is one of the few classes that I actually want to do all the readings for and there isn't too much work. Sure, you have to keep up with the readings and have the occasional close readings, but if you can't write 250 words every few weeks what are you doing here?
Self-indulgent lectures, harsh grades, poor reading selection. There are much better profs in the English dept, stay away from Irr.
She looks like Stephen King!  How can she be hot????
horrible professor, never explained anything, grades were very harsh, never explained corrections well, way too much work, readings were very dull
I agree that sometimes the lectures were too much, but staring at Prof. Irr's fabulous outfits and attractive face made up for it. Also some of the reading selections were poor choices.
The lectures are sometimes too theoretical and drone on. The workload is also relatively heavy, but she grades fairly and is very personable. She's also extremely attractive.

Prof. Murray is the best professor I have ever had in a science class. She is a phenomenal educator and cares a lot about her students. If you do the work and make a little effort to meet with her outside of class, you can develop a strong relationship with her and excel in chemistry.

Orgo is a difficult course and Murray gives you a lot of grade padding to succeed. I had a medical emergency just before the final which pushed me under, but Murray's tests are fair and the lectures are very well done and easy to follow. The course work builds on itself.

This is a test-heavy course, and all of them are very hard. However, Professor Murray's lectures were clear and easy to understand. She offered 4 office hours per week, so you have a lot of chances to ask her questions. She is a little tough in terms of grading, but overall everything makes sense and is VERY clear.

rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Murray manages to organize organic chemistry in a comprehensive way. The course material is (obviously) tough, but she is very pleasant and presents the material in a streamlined easy-to-digest fashion. For the first time in a chem course, I didn't have to rely on the textbook in order to understand the material, which is an outstanding feat.

Prof. Murray gives great lecture and has super clear criteria (if you will read her 40-page document on instruction of homework). Really like her, very approachable outside of class, and replies to emails fast.
I

One of the clearest, nicest, and most professional lecturers I've ever had. The expectations from day 1 were very clear. I feel as though I came out of Chem 25 and Chem 29 with a lot of useful tools and information.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Worksheets are helpful at times to study for exam material. Self-studying is the only thing that got me through 25A though, and lecture isnt quite helpful in terms of "learning material", do lots of practice problems on your own
Coursework with in-class echo-360s were quite helpful, did not quite pace with lectures, but found it a bit disorganized

The worksheets given were fairly simple, however, this was nowhere near reflective of the exam material. I often found myself self-studying, and this cost me more time that it should've... Syllabus grade breakdown mostly consisted of the exam materials. She responds to emails fairly quickly, that I found quite helpful, far too stress inducing.

She is not the most enthusiastic person but she is reasonable and straightforward. Her practice exams are very similar to the real ones. Considering the difficulty of orgo, her lectures and notes are easy to follow. Several times I have emailed her for her to check my synthesis or mechanism and she has always replied quickly with helpful feedback.

Honestly, she isn't that bad and the tests aren't extremely hard. The exams take up to 45-50% of your grade so be sure not to make stupid mistakes on them like I did. I feel like you can at least get the hang of how her questions will be and it's never anything too confusing as long as you take notes and do the worksheets. Overall, not horrible.
seems angry all the time

All the answers to the prelabs/postlabs were explained in lectures. The reports were time-consuming, but all the resources to do good on them were given. The class matched very well with orgo showing that there was communication between professors. The exams were fair, the only complaint I have is that they were too long for the time given.

Orgo is difficult and so Dr. Murray's class was too. I took the course online during covid. A lot of material made the classwork difficult but manageable online. Assignments were difficult and required some extra research.

Orgo in general is a tough subject, so I guess it makes sense that the lab is also challenging. The lab reports take up a LOT of time, and your grade pretty heavily depends on which TA you end up with. I haven't interacted a lot with Prof Murray, but she seems friendly enough. Orgo is just a struggle in general

-has no compassion or understanding for her students. makes no exceptions. -First time I encounter a college prof like her; seems as though she dislikes her job. Is not passionate. Most college prof love teaching but it feels as if we annoy if we have Qs - She does not care to alleviate the stress that we students face, she only adds to it '

I got a good grade but she really tries to teach all students as if they're going to become organic chemists/wants to pursue a path in chem. Gotta realize at least 2/3s of the people are listening into organic chem as a prehealth prerequisite. Didn't really help me prepare for the DAT, as her questions weren't related to at all.

Ok choice, orgo2 is just really hard. Murray likes to test on application-based questions, so you really really need to practice a lot to do well on her exams. Probably one of the most challenging class I'd ever taken, but as long as you do well on other assignments to buffer exams you'll be in good shape
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very very generous grader, but most of your understanding/ learning will have to be done on your own time, partially because organic chemistry is a hard subject. Her lectures are a good introduction to the material, but you're expected to go a step further for exams, but you better learn what her expectations are as the class proceeds.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Murray is fine. Her lecture notes for the reaction mechanisms are very organized. She is nice and generous about grades and deadlines. She replies to emails promptly. There is a bit of a gap of difficulty between her homework/tests and her lecture materials. But once you fully understand her lecture and do additional problems, you should do okay.

Murray is hard for no reason. I hate her explanation-based tests, because there are certain things you HAVE to include (strictly by a rubric) and if you don't have it, you get points taken off. Bad professor that thinks she's the best so she just tries to be harsh to students. Appears to be nice though.

Doesn't know how to teach! To make it worse, she defends all her odd teaching methods the second students bring up concerns. Stares an an iPad all lecture and has the messiest writing ever! Which is not great when you're trying to learn mechanisms. No grade scale, so I fought for a decent grade with scores that would usually guarantee an A for me.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Sabine is one of my favorite professors ever, she is super passionate about the classes she teaches and super inspirational. She is always available outside of class and responds to emails quickly. Her classes are a decent amount of work, but she is also very understanding and accommodating. I HIGHLY recommend taking an ENVS or WGS class with her!!

She's amazing and super sweet, super helpful, encourages you to contact her if you need help, is very kind. She gets so excited that she bounces sometimes, she's super passionate.Very strict about deadlines, but not unreasonable. Participation will definitely help your grade. This class was honestly one of my favorite classes I've ever taken.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: By far one of my favorite classes at Brandeis. I am an Environmental Studies major and this class really taught me practical things. In order to succeed, you need to participate at least 1-2 times per class (25%). There are a lot of small assignments and papers but you can revise and resubmit. Highly recommend. I learned a lot & Sabine is amazing!

Our class met 4 days a week, and most class had something due like an Aufsatz or some work in the Übungsbuch. Hearing her stories were always very interesting. Its not difficult to get an A as long as you take the time to study for the six quizzes and 2 tests, spend time grammar checking the 3 essays, and going to her office hours once in a while.

Sabine was one of my favorite profs! She is so excited about the material that she jumps up and down. If you love fairytales, this is the class for you. Homework consists of reading short-stories and critics, and watching movies. 3 papers very toughly graded, however theres always a revision option. If you do the work, you can get an A.

She's the worst professor I've ever encountered though my years at Brandeis. Not only she is a hard reader, but an unfair one also. She is resentful and holds grudges for anything you do and anything you don't.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is ok at teaching, However very hard grader and she is very bias. If you are in her good side you are guaranteed  a good grande. If in the 2 first classes she does not like you, "drop the class!!" probably you will get a bad grade (B os less) and you will work hard.

A very normal person but she caters to the top five kids and leaves it up to the rest to decipher her seemingly incomprehensible textbook. She remains vague as to what she is going to test you on for both quizzes and exams. Overall, I do NOT recommend this professor and regret ever having taken it.

She was a horrible grader and did not explain her grades. She was mean and had grudges against student. Also she had her favorite students who she would always give A's to. She was overall a horrrible professor. This class was awful! She is very strict, gives too much work, and grades unnecessarily hard for a USEM. She is very intimidating.

I took her fairytales class and it was great! She assigns such interesting books to read and I really enjoyed them all. She actively encourages people to participate in class and have a real discussion about the material, not just her talking all the time. She's also really funny and gives helpful feedback on papers.
she is really bad. a lot of effort in the class for a bad great.
She is not a bad teacher, however is very difficult. I don't recommend to take it. Be prepare for studying. And she dose not help .

She know how to teach, however go very fast and don't care if you understand. I am not telling you to do not take the class. But be prepare to work a lot because there a lot of work load. Most of the people get from C- to B.

She is not very nice. You have to put to much effort to pass the class, work a lot. However sabine don't care if you fail the class. If you think you are usually friend of the professor take it. If you don't go so much and talk to them, no recommended.
She is a good teacher, know how to teach, but is very difficult. And if she doesn't like you woww.
Quite simply the best professor I've ever had. CGES FOR LIFE, YO!

Fair grader; had 10a and 30a with her. Great personality, makes sure to get to know students. Classes are difficult if you don't pick up your expected share of work and speaking time. If you keep up, do your work and ask her for help, she will respond, and you will be rewarded! Thanks to her I am fluent in German now after only two years.

Pretty good teacher, awful person.  I have never encountered someone who is more excessively unreasonable.  I'm in a class of 10 people, and she knows me less than the professors in my huge lecture classes do.  She doesn't care about students other than their interest in German.  She's unclear in her assignments and she never responds to e-mail.

Super nice, quite helpful, always willing to explain and spend extra time with students. She really cares about the students and makes the class a fun learning environment. Very enthusiastic professor. The only downside was the low quality of the textbook (Deutsch Heute).

She's of awesome help and awesome fun as well. I loved the way she managed to keep our class alive.. and her sudden bursts of German words to keep us quite was terribly funny ! She was always ready to receive late homeworks and always ready to help even beyond her office hours !

She has interesting lectures, assigns interesting books, though if you're looking for theoretical physics/philosophy take Berger's Phil of time and Space. She focuses more on emotional aspect of time. She is very nice and understanding, she trully cares.
She's lots of fun

hes a chill dude and so I really don't want to say the things I'm about to

but he explains miserably. Hes passionate about chmeistry but to much and theres so much stuff thrown at us.

He isn't clear about the tests. He isnt clear about the questions. His explanations are not clear. His practice tests are NOT like the actual tests

Take the other ratings with a grain of salt. Many freshmen take this for the first time, and that's why it's so low. I would say he is about average for Brandeis professors: He is super kind and wants you to succeed, but his lectures are hard to understand and unclear. Go to office hours, study hard, and you will succeed. Very time-consuming class.

Completely illegible handwriting on a chalkboard, so good luck if you enjoy taking notes. He will ramble on about scientific concepts that have no place in an honors chemistry course and then throw it on your tests. It's too bad that he seems to be a nice guy outside of the course; things are just insufferable when you're his actual student.
He teaches quantum mechanics, but this is a chemistry honors class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I spent the entirety of the time I took this class on SDN while I was between med school interviews... easy to do well in, not quite sure the point of it. Very easy to make up for said interviews.

Most people really do not go. The class is not hard to do well in, because he does not really give grades less than a B, but he is disorganized. Students present half of every class (which are not on exams), and then he introduces a concept in the rest of class, but not in any detail. So you have no idea what are on exams.

The WORST professor ever. Lectures are disorganized and don't connect to each other at all. Exams don't cover anything presented in lecture. Final grade depended only on two presentations that were graded based on INTEREST??? That is straight up subjective, especially when the first topic was assigned and the second topic was randomly chosen.

In office hours he said, "If you don't understand it, bang your head against the wall until you do." He also said, "reading the textbook is completely useless." Most people didn't bother to come to class because the lectures were boring and those who did fell asleep. The tests and quizzes also have material that wasn't taught. Boring and useless.
Dr. Pochapsky was tough grader on tests, to hard,  he needs to make it easier for students, thankyou.

Really nice guy. Really knows his chemistry. Has a hard time staying organized, though, and is NOT very clear about instructions or expectations for lab reports, even when you ask him direct questions. If you're not worried about a grade, he's great!

Cares about chemistry and explains things well but occasionally gets off topic. Reminds me of my grandpa trying to teach me. Suggest sitting closer to the front because his handwriting can get small/sloppy
HOT!!
Very disorganized. Drove me to basically stop going to class and just teach myself from my textbook

Thomas just went from trying to explain metalloids, to confusing both himself and half the class with a tangential discussion on supernovas. ugh. It's like someone is reading out loud a shredded up textbook.  Very disorganized and boring, yet the content discussed is usually important to the course.

This man is about the worst teacher of all time. He wants to make a few extra bucks, so he decided to add to his research (alone mumbling incoherently to himself), a bit of teaching (mumbling straight at the chalk board, with 200 students behind his back). If this was 300 years ago, I would get his whole class to tar and feather him.
lol such a terrible teacher and curve is unfairly small, disorganized, ridiculous
i disagree, i thought he was pretty good.  i enjoyed him much better in o-chem than gen chem - there's only so much you can do to make gen chem interesting.
Does not help his students, only confuses everyone.   Tests are chalenging, and you have to study hard.  He is a researcher, not a teacher.
Least helpful prof. Also can't explain anything.

SUCKS... he is very disorganized and cannot usually answer questions in textbook. His quizzes and tests are difficult and nitpicky and focus on obscure aspects of the course. Lectures are not very worthwhile and he usually confuses himself. Good luck!
A smart and engaging man in person, but his lectures can be dry at times.  I think that's probably because he's teaching chemistry.  He covered a lot and graded his tests fairly.

Professor Anjaria is definitely one of my favorite anthropology professors! I had him in a fairly small class which was partially lectures with a LOT of discussion mixed in, he really valued everything every student said! He's also super practical and talks a lot about how to use what we're learning for possible jobs and how to find internships

The class is overall good. It's mainly lectures but there are 3 section meetings held by TAs. Expect lots of readings and memorize them because you'll need them for midterm and final. Takes attendance.

Anjaria is great! He really cared about the students in this class and it was really hands-on as opposed to lecture heavy. The projects were super interesting and all of the skills learned were largely applicable in future careers. He really stressed that yes, anthropology majors can find jobs. Lots of fun! Kind grader and always ready to help.

Tried to bring room for discussion in a 100 person intro class. A bit awkward but easily accessible outside of class. Truly cares about his students and tries to make everyone feel heard. Class content was interesting but felt arbitrarily designed. 5 books (parts) & readings for each class, 3 papers, written midterm & written final.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I think that this class is very easy to pass. That being said, lectures are extremely dry. Professor Anjaria expects his students to participate, but will oftentimes interrupt them and not let them complete their thoughts. This can be extremely discouraging for students who are more hesitant to participate. His TAs are excellent though!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Anjaria is by far one of the best professors Ive had. He is truly understanding and wants to make the class as easy for all students. He is accommodating and listens to all kinds of student feedback. He assigns a lot of reading but most are very interesting. I would take all of his classes.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Enjoys what he does but there are a lot of readings. You can probably get by from just skimming. The assignments were really good though and I feel like I learned a lot and gained a new perspective of the world.

I took this class remotely and it was entirely taught through podcasts. Pros: basically asynchronous, all the lectures are recorded and able to be revisited for exam prep. Cons: Can't ask questions (he does have office hours), the podcasts (usually over an hour long) often weren't posted until about 16 hours before the associated content was due.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Hes very sweet and enjoys what he teaches but the class I took was very easy. If youre into the subject matter it can be fun, but otherwise it can be hard to engage fully. Its easy to get by without actually doing the work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He's obviously very excited about his field/lectures and the assigned readings are very interesting. There's a lot of quizzes and papers, though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: As a science student who took this class for a general education requirement, I was very engaged. I highly recommend this course, even if you are not going into anthropology because you gain amazing insight into the world which is important in any job. If you work hard it is easy to do well. Very clear expectations, you know what will be on exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's super nice! It's a reading heavy class, but he's a cool guy and tries to make the class as engaging as he can. Picks readings he thinks are cool and doesn't make you read a bunch of archaic anthro which is a definite bonus.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Had to read the majority of the dense book he wrote for a reading quiz, and complete a paper for three days after that, all of which was the week before finals (including his). The rest of the class is ok but I think he gradually forgets that people have other duties.
A really genuine and excited professor, passionate about the subject matter. Not the most thrilling lecturer.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: not so useful in general as a methodology class - some good readings - mostly bad readings -
This class was a bit like holding a really long conversation with a wall.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Class is beyond boring, readings can be very hard to get through and there are an annoying amount of reading quizzes.  Professor is a nice guy though who likes to engage with his students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Interesting, passionate, and engaging professor. The readings are fascinating and the homework load is very manageable. I absolutely recommend his classes to anyone interested in exploring Anthropology!
He's clearly a very smart guy and very sweet. The readings were super interesting and we had great discussions in class. i would recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: sooooooooo boring and has no clue what he's doing

Took his class this semester and loved it. He's a little dorky and breaks the computer and projector all the time, but he tries so hard you have to forgive him. The readings he chooses are really interesting and he's a real sweetheart.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Great modeling course. Enjoyed and learned so much!!

I really enjoyed Prof. Abdurezak's Mergers and Acquisitions class at Brandeis International Business this past fall semester.
Strongly recommend it!
Excellent company financial modeling class delivered by excellent professor!

Professor Abdurezak's deep knowledge and industry experience comes out in his lectures and class case discussions.  I really learned a lot and enjoyed this course very much!
I strongly recommend it to all!

I took Mergers and Acquisitions class with Prof. Abdurezak this past fall semester.  
I really enjoyed his lectures and case discussions.  This is an excellent course for students interested in Investment Banking and Wall Street job in general.
Excellent professor with a lot of practical experience! I strongly recommend his course!

Prof. Abdurezak's financial modeling courses at Brandeis International business School are extremely useful!
I strongly recommend them to all students in finance!

Excellent professor! I really enjoyed his Corporate Finance course this past fall semester.  He hes deep  knowledge of finance and practice! I strongly recommend prof. Abdurezak's courses at Brandeis!

Hamza is the BEST!
He is really a NICE Person! I promise you will enjoying time with him! Taking his courses,You can learn a lot other than finance stuff!

He is the GREATEST Professor at Brandeis!
LOVE Him!

You will have to spend at least $200 on textbooks and you have to - his homework is on those textbooks. Does not teach at all, you will have to teach yourself and in the next class after the homework is submitted, will he tell you how to solve it?

A lot of homework without teaching anything. You have to figure it out and then he will teach you the homework in the following class when you have already learned how to do it. Seems like I am paying tuition to teach myself! If I go wrong with my homework, he cuts my points too. How am I supposed to learn then?

Prof. Hamza comes to every class well prepared and delivers great lectures.  I like the way he uses the case studies to show students the applications of the complicated finance concepts.  I would like to take his other courses as well.
Great Professor! I took classes with professor Abdurezak and I really enjoyed his classes!

Enjoyed Prof. Abdurezak's modeling classes very much!
I strongly recommend to those who are looking for practical and yet intellectually rigorous class.

Professor Abdurezak's Corporate Finance course was demanding but I learned very useful and applied finance concepts that I can use in my job in the financial services industry.  I learned Corporate Finance is such a core course since it touches upon key concepts of investment and financing decision that global corporations make. 
Great professor!

Professor Abdurezak's Modeling courses are very useful for getting financial industry jobs!
I talked about my projects during my interviews and I was able to impress my interviewers!
Thank you professor Abdurezak, keep up inspiring students and teaching applied but such rigorous courses!

Great professor with a lot of experience both in the industry and academics!
I strongly recommend his corporate finance and modeling classes!
I also took corporate financial engineering with him and I really enjoyed the case discussions and analysis!

Prof. Abdurezak's  classes are very practical and prepares you very well for Wall Street investment banking or investment management or analyst positions.  His modeling group projects are very demanding but very useful.  
During my interviews I talked about the projects that I did in his modeling classes and got a job!
Great professor!
Extremely massive workload. The time that I spent in this course was equal to the total amount of time that I spent in my other three courses. The lectures were super long and boring.

Bad experience. Heavy homework, less materials covered in his class, but much more tough materials shown in HW. The HW contains numerous strange materials which will be taught in next class; but the ddl is before next class! Tough Grading. HW instruction is wordy and vague. This is a modeling class, but I feel like I am taking a reading class.

His lectures are not hard, but his assignments are extremely tough! I need to finish a whole modeling project in one week and there are lots of materials are not mentioned in class shown in the assignment. He thinks students as financial expert instead of a learner. This is my first time to do a course homework before actually learning anything.

Not the best class. Did not receive enough support. Too lecture-driven, and did not focus on engagement. Too many group projects (and lack of support if the projects are not proceeding well). The classes are hard, and the material is hard. So be prepared to self-study if you must take the class.
The ONLY way to take a class with Wodinsky is if there is a TA.

He doesn't use slides and his lectures are really dense and hard to follow.  Attendance doesn't seem necessary, and those that are in class often just check facebook or something.  However, he grades nicely and with a curve, the grading is just the exams, and if you meet with him or the TA you can basically get the answers.  Hope for a good TA.

prof wodinsky provides the questions before each exam and is willing to meet with students and go over the answers. when students take advantage of this, they will do well. i've gotten A's in both classes i've taken with him (motivation, comparative)

Nitpicky and old. Nearly impossible to answer study questions without his help, but he'll tell you the answers if you go meet with him before exams. Referenced text maybe twice. Lectures are boring and incoherent, but somehow necessary. But you get the hang of it before the final, and he curves really nicely.

While prof. Wodinsky is a little old and a little scattered, he is still obviously a brilliant man. Biological Basis of Motivation, while presenting some out of date information, was instrumental in teaching me how to THINK like a psychologist. He also is incredibly helpful - if you meet with him, it's almost impossible to do poorly on the exams.

Dr. Wodinsky is the best professor I have ever had, and the most influential upon my career. He taught me how to do research and how to gain excitement from it. And, he steered me into neurosciences. I owe this man my life.  Dr. Mark Jacquin, Professor, Neurology; Director, NIH Program Project, Box 8111, Washington University School of Medicine, St
Oh my god
Abstract area of study.  Could benefit from some visual presentations in class.  Otherwise good courses in Psych 14a and Psych21a

He tries to be helpful and is available outside class, but his lectures are so disorganized--and often directly contradict the textbook--that it is difficult to get a good grade.  I went to office hours with a study group and we still had difficulty with the exams.  He also has a hearing difficulty which makes it hard for him to answer questions.

This is a very hard but great class. People who think they should be handed a grade without working for it will complain endlessly about it, but if you want to work, want to learn, don't miss the department's most unappreciated teachers. He provides the essay questions that will be on the exam BEFORE the exam. If you do poorly, don't blame him.

dear god...i wanted to kill myself every time i had to go to his god awful lectures...he's a HORRENDOUS teacher...and yes, i believe he is incredibly senile (he imitates cats having sexual relations in class...while smiling...::shudder::)
SOOO BAD

He is so boring and disorganized.  I take really good notes so I managed to get an A in the class, but he is a crappy lecturer.  You have to go sort out your notes immediately after class so that it will make sense.  He might want to consider retirement.

He is baaad and boring. We studied for the first test and got D's even when we met with him to go over the answers. We copied everything he said from the study session with him and we still did bad. CAUTION: STAY AWAY!
he teaches learning but only knows one way to teach it...there's something seriously wrong with that.  he needs to retire.
really a nice man, but  deaf, senile, and an incredibly boring lecturer
No Comments
No Comments
Senile, be afraid.
In his own universe...needs to retire!
No Comments

Very rude and is openly trashes STEM students. Very unpleasant person to speak with and is cold and uncaring.   Only straight lectures and random ice breakers made the course pathetic. Had high hopes for the class and was VERY let down. Truly disappointed. Unless you you must take it highly dont recommend.
Grading is a bit rough but Prof Shostak is very sweet. I got lucky with an amazing TA and I truly think I got a lot out of this class.
A great professor as long as you care about the course materials. Just try to show that you are making an effort instead of complaining and you gon get an A.

Class is boring. Nothing new is taught by Shostak, all information comes from textbook. She is an extremely tough grader and does not give any feedback whatsoever. She is not understanding and very condescending even in a pandemic. Seems like she does not like her students and gaslights a lot. Don't take her classes unless you have to. Awful.
Very tough grader and lots of work.

ive taken soc181a & soc189a. shes most impatient person ive ever met. gets frustrated when students ask questions. accuses us of not doing the readings when we ask for clarification on (complex and difficult!) soc theories. spits back the readings verbatim in lecture. wouldn't grant me an extension when a family emergency arose. made me miserable

The lectures are clear and thoughtful. The quality of weekly discussion sections really depends on your TAs. The two papers are tough but not unapproachable. Professor Shostak gave clear criteria and instructions to guide students how to give a start.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Shostak is one of the best professors at Brandeis. Very few professors genuinely care about their students like does. Though she is a department head, she's never too busy for her students. Not to mention, she takes feedback about her courses very seriously. She is extremely fair and understanding. Do the work and expect a great experience!
This was a very disorganized and chaotic class. Shostak's didn't even lecture most of the time, and kept changing plans.
This is a great class, though you have to do a group project at the end.

Professor Shostak is great. She is brilliant and presents her ideas in a clear and caring manner. However the class at first appears really easy. Work load is minimal. Readings are really not needed to be done for class, ever. But then she all of a sudden grades very difficultly. Grade is dependent on very few assignments.
Fantastic professor and person! She is incredibly smart, well-spoken, and clear. Cares about her students a lot. Definitely reccomend a class with her!

Soc of Body and Health was very interesting. Class and discussion sections were great, but the readings were very long and papers were graded harshly. I would recommend this class highly if you are willing to put in the work.

She was very clear in class. She expected the readings to be done but as long as you could pull the concepts from the the abstracts and conclusions you should be fine. She has expectations for her assignments that hardly anyone can meet. Most people (including me) are surprised by their finals grades- not in a good way.
The papers were graded very hard & there was no curve. I would have appreciated more help. I attended class regularly and paid attention but still didn't do well.

The class material was semi- interesting, but she managed to make it dry. About 150 pages of reading a week that was expected to be completed.   A hard grader, but if you put work into it you'll get a somewhere around what you expected, usually less. Ambiguous with what she expects in papers assigned. I will not take another class with her again.
one of the best teachers i have ever had...she is amazing! i would tell everyone to take soc of body and health...
unapproachable but really smart
extremely enthusiastic. she wants to teach you things you're interested in and she wants you to do well.

I took both environmental health and society and soc of body and health. Professor Shostak is brilliant and exciting. her classes are fun and always interesting. she truly cares about each and every student (even in her larger class. I strongly recommend her!
No Comments
A REAL QUEEN! I am so sad she is leaving. She blessed this campus and losing her is a loss.
Dr. Mascall is by far the best professor here at Brandeis. She is a superwoman who makes organic chemistry so much more manageable. I loved every second of her class.
Is by far the best professor in the sciences. Her lectures are really easy to understand and flow well. She understands her students and is helpful in office hours. She'll really push you to do well.
Nice prof and easy A

Mascall is the best professor ever. As a freshman taking orgo, she gives me so many helps. Her lecture was extremely clear and organized, but the notes was very heavy. You will learn a lot as long as you spend time on this class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Mascall is by far one of the best professors at Brandeis! Thanks to her, organic chemistry has been my favorite class Ive taken, which really says something considering the rigor of the subject. She truly cares about her students and it shows.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Her lectures are extremely clear and concise and she makes a hard subject accessible. Professor Mascall cares about every student and goes out of her way to learn every person's name. She is also very accommodating and lets you make up lab days and exams when necessary.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Orgo was the best experience it could have been with Dr. Mascall! Hard material but she is organized and easy to follow. Do practice, take SSG seriously and go to office hours
An amazing teacher, lectures, notes and practice problems are amazing. Do all practice problems and practice tests and youll be fine. Helpful during office hours and has a lot of them.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Hands down the best teacher I have had at Brandeis so far.
Amazing professor and a great person overall. Beware, the class is difficult but she is  super helpful during office hours.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Mascall's lectures are very clear and organized, so attending class and taking good notes is highly recommended. The book is a nice supplement for conceptual items, but the problems aren't very useful. Do every single practice problem set and exam that Dr. Mascall posts. Go to office hours for anything that is unclear. Tests are difficult.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great teacher. Organic chemistry is hard so you can't get away with just listening in lectures. Fair grader, on tests and quizzes she has some easy questions and also some hard ones. Before any test/quiz she will post practice problems, do them.

Professor Mascall is an excellent professor, who improves by the day. She is very helpful during office hours and effectively prepares her students for her exams. Her tests are difficult and they are always curved. There is usually a large curve on her exams.

She is very helpful in office hours and won't hesitate to explain something over and over again for you. Her exams are very fair and contain the material that she goes over in lecture. Her lectures are very well organized and she goes through things step by step which was very helpful as some topics can be challenging.

With time, I think she will become a great professor. She could not answer most questions in Gen Chem, which isn't her area of expertise.  Her pacing is too slow when writing on the board, and she flies through powerpoints. She is funny and organized. Her tests were so easy conceptually that there's no curve, and silly mistakes count for a lot.

In a word, Mascall is fair. Her lectures are fair, her tests are fair, her expectations are fair. She makes the information presented as clear and straightforward as the material(in this case organic chemistry ) will allow. Go to class and take good notes.. Go to office hours if you need help but dont wait until its too late as the class moves fast
Professor Mascall was an amazing General Chemistry professor. She was clear cut, unafraid to admit she needed to get back to us, and an all around great professor to get to know.
Very organized and clear... Take good notes, study throughly, and you will thrive  Very pleasant demeanor
Good teacher. Clear lecturer and very organized. Sometimes goes too quick but thats a fact of life when it comes to orgo  Go to lecture and take good notes

Her exams are significantly harder than what she teaches in class. She flies through material in lectures, which makes everything very confusing. Easily my hardest class at Brandeis so far. Get ready to read the textbook all the time. Shes available at office hours, and actually quite helpful.

Prof. Trelles is awesome! I took Basic Stats with him. He explained concepts clearly, yet thoroughly, although his lectures were tedious and uninteresting at times. Great class to take if you want to learn STATA and/or if you plan to do any social science research or a senior thesis down the line! Very understanding and accessible outside of class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment:
Attendance is mandatory. If missed once, it will be reflected in the final grade. 
Course content not too difficult, a lot of reading though. 
The professor is busy with his PhD work, so he does not have much time to focus on students.

Prof. Trelles is a brilliant guy. I felt like he covered the course material in amazing depth, and was able to explain everything in-depth. I found his lectures challenging due to the fast pace, but as long as you can take good notes you'll be fine. I felt like I was getting the best instruction I could with Prof. Trelles

Overall, I liked Prof Trelles, a lot of the material he taught in class was irellevent to our grade because we used Stata and he is a bit boring, but he is very accessible outside of class and gives good feedback on projects so you can get a good grade if you make the time to meet with him!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: The Basic Statistics class I took with him was a bit dry (but I think that's pretty inherent to stats classes), but I liked how it was taught. There were no tests, just a few homework assignments and assignments related to your final paper. I thought there was a reasonable amount of work, and I also got a good understanding of Stata out of it!

Pretty good but not spectacular. Lectures could get kind of boring and the readings were not really necessary as the main grade in the class was based on a research paper. I feel like I didn't learn that much about Latin America outside of my research paper. Really nice though and gave a lot of help on the paper if you went to office hours.

Prof. Trelles is a good lecturer, sometimes it can get a little dry here and there but overall would take again. He's very passionate about the work he does, and does a great job developing your skills as a political science writer.
I liked the format of the assignments. Multivariate regression, chi-squared test I think the STATA workshop was the most useful as I could see the concepts materialized within them.

I learned so much from the Stata workshops, I thought that the course layout of learning what goes into statistics and how different methods are used and then applying it in the stata workshops and assignments was extremely effective.

Professor Trelles is fantastic at establishing a comfortable learning environment. His personal experiences with Latin America added another layer to the great class discussions. There is a ton of reading, but if you're interested in the subject matter then they are all super interesting. One of my favourite classes this semester.

This class offers a deep and comprehensive overview of the most pressing social issues in Latin America. If you are interested in the region, this class is a must, especially if you are interested in politics and institutions. Writing-intensive class, so this is demanding, but no exams!

I love elections and if you are interested in understanding how elections work around the world, this is the class for you. The syllabus seems challenging but Dr. Trelles makes the topics and discussions really accessible. I really enjoyed this class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: This is a fantastic Intro to statistics class. After taking this class with Dr. Trelles, I feel significantly more comfortable reading academic literature and interpreting statistical results. He is an awesome guy!

Dr. Trelles is a great professor. I took both his Latin American Politics and his US-LA relations seminar and loved them. He relates the readings and class material to current political events. I have traveled extensively in the region and these classes were a perfect complement for me! His research on elections and redistricting is amazing!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I loved this class! Professor Trelles is clearly an expert in Latin American politics and he knows the insides of Mexican political institutions. His course is well structured, so you get a general intro and then go deep into relevant cases in the region. He has worked with international organizations and he has a lot of connections. Very friendly.

Dr. Trelles has traveled a lot working on elections and knows the literature very well. I loved this class. It is structured as a writing class, so you better like to read and write. It has a really nice GIS workshop. The professor is very kind and accessible. I highly recommend this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot from Dr. Trelles. It helps students to understand statistics in the context of the social sciences. Friendly to students with no math/ stats background.

Dr. Trelles is an awesome and easygoing guy. His lectures are clearly structured and the Stata workshop is a nice addition to the course. Great class if you do not have a previous quantitative background.

This class is a great introduction to statistics. It will help you understand how to read and interpret statistical results, structure your own research, and feel comfortable understanding the logic behind the scientific method. It does not require previous statistical/mathematical knowledge. Lectures are great and Professor Trelles is awesome! 5/5

It was definitely a very lecture heavy class, and Trelles wasn't the best at explaining concepts. But he was really clear about what material would be on tests and what you needed to memorize, and he wasn't completely inaccessible. But Dr. Corral was definitely more helpful with answering STATA questions for assignments.

Posts lecture slides, and doesn't go over them in much detail in class (mostly just reads them - and they're repetitive). Reading the textbook isn't necessary, same for the supplemental readings. Only a midterm and final, and three short generously-graded assignments using State software. Material isn't difficult, but his teaching isn't effective.
BEST PROFESSOR AT BRANDEIS!!!
Take her class if you get a chance she is so cool
Best professor I have taken at Brandeis. She cares about the subject and is knowledgeable about it. She is Passionate and cares for her students. I want to take all her classes.
amazing amazing amazing, life changing professor, so cool , so sophisticated, knows everything about art, great taste in clothes, so elegant
She gives really interesting lectures. You need to study very hard to get a good grade in tests.
Too much work..... Doing well in test needs to pay attention to every word in the lecture.
Really hardworking individual! Very interesting subject!
Wonderful teacher. Very nice, though a bit scary when you don't get your work done! VERY clear, knows her sh*t! Love the class. I'd recommend it to anyone.
Her enthusiasm for art is contagious.
No Comments
awesome
Prof. Wong is awesome, and she really knows what she's talking about.  Super sweet...she's one hot little firecracker!
TAs don't grade fairly, but is the hottest teacher at Brandeis.  Good if you get bored with looking at the artwork...
If I see another piece of asian pottery I shall cry.  Also favors some cultures over others!!!
Without a doubt, my favorite professor! She is so talented, engaging and enthusastic, not to mention brilliant!
No Comments
She's personable, involved, really knows her stuff and likes it, too.
loved chinese art history.  wonderful class, by a prof who knows the material.
No Comments
No Comments
The best professor I have ever had. She really cares about her students and puts in so much effort.

AOKO is a fantastic professor. She lectures with passion and in a way students really comprehend the material. Her exams are fair and can get an A with some hard studying. She is not an easy A prof. She really cares about her students and wants them to achieve. Even if you don't know Latin, you can understand the material.

One of the best professors Brandeis has to offer. Kind, generous, understanding, and loving: she is the mixture of an academic and a great aunt. Cookies were a plus, and the class was superb. Great professor, but be prepared to meet her high grammatical standards.

Upsides: smart, knowledgeable, helpful, very kind. Downside: seems to have low expectations, as if she doesn't want to scare off skittish students; didn't feel challenged.          An easy course if you are remotely interested in the subject, or interested in fresh-baked cookies.
