I love AOKO! she is my favorite teacher, makes the classes fun & interesting, she loves what she teaches, & is always available to help outside of class, or just to talk to. Some people are saying her classes are easy, but thats if you don't do much of the readings, she's not going to force you to care,  you have to take an interest in it

I love Professor AOKO! She's an amazingly passionate teacher - and she speaks mostly from experience. There's a lot of information in her classes, but if you take notes and make an effort, you'll do well. If you don't do so well, don't be afraid to approach her - she'll help you improve.

She is really a great professor. I felt so out of my league in her class, but I met with her during office hours and she really helped get me on track. If she sees you working hard, she'll give you a good grade, whether you really deserve it or not.

AOKO's a great teacher - if you go to the lectures you'll learn all you need to know for the exams and what to read about in the books - she'll never ask you to know something she hasn't told you in class. Very approachable outside of class.

Dr. aoko is an amazing instructor.. her lectures are interesting to say the least. the amount of reading is quite exhaustive.. but the course in itself is a breeze..I enjoyed every minute of this course.. She is a fair and at times "soft grader... she is accessible both in and out class.. i plan on taking her for two other courses..

She is by far the best professor that I've had at Brandeis, and I definitely recommend her to anyone.  Yes, she does teach so that the beginning level students will not feel overwhelmed, but she offers opportunities to challenge yourself as well, if you choose to take them.  She really cares about her students and is passionate about the subject.

Professor AOKO is an amazing teacher! Her lectures are interesting, especially since she is passionate about the subjects she teaches. As long as you keep up with the readings, go to class, and hanf everything in you have yourself an easy A for the class. Plus, she is always available outside of class if you do need help!

Prof. AOKO is absolutely amazing. I have never met a professor who cared more about her students on so many levels. She is always willing to spend the time it takes for you to learn, gives much respect to student ideas, and is overall a very positive person. Definitely try to take a course with her.

Koloski-Ostrow is incredibly nice.. she gives cookies during class and she's a pretty easy grader. Her lectures can be interesting if you pay attentiona and have some interest in the subject matter. Very knowledgable... I never did the reading and have a great average. She's very passionate about classics.

An absolute sweetheart, she really cares about you and will go the extra mile for students. Tends to set the pace of the class at the level of the slower students, so it's not too hard to keep up. Show that you're putting in some effort and she'll be completely on your side.

This course was fairly easy. Most students did not do the readings and still received good grades. She did not force students to participate in class discussions or penalize those who didn't. The course consists of three papers and one mandatory rewrite. Whatever you do, don't disagree with her.
She is an excellent professor who clearly has command of her field of expertise.  She is giving of her time and truly cares about her students and legitamately wants her students to do well.
class at a lower level than my high school classes.  no depth to discussions.

Extremely wonderful, sweet, kind woman.  Had cookies for her class.  Was VERY knowledgeable in her field.  Very personable, made effort to know her students.  She is a hard-ass about grammar, but it's only constructive crit, at least.
Took her class a while back... she's the female version of Mr. Rogers.  Not very challenging.
excellent professor, knowleagable and passionate
Professor Cadge clearly cares a lot about her students, but it felt like she didn't really connect. Classes weren't that interesting, but the assignments weren't hard. Taken Fall 2018.
I didn't do any readings and I ended with a B. Probably a good idea to do the readings.

There was a lot of readings to do, but they were interesting. If you just never miss class and do most of the readings, you can get a good grade. Professor Cadge was always available for me. Great class to take if curious in sociology!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She's very organized with her work on latte page and is very clear with the pre work (homework) that is due. She does have a lot of readings but they're not long most of the time. A lot of latte posts due at midnight but it is a completion grade and they're not difficult. She is very clear on how to get a good grade on papers/assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Lots of reading (textbooks, Latte), but information was really interesting. Can be pretty funny and occasionally talks a bit about herself, which definitely adds personality to the lecture. No superiority complex, but still didn't seem like the easiest person to talk to, though she held her office hours in the SCC to make herself more accessible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The class is "flipped," so there's lots of reading, but I really enjoyed the books. She asks comprehension/analysis questions about the reading (graded for completion). I loved the topics we covered. Classes were really interesting and engaging, but it was sort of unclear what information she expected us to be accountable for.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Overall Cadges intro to sociology class this semester has been really great. She does assign a lot of work but most of it is based off of completion. Not only this but she is very real with her students and always makes the lectures personal and funny. Would definitely recommend taking a course with her.
Such a wonderful professor.

She's a delight.  She doesn't have the most sparkly of personalities, but she's witty, engaging and VERY bright.  Also very warm on an individual basis... Tries to give her students all the opportunities and advantages possible.  Is very open to input.  Liked her and her course a lot.
She takes attendance so you have to go to class but she's really straightforward with her assignments

Great professor - knowledgable about subject, facilitates a lecture hall full of people in a discussion, is very clear about what she is looking for. Also just a down to earth normal person - very few professors who aren't ready to tell you how much smarter they are than you, but this is definitely one professor who does not act that way.

Great teacher. I found her to show interest and do a great job in facilitating discussions. I didn't find her to be a strict grader. This was my 2nd class with her and I plan to take a 3rd with her this upcoming semester. HIGHLY recommend her.
average at best.  doesn't seem concerned with students' success.   Has clear guidelines and expectations.
No
Cadge was very knowledgeable about the subject matter and made herself available for questions and ongoing discussions outside of the classroom.

great professor. the class isn't a joke and a good deal of work is expected of the students, but she makes it interesting.  the readings themselves could use some cutting down but prof. cadge is always well-prepared and the course outline is well-organized.  she's very nice, willing to help, and accepting of all ideas.

Some lectures were interesting, but most readings were dense and theoretical.  Papers were painfully specific and harshly graded if not exactly on the topic.  I tried to visit her office hours, but she wasn't even there and hardly apologized.  I barely felt like she cared about my learning, and her attention to obvious favorites only frustrated me.
great professor, excellent class. she was very helpful to students doing research projects.

i thought the class would be easy and fun but i was sorely let down. most of her lectures were boring when they could have been made interesting and her grading was harsh and unexplained in her comments.
All she does in class is repeat the readings. A totally uninspiring lecturer, and such a cold person.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. She is not the worst lecturer but the way she does things is completely horrible. She gives you homework every class and she is extremely picky about what you write and it generally takes at least 2 hours to do. She is also very petty and takes offense if you ask a question she cannot seem to answer.

Don't take this class.Totally waste of time.Her hw and exams are creative in a bad way. There is nothing to learn from this class and she criticizes on intermediate macro classes calling them not applicable at all. Doesnt utilize math enough for an econ class. Just go cross-register at a partnering school like BC or tufts for the similair class.

Terrible class. She tries to use all her own material for the course, textbook, slides, ps, exams and they were all poorly written. Questions literally makes no sense. I was an econ major at Brandeis too and she was the worst econ prof ever at IBS.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF U CAN!!!!! HW due every class and each hw needs 2+ hours to finish. THIS IS NOT AN ECON CLASS!!! She wants you to do paraphrase, graphing(has to be exactly the same as hers or you get 70%). TOTALLY WASTE OF TIME. WORST CLASS TAKEN IN BRANDEIS IBS. DODGE AT ALL COSTS!!!!!

Incredibly unorganized. Self-absorbed. Forgets attendance every single class until reminded by students on the way out the door. Late to submit assignment grades. Doesn't post any grades online. Late to the final. Late to submit final grades.

Prof Osler is the worst professor I have ever had. She begins the class by saying "the only way for me to get anything out of this is if you come to see me at office hours," an act of concerned that is very fake and self serving. She is not helpful outside of class, her lectures are unorganized, and her grading has no clear reason behind it.

Professor Osler is very knowledgeable with industry expertise. But less homework and more organized presentation would be better considering the overall arrangement , given the huge amount of material covered in class.
Too much homework, inconsiderate to the students

If you take one course in macroeconomics, take Professor Osler's course. It will make you want to study economics, and will make you fascinated with reading about policies around the world. This is not a theoretical course with a boring textbook, it teaches you practically based on current and historical events. You have to put in effort though.

Carol bases her lectures on opinion pieces and completely defys the use of math in economics. I took graduate level international macroeconomics (a subject required for the degree I was enrolled at in Brandeis) expecting to expand on the knowledge of my macroeconomics after having completed my bachelors in economics at VT. But, nothing to learn!

Osler is hard and expects you to perform at a professional level, which is why most people dislike her. She's an engaging lecturer and you learn deeply. There are problem sets due every class, which is time consuming and difficult, but they are the least busy-work assignments I've ever had. Applied Macro was hard, but I very well equipped.

Professor Osler is a great teacher. Her lessons are great and I really enjoyed taking international macro. I gained more insight into macro in her class.  There was a lot of homework though. But then why come to grad school if you don't expect to work.
Worst Professor at my time at Brandeis.
Do not take this class.  The professor is not clear within her lectures or expectations.  She does not communicate with students outside of class.

The worst professor I had ever. Tip you should keep in mind: tay as far as you can from her! Terrible experience during the semester with her lectures. Pointless slides and disorganized content. Too much homework, due before every class (two classes per week). Never gonna be satisfied with your final paper if she does not like the topic you chose.

She is very enthusiastic about her subject, but does not realize that her teaching style is far from efficient. She talks to fast, jumps between topics, and is very disorganized. On top of that, she is so full of herself that discussion with her is absolutely pointless! Avoid this professor if you can!

Carol is disorganized, opinionated and intimidating. Most importantly she is not an expert in the field. Apart from anecdotal stories she is using to attract the students, she does not explore the topic in depth. As a person she is mean,inconistent and generally insulting. After taking her class I completely lost interest in the topic.

terrible prof, most boring class ever, i have never been less motivated to go to a class. she drags on in her lectures and is extremely uninteresting and unhelpful. assignments are pointless and due every class. i have never had a worse professor, she should have paid me to take it
She is very disorganized and reflect this in her teaching and grading style. She does not challenge students, she just expects students to replicate her disorganized writing/analysis style!
No Comments

Professor Gaskins is always available to help students who may need help wiht course material, or who just want to chat about what's on their mind. Open to all comments in class and tries to have a genuine discussion rather than looking for people to echo his own views. I highly reccommend his program in the Hague.

Professor Gaskins is the type of Professor who makes Brandeis great. He is unswervingly dedicated to his students' success and he is a phenomenal mentor. I strongly recommend him to any student interested in the fields that Prof. Gaskins teaches.
I exaggerate not, he is the best professor i've ever had.. to not know him is the biggest mistake you never knew you made.

There is a difference between boring and long-winded.Professor Gaskins will explain a subject 3-4 different ways. If you show him you're interested, though he will not only challenge you but go above and beyond to help you pursue those interests. Definitely worth creating a personal relationship with!
Adored his class. He made the material interesting and pertinent to today's world.

He's a wonderful professor - I think Brandeis is so lucky to have him.  Brilliant, passionate, and patient, Gaskins defines what I believe is the ideal professor.  He has inspired me to pursue my law career to the doctorate level.  Take a class with him - it's an unforgettable experience.
Awesome Professor, I have had him for both senior thesis and for two classes at the Hague and he is the best professor I have had at Brandeis- he cares about his students a lot!

Gaskins is secretly the best professor at Brandeis. If anyone finds him boring, it probably says more about their own unwillingness to engage with the topic than about Gaskins' inability to provoke thought. He will certainly broaden your perspective.
Great class
I write english paper good
MAD boring dear god kill me now

gaskins is a great guys, he knows what hes saying and the class has interesting material...there are 2 lectures a week, and then you have recitations with lawyers from boston. thats kinda cool. its def a great class for anyone considering law or wanting the SS requirement
v. smart
No Comments

real nice guy. i think he's pretty smart and comprehensive, many people say he's boring. good and simple readings. good grading system (25% lawyer ta session participation, several 2-4 pg papers and a 20% in class final)
Very nice guy but deathly boring class
Just a really, really nice guy!  :-)
Good class... Gaskins could pick better readings, though.
good class, boringggg prof
Really nice man, but so boring! I wish that environmental law actually included reading some cases, and not discussing boring policy!

Prof Charles McClendon is definitely a good scholar and a respectful old gentleman. He is a very TOUGH grader and I didn't see there's any room for negotiation for improvement in grades. For instance, for his final paper, I went to his office hour twice and made three revisions based on his suggestions, and my paper ended up with an A-.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: My favorite professor by FAR here at Brandeis. McClendon was always quick to respond to my emails when I have questions and gives great feedbacks. His classes are extremely interesting, but can be a bit dull/difficult if you are not into Art History/European History. Overall, great professor, very caring, and is always accessible outside of class!

clearly very knowledgable and passionate about what he teaches. loves what he does and wants you to love it, too! a very kind and non-intimidating person. he speaks quietly so it can be easy to zone out in class, but he can be very witty. he reasonably adjusted the workload during covid19, but imo couldve been more radical given the circumstances

old school prof: class is entirely lecture based (no discussion, rarely asks for participation), and he teaches to the test. looks for you to include LOTS of small details from the lectures in your graded work, but he doesn't take off too many points for not including them. no required reading. he loves what he does, and the material is interesting

Charles is very knowledgable about the topic (cathedrals) and can talk about them for a long time. Doesn't ask for a lot of participation, tests are easy. Can get kind of boring, espeically because classroom is dark and his voice is soft. I learned a lot, though, and it was a fun, easy class to take to fill the Creative Arts requirement.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: he is efficient. but boy is he boring. he goes on and on about small details. and his voice puts you to sleep. do not take his st. peter's and the vatican course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Covers everything that will be on the exams in his lectures and gives us study guides for each exam, so the textbook is really only helpful for the definitions. There's a lot of information covered, but as long as you study over time you will do well. He clearly cares about the subject and about students paying attention in class. 10/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: hes very caring and helpful. tests based on memorizations are hard for non art history majors, but it will be ok if you just want to take it for your ca requirement

Professor McClendon is great. He is being very clear and detailed with his lecture and all the assignment instructions . Basically you just need to follow the instructions and the grade will be good. The exams are fair.

His lectures and engaging, interesting and very clear. The content of assessments (tests and essays) is very easy to master (memorization of images for tests and using the words he uses to describe images for essays and image comparisons.) The grading is not strict and it was easy for me and others to do well in this course. Interesting and easy.

Clear, interesting lecturer, very easy grader. Don't buy textbook, just show up to class. Very little work other than tests, which cover a lot of material but are graded leniently. Take note of all art comparisons made in class. Grading criteriatest material are clearly explained in study guides. Good lecturer, interesting material, worth taking.
He is a great lecturer.  If you pay attention, take good notes, and then memorize your notes, the tests are no problem.
Really stoked to start learning! He already has made it clear that this class is going to be simple but engaging

I really enjoyed this course, the textbook reading wasn't really necessary as he never tested on it.  Prof McClendon knows his stuff, but his lectures can get pretty lengthy.  The tests are exactly what he tells you they will be, and he is a fair-to-easy grader.  He obviously is passionate about the subject he teaches.

Amazing, Absolutely amazing. The sweetest man ever, and he really really knows the material he's teaching. I thought I was just taking a fine arts class to get my CA credit out of the way, but he made me fall in love with Art History. Plus, he compared Roman Concrete to Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough...
No Comments
Hands down the most organized Art Historian in the department.  If you're taking an Art History course, make sure its with him.
McClendon is sooooo cute and sooooooo amazingly smart and good at what he does!!
I had him for USEM and then he left for a dig, I thought he was excellent
No Comments

This class was pretty easy but Professor Kryder does have a tendency to ramble, and its all lecture-based. It was pretty tough for me to take notes though, as he would often jump around and had no slides for me to base notes off of. I appreciated the format of exams though and his directions were clear. The class was only graded on exams though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class was very engaging, sure, Professor Kryder has a tendency to ramble, but his conversations are always engaging. He is a very nice and caring man, and an excellent educator. By far one of the best professors I have had so far.

Professor Kryder is a passionate man who loves to teach. As a freshman, his class was the perfect challenge. He is very easy to talk to, and I felt very comfortable in his office hours. He is understanding of personal struggles and is willing to offer chances for students to do better, like extensions.

Kryder never comes to class on time and lacks any enthusiasm during his lectures. He scribbles incoherently all over the whiteboards and shuns people who use technology; consistently and derangedly ranting about a "screenslaver" which will enslave you if you use technology. His exams are written to confuse you and are graded incredibly harshly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Kryder is a terrible lecturer. His classes are dry, and you don't really learn much. He assigns many readings. His tests are based off of memorization of the readings. He sets no clear expectations of how he grades his in class essays. He's a nice guy, but TERRIBLE professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: Kryders teaching style is that of a professor who is only at their university for research money. He assigns readings that have nothing to do with the subjects he taught. His lectures will make you fall asleep and the whiteboards are often cluttered with hard to follow tangents. Professor Kryder's tests are awful and made to confuse students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Kryder is very kind and cares deeply about the subject he's teaching. My only complaints are that he's a bit disorganized and often assigns unnecessary readings. The assignments for this class all build on one another, and he gives very thorough feedback on each one. You'll be less overwhelmed with work once you're more used to his style!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment:
the class material and structure were set up very interestingly. However, Kryder responds to emails very last minute. One time I asked for an office hour a week ago, and he responded a week later asking me to meet in five minutes. and this happened twice. 

His assignment is tough 
he is very disorganized.

There's a midterm and a final paper. The midterm is not hard provided you have done the readings and attended the lectures. The final paper is kinda demanding though. You'd better go to his office hours to talk about it before writing it. He usually cancels classes due to personal matters and make-up lectures are at the end of the semester.

Kryder was very disorganized and changed grading criteria every week. So many readings and very little class engagement during lectures despite it being considered a seminar. The simulation allowed group members to slack without any punishment. He was late to every single class, sometimes up to 45 minutes. The TAs carried this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: He was late to every class & never gave out a syllabus or grading criteria. He is accessible outside of class, but email responses are sporadic & his answers are often unhelpful. Latte page was set up for an entirely different class from 3 years ago for most of the semester. Term paper was 15+pages & everyone gave a final 30 min presentation.

Professor Kryder is a kind and understanding professor. The class only had one midterm, one presentation, and a final research paper. Beware of lots and lots of mandatory reading! He gave good feedback and genuinely wanted his students to do well. Only thing was that he was consistently tardy (due to personal matters).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: His class is fairly interesting but the amount of reading you have to do is insane. On top of that if for some reason you fall behind on the reading, you won't be able to do well on the midterm or research paper. i wish that the research assignment was slightly smaller because it was incredibly long and daunting
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: He is a cool guy and gives very insightful lectures but sometimes he occasionally goes on tangents. He is also super nice!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I appreciate his clarity and intelligence though he can be tardy sometimes

Once a week class that was cancelled twice at the last minute. Classes weren't made up until the end of the semester. Class discussions mostly did not focus on the readings but rather on current political events. Class easily got off track with discussions. Takes a long time to return grades. Did not get midterm back until December.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof. Kryder has really high expectations for his students. He gives a lot of freedom and trust, so you really need to hold yourself accountable for getting stuff done. He assigns a lot of reading, but try to stay on top of it because it's often necessary in order to do well. He really treats students like adults and he's very understanding.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: tough demeanor, complicated and intensive assignments but a reasonable grader. likes smart quiet students.
Kryder is pretty cool, but he would be best suited to a small seminar environment and not a big lecture class.  Also he is very mysterious.
No Comments

He was nice but kind of disorganized at points. Three group recording projects which weren't great because it was hard to coordinate times to work on them. Also the quizzes had so many reading questions and at times they asked about very small details from the readings which he had not gone over in class. He did offer extra credit for the quizzes.
Cool class. Interesting content and conversation. Wish the professor had kept class more on topic though, can be a little disorganized.
Seminar. Very collaborative and supportive of students. Really interesting material.
Great class and readings. The professor definitely loves his field and talks about interesting art. Do the work if you want to do well.

He was an okay professor. I took this class for my fine arts requirement and found his lectures to be extremely boring. He was also disorganized and would sometimes get confused as to what he was talking about. Definitely had some odd interpretations of the art. Study hard for the quizzes, but once you get the hang of it, it can be an easy class.
Great class and professor. Wants lots of discussion. Material can be tough, so ask questions in or out of class. But fair grader, wants you to do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Really interesting. I took the class to fulfill requirements, but now thinking of a major or minor. Professor is funny and really makes the class a safe place for discussion.

So much information, really knows his stuff. Classes can be a little disorganized. Maybe because it's more discussion than lecture? You'll definitely do better if you do the reading and assignments, but he is so understanding and will give extra credit. Meet outside of class or email! So caring.

This was one of my favorite classes ever! Kalb really makes art accessible and interesting. He is so smart, and really values student voices and opinions. You def have a fair amount of reading and assignments, but he is super understanding and flexible. One of the best profs I've had at Brandeis.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: cold calls constantly, barely giving students a chance to even think about the artwork before being forced to comment, which creates a hostile environment and is not even conducive to good discussion. quizzes only show mystery slides. doesn't assign essays but instead oral exams, which allows you and a partner to speak for 10-15 minutes about art
He is a nice guy, and the class is particularly easy.

Kalb was ok, nice guy, but his class is not easy, there is a lot of writing, tough grading on that writing, and its all based on reading that you have to do. There are quizes which are hard too. Unless you find photography REALLY REALLY interesting, do not take this class. I thought it would be an easy CA credit, it IS NOT. Just trying to help
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Lots of readings and some of them can be hard to follow. Lots of different kinds of assignments but easy grading. There is an extra credit to increase the entire grades for 5%, which really can bump into another level.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is really an easy A professor if you do what you suppose to do. His guidelines over the assignments are not so clear, but he is very friendly with emails and question. A lot of readings and he uses this online platform so you have to read them. Very great grader, he grades everything fair and really respects students and their ideas.

He seems like a pretty good guy overall, but the problem is the for his HISTORY OF PHOTOGRAPHY class you basically have like 3 big papers to write, you have 4 quizzes in class that are pretty hard, and you have to attend 2 outside of class events... Just a lot of time and effort for a Creative Arts credit class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Great professor!

Hands down my favorite professor I ever had in college. He is always willing to go out of his way to support his students, both inside and outside of the classroom. I highly recommend taking any of his classes- you won't regret it!

BEST TEACHER EVER. He really cares about and works with this students. I only took this class to fulfill the CA requirement but I left with a new found appreciation of art. Even when I was struggling he went out of his way to make sure I would succeed. TAKE HIS CLASSES!!!
Hands down, my favorite professor at Brandeis.  He's witty and engaging and absolutely brilliant.
Best professor ever. Not only is he brilliant, but everything he says is interesting. I was never bored in that class.
Pretty interesting class, but sometimes can be unclear. He's a cool guy, REALLY goodlooking.
I learned a lot under Prof. Klausen. She was a little tough but very fair, and her class was extremely interesting!

Professor Klausen has been one of the most amazing professors I have ever had. Not only is she an expert in her field, she is a trailblazer for women in political science. Her classes are interesting, relevant, and always a fun time. I cannot recommend highly enough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: This professor was one of the most intelligent and impressive people I have ever met. Particularly as a woman and successful author in a very contentious and male dominated field. Anyone who takes her classes will be learning from an individual who has dedicated their career to shedding light on the reality of the subjects and groups she studies.
Professor Klausen is by far one of the most knowledgeable professors I have had in my time at college. She is very funny in a dry humor sense, and I learned a lot from this class.

Fantastic professor, but she has high expectations for her students. A leading expert in her field, I learned a lot about the material. Claims about her controversiality seem largely exaggerated. During my experience in her classes, I've never witnessed any behavior I saw as problematic or rude.

The class was interesting, the assignments valuable and the workload manageable. The issue is that the professor seems to unable to determine when she has offended someone or made a comment that has come across as detached. This may be due to a language barrier.  I would recommend taking this class because it was structured well.

I love Professor Klausen-- this was the second class with her I took last year. She is a very hard professor and expects high effort and participation, but appreciates good work when you give it. Like another review said, you have to swallow your ego a bit, but get ready to learn a lot. I respect her so much!!

Prof. Klausen, is a good professor, it's very rare that you find a LEADING professor in their field of study. Understandable that her controversial work turns students away from her. But looking at her classes and classes is only, her teaching/grading style is very interesting and she gives solid feedback to improve your papers

Klausen's good, I don't understand the hate on her. Sure, there are some things that might make the class a bit more interesting and/or exciting, but that's about it. Plus, 3-hour courses are a tough thing to do and allowing time to take a breath is perfect. Main issue is that the class can be a bit of a drag because of its length.

She is clearly a competent and able professor but cultural communication differences severely limit the professor-student relationship. She is very direct and sometimes forgets otherwise coustomary niceties. I would take her course again for the content of her lectures but would not recommend it if one is seeking more than content.

Y'all need to get over it. Yes, Klausen assigns a lot of work and sets very high expectations. Yes, she leads lectures like a well-respected academic instead of a recitation TA. Her classes require you to swallow your ego and actually challenge your own beliefs, and yes, that can suck sometimes. But it's also extremely valuable if you lean into it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: bored

Very unhelpful professor. Poor at leading what was allegedly a discussion section. Assigned massive amounts of reading, much of which was not covered during the alleged "seminar" class. Gives poor feedback, and is hard to communicate with. Seems more self-absorbed than interested in students. Obviously knows her stuff, but avoid her classes.
awful awful prof. just terrible.not a good teacher, preoccupied with personal issues, picks worthless arguments with students, hard grader with no teaching to show for it.
She is tough (and sometimes arrogant), and her lectures are sometimes difficult to understand and fast-paced, but overall her class is great and you take a lot of information and wisdom from it.
Good Class.  Teacher expects a lot.  The tests are difficult untill you learn what kinds of things she is looking for.
She knows her****.  She cares if you learn.  She responds to emails and will meet with students though she is busy.  She's a great professor and a great resource if you use her wisely.

good grading setup (50% participation, 50% final paper). poor email response and not very accessible.  particual and inflexible about final research paper and does not prepare class well for it, but a lenient grader if you have good original research or a good relationship with her.
worst professor i have ever had. this was confirmed by others in the class as well. stay away. she is moody and believes kissing up is a requisite to good grades.

Arteta is definitely a nice guy and cares about his students, yet he is super disorganized. No students ever know what is happening during class and you don't know what the quiz is on until the day before. Honestly, if you are just taking the class to fulfill the language requirement, fine, but do not take a class with him if you want to learn
He is super accessible and kind
Arteta is so helpful and approachable. Easy homework and easy quiz. Definitely recommend.
Arteta is approachable and really helpful. You could ask for permission of the extension of homework. Definitely recommend his course.
He truly wants you to learn and will be there to help you if needed. I will probably take a semester off from Spanish in order to take a class with him again.

Jorge's adorable! He's so enthusiastic, about Spanish but also about politics and history and so he makes things interesting by incorporating real-world issues. He really will take assignments late, and he's fairly easy overall. It's true you probably won't learn too much though.

Arteta is lovely.  Funny, cute, enthusiastic, and EASY!!  He will take any and all assignments late, and will let you correct your mistakes and average the final grade with the original.  He just wants you to learn and improve, and is willing to help in whatever way.  You won't learn too much though, that's almost for sure!

Jorge is a genuinely nice guy, who cares about his students and loves the Hispanic culture. He's definitely proud of his Puerto Rican heritage too. Somewhat unorganized though. Last week he accidentally missed class, but he is "making it up to us" by buying us all pizza or lunch sometime :)
Knows a lot about Spanish and Latin American history.
really nice guy...really cares about his students but at the same time really unorganized and confusing.
Very easy but a super cool teacher. Didn't learn much. More the fault of the deis Spanish program than Arteta.
Jorge is helpful and cares about his students, but he does loose stuff, doesn't follow the syllabus, but grades supaaa easy to make for all of it.  Rock on Jorge!

Jorge Arteta is one of the nicest teachers I've ever had. Ever. He's kind and funny and genuinely cares about his students. On top of that, he's also an excellent instructor who's always availble for help outside of class, and he's an INCREDIBLY easy grader- IF you put in the effort. If you are going to take Spanish, take it with Professor Arteta.
Awesome professor, very clear and was always there for students.  he made spanish fun to learn.  fair grader and a nice guy
very *literate.* almost mothering.  gives you a very good chance at getting a good grade.  but you will also learn a lot if you should be in the level of spanish, where you have been placed.
jorge is awesome...he loses stuff a lot, and grades super easy
Jorge Arteta is the man!
class is comical, lectures are unorganized, dont learn that much, but its easy
very friendly and approachable...is a genuinely nice person and good teacher

This is a very difficult class that covers many foundational concepts in computer system design. Liuba's lectures are not always the most organized, but she is accessible and ready to answer questions. The textbook is your friend and covers just about everything in extreme detail. Don't expect to get everything from lectures the first time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Liuba is a really nice person, just a terrible lecturer. I got a 35% on one of the quiz's and she was more than happy to explain when i went to her hours. However, you gotta learn on your own to pass, the TA's are good too. I suggest having a solid study group, because I went to every single lecture and she did not teach me a thing.

She seems to have no conception of the fact that her students have personal lives and other classes, and assigns work/gives tests like she expects you to spend 40 hrs/week on this class. There's no earthly reason why she needs to assign such a heavy workload, but she does so anyway. 21 with Antonella is a breeze compared to this.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Liuba was incredible.  I took OS and Principles of Computer System Design with her.  If you blame others for not being a good programmer, thats on you, we need less of you anyway.  Liuba had a dedication to the art of crafting well architected systems that reverberated through here lectures and passion.  I am forever grateful for her inspiration.

Be warned, this is a terrible course. The lectures are extremely hard to understand and give you nowhere near the level of detail required for the assignments/tests. PAs are ridiculously difficult and PS's are harshly graded. But, Liuba and TA's are approachable and will give points back at office hours if you really deserve it.

While the grading system of programming assignments and the time allotted for assignments has improved since previous semesters, the class still has some of the worst lectures and tests of any COSI course at Brandeis. The professor knows the content of the class but is incapable of presenting it to a large audience. Just read the textbook and pray.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I read all chapters that she required before midterm but still failed in a very bad score

DON'T take any courses taught by this instructor. She is poor in delivery and is barely able to answer questions. Most of the instructor responsibilities are outsourced to the teaching fellow. The entire class is conducted by reading out from supplementary slides of the textbook.
Can you believe that you will have 3 parallel assignments dues within 24 hours? TAKE IT IF YOU WANT THAT!!!!!!
I spent days with programming assignment and received an 0 because of wrong archive format.

Poor lecturer, most of my learning came from the textbook. Lectures, assignments, and quizzes do not go well with each other. A harsh teacher, the class average for many major assignments was around a 60 and she makes comebacks difficult. It is clear why every student I ask is extremely disappointed with the quality of this course. Avoid her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Out of all the classes that I have taken, at Brandeis, she is BY FAR the ABSOLUTE WORST Professor I've ever had. She doesn't care about her students and blames US for bad performance and not putting in enough effort--a student said they read all the slides and the textbook chapters and still failed the midterm (class avg was 62). AVOID AT ALL COST
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She made the final programming assignment, final problem sets (yes that's plural) and the final quiz (didn't utilize finals period at all) all due within 72 hours of each other. I was wiped out with the flu the week of all this and she wasn't understanding at all. Wait for a term where she's not teaching this course.
If Liuba teaches COSI131, don't take it.

Horrible is an understatement. I wish Mitch Cherniack taught the class. Her lectures have nothing to do with the hw or exams. As mentioned, you can't avoid, as class is needed for BA and BS! Her syllabus says 2 late days, but then she said there is no late days, which absolutely got me screwed. take this as the only cosi class for the semester...

Liuba is very enthusiastic about the topic and is very friendly.  But her lectures and assignments don't go very well together and I personally don't feel like I learned very much.  Don't frustrate yourself over a poor grade on an assignment because you will receive MANY in this class.  She says she doesn't curve the grades but she does in the end.
It's a challenging course, but if you're interested in it and do the work you can do well.

Class is not that bad! Lectures are boring and there are some issues with translating the lectures to the programming assignments, since the lectures are theoretical and you're not really taught what to do in the Java context. That being said, I thought the assignments were pretty interesting, and I learned a good amount! Final was hard.

This is a core class for CS major, for both BA and BS. She is the WORST professor I've ever met. The worst thing is that you do not have any way to avoid her. She is very good at skipping important slides of PPT and wasting most of the time explaining easy and minor stuffs. The only advice I can give is do NOT MAJOR COMPUTER SCIENCE!!!!!!!
If you have other choices, go for that; none shall be responsible for your mental death afterwards...
I hate math, but Professor Parker was so kind and so approachable. She made the class bearable.
She is the best professor in this department. If you get a chance to take her class, make sure that you won't change sessions because there's no doubt that hers is the best!
SP is the bomb dot com. After struggling with Math throughout high school, I'm now going on to get a math minor - she changed the way I think about learning mathematics.
Precalc was very easy. Great, clear teacher and VERY nice. Definitely worth it to have her instead of a TA.
AMAZING person and professor.  she left such an impression on me her classes were great

Professor Parker is the best professor I have ever had! She is wonderful and interesting and so nice to speak to and she is always willing 2 help her students.  I want to take calc 10 b because of her.
Awesome teacher!  Nice to talk to.  Cares about her students.  Great explanations, though more difficult in class examples would have helped.
AMAZING TEACHER LOVED THE CLASS, FUNNY AND AWESOME, EXTREMELY HELPFUL AND CARING
She is the best math teacher you could imagine!
Very Helpful. Easy if you do your homework and study.
Really good lecturer and very nice to talk with. However, as someone mentioned earlier, the math department has some odd policies with grading that are probably her fault.
No Comments

there are a lot of stupid math department policies and i blame her for them.  they don't care about their students.  also, suggestion, please try to make exams and study sessions and tutoring sessions at at time when students are not asleep!  math exams should be shorter + in-class.

She is VERY helpful and VERY nice. Even if you get one of the TAs, go to her office hours for a chat. She's got all sorts of extra materials and great ways of explaining everything. Her lectures are well organized and cover everything you need to know.
A brilliant prof -- our heroine.
No Comments
Great professor!!
She's a very nice woman,
Charismatic, fun, and inviting of student input.

Definitely has her favorites. While she IS nice, I noticed her interrupt both myself and others just to repeat the exact points they were saying as if she thought of it. Had a syllabus with very diverse perspectives but the topics she covered felt VERY surface level with the analysis kinda capping out at "racism bad" or "colonialism is everywhere".

She absolutely knows her shi, she is a badass woman. I look up to her, even thought this class was not in my major and I took it as a core requirement. Curves her tests, fun final projects, and amazing lecturer. If it lined up with my timing, i would of done a minor.
Love her. Such an easy class and you can tell how passionate and caring she is.

I love Professor ChaeRan so much. She is super caring and willing to help you with anything. There is a lot of reading a lot but they are worthwhile. Her lecture is a little bit messy since she wants to include everything. There is one multiple take-home exam, which will be fine if you do all the reading and some papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She's supremely nice and caring! She wants the student to succeed and gives extensions to support student mental health and wellbeing! Yes, there is a LOT of reading and the midterm is a bit challenging but, it is definitely possible to succeed and it is such an easy A+. Definite GPA booster!
She's such a great human and cares about her students. Not too much work.

She is one of the coolest people I've ever met in my life. Her lectures can sometimes be boring but the class is very easy. There are very few homework assignments and as long as you do the work, you'll be set. 100% will be taking a class with her again.
Very nice and understanding! The professor is very easygoing, and great to talk to! 5 stars!
Didn't really do the readings but I ill ended up with an A.

really interesting (grew up in ethiopia) and cool (tells great stories, good sense of humor) professor. has a warm and friendly personality and is very approachable. speaks very passionately about feminism and inspires you to be revolutionary. values students' insight. really easy grader as long as you just think critically about the material

really interesting subject and material. readings were insightful, and lectures were engaging and generated discussion. spoke with sincere passion about all the topics and explained them well. easy grading  just wants to see you think critically  and theres extra credit. powerpoints were at times unclear, but overall a great (and easy!) class
Prof. Freeze truly cares about her students. She may seem timid, but she's a really warm and lovely woman! Stop by her office hours - being on her good side will help you!
She is a nice professor even thought the reading in this class is very long. But They are interesting!
Really helpful, clear, willing to help students, great class
ChaeRan is seriously awesome. Her lectures are fascinating and provide in-depth information and analysis. She is my role model. <3 ChaeRan

This professor is pretty good, but sometimes the feminism gets pretty stifling if you believe a rock is just a rock and that its dark appearance has no bearing on socioeconomic determinism or your current mental condition.

Prof. Freeze was an interesting choice for 5A. Her passion is clearly in Judaic studies and NOT in WMGS. Still, she provided interesting lectures and supplemented them with VERY interesting readings. The real gems in this class are the TAs; Prof. Freeze does a wonderful job picking some of the brightest at Brandeis to guide her class.

She is not a brilliantly exciting lecturer, but her lectures are solid, and she is happy to elaborate on anything confusing. Her tests are fair and she gives her students a chance to rewrite papers for a better grade. Outside of class, she is insightful, caring, and passionate. If you have any passing interest in her subjects, take a class with her

Prof Freeze is brilliant, and she's so sweet!  She knows her subject very well (she spent time in confidential russian archives), and she explains things with amazing patience.  She is very nurturing and will help all her students to improve, learn a fantastic amount, and ultimitely earn the grades that they want.
Great readings chosen, though reading assignments were sometimes rather long.  Good class and good instructor.

Simple structure to classes every week. Nice person overall and loved going to her extra help meetings. She helped me figure out my schedule to be able to graduate as a math major. Always a person I'll think about reaching out to if I need help or a reference letter.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: She is very helpful outside the class.
She should be the definition of teacher - caring, accessible, nice, neat teaching

She was a sweetheart. I had a really crappy semester with mental health, and when I decided in the last couples of school to get my act together, she still helped me. Did some recourse instruction over the summer, did the final and ended up with almost above a B! She's a miracle worker. Never taking a math ever again but yeah she saved me from that
If the class is too tough go to office hours. There she will help you to the best of her ability. She is also extremely accommodating.
Amazing math prof. Helps explain concepts if people dont get it.
Approachable and caring. She seems excited to teach and explains concept well. I think if you pay attention in class you can do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Great professor!! She is very nice in her office hours.

Funny and very caring to her students. She really wants you to succeed in her class and will notice if you are putting in a lot of effort. She has really generous office hours so visit as much as possible.
I struggled with math in high school and professor Torrey made math easy and fun again. I would recommend her to anyone interested in doing precalc or calc.

Becci is very easy to understand and really wants you to understand the material. She holds office hours almost every day and is willing to answer all of your questions during that time. You have to work hard, but you can get a good grade if you do so and talk to her. Very nice person.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: fantastic teacher. Knowa her stuff and knows how to help out no matter where your skill level is at

She's very good. She flipped the classroom for us, so we had to do readings (so if you forgot to fill out the reading surveys often, like I did, then it will affect your grade), but she didn't waste time on things that people already understood. She was able to give specific feedback to individuals and be very helpful. Very accessible, clear.
Prof. Torrey is a really nice person, BUT she is terrible at teaching!!! I could learn nothing, seriously nothing from her class. Everything I learn is by myself and by reading that worse textbook.
Bad teacher worse textbook
terrible

Professor Torrey is a wonderful person. She is friendly, and approachable and truly wants all of her students to succeed. Her exams however rarely fit the subject matter taught in class and the assigned homework. Doing well in this class relies on being naturally good at math.

Overall great and approachable teacher. For most, the class will be of moderate difficulty, but she does a good job of explaining some of the tougher concepts. She's a lively person, which makes paying attention during her lectures a lot easier. I felt like as long as you put in the work you would do well in her class

I studied with Professor Whitfield back in the 70s. His criticism of my writing encouraged me to become a better writer. I took a second course with him and received a higher grade after heeding his input. He had a permanent impact through these critiques.

I graduated in '00. I took three courses with him, and they changed me. He was so intelligent and knowledgeable that simply disagreeing with him meant you were wrong, and he'd prove it. I'm a high school teacher now. I spend my days trying to be Stephen Whitfield, and it's impossible. He helped me make sense of the world. If I have a hero, it's him
Readings are very long with little time to complete. Toughest grader I've had in 3 years at Brandeis.
Class was okay but tests were not easy

AMAZING PROFESSOR! I want to major in Whitfield. Never uses notes and can talk about the subject matter and use quotes without referencing anything. Definitely not an easy course but if you speak up in class, do the readings and pay attention and take good notes you will succeed and enjoy!

Although attendance isn't mandatory, you actually want to go to his classes because he legitimately cares about his students and you feel like you let him down if you don't attend. He's not an easy grader but fair and he really pushes you to push yourself.

THE BEST! Combines all the best parts of my other favorites.  The compassion of Gordie Fellman, as interesting as Cohen, and the encyclopedic knowledge of Doherty.  Best lecturer I've had, I'm disappointed I only took two courses with him.
Amazing professor. Does not refer to "notes" at all, just really knows what he is talking about. Intelligent, but not aloof or mean. Loved this class.
Whitfield = The Man... he and Cohen are like the Batman and Superman of my college career..
best prof i've had so far and brandeis! AMAZING guy

This guy loves intelligent comments from his students. But if you say something wrong, be prepared for the hiss, or the hiss and the lean-back. And if you say something really dumb, Professor Whitfield will throw up his jazz hands.
I am a journalist today, prolly b/c of this guy.  I ****in hate it. Thanks a LOT STEVE!   He's a master.

whitfield is exactly what you think of when you think of a college professor, tweed jacket, bristling moustache and all. he is extremely nice and helpful and is very open to student contributions to his class.
He is an amazing and brilliant professor!! Incredibly tough but worth the experience!
I loved this guy!!! He is so smart, so enthusiastic, and is really quite endearing...I loved listening to him teach
He's the BEST!
a brilliant man! I could listen to him lecture forever...
Incredibly smart, but as a result very posh. He is an unfair grader -- grades tend not to represent how much you know from the class.

I was not a fan of the class as it did not teach anything practical. I do not think it helped me write better proofs. Lectures were very dry. However, Professor Cherniack was an effective (if persnickety) teacher and tests were very relevant to the course. He actually made you learn to do well in the class, unlike many COSI professors at Brandeis.
Tough class, effective lecturer. If you need him or any of the TAs, they're available (office hours) and help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I didn't find lectures that helpful, because literally everything was taken directly from the book. As such, if you understand the book, you could skip class, or if you go to class, you could skip the readings. For tests, I found him to be nitpicky about taking points off. Personality-wise... let's just say I was surprised to learn he's Canadian...

Mitch is so good and passionate about his teaching. He answers a lot of question on the forum. Attendance is not mandatory and basically he upload everything we need to know on latte. Best professor at CS department.
The professor is great. His slideslectures are awesome. PA is not easy. But if you do it on your own or only with the help of TA, you will get a good grade.
Mitch is the most wonderful professor in cs department
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class may be difficult, but the professor is great. He gives in slides everything you ever need to know for hw and exams. if you still don't understand the material, at least take college level algebra! I appreciate him so much more after taking classes with other professors. He is the best overall prof and Cosi prof in the 3 colleges I attended.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: This was a hard class but Professor Cherniack was very helpful in getting us to understand the topics. He knows what he's talking about and cares about teaching :)
One of the best teachers in the department.
The only good professor in the COSI dept. Good slides and clear presentation of materials.

While he's clear and exciting lecturer, he expects that students understand the material. The class is hard for beginners in Cosi, it's for people with a background. He needs to slow down, goes too fast. It's a pain for non Cosi people.
Incredibly well-organized and clear.
One of the only good Cosci prodfessors at Deis.
The best professor in the Computer Science department.
Simply the best at Brandeis
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Very sweet professor, I always felt comfortable participating. Also easy grader!
You could say almost anything and she'll agree.  Not a bad professor, but discussions never really went anywhere.  Socratic seminar type beat
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She's extremely nice and sweet! She is willing to help you as much as she possibly can and cares so much about her students. She always told me how smart, hardworking, and intelligent I was and believed in me when I couldn't believe in myself! A true gem! Relatively easy grader! Smart, witty, and firm when she needs to be! She is an inspiration!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Great style, knows her stuff (I have her for her Witchcraft and Magic in the Renaissance) and she's a very thorough professor. She makes sure everyone understands the material and encourages class participation.
Cristal clear, higly knowledgeable, creative in interpretation and exposition.

Her personality is cold and too self-involved, but she loves the literature, and that comes across. She's a bit too impatience, makes litlle effort at formalities or being nice. She carries herself like she's too good for everyone else. If--somehow--you can get time alone with her, she will help you improve your work, and her recommendations help.
Extremely organized and thorough.

Brilliant, sassy, well-read, organized lecturer.  She took care to memorize everyone's names (in a 100-person lecture) and balance her time between lecture and Q+A.  One of the best teachers in the ENG department.
Annoyed that all of her material came from her husband (Greenblat).  A bit of a **** if you bring up other perspectives.
parrots Greenblatt, judgmental
VERY difficult: class will kick your ass if you show up unprepared.  Smart, savvy, passionate about her courses.  Very focused seminars, great care given to grading.

she's wicked smart, bitingly sarcastic and very well dressed. I had her for english core which was kind of a dumb course, but she did the best she could to get through the boring as ef introductory meter, vocab, etc and get onto the literature.

I don't know where the negativity is coming from here, because the targoff was one of the sharpest lecturers I had at brandeis.  The depth of her knowledge is incredible and she brings a lot of wit, depth, and humanity to her classes. But if you say something dumb, watch out, because she'll let you and the other 60 people in your class know it.
Bright-enough, engaging lecturer (much of her material is cribbed from Stephen Greenblatt, but so much the better!)
No Comments
Not impressed. Reminds me a lot of Janice from 'Friends.'
No Comments
very clear and enthusiastic.  loves the material and encourages participation

Professor Singh rocks. This class was one of my favorites. So knowledgeable about the topic and she picked some amazing films to watch. I was so sad when the semester ended. She also is very willing if you put in effort to give extensions, so try your best and she will help bolster you as a student.

Amazing and intelligent teacher. Lectures are super inspirational and enlightening. Youd better do the assigned readings before class (but not do them all is also fine). But she seldom gives feedback about paper and exam. Grade mainly depends on TA and the grading rubric is unclear. Hard to know how to improve.

Professor Singh's class was one of the most engaging, though-provoking classes I've ever attended. The topics we discussed allowed for meaningful conversations which guided the course of the class. Take notes during class and do the readings for the midterm, and reach out to her or the TAs for the essays. Highly recommend this class!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Her lectures? Amazing! She is an inspirational and funny woman with an amazing history. She understands her students and inspires us to step out of our comfort zone. Her midterms are easy, and the essays are honestly a breeze. Her TFs are very cool, so you don't have to sweat it. Harleen is literally the best professor out there.
Best professor
Prof. Singh is pretty cool, very knowledgeable. Tough grader and is often unclear about her feedback.

Very passionate and knowledgeable about her subject--South Asian Studies. She is quite engaging and open to comments during her classes and I feel as though I learned a great deal in her class about the South Asian culture and history, things that wouldn't have been possible without Professor Singh. You should definitely take a class with her!
great professor, extremely helpful as well as very caring about her students and suers material.

Harleen was the BEST professor ever.I was not very interested in the class before i took it but she made me fall in love with the subject! She is extremely smart, funny and a very knowledgeable person.I loved talking to her.DEFINITELY take a class with her if you get the chance.She is one of the best Brandeis has to offer :)

One of the most interesting, clear, and helpful professors ever. Willing to help out students, understanding about deadlines, and easy to communicate with. Genuinely knowledgeable in subject matter, too. Definitely looking forward to taking another class with her.
Hands down my favorite teacher I've had so far. I recommend everyone to take a class with her. Riveting and thought-provooking. Well worth the liberal arts education right there.

Amazing professor. Her lectures are organized and inspire some really great discussion. She cares about attendance so if you miss more than a few classes she will notice and it will affect your grade. Exams and papers are  very straightforward and the readings will change your life.
One of the most interesting classes taken. Goes out of her way to explain the background on  South Asia to those who might not know. Is very friendly and her thoughts are interesting.
She's a really great professor and a really nice woman. She deffinately has very strong opinions and you'll do better in the class if you agree with her.

A genuinely considerate person. Her knowledge is more in women's studies than gender, so if you're looking for a gender class, don't take this one. However, her approach to intersecting oppresions is interesting and valuable. She is articulate, approachable, and funny. I recomend going to office hours to discuss issues face-to-face.
Okay, so granted she's pretty. But what a B*****! An airhead and arrogant! Who made this incompetent woman a professor?
She is the most amazing professor I have ever had. This school is full of****ty professors except for her. She makes this school a lot better.
Harleen is a fabulous professor.  It doesn't hurt that she's BEAUTIFUL... in fact, it makes things quite... enjoyable ;)  She's talented, and smart, and pretty... and we wish she weren't married...

She was both my professor and my graduate advisor. Her disdain and lack of confidence in my abilities was overt, going as far as to disparage me to another student to praise them by comparison. Immense lack of compassion. Her lectures are dry, and feedback on papers is brutal. Perfect case of someone who wanted to be an academic but not a teacher.

The lecture is really dry and I can hardly pay attention to it because every class is just her talking with one slide of powerpoint about the very basic structure of today's topic (which doesn't help at all). The readings are lengthy and often times very dry as well. I took it as an interest and suffered. Don't take and avoid if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor has been openly racist to her students of color by making comments condemning the use of AAVE in her classroom.

I cannot emphasize more that her lectures are drier than the Atacama desert which someone had previously stated. She assigns too many readings and in class does not talk about anything important or relevant as to what is needed for the later paper assignments. DO NOT TAKE, UNLESS YOU WANT A CLASS TO SLEEP IN!!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Her lectures are drier than the Atacama Desert, which doesn't bode well for a course with difficult material. While she does outline her lecture before beginning, the flow isn't always clear and her ability to unpack the readings isn't the greatest. Mandatory writing conference for the first essay was awkward and unhelpful. Avoid taking if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is a Theory class -  theory is hard! Duh! If you love it you love it, if you hate it you hate it, so take that into account before taking the class. If you love it then this is a great class. Miller knows what she is talking about. She's a bit of a nerd but is actually pretty entertaining if you like nerd humor. The papers were hard but fun.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures seem quite organized and difficult to follow. Very boring and difficult to sit through all of the lectures. There are a lot of readings and a fair amount of difficult essays. I would recommend avoiding this class as I did not enjoy it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very difficult lecture to sit through. Reads from notes. Captures the attention of no one.
Incredibly boring. To the point where it is painful. Avoid her classes.
She is incredibly boring but the idea of the class was interesting.  I sit and go on buzzfeed and facebook the entire class and it's fine
Interesting class but the amount of times she says um/uh unquestionably outnumbers the amount of other words she says. Its impossible to not be distracted by it

Her culture of consumption class has interesting readings, however her lectures are most of the time boring. It's hard to stay focus sometimes. Essays depend on readings which she assigns every week, and her lectures aren't all that useful in writing essays.

Whoever hated Culture of Consumption was just dumb. The class was very detailed and she outlines her lectures on the board for clarity. Miller is very well read and has a wide range of knowledge. She's also a cool person and fun to meet with.

She is extremely boring and her lectures don't follow any logical flow. She managed to make a topic I love--cultural consumption-- a topic I dread. There is little discussion; the class is mainly listening to her talk pointlessly about history and common sense.
I found the class (Globalization and the Media) to be very boring, which was disappointing because it's an interesting topic. She's a very nice person though and I enjoyed talking to her one on one.
She clearly just doesn't like students. She is the most boring teacher I've ever had. I can't believe the usually great brandeis sociology department hired her. yuck!
No Comments
The class was ok.  She was nice.  There are sections with TA's once a week.

I literally just wrote a review to say this man is the nicest most invested in his students chemistry teacher I have ever had and you are lucky if you are in his class.  I asked him a question about the final via email and he gave an in depth response within five minutes.
Love him so much!! Choose his courses for no reason. He is always patient. I really appreciate his redemption policy.

Professor Ingoglia is absolutely one of the best chemistry professors at Brandeis (or probably anywhere). He's caring, passionate about organic chemistry, a good lecturer, and an overall great person. If you take orgo/orgo lab with him, you're in good hands. And make sure to go to office hours, because it's a tough subject.
Took lab online during COVID. TAs led the sections and did great. The lectures were very informative and helpful.

It is Obvious Dr. Ingoglia is passionate about this topic. This class is structured as a lecture and Q/A discussion hybrid. A lot of general information and scientific literacy is built about environmental chemistry in this course. Was educational, relevant, and fun.

Dr. Ingoglia is kind, smart, and understanding. Orgo is not an easy topic, but he does his best to make the course and himself as approachable and accessible as possible.  Definitely do the textbook problems and find classmates/resources that will help you. Dr. Ingoglia is wonderful and I would take the course again without second thought.

Professor Ingoglia is the best professor I have had at Brandeis. Orgo is known to be difficult, and Prof. Ingoglia makes it an enjoyable class and explains concepts in a very clear fashion. His tests are not too bad, but just be sure to keep up with the material and don't fall behind. 10/10 professor, would love to take him again.

As a person, Prof Ingoglia is probably my favorite prof to spend time with. He cares very deeply about his students and truly wants them to succeed and enjoy orgo. However, it's still orgo lol. In order to do well, you really can't slouch. Put in the effort and make it known that you want to do well in his class and you'll have the biggest ally.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He's a very sweet guy but his tests are just very difficult and he doesn't curve. Honestly, I think I worked hard and still did not receive a good grade. Also, all his redemption points came from doing well on respective sections of the final exam so.... yeah it was very stressful and it doesn't look like I benefitted from it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Best professor ever since I entered Brandeis! He's a really inspirational and enthusiastic lecturer who explains orgo very well. Definitely go to his office hour, as he'll reexplain the class material until you get it. HARD TESTS, NO CURVE, BE SURE TO PREPARE WELL. (Also remember to check his online wedding webpage and twitter pages out lol)

He's a very caring professor, but I think he has too much hope for our retention of the material in such a short span of time. I always think I understand the material until we do a test and we're expected to piece many pieces of organic chemistry together, which is understandable, but not when we have a test and a final exam a week apart! :(
Generally a good class, but his tests are hard

He is an amazing professor and explains things very well. However, he does not really understand the course load of this class. Our third test and our cumulative final test were a week apart and during this week we had tons of new materials introduced to us. He was an MIT genius but not everyone is.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: He helps student understand the question step by step. In office hour, he will push you to the correct path on solving the questions. Also, he's always there to help student better! To this day he's one of the best professors I've ever met Go! Pensive Cat!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing professor! You can tell her is passionate! He is always available for questions before during and after lecture. Has lots of office hours! Explains organic chem suppppperrr well!

Very nice, was the only one of my professors to automatically call me by my preferred name just based off my email signature and reached out to me when he noticed I had started missing class. His lectures are a bit long-winded and I didn't do very well on his tests, although that was likely because I was a psych/history major in honors chem.
Solid choice. Very nice professor, but sometimes explains things more than he has to (in a bad way). Spectroscopy reports were pretty hard, but TAs are willing to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a great professor. The materials covered in this course are difficult but he does his best with explaining it (provides many great examples + very helpful during office hours). You can tell he really cares about his students learning the material.
The readings and discussions in Gordie's class inspired me to change how I think about the world. What more is there to say? Thank you, Gordie!

TA based class but he chooses great ones (most undergrad). Show that you care through papers & group discussions and you'll be fine. Interesting material and students really admire Prof. Fellman. Topics are engaging, lectures can be quite long, bland, & he tends to repeat himself but he's caring and the material is interesting. Books not all needed

Earns raves by currying favor with lefty students. Actually glib. Piles one commonplace assertion atop another. Relishes posing as  intellectual provocateur. But can not tolerate contradiction. Flies into a rage and resorts to ad hominem attack if persistently challenged. Assume student debt to study with this guy? Money down the drain!
Gordie is phenomenal. Probably one of the most empathetic human beings I've ever met.  He has a huge influence on his students, and it's definitely a profoundly good influence.
An incredible and inspirational professor.  He completely changed my freshman year of college.

mind-opening prof.  truly forces you to question your every belief. frustrating when you realize it should be "war and no/little possibilities of peace" in no time. he makes students frustrated by status quo, but it is an amazing experience to question everything and reconsider if/how you can be a consciously peaceful being in this world of hatred.

Gordie is an amazing professor an all-around good guy.  He is the ultimate prof in that doesn't force rote memorization, but rather forces you to struggle with your own presuppositions and biases, even if you agree with him (which is probably why a lot of people can find his class frustrating).  Just have an open mind and be willing to ask WHY?

Terrible teacher, I didn't learn a thing other than ultra leftist talking points.  Constantly bashed anyother opinion than his own and offered no logical ideas to affect change.  His assignments make no sense and are required to be done in groups which don't yield themselves at all. STAY AWAY, Most Overrated Teacher at Brandeis.

Gordie is a good and interesting professor. I'd recommend taking one of his classes in your time at Brandeis. He may be a bit overrated, but I did learn a good amount from his classes and I enjoyed the layout and partnered paper writing.

Hey Gordy, the 60s ended 35 years ago.  Seriously, I'm a liberal but all this guy does is rant about his political viewpoints which have not been updated since he entered the ivory tower.  Give this guy 5 years actually working for a living and then let him teach ago.
Facinating class and wonderful educator (and person!)  Gordie is a real gem!
No Comments

If you hug trees, walk around barefoot..grow your leg hairs REALLY LONG..or are an all around hippy..THIS IS YOUR MAN.  He's got great insight into everything from global warming to why blacks hate whites.  Remember this guy was boys with Morrie, from "Tuesdays with Morrie"..I would take him for whatever course he's teaching..he makes a muther****er read alot which is good, I guess. He knows a thing or two about Barbara Eirenreich and that bunch.
