He's one of those teachers you just HAVE to take no matter what your major is. You don't have to agree with him, but at least think about what he suggests.

Most OVERRATED PROFESSOR AT BRANDEIS!!  Spent way too much time selling his political viewpoints, regardless of its relevance to subject matter.  And this is coming from someone who is just as liberal/left wing as him.  If he ever had "it," Gordie's lost "it."
Not a bad professor if you agree with him. He is very liberal and he tends to treat students who are not as left-leaning as he is badly.
Best Professor I have had at Brandeis.  If you get a chance to take a class with Gordie do it!  He's awesome!!!
No Comments

Unfortunately the only thing I can say about Professor Sarna is that he is a lazy past his prime old man that regularly fell asleep during students presentations. It was not unusual for him to literally snore during class and wake himself up. He was regularly rude or demeaning to students and I would never take a class with him again.

Some reviews say he's boring but I really found him super interesting. I probably learned more in this class than in any other this semester, and it's probably one of my top classes at Brandeis so far. I would absolutely take him again, he's a sweet old guy and just knows SO much that it makes the class really engaging. Not a super harsh grader.

Professor Sarna's lectures are fascinating! His insights about history and the world made me see things differently. Grading is not harsh, and if you apply yourself, you'll do fine in this course. He is available outside of class, and goes out of his way to help struggling students. If you're interested in Jewish history, you'll love his classes,

Sarna is a delight. A brilliant scholar and a funny man. I loved listening to him lecture.  He also doesn't grade harshly. On my midterm paper I got an A- even though I fell short in page count and only had two sources.
Brilliant, brillant man. Proud to have him as a teacher
Boring, monotone - although brilliant, this does not translate into good teaching.
He's clearly a brilliant guy, and I found his class to be very interesting!  He's nice and funny in his own quirky way, and I deffinatly think its worth it to take at least one class with him!
Knows everything.  Available to talk outside of class.  Not only interested in listening to himself talk. The leading scholar in his field.
My favorite professor at Brandeis!  Wonderful teacher, expert in his field, enthusiastic.  Take his classes!
Sarna is great. Brilliant guy and I learned so much from his class.

Absolutely wondeful! One of the best professors you'll ever have! Great emailer. Genuinely cares about his students. I was Prof. Sarna's student about five years ago, and to this day, I keep in touch with him.
boring class, not a nice guy at all.
BORING -- however very informative if you can get past Sarna's speech - it's hard to understand at best!
so boring and so hard to pay attention in class.  Don't bother doing the reading because he just says it all again during class
boring class
not as good as he's cracked up to be.  just because he's famous doesn't mean he's a good teacher.
very interesting lectures - involves the entire class-a lot of the readings were boring
Prof. Sarna is AMAZING!  I love his class.  His lectures are very interesting and he involves the whole class, so no one gets left out and gives chances for everyone to get their questions answered.
Professor Weinberg is great! His class is super chill, but he still cares a lot about the work you put in and he expects you to do your best.

credit/no credit class. easily one of the easiest courses ive ever taken; half my class didn't show up half the time and im pretty sure we all passed. super chill and funny guy; classtime was pretty much 100% (lively) group discussion, DONT take if you want a lot of constructive criticism from marc himself. went out to a restaurant for our last day

I love Marc! He is so funny and sweet. I didn't enjoy the pop quizzes, but since the class wasn't graded it wasn't a big deal. I'm pretty sure I failed most of the pop quizzes, but I still did well in the class either way.   He's very passionate about screenplay AND about teaching, which makes him an impressive lecturer.
Really awesome guy!

Professor Weinberg = the most awesome teacher. He's funny and sometimes lewd but he makes even the dullest of the intro to film material seem fun. Great films and mini-skits, I could never wait to get to class. Material is pretty easy but I really just went for Weinbergs antics. HIGHLY recommend

Marc Weinberg is a frickin hilarious guy and he truly shows a passion and sincere love for films. He always tries to keep you interested and every once in awhile he will spring something quirky on you. His class is a little heavy on the "clips" but it's a film class so I guess it's warranted. There is not a ton of work so grades are not predictable

Marc is absolutely brilliant. Two class periods in and he had already convinced me to become a Film major; his lectures are informative and fun, and his passion for Film really translates to a good class experience. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Dont buy the book everything is on ppt. Dont email him-he never responds. See the TA-shes really helpful (gives good feedback/ideas on papers) Lectures are fun but too many movie clips n lights off are bad combo. Learned cool movie facts. Wasn't as easy as even Marc made it out to be. Only got an A-
He's a great guy. Had lots of fun in the class. Marc is always willing to help you out. I didn't use the textbook at all, though, since all the information was on his slides.
Film100A is the best class I have taken at Brandeis. Marc Weinberg is a genius, and makes you work for an A.
Love this class! Discussions are always fun and informative and he is so enthusiastic about his subject that its contagious!
The self-proclaimed Fearless Leader.
The mother-****ing-shit-man.
He's the cat's pajamas!
I'm not writing this because he told us to... I'm writing because he's the MUTHA****IN MAN!
No Comments
This is one of my favorite classes so far. I didn't know much of anything about the subnect matter, but he is clear enoguh that it didn't matter. And he's alwasy willing to accomodate.
No Comments

Very repetitive, but I did learn some things. A few years ago this may have been an easy class, but Woll now takes attendance and he uses a TA to grade assignments (who can be quite picky). He is an extremely friendly teacher though!
Took all 4 classes he teaches. I would say "show up, pass" except it's more like "don't show up, still pass".

Woll is by far one of the sweetest professors at Brandeis. He does go off topic but he is so knowledgeable and funny! If you go to class and pay attention  at the review sessions before the midterm and final you will get an A. He also loves if you speak in class or email him! Highly recommend.
Start to memorize the powerpoints he sends out in the midterm and final review guides a few days before each exam, and you will do fine.
Rambles on about irrelevant topics and issues.

Not exactly helpful, let us out too early all the time, so you're not really getting what you paid for, incredibly overrated. Sitting through his lecture is kinda like reading through an endless high school essay that has no structure.
He was horrible. I took this class thinking he was a good teacher. He doesn't even know what he's talking about.

I took Con Law. Woll is very nice and it's definitely and easy class. The readings are good and the class goes slowly so you learn and remember everything. He's available for help in office hours. Class gets  repetitive but if you stay focused you can retain a lot. straightforward midterm and final.
great guy, interesting class, a lot of reading--but easy midterm/final with limited studying

Basically you have to be in a coma to not get an A in this guy's class. I have taken two of his classes and have literally gone to 7 lectures combined for both classes, yet recieved A's in both of them. Read the power points and maybe the books. Nice guy, knowledgable, horrible lecturer.
Great Class!  Great teacher!  Very Interesting!

woll's intro to american gov lectures are available online along with his powerpoint presentations, making it difficult to get out of bed and listen to him speak for an hour. on top of that, while he is very educated on the history of american government, he seems to have trouble expressing it in an interesting way.
Everybody loves this guy!
simply the best.
Can't ask for a better professor!  Too bad he only teaches four courses.  Now I have to find a new professor.
One of the great experts on politics in this country---an outstanding lecturer and a genuinely caring professor.
Amazing lecturer, brilliant guy...belives it's his mission to bring law school to undergrads.  Great courses!!
reminds me of my grandfather

Prof Gutchess is great! I think she gets a lot of mixed reviews for intro psych bc learning and memory is her forte. In NPSY 28a she's really engaged and creates a lot of interesting discussions while using techniques to keep people engaged. It's definitely lecture heavy but still pretty easy to keep up with. One of my favorites!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I took this class to fulfil my psych major requirement. Gutchess is a fine professor and that's where it ends. She thinks her speaking fast is the problem that many students have with her, but in reality, it's not that. Her lectures are boring, she could do so much more to make them engaging and she tries but miserably fails.
Lectures are boring but tests arent too bad. Just straight memorization.
Gutchess is really nice. She talks fast but after the first few classes it is easy to keep up. Her lectures are interesting and involved and the tests are based directly off the lecture slides.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Even though she gave the appearance of trying, when asked questions about what she was teaching in class, she wouldn't know the answer and would poll the class. She also clearly doesn't know how to lecture, as she would rush through her lectures to try and cover a set amount of material, often skipping vital information to understanding concepts.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Her score above is very misleading. Although she has the potential to be a good teacher, she is extremely lazy. She makes her tests before teaching the material, and then will skip over concepts and vocabulary on the test and expects you to know them without telling you. What she doesn't skip over she races through to cover everything.

Loved this class! It's really fun and interactive, super easy too! You will definitely pass if you study and understand the lectures, though you will need to read the textbook if you want to ace the exams. She's a very fast speaker but if you ask her to slow it down it'll be all good! Overall, it's a really fun class and an easy A for sure.

Her tests are written weirdly. Depending on the TAs. But she herself is really cool. Go to office hours! She knows a lot and really REALLY cares. I did not realize how successful and experienced she is. Great woman. Sometimes her lectures are not 100 percent clear but ask questions. She will know you by name if you do!

Speaks very quickly, but you can focus on the slides (at least 80 percent of stuffs in tests are from the slides, so you seldom need the textbook) You have to memorize many terms before every mid-term (can be a lot for especially international students) but for each term, just understand it.
Great!

She is extremely nice and helpful, she is fun and her classes are very interesting. Reasonable homework. Uses blackboard and is strict about due date. Take her, you will love her classes even though it is hard to concentrate on what she says because she is so hot.

Incredibly easy to the point where I wished I would have to think a little bit.  Also, taking attendance in this class was a bit silly.  Overall, I enjoyed the class as she was a great lecturer and reading the book and doing the quizzes at the end of each chapter was enough to ensure a good grade.
Such a great professor. Intro to Psych lectures are interesting and engaging. She definitely makes herself available to her students. This was a great class.

She is very helpful, and the class is very straight forward if you come to class, use the textbook, and her power points.  She tries hard to help people do well and be as clrea as possible. The class has easy access to the TAs.

In her intro class, you don't have to do any of the readings if you pay attention. Also be sure to take her powerpoints from LATTE and bring them to class instead of writing down everything she says, because it's all on there. She'll tell you what to read in the textbook that she didn't cover in class.

I would call this class an easy-A but having reflected, I realize that I spent lots of time reading the text book, taking notes, and came to every lecture. So...if you read the book, it's a breeze. Her PPTs are actually quite helpful in highlighting important material. Also, she's funny, modern, and engaging! So much fun! PS. come to class.
interesting,fun, interactive, fast paced class, but slides are a little confusing

she makes the class fun and she's really nice and helpful. she loves psych and loves teaching it. always available for help and questions, puts class notes online and makes study guides for exams and puts them online too. great teacher.
Keith Plaster is a great professor. He explains things very clearly in his lectures, and is happy to help people one on one.
Tough class, good professor.
Hard class that touches a lot of linguistic subjects. Good professor.

The way KP says “yeahhhhh!” and “nooo…. noo….” is iconic and contagious. Lectures are helpful, phonetics is pretty straightforward, but some of the exam questions in phonology felt like he had lifted them from the LSAT and added linguistics flavor to them. Very accessible outside of class if something needs clarification.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He's an ex-lawyer who can't give clear instructions and will argue with you about it. Knowing how he wants you to answer a question requires mind reading powers; he doesn't know what his enigmatic rubric means either, if he has one. Heard he used to be better but went downhill. Go to OH, skim the readings, and ally against him with your classmates.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: The guidelines for homework were not communicated clearly, and grading criteria for tests was equally cryptic. A lot of openings for class discussion (sometimes allowed to go on for longer than is arguably reasonable), though if he disagrees with a student, he often insists that they are wrong (including difficulty of his formatting guidelines).

Very nice prof! broad content. prof lectures slowly and repeats things the following lecture. gives a list of things to know for exams. very accessible by email and OH. class is mandatory. put in the work and you'll get an A.

Take this class if you're interested in linguistics but it's NOT easy A. Plaster is intelligent and passionate and try to go to all of his office hours if you can. OH is a great way for me to fully understand the materials. Lecture heavy and you do need to put in a lot of effort.

thought this class would be interesting but the prof and TAs are such harsh graders. definitely don't consider as a "fun" class. also the other students in my class were so annoying, the typical socially inept people you find at brandeis. didn't know when to shut up.

good parts are that Plaster is very intelligent/passionate
He's an awesome professor, but you have a lot of homework. Also, GO TO ALL OFFICE HOURS! You will not regret it.

Professor Plaster got me hooked on Linguistics. The class was organized and each lecture was interesting. The homework assignments are time consuming and tedious (specifically when you are getting used to the IPA, syntax trees, etc), and he marks off for small mistakes, but he is very accessible and there to help.
I'm not a linguistics major but I'm so glad I got to take a class with KP. Amazing lecturer, great sense of humor, super engaging. Would highly recommend to anyone.
KP is an amazing Professor! Even though the course was hard, he managed to make us feel as if the course was very easy. One of the best educators I have ever met.

so kind, helpful, and such a good teacher in general. I found linguistics a little challenging but he was such a good teacher, I was able to catch up. I really enjoyed the class. Sometimes does exit tickets to see who's in class so be aware of not skipping too much. Makes slides available but does a lot of work on the board - no computers allowed
Nice, amazing guy, great teacher, makes everything easy to understand, very patient and willing to help, grades pretty easily.
really funny, passionate even in intro to ling, willing to work with you and help you with anything. easily the most engaging professor i've met.

Course: Phonology II: Optimality Theory Professor Plaster is engaging and always willing to go in-depth on specific topics as well as go over anything students don't understand or are having difficulty with. Lectures are entertaining and informative, and you will leave a Plaster class having learned a lot. Always willing to meet with students.

Incredible lecturer, answers questions super clearly. Also just a genuinely nice guy who makes you love linguistics as much as he does. Really glad he teaches intro. Gives a very reasonable workload, moves through topics at a fast but manageable pace, leaves you feeling like you learned a ton (because you did).
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Possibly the best lecturer in ling. respects the fact that you have a life/other classes but you will still learn a ton, always answers questions clearly. take his class!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is an amazing lecturer and professor. Her class made an improvement in my french in 3 months that four years of high school couldn't do. The class may require time to fully comprehend the themes taken on the course however professor harder is always available for help and is incredibly kind and willing to go the extra mile for her students

Very sweet human who is sensitive to the needs of her students. I always felt I could talk to her and her tests are open-ended enough so that you don't need to be an expert on everything to do well. I feel that the flipped-classroom model works well for the most part. I was nervous to skip FREN 32 to take the 104 level but it was worth it :)

Honestly, Professor Harder was one of the best teachers I had this semester. She's a very nice, helpful woman. If you are having any trouble she'll gladly have a sit-down talk with you and answer all your questions. You just need to show a little effort and actually care and attend classes to get a good grade.

Professor Harder gets a mixed reputation, but the truth is that she responds strongly to students who show interest or enthusiasm for the subject. What she can't stand is students who grub for their grade or have a bad attitude towards the class. She puts a lot of effort into her class and appreciates those who appreciate her. I think she's great.

She was a great professor, in my opinion. The best I had of the semester, I don't see why people say she's mean- I think she's great. In fact, i would recommend her courses in a second. She's fun and very human, willing to help you, and just overall a good person.
She is a very sweet woman and has helped me tremendously with my French. I'm not sure what other people are saying about her being mean or not a good teacher, because I just don't see it.
-sometimes moody but really tries to meet the student half-way and is creative with planning

despite the fact that she is cool simply for having a**** star name, i got very very little out of her class...she's a tough grader, and not very enthused about what she's teaching...maybe she needs to teach more upper level french classes

She was a horrible grader and did not explain her grades. She was mean and had grudges against student. Also she had her favorite students who she would always give A's to. She was overall a horrrible professor.

she's a really nice person, always genial, very friendly with all the students, just not a very good teacher. she tried very hard to do things that were useful but it never really worked and her tests tend to be odd....
This class was awful!  She is very strict, gives too much work, and grades unnecessarily hard for a USEM.  She is very intimidating and a generally unpleasant person.
She is great- very helpful and enthusiastic!  Just because she tries to get the class involved does not mean that she is a bad teacher.  Weren't you in the class to *practice and learn French*??
well, when your tests dont correlate to the excerises done in class.....
seems like a strict teacher, she's hard on people, expects them to speak french in the beginning even if they don't know what is going on. She is touh, unpleasant.

I love Prof. Harder! I don't what these other people are talking about. She was always available for me, and if the class didn't understand something, she would say the whole thing over in English. Honestly, what other Prof says Groovy on a regular basis&
Lots of work, and she grades pretty hard.
She's the least helpful professor I had in four years. If you don't already know French, don't bother with her...
She is the best French teacher I have ever had in my 7 yrs of studying French! She made it such a fun class!
Very bad professor who doesn't prepare his own powerpoint. He will just read connect. When you email question to him, his answer is irrelevant. DONT CHOOSE HIS CLASS.

My interest in accounting was destroyed by this class. The professor basically just read the slides out and assigned works. And there are no review packets before every exam and you need to ask specifically to get oral review instructions. If you aren't very good at self-learning, you better take another class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Angell was a great lecturer and based the speed of the course on how the class was learning and managing the material. He found guests to come speak to us about their experiences in accounting and gave us good recommendations to study for exams. Do your work and you will do great!

Although professor Robert is very caring, his class is painfully hard to manage. My interest in accounting was destroyed during his class since I cannot ask the questions I am confused about. Not recommend. I asked him during his office hours about some questions to understand more about the intuition, and he said just apply the formula.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: His class is honestly not too bad if you do all the readings and homeworks on your own. He genuinely cares about his students and how they do but only to the extent that he will push you to do the work required or tell you to drop out.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: This class is one of the 'weed-out' classes you have to take in order to take further business classes, and there's no doubt it's difficult (and not super interesting). That said, Prof. Angell did his best to make the material engaging and understandable. He was also very accommodating during the coronavirus crisis; he really cares about his kids.

Lots of people told me bus6 was a pain, but Prof. Angell made it so engaging with amazing lectures and lots of student participation. Even though he is a tough grader, he is always fair and cares about whether we understand the material. I originally wanted to take this for econ lower elective but now I want to major in business bc of this class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Extremely useless teacher. Flies by his powerpoints in class and expects students to know everything through the readings.. doesn't go in depth during lectures. All those other reviews prior to mine are full of..
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor Angell makes class interesting and really cares about his students

He is a great professor who truly wants to see the best from his students. He is a tough teacher, but you can tell he really wants his students to understand financial accounting and succeed in it. Very tough tests - tries to trick you all the time!

I loved taking this class with Professor Angell. It is always great to see that a professor loves to encourage and see the growth in his students. He made Financial Accounting so much more bearable because of his humor. It is a difficult class, but if I took it again my only choice would be with Professor Angell.

Class is a real pain to deal with. Angell makes it tolerable and is quite funny. Class is interactive but sometimes rushed. Lots of hard homework-doesnt prepare for test. He won't help with the final project at all. Need to do all reading BEFORE its covered in class and need to do tons of practice if you want to do well.He's the one to take it with

Professor Angell makes a tough subject (Financial Accounting)understandable. You must do the homework or you will fall behind and not do well on either the mid-term or your final. He is very patient and takes the time to explain financial accounting in plain English!

He's a great guy and really makes an effort to connect with his students. Definitely wants to see his students succeed. If the material comes more naturally to you, the lectures don't teach much that the book does not. His exams throw some curveballs (he tests you on a lot of exceptions) but he's also very good with partial credit.

He is a really nice guy, but his lectures did get pretty boring. He was also really accessible and since I never understood anything I pretty much lived in his office hours. He grades homeworks with A's for effort, so that's pretty sweet...

If you attend class and do your homework it's pretty straight forward. Important to be able to stay on top of your work, cramming isn't really an option. He makes an effort to keep the class interesting.
Excellent professor, explains GAAP well. As long as you study you'll get a ton out of the class.
Extremely strict with his grading! I wouldnt recommend him to anyone.

He is super, super, super nice, and his lectures are fascinating. Many students will take both 147a and 147b because he is perfect at teaching. You will get an A if you make some effort on exams(open book). Presentations can be well-prepared if you meet him before. Best Professor at Brandeis, the rating should be 5+/5.
Professor Freeze is not a difficult professor. You will get a good grade as long as you put in the effort. He could be better at lecturing though.

Not a super personable guy, a bit bland, but very clearly knows what he's talking about. His lectures are great and he posts them on LATTE ahead of time, along with an outline and a couple sentences on the main points of each class. Homework requires A LOT of reading and some movies, but it's pretty easy to get avoid most it if you run out of time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Nice teacher and lenient grader. He might speak unclearly sometimes but most of time the lectures and slides are well-organized. Paying attention to the lecture and taking detailed notes, finishing the gridsheet based on notes (its fine to not do all readings) and attending the discussion session and taking TAs notes, it is not hard to get A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Freeze is one of the few professors left that actually just care that you learn, not about the grading. If you communicate with him if you struggle, he will make it work as long as you show you care and are learning. I enjoyed all of the material, and felt like the assignments helped me reflect that. As long as you do your part, A!

He knows a lot, and can talk about Russian history or politics with more nuance and objectivity than anyone other person I've met from his generation. Most of the class is him lecturing but I didn't find it boring. Once-weekly discussions were somewhat repetitive. Very reasonable and empathetic when it comes to giving extensions, unlike some profs.
As long as you pay attention to the lectures and do the assignments, it's not hard to get an A.

He may not be the most stimulating lecturer, but if you take advantage of all the readings he gives you and really jump in you'll learn a lot. I had absolutely no experience with the subject beforehand, and at times I felt like I was at a serious disadvantage because of it. But then again, I didn't do all the readings. Work hard and you'll do well.

-lots to read for this course but it's what you make of itbased on your need so not all of it is necessary -Freeze works hard to help students do well. Extra help is there if you want or need it and he will make the effort to aid students with study sessions.  -really interesting to chat with -TA (just 1) did gradingdiscussions but he was great
LOVE Professor Freeze!! So smart, and obviously cares a great deal about his classes. Sometimes he repeats things, but it only helps you take better notes!

I took his class on Russian history. I thought Freeze was an excellent professor who was extremely knowledgeable and engaging on the subject. His tests and essay subjects were very well thought out, and he graded them reasonably. I was surprised, however when my grade turned out to be lower than I expected; maybe he curved them down?
best teacher ever.

Really loved his class. Very funny and entertaining. It probably wasn't necessary to go to every lecture, but it was one of the few classes I looked forward too every week. He really knows his stuff. Very modest, but has so much world experience.

If you just analyze Freeze based on his in-class lectures, you definitely won't be impressed. But he really shows how awesome he is when you talk to him outside the classroom or attend his office hours. I had never spoken to him in my life but he knew my name, year, and major. He's much more observant of his classes than you would think.

This class is so interesting. Professor Freeze is very smart and he knows what he is talking about but he is not always clear. He is always trying to be funny and you don't really have to go to all of the lectures in order to get a good grade.
Definitely knows his stuff, and clearly very intelligent, but hard to understand sometimes. Not the most riveting lecturer
Amazing! This guy knows EVERYTHING. Never thought I could learn so much from a leftie. Very demanding course, but worth it!
I can't believe that the reviewer before me thinks that King is heterosexual.  Really.

I can't say enough about TK. I hit a deep depression, and he let me turn in my papers WEEKS late and only took off 3-5 points. He was supportive and gave great feedback on my previous papers. He's also very aware of his status as a cishet white man, and he allowed Jewish, Black, gay, and female students to take the lead on many conversations.

I'm so glad I took took this class! Prof. King is very accessible and willing to help students with the assignments (which can definitely seem daunting, since it's a writing intensive). He loves Shakespeare and has so much knowledge about the plays, but he doesn't seems overly pretentious, just genuinely excited. I loved this course!

TK is the kindest, most supportive man. He only wants his students to learn and discuss their ideas!! He is a pretty easy grader, if you read the books and can form just one or two original thoughts you will get an A. If you are struggling, he is a big help in his office hours. I always looked forward to class, but his lectures can sometimes go on.

SUCH a lovely human being. Cares so deeply for all students and his lessons. It is inspiring and beautiful. Unfortunately, this enthusiasm is not contagious. It is a difficult class to sit through, and you MUST genuinely enjoy the readings to have much interest in the course.

Prof. King is easily one of the best Professors at Brandeis. Although he might not get to all the class material planned, he is an outstanding lecturer, a thoughtful professor, and a kind teacher. He is also incredibly receptive to the ideas of his students and really works to shape the class around them. Not to mention his amazing sense of style.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor King is a super nice guy and very interesting as well. He knows what he is doing and he knows the subject matter like the back of his hand. However, if you don't have a strong interest in the subject and you don't already know a good amount about it then his class might not be for you. You're expected to know a lot. It's a challenge.

If you take a class with King, make sure it's something you're interested in.  It's a little difficult to pay attention if you're not into the subject.  He ends up saying "um" and "uh" a lot. However, he is a truly fantastic professor, really cares about his students, and has very interesting points of view.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

I LOVE tking, he is an amazing professor and a very kind, gentle person. he will totally change the way you look at anything you read in one of his classes. I've had a course with him every semester the past three, being in his class is a pleasure.

There are many people at Brandeis who felel that a class with King was their most influential.  He will push you to become a much better scholar.  His commitment to pedagogy is amazing. Not for the weak of academic will (A's do not come easy in his class). But you'll get one of the most rigorous tours through theory at deis.  And he's cute.
I learned the subject well, even though we raced through about fifteen plays.  Well chosen secondary material.  Great class discussions.

I learned so much in King's class.  His lectures cover all sorts of things and really make you think.  I loved his class and actually enjoyed the readings, theory, & assignments.  Also, yes, he's very attractive and he has his own fan club/cult following.

Professor King is a marvelous instructor.  He brings passion and energy to the material he teaches and really helps his students to approach literature in the proper manner so that they can learn to write clear and concise papers.
Interesting class, though too theoretical.  Hes a hardass about writing, reading, and discussions.  Sticks very strictly to his plans and lectures.  Good looking man.
Brilliant historian, the best conduit between academia and popular American history today.

The class was a pleasant experience: lots of facts and anecdotes about the time period. Interesting man, but the TA's were hits and misses. Be wary of them taking this class, but other than that, the class was superb.
Holds your attention with anecdotes that are like the most exciting movie or book.  fantastic lecturer

Best Professor & lecturer I have ever had, also took American Revolution and Slavery and Civil War.  Very balanced and knowledgeable, anyone remotely interested in history or WWII should take his class.  Requires effort, but if you do the reading and go to class you will do well and learn and retain more than you ever thought you would.

Best Professor at Brandeis, teaches three main classes: American Revolution, Slavery and the Civil War, and WW II, all excellent if you are interested in History.  They are difficult classes with lots of reading, but he is incredibly knowledgeable and always provides multiple interpretations of events.  Best Professor & lecturer I have ever had.
Best Professor at Brandeis.  Difficult class with lots of reading, but he is incredibly knowledgeable and always provides multiple interpretations of events.  Best Professor I have ever had.

any professor who can, in a history lecture, incorporate an explanation of the second derivative (complete with a graph and an explanation of acceleration) to describe historical change is ok in my book. really fantastic lecturer. lives up to and exceeds the hype.

This is an amazing professor. THe hype is actually true with Prof. Fischer. He is a great lecturer and seems to truly care about/help students. Occasionally there is a bit too much reading, but the positives far outweigh any few negatives. Lastly, he was very accomadating to students, having some office hours even on Sundays
He's fantastic. Best Prof at Brandeis
I had him for a couple of classes.  I love his books, and the classes were pretty interesting.
Professor fischer is the best professor EVER!!!

David Fischer is a genius in the old school form.  He can connect economics, statistics, geology, climatology, archaeology and history in one lesson.  No one knows everything, be he comes darn close.  His books can be very dry.

so after 4 classes with him, it was not as much fun as it used to be.  but he has such a passion for history and the subjects he's talking about that he made it exciting for me.  my favorite class was slavery and the civil war.
I thought he was fantastic, so interesting, difficult at times, picky, knows what he wants, has a presence about him but not arrogant, makes you read books that he wrote
Quite simply, the best teacher I've ever had.  Not the least bit arrogant at all.  A professor who really loves his work, and it shows.

arrogant ****. yes, he knows much about early america, but he won't accept different opinions. plus, in  fire and ice  he sometimes said stuff that was plain wrong. be careful, simpy b/c he has a reputation doesn't mean he's a good teacher.

He's one of the most amazing professors in the school. Last rater doesn't know what he's talking about. He was recently given the title of University Professor, which is reserved for the best professors in the school.

Great class with good structure and reasonable grading policies, professor is very supportive, and does her best to make the lectures meaningful. Class is like seminar style, required to attend and will get the most out of the class if you dive deep into the assigned readings

Lots of readings. you dont need to do them to do well in the class. You have a one time use for an extension whenever you want which is nice. only 3 papers the whole semester. if you dont mind skipping readings (which you will be fine if u skip) the workload is light. This was my back burner class.

She's fine. Im not an ANTH person and don't care for the topic, but for what it was she did a good job. Beware SUPER transparent of her political opinion. If you get annoyed by crazy woke liberals stay away! I lied my way through a paper and felt I only did well because I wrote what SHE wanted. I never felt comfortable voicing my opinion in class.

Professor Ferry is passionate and accommodating. There is a lot of reading, but it makes the lectures all the more worthwhile. Attendance was haphazardly taken and if you happen to miss a class, all the in-class materials are posted on LATTE. You do miss out on the valuable discussion points though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: The good thing about ferry is that she has an incredibly lenient extension policy. (maybe this was covid related) as long as you emailed at least 24 hours ahead of a deadline she would usually grant an extension. there is a lot of reading tho, like crazy amounts and most of the papers done in the class/midtems/assignments are related to the reading
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Nice teacher. Her slides are well-organized but lectures are a little boring... Readings a lot but doable, and the majority are interesting. Must do the readings or youll lose in lectures and fail reading quizzes. Not a hard grader and most of time she gives you a satisfying grade as long as you show efforts in papers/exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Ferry is amazing! I would recommend Anthropology of power and violence to anyone interested in social theory.

Professor Ferry is a nice person, but her lectures bored me to death and I could not stop staring at the clock.  She did not give clear grading criteria at all which made papers extremely difficult to write not knowing what she was looking for in them.  The assignment for the final paper was vague since she does not give any suggestions of topics.

While she was friendly, I would NOT recommend her as a professor. Our class was purely discussion-based, and I ended up learning more about my fellow students' family life than the subject itself. I felt that this class was a huge waste of time and money. Also her assignments were unclear and often didn't reflect the little bit we were taught.
Dr. Ferry's SAT scores are most likely better than mine are and "Return to Laughter," a book she assigned, was good.  Sorry.

Prof. Ferry is one of the most amazing professors at Brandies. She is kind, knows her stuff, and makes every lecture interesting! You have to work in the class to get the most out of it, but if you do the readings you will love it!

Elizabeth Ferry is a wonderful professor! She made the topic interesting and is very approachable and helpful. She's completely understanding regarding extensions on papers and I never felt that the lectures were boring. I was engaged in discussion and felt comfortable participating. Definitely one of my favorites!
OK, so I like Prof. Ferry, but, I am not impressed by her teaching style.  Anth Inq. sucks, but all of the anth req. are made to blow!

Great class. Interesting topic.  Lot of reading.  Grades papers fairly.  Allows you to submit your papers early so she can revise them and make suggestions.  I would suggest that you have a general background in Anthro before you take this class, although it is not necessary.

Elizabeth Emma Ferry is one of the most helpful professors I've ever had. She's incredibly nice and funny and always available for guidance, even when she doesn't have office hours. I am not an anthro student and had not taken an anthro class before (nor since), but I would love to take another course with Ferry. She really did make anthro fun.
No Comments
No Comments

Everyone fears organic chemistry. Pontrello explained everything step by step, making you understand why everything happens, so you are not left to memorize a million mechanisms. His lectures were always compelling. He was extremely organized and clear. He provided practice problems from previous years' exams that SAVED me. Best professor I've had.
Dr. Pontrello is incredible at what he does. His perennial spirit of adventure towards teaching and research is laudable.
I never thought I'd miss orgo, but I will. Pontrello's dedication is pretty amazing, and if you put forth the same amount of effort as a student you'll do well. Love this class
great at what he does

Dr. Pontrello is a fantastic and passionate teacher who cares so much about his students. He holds more office hours than could ever be needed. He also incorporates real life examples into the class material so that his students can see the application of the topics they are learning. Overall, an amazing professor and mentor!
Pontrello is the man. That is all.

All the good things everyone else wrote are completely true. He was amazing, and had like 5 hour long office hours EVERY DAY and would still stay late if you still had questions. He was a great teacher, tests are hard but very fair, and always gives partial credit. And he's very hot.

BEST professor I have ever taken a class with... Pontrello explains everything very clearly and if you still dont understand, he will take his time and explain even further. His exams are actually very easy if you understand the key points instead of just memorizing the mechanisms. His practice exams are exactly like real tests, so utilize them!!

I've taken all of the Pre-Med, and many Bio and Neuro courses at Brandeis, and out of every professor I ever had, Jason Pontrello was hands down the best. Exams are difficult, but you can usually argue a point or two back. Go to office hours, they're incredibly helpful. If you write down everything he writes down, you'll be prepared for the tests.

Dr. Pontrello is incredible. His teaching style is excellent, and he transforms organic chemistry from an intimidating class to an much more manageable class. The material is intense, the tests are challenging but fair, and he will teach from the exact start of class until the exact end of class; no getting out early or starting late with him.

Dr. Pontrello is one of the best professors I have ever had. He unravels what could very easily become confusing into material that is understandable, concise, and clear. Very fair exams, and practice material is usually more difficult than tests (which helps). Because of him I actually like organic chemistry!

I have had Dr. Pontrello for Chem 15B and Chem 25A - he is a phenomenal professor. He clearly cares about his students, is constantly willing to meet outside of class (if you can't manage to find a way into his 8+ office hours a week), provides students with a comprehensive understanding of Chemistry. Attending lecture is a MUST.
One of the best lecturers I have had. He makes organic chemistry meaningful enjoyable.

pontrello had incredibly engaging lectures and was clearly interested in his students. Legit, he knew everyone's name for the entire lecture. Also be prepared for resonance, non-bonding electrons, and chalk board drawings done faster than you thought possible.
Dr. Pontrello is accessible, coherent, fair, and respectful. He's all we could ever hope for in a professor...

Amazing Teacher.  He really cares about his students learning.  He is always available either in one of his 20 office hours/week or by email.  Every single things he says he writes on the board, never skips steps, always emphasizes his points.  His tests seem long and hard, but they aren't as long as you prepare, and read the whole question. GREAT

Professor Pontrello is an excellent teacher!  He has about 16 office hours a week and will always help you if you have questions.  He speaks and writes very clearly and budgets his time in lecture effectively.  He makes me love organic chemistry.

Prof Cunningham's Disorders of Childhood class is hands down the best psych class I've ever taken. While most psych profs just teach from the textbook, Prof Cunningham takes a much more subtle, "real-world" approach by allowing us to learn about disorders of childhood from novels, poetry, and our own plays. Lotsssss of hw but its 100% worth it

Professor Cunningham is a great Professor and leads interesting class discussions. I would recommend taking his class. However, I would not recommend going to him for career advice as he is quite discouraging.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Very interested in students, but too intense.
Incredible professor!!!!
prof c is my fave prof at 'deis, and i've loved taking classes with him. i've found him to be so kind, patient and supportive. thanks so much, prof c!

just such a disappointment. I hated his class and thought he had such low expectations  for his students. He doesn't understand that students struggle with the material, even though he acknowledges the class is very difficult

Professor Cunningham just makes me sad. He is so unhelpful it's amazing. I've never met a professor as impatient as him. He has such little respect for his student's ideas, especially when they don't agree with his own. What kind of professor makes students feel stupid for expressing their own opinion?

Professor Cunningham has such little patience for his students. I genuinely feel uncomfortable going to him for extra help because I sincerely feel like he judges me for not knowing everything and for needing clarity. He has high expectations for his students and doesn't understand that they sometimes need a little help. It's sink or swim with him

I find professor c to be extremely unhelpful both outside of class and during class. he appears to have little tolerance when students don't do everything exactly right (it's his way or nothing!) and isn't very receptive to questions asking for clarification.

Professor Joseph Cunningham’s exemplary kindness, thoughtfulness, patience, talents, and expertise make him an extraordinary educator and mentor. He has a very holistic and interactive approach to teaching, and he is extremely supportive both inside and outside the classroom. I highly recommend his classes. Thank you so much, Professor Cunningham!

Wonderful teacher who will get you to personally engage with the material in a way that no other teacher does. Pretty incredible class. Difficult grader with very high expectations and can be tough to get ahold of, but if you have an interest in children/abnormal psych, you need to take this class. Also, attendance is very much mandatory.
Engaging prof. Seems almost uncomfortable in a one on one setting, but knows his stuff.

The actual psych material is not difficult whatsoever and he's one of the easiest graders in the psych dept. But class participation is a must in Disorders. He has you write a script and perform a skit. i wasn't looking forward to it at first, but the play turned out to be kinda fun. Class is once a week. I recommend.

Doesn't have a very high opinion of his students capabilities.  Personally unpleasant. I took Disorders of Childhood and did well in the class, but do not feel like I learned anything. A lot of busywork and not a lot of substance.
An incredible human being and an extraordinary teacher!
No Comments
Disorders of Childhood was the best class EVER. Cunningham is BRILLIANT!  I recommend taking any of his courses.

If possible, I'd recommend choosing a different professor, as she can be condescending and challenging to work with, both in and outside of class. Unfortunately, the psychology department as a whole could use improvement, so keep that in mind when considering courses.

This class was half in person and half online, wherein the majority of the assignments were on moodle and there were mostly just exams and weekly assignments in person, which gets a bit monotonous after a while. the highlight was observing at the lemberg children's center, but that's probably the only remarkable thing about the class.

One thing that really annoyed me and was the only reason I got a B instead of an A is that she will not let you retake quiz 1 or 2 under any circumstance which sucks because you will have to take the cumulative final meaning that 100% of the quiz weight depends on that last final. She's also lowkey acts like your stupid whenever you ask a question.

Going to be honest, this class made me not want to minor in psych. The exams seemed made to confuse you, and she does not give extra credit under any circumstance. The class was only graded on exams, and her lectures were really difficult to understand. The class was a flipped model, which was not helpful and made it harder.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Meh professor. She's just annoying tbh, but only have to go in person once a week. Lots of remote work. Tests are fine, not super easy but also not super challenging if you are familiar with the material. I wouldn't recommend unless you are interested in the topic or need it as a pre-req.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Snyder is a great teacher and gives interesting, easy-to-understand lectures. She uses an inverted class style where she assigns lecture recordings and videos as homework and gives worksheets to complete during class. I really loved this style of teaching and found it really easy to digest.

Extremely organized professor and a great class where I felt like I was always learning. The flipped classroom structure felt very fair as the actual class was only held once a week, and it was nice learning at my own pace. The 40% effort/completion + 60% tests felt reasonable, and the extra credit was appreciated. Highly recommend this course!

Prof. Snyder is awesome class is clear/organized. Lot of material to learn for tests but she has very detailed study guides, review sessions, and chances in class to work with the material. She also provides helpful study tips and chances to retake a test to improve your grade. Thorough, accessible+great lectures! She cares about your success
Most difficult class at Brandeis. Good luck.

Although this is a hybrid class, there is a lot of work. The test accounts for a large proportion of your final grade, so do everything required to have a good grade. She is a strict professor and can be a little bit moody. However, she really wants to help students achieve their goals in the class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: This class was awful. The tests were impossible and covered the most unimportant, obscure things. I cared about the subject before this class, and she made me lose interest. You have to attend class because she assigns pointless group busywork during class time. She did not make me excited to learn and I would never ever take this class again.
A handful of weekly projects, but doing them really helps your grade. The grading criteria was really clear so I knew what my grade was at any given time.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Good luck
Best Psychology professor of the department!

She's nice and encouraging. She has a lot of student resources to do well on exams and tells you exactly what to do to succeed in her class! She's slightly cranky but, she seriously cares for the student's success in the class! Her course and exams are thorough and she has high expectations! Her research is interesting and inspirational

She's really nice and encouraging. She has SEVERAL student support resources to do well on exams and tells you exactly what to do to succeed in her class! She's a bit testy and moody but, she GENUINELY cares for the student's success in the class! Her course and exams are rigorous and she has high expectations! Would definitely take it again!

She's an AMAZING professor but she can get a bit testy and moody which is frustrating to endure. But she's really knowledgeable and helpful and wants the student to succeed and will do what she can to help her students.
She's an amazing professor but she is a bit moody and testy. She's really knowledgeable and willing to help you as much as she can but her mood swings are a bit frustrating to endure

If you read the textbook chapters and attend the lectures you won't have to study much. If you only do one of those things you'll have to study as much as usual. I was disappointed that the class "Developmental Psych" is not based on childhood development but rather almost all based on infant development.
She's great! Provides really prompt feedback and is very willing to help you outside of class with assignments, with life, I swear she'd even help you change your tire if you asked.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Willrich is the greatest lecturer I have every met. He's well organized and very easy to get along with, especially while discussing research paper. But get ready to read and write a lot.

He was condescending and had a know-it-all attitude, obviously this makes him not that easy to approach. He would throw a fit if a student came a minute late. Class starts 9:35, I came 9:30 and set my things down to use the restroom, I came back 9:37, and he gave me a snarky comment as if soooo much information was relayed in 2 minutes.
His crime class is interesting and fun! He is nice!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Although I had previous heard that Professor Willrich was an great professor and was excited and optimistic about taking his class, I am completely disappointed with his lack of understanding and "know it all" attitude towards students. Multiple individuals in my class agree with this statement.

WIllrich is an amazing professor and I think everyone should take a class with him. He is very organized and the lectures are easy to follow. He clearly demonstrates a passion for teaching and I was never bored in his class.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Willrich is awesome, organized, and passionate, and simply changes outlooks. I entered his class a naive student and left it (before coming back for another of his classes) an eager, serious scholar. Of course that entails hard work, but he cares so deeply about you and about the content of his class that it more than pays off.

A must-take for any history or legal studies student. Willrich is perhaps the best lecturer on campus. While he makes you work for your grade and the readings are sometimes long and dense, they are always interesting and the feedback that he gives and attention given to each student is unparalleled. The man is brilliant and a brilliant teacher.

Favorite teacher at Brandeis.  Attendance is a must as is keeping up with the readings (which are mostly very interesting court cases).  By no means an easy A. However the class is extremely rewarding and you'll do well if you put in the effort and go to office hours.  take advantage of the option to turn in a rough draft for your research paper

Great professor who is extremely knowledgable and helpful. I had him for American Legal History II, and he was an engaging lecturer. He expects a lot from students so reading and class participation are essential.

Willrich is inarguably the best professor I've had at Brandeis so far. His lectures are extremely engaging, every class is marked by lively discussion, and he is very helpful in office hours. His class may be challenging, but taking a Willrich class is a rewarding experience. If you work hard, you'll do well. He's a must for any history student.

Great professor, lectures were well organized with outlines handed to the class at the start of each. slightly tough with the grading, but not unfair. Simply a brilliant man, one of the brightest profs ive had, especially for such a young guy.
Willrich is God... what an amazing class, what an amazing lecturer.

so in the classroom he's great and incorporates slides into lectures which is great.  very hard grader, maybe too hard, discouraged my from another class.  as thesis advisor pretty good.  confident in me and my project and excited about where it's going.
No Comments
He is one of the best professors I've had in college.  The combination of well developed and delivered lectures and willingness for discussion made this class a great learning experience for me.

Great professor, really interested in the topics he teaches.  Always supportive and encouraging, although completely honest when work is just not up to par, which, in the long run, is more helpful than not.Extremely approachable, great discussion leader!
lectures like he just came out of law school....boring.....

Adler really was not a good lecturer. Class was recorded so attendance was optional and like 3 out of 30 kids would show up in person. If you go to class you can stop him mid lecture to ask questions which was nice. I think he's retired now so not even sure if this review matters lol.
Drop it unless you don't care about your GPA.
This guy doesn't give a clear grading criteria and his exams and pop up quizzes can be extremely difficult. I wouldn't recommend anyone to take this class with him.
The class is mostly him rambling on about what seems like the same thing every day. If you can read through the nonsense then it's not too difficult, but please don't subject yourself to his lectures

Adler has a monotone voice and does not engage the class during lectures. Thus you might get the sense that he doesn't care about us. However, outside of class, he's a helpful, knowledgeable asset, and he is friendly if you get to know him. I like him personally, but his lectures are so atrocious that I have to knock him down a little.

Worst professor I have ever seen from the Math department. Homework assgiments make no sense. Lots of graphs that are meaningless. This professor does not care about his students. DO NOT TAKE course with him.
Attendance not required, no exams, and homework only make this course extremely easy. Lectures might be boring, but he is ready to help you with your homework during his office hours.

nice professor overall.  Like his teaching style, such as giving his own intuitive  understanding on some of the topics. Can be quite funny sometimes. Although i guess most students are probably beetles in his eyes, his is very tolerant and shows a great deal of understanding for our deficiency in intelligence---easy tests and nice graders
he's an easy grader but you may have difficulties understanding what he is saying!
Excellent nice to students.
great guy!He really takes time to write impeccable notes! loved him!
He is a wise teacher. Homework counts one third of the total score. Only one midtrem. A teacher to recommand

Class was okay but hard to understand.  He was also the biggest **** I've me.  He implied that I was below average when asked for help (I got an A so take that!) and was unhelpful in office hours, saying he couldn't help if I didn't understand the material.  Luckily grade was only on homeworks and no tests.
Good luck staying awake. He is probably one of the driest professors on earth.

Professor Alder is one of the worst professors I have ever had.  He mumbled, was inconsistent and actually made me feel more confused about material that I knew prior to taking his class on Probability and Statistics.  If you want to use your time wisely, do NOT take a class with him.
Great lecturer, very helpful, and made learning fun. He also has a striking resemblance to Roger Moore. A+

Rambling lectures, annoying fixation on certain phrases while lecturing, jumps from one topic to another. Seemed willing to help if needed, though. Also, lax system fo assesment made the class very easy.

i definitely recommend goodhart for intro to IR or POL119. she cares so much about her students and her lectures. definitely one of the best professor at brandeis!! you will learn a lot from her lectures and assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: She talks like Margaret Thatcher.
Professor Goodhart is amazing. Although the lectures are a little long, she teaches with a lot of passion and is very available to students. Get ready for an assignment every week.

Prof. Goodhart is a lovely human and is a great professor as well. Super kind (she'll bring treats for class and tries to let us out a few minutes early). Very lecture based, so I'd recommend going to class and actually taking good notes.

She is so fantastic, easily one of the best professors at Brandeis! Not only is she incredibly knowledgeable, interesting, and engaging, but she is also incredibly kind. She stimulates so much passion and interest in her classes and truly cares about her students and their learning. I've taken two classes with her and can't wait to take more!

Lucy Goodhart is one of the best professors/teachers I've had in my time as a student. She is extremely passionate about what she is teaching and she makes it worth getting out of bed in the morning to go to class. I absolutely recommend anyone who can, take a class with her.

Professor Goodhart is very nice! I don't know if she's the best Brandeis prof like everyone says she is, but I liked the class I took with her and I thought she was a fair grader who was accessible outside of class. She's also funny.

Professor Lucy Goodhart is great!!!!!!
I strongly recommended both her introduction course and seminar (if you want to choose an IGS major). She is a very experienced professor and taught politics and economics before she came to the IGS department. 
There are clear quizzes and midterm reviewing sessions and the responsible TA is very kind!

I have to say Professor Goodhart is the best teacher I've ever had in my education process, she makes me want to dig more Professor like her in Brandeis. She is so nice and willing to give the knowledge to students. I didn't open the book once throughout the semester.

Professor Goodhart is a really kind woman and a great teacher, extremely warm and friendly with her students. IGS 8A was really well organized, pay attention during the lectures and keep up with the problem sets to do well, textbook reading isn't really necessary because the material is covered in the lecture.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: amazing professor super knowledgeable about the content she's teaching and super passionate about helping her students. 10/10 would recommend.

Approachable teacher and reasonable grader. Her lectures are well-organized and you dont have to do readings. Problem sets are a little difficult but you can ask her questions by email and she always replies very quickly. Quizzes and tests are not hard as long as you do the ps carefully. Participation matters. Be prepared to answer her questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Goodhart is one of the best researchers and educators that I have had in my life. She is incredibly kind and will take the extra steps to make sure you understand the material and succeed in class. Make the effort to establish a personal connection with her, it will enrich your time here at Brandeis and beyond.

Great professor, great lectures. A lot of readings, but she will explain them all in class. TFs are very nice. Grading system is very high, it is hard to receive a A but if you work hard at least you will get a A-.

One of the best teachers I've had at Brandeis. Organized lectures, asks insightful questions to get students to think and participate, and is always available outside of class to answer questions. 10/10 would recommend!
humorous, inspiring, helpful, and easy As
The course is engaging and fairly easy if you contribute yourself to it. Prof Goodhart is simply helpful and caring.

This class is designed in a very organised manner. If the reading is done before class, it is really helpful as the teacher moves really quickly with the material. She values participation a lot, and this could be in any form. Since the clarity in her voice is low, and the class is for an hour and a half, it seems too long.

I was studying the night before the final, and 12 hours before the exam he deleted all the homework AND THE REVIEW PROBLEMS from the class website, making it impossible to check my work. His lectures are also unwatchable. It is unclear whether the stuff he's writing is a general rule or specific to the current problem.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Tough professor and difficult class, but Prof. Fell is a great guy in general and really easy going if you get to know him better.

His lectures are beyond deplorable. He taught the intro to electricity and magnetism class with the presumption that everyone already knows the basic concepts, how ironic. The lecture content is a complete tangent from be actual coursedont bother with them and just read the book. He also blames things on students when its clearly his fault.

He devote his time on teaching, but, unfortunately, he did a bad job. I learned all the stuff by reading notes from Caltech and learned almost nothing from his lectures. He has no idea what is the most fascinating and important thing in classical mechanics. For ex: I cannot imagine a classical mechanics course without symmetry and Noether theorem.

Hard lectures but with easy tests. If you can fully understand his lecture, you will be able to jump to PHYS 30 : ) But his lecture is pretty inspirational and informative. The grading policy is clear but it seems like TA does not follow that. Bad TA, Good professor.

I had a terrible experience in my intro physics class. He is a really kind person, but I found his instruction hard to follow and he taught beyond the required math level (he often used multivariable calculus which was not a prerequisite for the class). I ended up relying completely on the textbook for instruction.

Fell is a nice person... This doesn't make him an amazing professor. He glides over major concepts necessary to the overall understanding of physics but spends entire lectures on derivations we were never tested on. Read the textbook and you should pass.
Super boring, talks very quietly, but tests are fair and grading is fair. Don't skip recitation, but if you have a strong enough background in high school physics, you can probably skip the lectures.

One of the most unusual and helpful professors at Brandeis (at least when I was there).  Off the wall funny, brilliant, and kind. He directly engaged with students in class, and made himself available outside class time .

Professor Fell is a horrible lecture and does not know how to write a decent exam. The first exam was insanely easy, while the second one covered topics not discussed in lecture of covered in any homework problem.

Knows his stuff, but is extremely unclear on what he wants you to know for exams. His wording on exams is abysmal. Does not curve grades even slightly, so there's a huge change you can do bad in the class.
Uninterested in teaching and rude to students

In PHYS11, you can get an A or a high B if you have taken higher level physics in high school (IB or AP) before. Having never taken physics in any capacity, Fell failed to teach me even an introductory understanding of the topic. I attended every lecture and did the book reading. His lectures  proved unhelpful; as a consequence I did very poorly.
Not great but not bad.
Fell is the father of Brandeis Physics!

The perfect antidote to the 11/15 lectures. Dr. Fell is usually quite good at making the lab interesting and doable. His grading could be described as "generous", which is very welcome once you start getting lecture midterms back. The midterms mostly test whether or not you *understood* the lab, so you will have to do your reading.
A great and really responsible teacher, definitely will take her courses again.

Menon wants you to succeed, makes you work for the grade but grades fairly, the best thing about her is she can read the class; meaning she knows when we are stuck and she will explain this in more detail until we get it; also she is also funny.

Prof. Menon is simply phenomenal. I have learned more about research and data analysis in this class than all other Econ classes combined. She is a tough grader but also very fair if you put in the work. she is also super organized and funny; you will never be bored. Take her class if you can; I guarantee you won't regret it.
Loves Professor Menon! Her lectures are always organized. Even her board writing is well designed, the sequence and the connection, etc. You can tell that from the way she uses those boards.

Honestly, this professor is super clear and to the point. She knows the material she teaches front and back and does a good job of making sure her students know it too. She's also a hardo. She insults her classes once a day, but it's almost funny if you take it lightly. Didn't make me feel stupid so much as give me something to talk about.
This professor is awesome! Every student who took her class loves her!
amazing professor. if you do the work, you'll get an a
she is one of the best prof in Brandeis Univ, you should take her class
Great professor. Knows the material well and is great at teaching it and keeping the class engaged.

In class notes were comprehensive and organized. Class structure was great, didn't start or end on time but it was not a big deal at all. Great learning environment, probably my favorite class this semester.
She is great
Crystal clear lectures, explains everything in great detail. Staid in class; exams and grading is fair

I strongly recommend taking a class with Prof. Menon. She is clear, engaging, and thoughtful in class. She has a passion for the material and clearly knows her stuff and wants to teach it well. The result is a sometimes challenging course, but it's well worth it. You leave having learned a lot. It has played a major role in how I see Economics.

I strongly recommend taking a class with Prof. Menon. She is clear, engaging, and thoughtful in class. She has a passion for the material and clearly knows her stuff and wants to teach it well. The result is a sometimes challenging course, but it's well worth it. You leave having learned a lot. It has played a major role in how I see Economics.
No Comments
Amazing teacher, very concise, clear.  classes are well-structured and she's very helpful.  Although she's a pretty harsh grader, the material is not that hard.

If you do not absolutely have to take a class from her, save yourself. She is extremely knowledgeable about the subject matter, but she makes sure that you know that she knows more than you. She is the least approachable professor I have ever met.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Ms.Suh is not just what makes this class difficult, its her TAs. TAs have different grading criteria, and your grade depends on if you have a lenient or critical though this class is taken by freshman. Terrible and unclear professor, terrible system. I didn't get an extension although others did.Don't take this class unless you absolutely have to

This was my favorite soc class. If you want an easy class where you don't have to do the readings, this is not for you. But, if you are interested in the material and are willing to put in work, I would recommend. Good teacher, clear grader, tough but fair. Some find her intimidating but I think it's just that she is direct and very smart.
Interesting class, lots of readings. She is a fairly harsh grader and would honestly recommend taking this after you have taken other sociology/writing heavy classes. Also attendence matters!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took this class last year and TAs graded everything. She is difficult and does not care about students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She has an attitude with students. Lectures are very monotonous and boring. All large assignments are graded by TAs, who don't all have the same standard of grading. Attendance policy is ridiculous as she only opens attendance  for 2-5 minutes at the start of class and if you can't do it in time, even if you were in class, she doesn't care.

Sometime I think the professor doesnt even know what she is talking about. Uses a lot of ummss and uhhs. Reads a lot off of slides. TAs also grade very hard for no reason. They are super cringe as well and your entire grade is based on your TA.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: If you email her she would respond with a generic message everytime its like she doesnt want to help you. The TAs are also try so try hard like chill for a bit. This class is just made so much harder than it needs to be.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Talks in a monotone voice and reads off of slides. 3 Essays in total and one research proposal. 5 pop quizzes. If you miss a quiz you have to make it up. TAs are super try hard mode like this is a soc class. Pushing one agenda way too much.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Siri has an incredible background in reproduction and her work inspires the way she teaches, her lectures could not keep me engaged but you will learn a lot by taking this course (everyone should want to learn about this), heavy readings but she grades fairly, she's also a bit too serious in my opinion -- can be a bit intimidating
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Her lectures could be a bit boring because her voice is monotone and she says "right?" all the time. It was one of the harder non-science classes I've taken at Brandeis, but I ended with a B+ which I was fine with. I just took it for my HSSP major and didn't love it, although the material was pretty interesting and useful to know.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Although she is intimidating, Professor Suh is very knowledgeable on this topic & I learned a lot. If you pay attention in class, you'll be fine on pop quizzes. There were a TON of readings and only a few essays that asked for a LOT of info (I recommend reaching out to your TA for help). Although it was stressful, I don't regret taking this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: At first, I was turned off by the amount of readings and presentations/fishbowl discussions we had to do, but at the end I realized it was really effective to my learning. I loved the topics we discussed in class, which made all the assignments fun and not like a "burden". This was the first class I feel like I was excited to attend each week.

Professor Suh's class was one of my favourites that I've taken at Brandeis. It was hard work--lots of reading & writing & hard concepts/topics--but it was worth it. I learned so much from her class. The lectures and discussions went way beyond the readings, which were deep on their own. Suh isn't as tough as she seems at first.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I found Prof. Suh's lectures to be very engaging, even if you don't participate. There are lots of readings every week, and if you do them before class you will be very comfortable with what's being taught. Your TA will grade everything you submit for the class, so pray you get a good one.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: the content of professors suh's class is really interesting but assessments are pretty tedious and your success solely depend on your TA. she assigns a LOT of reading. her lectures are pretty boring but she will sometimes give away pop quiz questions
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Suh's lectures will put you to sleep. More than half of the words said are "uh" and you probably won't learn too much. She gets upset when people walk in late, and she closes attendance before class starts so if you're walking to class you get market as late or absent. Most of what she says in class makes no sense. Has pop quizzes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great Mathematician and great person. Someone with top mathematical intelligence yet still care about students like me with (relative to him) ordinary endowments.
