I found lectures v traditional and somewhat hard to follow at times, but he tries v hard to make sure everyone's w him, happy to take Qs. very open during office hours. cares a lot and tries to help. basically taught myself most of linalg with the textbook, though. (a bit more my fault though). hw not too bad. mostly graded by 2 midterms + final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I really loved his lectures. He introduced linear algebra in a very intuitive way that explained the "why" just as much as the "what."

Overall, Dr. Kleinbock is a very good professor.  He clearly prepares his lectures before class and wants everyone to understand the material.  Sometimes his organization on the chalkboard can be hard to follow.  He sticks to the textbook very well.  I will say that his tests are very difficult - lots of computational work.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: He is a very good and thoughtful clear lecturer. Textbook for the class carries, and his teaching style is great. A bit tough on grading and not the most social, but very accessible by email and flexible with student concerns. Would take another course with him. 22B is a difficult course that demands lots of time so consider this before taking it.
Well-organized lectures. It's a hard and abstract class to learn though. Grading is reasonable.

Took multi, which is a very boring subject. He managed to make it fun. He made the material seem easy and not as dry. Proofs given in class were very clear, easy to understand and rigorous, much better than textbook. Good professor!

Dmitry is a very good professor overall.  His lectures can be dry sometimes but that's mostly because he gives a lot of examples, which are helpful for the advanced parts of the course.  He's relatively lenient  when it comes to the final grade since he curves the grades based on his perception of how hard the tests/hw were.

Barely speaks above a whisper. Makes a few half-hearted attempts to quiet people down but doesn't really seem to care. Couldn't hear him at all in class so I stopped going and started reading the book. He stuck to the book so it wasn't a problem.   Homeworks, tests and quizzes all seemed fair to me.   A little upset cause I liked the subject.
Good professor. Engages with students and does his best to help them both in and out of class.
One of the best Math Professors at Brandeis especially for higher level
Decent professor but boring as hell...a lot of people stopped turning up for class since he didn't seem to care.
fair
He looks like one the beetles! Yesterday, all my troubles seemed so far away, now it looks as though they're here to stay....
Decent professor.
No Comments

He was just mean. He constantly was sarcastic and never offered clarification instead he pushed students to think further. I also think that political theory is one of the most boring topics I've ever learned about, so maybe that isn't his fault. But sitting in an auditorium and looking at slides did not help.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Lenowitz is a fairly nice guy, I like that he can see thru pseudointellectual bull, but he is SUPER picky (grading, word choice when speaking, etc) Only 1 course paper. Do NOt take if u are a visual learner (he skips thru slides quickly & out of order, doesn't post them online, & scolds ppl for taking pics of them). And theory is difficult anyway.

Do NOT take him. If you need Intro to Political Theory, wait until Professor Yack teaches it. Worst prof I've ever had. Blew off my office hours meeting, was rude to students, and acts like he's God's gift to humanity. Graded my essay based off the wrong prompt. Said he takes off points if he doesn't agree with you no matter how well it's written.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Knowing that I needed this class to graduate on time, Prof. Lenowitz took great pleasure in giving me 1/3 of a grade lower than I needed for my credit. He was verbally abusive, he was not diplomatic and did not care about his students. He has foul language and is very pretentious. As a professor, I grade hime as a 1/5 and as a person 0/5.

I loved Democratic Theory with Lenowitz. He's such a good lecturer and helps students understand the material. He's super funny and really cares about the well-being of his students and wants them to do well regardless of their level of knowledge for Theory.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: I see people give Lenowitz hate for being cold but honestly it's what I like about him. He is sarcastic and can see right through students who try to fake it, which means you actually have to try to learn in his classes. He is not an easy professor but he is a respectable one who is kind and funny. Easily my favorite in the Politics deparment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Curses a lot, makes fun of the students during the lecture, doesn't have grading criteria on the syllabus, although an intro course, he only gives an A for 95% and above.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Lenowitz is the only person in the entire Politics department that gives feedback that has actually helped me improve my writing. His classes are extremely interesting and he is always there to help you understand difficult concepts. He might seem cold at first, but he is not at all and is willing to talk about nearly anything in politics
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Lenowitz is a fantastic professor and definitely is an expert in the course material. The reading is A LOT, but it is interesting if you like political theory. He is generously accommodating with deadlines and extensions and is very accessible outside of class. I recommend outlining your essays and then meeting with him to go over it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Lenowitz is easily my favorite professor in the politics department so far. He is funny, caring, and knows what he is talking about. He does a very good job at teaching in a way students can retain. If given the opportunity I'd take every class he teaches. Go to his office hours if you have questions or have something to discuss. 10/10

Professor Lenowitz is a great professor. He made a large lecture hall feel like a discussion section. Make sure you do the readings(or at least most of them) because it helps you understand what he discusses in class the next day. This class is supposed to be one of the hardest politics classes offered at Brandeis, but Lenowitz made it enjoyable!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Amazing oratory skills. Cut to the chase. Get classroom structure in control rather than letting students going rampant for 80 minutes. Sometimes lecture style sometimes argumentative format. Stimulating materials for constitutional studies with side dishes of political philosophy/theory. Recommended for both politics and legal minor students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Decent lecturer, but can act pretentious. Sometimes acts passive aggressive at little things. Classes range between passionate and interesting to more mundane and boring, depending on material. Lots of reading, with 8 assigned books.

He's a good teacher who is usually generous with his time. If any questions arise or you are genuinely interested to discuss the topics being taught in class then go to his office hours. Would definitely recommend to take a class from him if you are interested in politics.

Lenowitz is a very good professor. Although this was my first semester at Brandeis, he is my favorite so far. There is a serious workload, but his grading is very fair; I was never unclear as to why I got a certain grade. He is accessible outside of class, makes lectures interesting, (also fast-paced) and is funny at times. Would recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Lenowitz is super informed about the material he teaches and makes things interesting enough that you want to learn.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Lenowitz is a great professor, I'm gonna keep taking classes with him. He is really smart and always makes the lectures super interesting!

Professor Morrison is not a bad professor. I took him 2 times.  The first time he was ok. The second time he was horrible as he was constantly sick so he could not lecture at times. He also takes weeks and weeks to cover one single movie. Also, his final paper is worth 45% which can put a lot of pressure at times.

Professor Morrison is caring and supportive. I love those movies he picked for this class. He also inspires me to learn more about this subject. The test he gave, however, was quite confusing and difficult, at least for me.

Prof Morrison was not a good teacher. You're only graded by 2 essays and a test. The TA's graded it easy, so that was nice, but for a film teacher he's not in touch with technology and doesn't post much on latte. Drones on and on about one movie for weeks on end. Had to cut out several movies from the schedule because he took too long. Very boring.
Professor Morisson gives great lectures and definitely inspires interest in his subject.
What a charmer. Every person in our big auditorium size class was obsessed with him. He's fantastic. Taking his class is a gift.
Hilarious.
i LOVED this class with him! he's a fantastic professor, and has a cute toosh to boot ;)

He's pretty funny and if you talk to him, he is friendly. The lectures were interesting. My main complaint is that his lectures could have been slightly more structured, but that is just a personal preference.
Fantastic teacher, interesting classes and so helpful and caring about his students!

Taught complex subject matter fairly clearly.  His Contemporary Literary Theory was better than his History of Literary Theory, although the textbook for the latter class is great.  He's a nice guy who helped me a lot.
Really, really funny.  Sneaks out of class during films to smoke.  Loved him.  Looks kind of like a Greek God.
He teaches well and makes you think about the subject.  I loved his Canadian accent, but I wish he'd leave more comments when he's grading papers.
No Comments
kinda weird. Strange faux british accent
No Comments
No Comments
Great Professor. Great content.

His teaching style is good in ways that
- goes straight to the point (organized ppt & graph demonstration)
- fun (with real-life examples and upbeat music before class-time)
- meaningful (tells you why you need to learn these knowledge) 

The fact that he is a approachable professor makes his classroom time not scary

Bad reviews seem outdated. Shiller is a solid prof. Goes through plenty of practice problems in class. gave practice midterm that mirrored the real midterm. Seems like he's worked hard at his teaching style and it shows. He's not the best prof ever at answering questions, but pretty good. Math heavy course, so could be hard if you're bad at math.

Don't know where the horrible rates came from. If you do pay some attention to his recorded video you will realize he made concepts crystal clear. Super nice guy and good lecturer. Had a Nobel prize winning dad but never mention that. Do take his 80 and you will learn a lot and get a good grade.

Not sure where the other reviews are coming from. Great prof, made me want to continue econ. Concise, easy to follow assuming basic high school math background is strong. Easy to get 100% on problem sets, tests largely based on lecture slides and problem sets. Genuine guy who is happy to help. Cracks corny dad jokes here and there.
Genuine guy
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Shiller is clearly a smart and nice guy, but teaching is not for him. Ineffective at leading a class, engaging students, and explaining concepts. Would not recommend, in fact, I usually steer friends away from taking his classes.
Excellent Professor. Very upfront about his expectations and provides a large amount of resources and advice for succeeding in his class and at Brandeis.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: He simply does a poor job explaining what needs to be done and clearly and explicitly stating the models.

Shiller is an absolutely wonderful professor! His intermediate micro class might as well be the best thing ever happened in my life, making me to actually want to continue to further economics. He goes over decent amount of problems in class and homework is really helpful. Class is always fun and interesting to go to. Microeconomics rocks!
horrible instructor. stay away
He was extremely unclear. And the TA was with really heavy Chinese accent and not helpful at all, even not showing up during the final period.

He is the worst professor I've ever had in my life. Bad at explaining, disorganized, inexperienced. Hard assignments, boring lectures. Bottom line:don't take his class if you don't wanna hate microeconomiccs.

Dropped this micro because the teacher is incredibly unhelpful. I'm an econ major and am altering my schedule because of the professor.  Although qualified and very nice, he just hasn't developed his teaching style. One day, with time and experience, he may be a great teacher but it doesn't seem like that day will come anytime soon.
HE IS A NICE GUY, BUT NOT A VERY GOOD TEACHER. HE IS JUST NOT GOOD AT EXPLAINING. :(
Dont take his class. He doesnt even know what he is teaching.
The class was incredibly easy and everything is easily accessible through the lecture slides. The TAs graded everything due to how big the class is.

This was the easiest course ever. If you want to learn, Professor Howard's lectures are actually really interesting, but you can easily get an A in this course without learning anything at all. Exams are open-book, online, and you have 9 hours to take them. Most of the exam is multiple-choice and straight off his slides.
midterm and final are take home, open book
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Howard is a very knowledgeable guy in the field of Psychology. But in a big lecture like Intro to Psych, he just reads off the slides. Although he often expands on information not on his slides, if attendance wasn't part of the grade, no one would show up to class. The tests are online and open book, there is no excuse for not getting an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Super sweet and funny professor. Class was easy and straightforward but still interesting. Good survey level course.

This is a very easy course. Professor Howard tells you at the beginning of the semester that the average grade is a B+ but everyone I know got an A. Tests are open book and assignments are easy. At first, the lectures were boring but as the semester went on he began joking around more. Super nice person and knows the subject well.

Class was too easy, and the professor didn't seem passionate about teaching. Didn't really learn anything that can't be learned on your own, but he is very nice. Not a great foundation to start a psych minor.

Good guy and all, but he's a bit boring. Big class, attendance was a google form with a code so you can just ask a friend what the code was and be fine. Tests were online and open the whole day, answers can be found right on the lecture slides. Only 2 assignments the whole semester, pretty easy. Also ngl I never opened the textbook lol
Just read off of slides the whole time. You could never show up and just read the textbook and get an A+. Tests are open-book, open-note, and open-internet sooo you should be fine.
Boring.

Intensely average professor. Easy class (open note tests) but that also results in not much actually retained. Attendance is recorded via Google Forms. I regret getting a textbook, I literally never opened it. Would take again on the basis of an easy A

Its a very easy class. Not a lot of tests or assignments but gives you a lot of time to complete them. The concepts are easy enough and he does a good job explaining them. He also posts lectures online, but its better to be in person so you can ask questions. Offers no extra credit but does offer extensions.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Barely anyone shows up to lectures, especially towards the end. he posts everything online so it's pointless to go. Very easy class.
This class was not particularly difficult. I found it hard to remain engaged in lectures. Only about 1/3 of the class showed up in person.
If you want an easy A, this is the class to take, but if you want to walk away from the class feeling like you learned a lot, probably not.

Incredible professor. Textbook was optional but I never had to read it because he covered everything in class. Lectures were clear and easy to understand. Exams were open note and you have tons of time to complete them. His hilarious jokes made the class really fun to attend. If you have the opportunity to take a class taught by him, take it.

Very nice guy, cares about his students, is funny. Easy grader and the tests were open notes and online, so they weren't difficult, but his slides are just copies of the textbook. You can tell he's very excited about psychology and loves it, but he spent 15 yrs on his one niche subject (smell) and had forgotten a lot of things about general psych.

Prof. Howard clearly shows great interest in the subject, however, his lecture slides were a copy of the textbook. By the end of the semester students stopped going to lecture because they would pass the exams just by using the textbook. The 3 exams were open note. He's a really friendly guy, he did a great job for it being his first semester.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm not good at public speaking but participation is mandatory for this class. I hated it in the beginning but it gets much easier for everyone. Once you get used to Prof Bayone's teaching style, the class is amazing and truly helps you grow as a student.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Definitely my favorite professor during my freshman spring as I would get excited for his class every time. Made you have to engage with the class and read in order to get a good grade, but it never came off as pushy or annoying. Quite intellectually and verbally stimulating although I personally hated the presentational aspect. Interesting lad.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Bayone was one of the best professors I have ever had. Definitely a class to work hard in but great rewards of knowledge and education.
Great teacher, hard class. Work required.
Excellent professor, and I believe he is tough grader because he is a perfectionist!

Professor Bayone assigns a lot of work and thinks he's the only professor at Brandeis. He makes you work hard for your grades and he expects everyone to participate in every single class. He also takes attendance and requires the name tag, which is helpful because it creates a classroom environment. Sometimes he can come off as arrogant and rude.
great professor!

Greatest professor at Brandeis; hands down! Anyone who wants to get into ANYTHING in business at all should take a class with him. He gives you a real life insight into business & is the type of professor that makes you want to do well. He also really makes you fight for participation grades, so if you don't like participating don't take this class

I hate school. I am the master of ditching classes, but not Bayone's. He makes you WANT to be prepared for class. This is the only class I did ALL the readings for WILLINGLY during my Brandeis career. This professor is not kidding around. He's going to teach you business as it is: not the polite business, not the textbook business... REAL

Great professor.  Lots to teach and lots of experience.  If you're a slacker, you'll probably not do well in this class.  No room to fall behind.  However, Bayone keeps it interesting enough for everyone to want to keep up.  Also, if you're shy, don't take the class.  Bayone requires you speak up at EACH class.

Excellent pofessor!!!... You need to spend a lot of time in each assignment, but really helpful... He has a lot of experience, but he is not an academic... wait a very "practical" approach... Recommended
good
High expectations. Great class. A must for business students
No Comments
No Comments
Prof. B is amazing! he rocks!  a class all undergrads must take!!!
Prof. Dowden was really nice! He was accessibly outside of class and a fair grader.

Professor Dowden's feedback on papers and reading reflections were always so diligent. He is respectful of students' opinions but does not hesitate to point out what does not make sense. He would touch on so many works and ideas during the seminar inducive of further reflection and reading. Learned a lot!
I learned so much from professor Dowden, a really nice and caring professor. Inspirational.

Professor Dowden is a great, warm professor and a true intellectual. Be prepared to think abstractly and utilize concepts from all corners of class readings. Class discussions are really important, so make sure you have done the readings, which should be very easy because he chooses great books to read.

Had him for three separate courses, one in German. Consistent throughout, wonderful teacher, speaks to you as an equal, open about both disagreements and agreements... Topics presented and discussed in class are substantial and sometimes rather heavy, always rewarding, and the readings are, in a word, fantastic. Take a class with him if you can.
Incredibly provocative discussions, imaginative reading lists, genuine interpersonal exchanges of ideas... Everyone should experience the Dowden seminar.
Intelligent, snarky, reasonable grader.  Great classes.  Recognizes and appreciates intelligent comments.
Wow--Dowden is an EXCELLENT professor in every way. He is as fair as they come. Be prepared to learn a lot, though.
what a good man. i had him as a freshman and a senior. his text selections are really superb. he's smart and speaks to you like a colleague, so a lot is accomplished in class discussions.

... not a huge fan of Dowden's teaching.. took a very disapointing class with him once, and he seemed more into bashing philosophers than teaching them.  But I will say that his classes can be one of the easiest A's you'll ever make at Brandeis, especially if you are a girl.  If you are a BS artist, all the better. Sorry D, but it's true.
and WHAT a voice :)

don't ask him for a recommendation even if you think he likes you.  i thought he really liked me, asked him for a rec for grad school, and. had a hell of a time getting into grad school. when i finally got in, i looked at his rec and understood why. i was really taken back and felt somewhat deceived
he is an amazing lecturer and is great at posing questions, listening to students and constantly discovering new things. could care less about papers, do the reading, though. i heart him :)

He expects a lot from the class discussions, which makes them good. Do the reading ahead of time. He's a really easy grader, though, so you don't have to worry much about the papers if you pay attention and do a halfway decent job of explaining yourself.
Lectures are uber-interesting!
Great professor

Elena is a fantastic instructor who really encourages you to learn and persevere through any mistakes you make along your journey to mastering the Spanish language. I can't say a single bad thing about her. If you participate in class and do the work, she sets you up for success.

Attendance is mandatory and she is not flexible at all. You have 4 absences available but after that she will not take any reasoning- you could be sick and she will still count it as an unexcused absence. So if you are not someone that can show up to every class don't take her class. She's funny, kind, caring, and lovely otherwise.
Would recommend her classes to anybody at Brandeis thinking about taking Spanish. She's the sweetest person ever, so caring and kind, and also an absolutely amazing professor.

I went into this course after a nightmarish experience in AP Spanish where I managed to get a 4 on the test but my teacher was the worst person I had ever met in my entire life. Professor Gonzalez Ros reignited my love for Spanish and has inspired me to pursue a minor in the subject! I can't praise her enough as a professor or a person!
one of my favorite professors from brandeis! if you need to take a higher level spanish class take this one!!!!!

So great and so funny! Her classes always went by quickly because of the fun and well-planned activities. Her classes are engaging and keep you on your toes. Her grade policies are clear and easy to understand (lots of rubrics) so you know where you stand.
such a sweet a caring professor. Really enjoy her class even though it's early in the morning.

I took Spanish because I had to and as a science student was not looking forward to it. Elena was AMAZING and made the experience engaging and doable. She made me enjoy the class which I will always remember! Get to know her as a class and she will make jokes with your class
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Gonzales Ros is the ultimate "homie." Class material was very engaging, focusing on culture and utilizing movies and current events. Prof. Gonzales Ros was always very understanding about health issues and wants to see students succeed. I learned more in this class than any other Spanish class I've taken.

Elena's class is easy if you put the effort in. She's a fair understanding grader and the quizzes and tests are easy as long as you pay attention in class. She makes things interesting so it's easy to pay attention. Would love to take her again.

I hated Spanish by the end of high school and didn't look forward to taking it in college to satisfy a requirement. But Elena made learning the language fun for me again. She does expect participation and pushed me whenever things that felt like review came along. But I'm so happy this will be my last memory of a Spanish class. Excellent professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Elena's class feels like high school Spanish, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, I just wouldn't take it 2 semesters in a row. She's a nice woman and funny in a cute way. If you're confused about something you gotta ask. Also, participate. That's key. Put in the effort to go over grammar etc. and the grades will be there.

Gonzalez-Ros is very caring and she will always help you if you ask for it. She is very organized and top of everything and she responds to emails quickly. That being said you must participate in order to do really well in the class, and she will like you more if you do so. She is a great professor, I would take her class again.

I really enjoyed this class which surprised me because languages are not really my thing.  She made me feel comfortable when I spoke in class (which I did every day because she calls on everyone multiple times per class).  However, teaching grammar was not her strongest point and the end of semester tests became difficult because of this.

Elena is a fantastic person. She is funny and great at engaging students in conversation. Her curriculum is very diverse, especially at the beginning of the course. I did find that although her teaching of grammar was creative, it was ineffective and it was challenging to do well on tests (although they weren't worth much)

Elena was a excellent professor, particularly for HISP 105. She was extremely accessible to students, went out of her way to accommodate them, and she effectively conveyed her love for teaching the language. She also was clear and efficiently taught otherwise difficult material. Challenging and may dissaude you from Spanish, yet highly recommended!

Great Guy and obviously loves the subject, but his lectures are incredibly disorganized. He tends to start saying things, then erases it, and tries again, making it very confusing. Learned way more form the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Could not read his handwriting or understand him when he spoke. Made class feel impossible.
10/10 do not recommend
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The whole lecture is like a Spanish rap song, but in the end you will suddenly realize it might be English.
The equivalent of Trump teaching a Math Class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: I don't know why you all describe him to be disorganized and confusing. it's quite easy to keep up with him and understand everything. And he likes to play interesting Maths games to make review sessions interesting. As a freshman who intends to take Math major, I really like him.

He's a pretty cool dude but he's kinda disorganized which means that we are always behind the other sections. The quizzes/tests are for the most part reasonable, except for some weirdly difficult questions that will sink your grade if you don't understand how to do it.

He is very very disorganized and has trouble focusing, and is clearly falling behind the other teachers teaching this class. By the date of the midterm exam most classes had taken multiple quizzes and were well prepared, but our class had only taken one quiz which we never received back. He's a nice guy, but not a good teacher.
If he takes a dislike to you you're dead. Cant teach to students who dont get the concept the first time round, so if you're confused you're about to be left behind.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Awesome.
Funniest dude ever. An okay teacher.  Not the greatest but definitely knew what he was talking about and cared about each student.

He definitely tries to make sure that each student succeeds or does the best of their ability, but he complicates simple concepts and makes learning confusing. He also loves the subject and it truly makes him happy, but he isn't the greatest teacher, unfortunately.

This man is friendly and ADORABLE. He doesn't "speak English good" but he loves "deers" and tries hard to teach through the language barrier. He may be hard to understand but who cares? For lower level "maths" there's SO MUCH FREE TUTORING. He gives ample opportunity for you to improve your grade (e.g. extra quizzes and TONS of homework grades)
awful.  Straight up.
he's all over the place, and makes simple concepts more confusing than they should be.
Assignments are tough, best to work in groups. I did not unfortunately.

Professor Goldberg is clearly incredibly passionate about syntax, making her lectures very engaging. She does have the tendency of getting off topic and therefore rushing through the important content, but does everything she can to ensure everybody who is working at it understands the material. She is accessible and deeply cares.

I love Prof. Goldberg! She makes the wellbeing of her students her top priority and does everything she can ensure that everyone is getting the support they need. I have never met a kinder and more understanding professor. She is also super passionate and engaging. Would recommend for those who prefer a more relaxed and laid-back atmosphere.

She's helpful to expand her lectures for ppl of all levels. She's always available outside class, sometimes too available! the annoying thing is she spends 10-30 mins at the beginning of class setting things up, mentioning her office hours or assignments+wastes lecture time and puts class behind schedule. Little feedback on homework. Still love her

Professor Goldberg's lectures made the material manageable, and she is very understanding of struggling students, and is willing to help them. I found Syntactic Theory to be particularly difficult, though very informative. This is a requirement for the Ling major, and so is graded more harshly than Ling electives.

Honestly an amazing person who really cares about her students learning the material. Her one flaw is that she tends to bring more material to class than the class has time for. My rec would be to see her in office hours or schedule separate meetings--she is so helpful one-on-one in a way that's not always accessible in a classroom full of students
tons of homework

Not the easiest class ever, but material is interesting, covered well in readings, expanded on VERY clearly during lectures. Great office hours, prof. very responsive and open to even the most basic questions. Reading is helpful, but class is easily passable without it. FASCINATING course, definitely recommend. 3 2- or 3-hr wkshts, 1 quiz, 3 tests.

Everything she assigns, she explains clearly, if not in class, on the homework handouts. Overall she's very conscientious of her students, always validating their (sometimes ill-thought) comments. If you take the time to do the work the class is actually rather engaging and interesting.
Constant digressions and  inadequate supporting material made this class very frustrating for an independent learner, but professor Goldberg is nice and very helpful in person.
Great professor. Really enthusiastic about what she is teaching. Very helpful and eager to assist if you have any problems.
She is quite enthusiastic about teaching and linguistics in general. It seems to me her explanations in the class could be clearer and more specific.
She is awesome. A professor who is not only smart, but also really cares about the student.
No Comments
No Comments

I still shudder when I think about this class.  To call professor Bown ego-involved understates it; the class is the Chad Bown show with special guest the material you're supposed to learn.  The material is dumbed down and the class winds up being a waste.  I got an A in the class, but I'd trade it in for a class with some dignity.
One of the best profs ever!

took international trade disputes. Best Teacher I've ever had, even got to make him my advisor. So funny, down to earth, helpful, fair and the best part FUNNY. I'm not usually the best one in the class but I did really well in that class. It was actually Fun to attend and study.
A very good professor. Although he seems fairly young, Bown has an excellent teaching style. On top of that he is nice, tries to be funny, and even gave out cookies to class once.
This guy is great
One of the greatest teachers you could ever hope to have.  Smart, fun, interesting, engaging... there really aren't enough positive adjectives in the language to fully encapsulate Bown as a teacher.
Best professor ever!  Easy to talk to, approachable and sends engaging & funny e-mails.  Don't graduate without taking a class with him.
Awesome professor!  Inspired me to become an econ major!
MY HERO
A really nice guy; I had him his first year teaching at Brandeis. It was one of my most memorable classes and he is a great teacher who really cared.
If you are looking for a challenge or to grow intellectually, move on or be bored. If you want to learn some pretty straight-forward economic principles and techniques, stay and enjoy.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Very old-fashioned teaching style, just lectures at you, no slides or anything. I think if you're REALLY into WWII you may enjoy this class because he clearly is very intelligent, but I find it unengaging.

First of all idk if you've ever read Harry Potter but he is Prof Binns. That's actually what I refer to him as “heading to Binns' class”. Also his TA grades based on how much she likes reading your sources not your actual argument or the fact that ur sources are all valid!

Jankowski is brilliant.  This was the 3rd class I took with him (War in European History, Europe in World War II, World War I).  He is Oxford thoroughbred for all of his degrees and lectures in a dry British tone.  This is a good thing, however.  He is incredibly knowledgeable and informative and has studied extensively.  Very easy, easy A.
Jankowski's a great lecturer - he has this dry tone, almost like he's British, or wants to be.  He also always has one eyebrow raised.
Best teacher I have ever had at brandeis! Funny, good looking and extreemly helpful. He likes all his students! No ego. Listens and respects what students say. Cultures in conflict was a great class.
awesome professor, best i've ever had at brandeis, knowledgeable, friendly, very helpful, his class was amazing
Brilliant man, quality course
the first teacher i ever had a crush on :)...brilliant lecturer, brilliant man
I think of Jankowski like fine wine, you need to experience it in order to appreciate it.  He's absolutely brilliant, and hilarious.  Easily one of my favorite professors at Brandeis.

Brilliant professor and also quite a nice guy. The course consisted of two 5-7 page papers and a final exam for which students are given the questions in advance. The course is difficult only in the sense that it covers a broad period of time (200 years). Freshmen tend to get B's in this course.
Single worst lecturer I have ever had.  Most boring man alive...  only use this class if you are in desperate need of a general anasthetic.  Because it does an excellent job in that capacity.
awsome professor
Great lecturer.  I learn a lot from his class
Amazing lecturer, very engaging, very funny. Wonderful teacher.
Great instructor, learned alot, very sexy (and not married!).

Very kind and sweet professor. He knows so much about Jewish history and has so much passion and interest in the subject, which is very evident in his lectures. The class was super easy, pretty much just a midterm and final, with all other assignments being credit/no-credit. Only complaint is that he could be disorganized at times. Would recommend!

Prof. Sheppard was an incredible instructor. Hegel is demanding & Sheppard's role in guiding the class through challenging material was invaluable. While we had a syllabus agreed upon at the beginning of the class, he accommodated the interests of the class as we went through the course in a lively and spirited way. He is an exceptional professor

Grad student in a different department and Sheppard let me sit in to get an overview of all Jewish history.  A highlight of my experience at brandeis.  Best stuff was in Jewish intellectual history.  Who knew chains of traditions were so central and potentially so subversive not only in Jewish history,but in every group or institution U can imagine

I thought I knew quite a bit about Judaism but some of my basic thinking was challenged about what is Jewish and what is not .  And this is a good thing.  The course exposed me to think through Judaism from philosophical positions, and the other way around. I now take Cohen, Rosenzweig, Arendt, Mendelssohn, Levinas are with me now.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: great professor made shows just how strange things are that we often taken as being natural
Really nice guy, but he's one of the most boring teachers I've had in my life.
Excellent, inspiring professor.

Very unclear in regards to reading assignments and his lectures were often fairly hard to follow. The fact that he read many of his lectures from a piece of paper further hampered the ability to understand class material.

This course was pretty rough at first in terms of the high level readings from Plato and Otto Kirchheimer.  But as the course went on, I began to view trials in a deeper way. Thanks Professor Sheppard for an awesome course!
Professor Sheppard is passionate and very interesting. He made this USEM class challenging but fun to be in.

Very vague and disorganized, I felt like he had no idea what was going on half of the time.  He fought constantly with the TA during class time.  His lectures were dull and uninspired, and he once even resorted to just reading a typed out paper that he had written instead of giving a lecture.  His class was a constant battle to stay awake.

This course was hard for someone with no background, but I got a whole lot of this course.  Now i'm in law school and I can appreciate the difference of Jewish law in the diaspora vs laws of a nation-state.
Awesome prof.!
He's a nice, engaging, patient teacher. Super approachable and super cute!
Prof. Sheppard is passionate about his subject, and is very approachable outside of class.

I really like the way he organized and gave lectures, and they formed a progressive flow of the changes in contemporary architecture, and offered a wonderful picture about different styles, the ideas behind them, and different ways architects represented them in their works. Cant wait to see many of the buildings mentioned in person. Caring prof.

I found the presentations and lectures to be the most valuable for learning because they provided details about the material and connections between the building and its landscapes, people, and materials. I also found the use of videos to be really useful. The professor's enthusiasm for the course was really helpful because helped keep me focused.

I really liked the studentled lectures and the format of the lectures. They helped me question and draw conclusions beyond just the reading and think more deeply about the readings instead of just reading before listening to lectures. I enjoyed that there were so many examples present tying the theme together. It helped me understand better.
Really helpful!
always helped with my papers and always gave extra time and couldnt have passed w/out his help
No exams but case studies and theory papers. Teacher had a lot of personal stories and travels that made the material really interesting.
great class

Never met a professor who on the first day asked us what the other deadlines for other classes were, so that deadlines for this class didn't collide. That helped a lot. Always had office hours and flexible to meet. Good feedback and always helpful with HW.
great class and lectures/very helpful and listens/great feedback

Flexible with deadlines, and bent to deadlines in my other classes. Could not have gotn thru without that. Really liked the lectures. Rob was helpful with papers and feedback. Glad that there were no tests. A lot of reading.
Knows so much material and is very interesting. Like that he has traveled to many of the locations. Always willing to explain ideas to those of us not in the major.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: straight up ignored my emails to him and refused to be even remotely accommodating. the topic is really interesting but hes not rlly a good prof
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Very knowledgeable on his area of expertise and really wants you to learn. Receptive to student participation in class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: The topics covered in class are extremely interesting but this class will undoubtedly ruin it for you. The amount of work is ludicrous and it feels unfair. Not only does he make you prepare a final paper for his class, but in addition there's presentations, an extra essay, and MORE... Just for one final evaluation! He is also obsessed with margins.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: hes so much more effort than his class is worth. you're going to be reading a lot, and doing constant writing. i emailed him multiple times begging for extensions because i had many other papers due the same time his was and he denied me each time. thinks hes the most important class out of everyone. not worth it :/
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Well read, smart, funny.
Best, moat helpful teacher I've had.
Brilliant, well-read, helpful to students.  You have to work hard for your grades, but you'll learn a great deal.

Should be doing research alone somewhere, not teaching. She brings a lot of moodiness to class. Allows 1st & 2nd years to enroll, but automatically grades them down if she notices their status (her class is too deep for them to grasp at that age!). She judges students according to her own emotional connection. Among the worst profs at Brandeis.
Unclear and imprecise with instructions, she lacked any real zeal for educating.
I get the feeling Prof. Campbell teaches only to fund her poetry.  She seemed aloof and often angry.  Did not inspire much in the students regarding the material at hand.

She is not unknowledgeable.  The problem is that here classes were a nightmare in the sense that her awful personality would get in the way of the material.  I have never met such an unctuous person.  And the ways in which she is a hard teacher are not necessarily methods that actually help the student learn.
Amazing professor- easily my favorite at Brandeis. Took everything from her I could. She tends to ramble in class, but her ramblings are always interesting. I learned so much from her.
She inspired me with a love of and a deeper understanding of medieval literature.
Easily the best professor that I had at Brandeis.  Very sensitive to student's needs.  Flexible and helpful.  Most of our class wanted to expand the course from one semester to two.
Very cool lady
No Comments

Had PMS for entire semester, was unapologetically rude and insensitive to large class.  Personal mtgs were fine, but had a definite problem in class setting.  Was not personable, often irate, had bad temper.  Lots of mood swings (mostly toward bad moods).
Prof. Campbell has a definite problem dealing with people.

absolutely fantastic. process-engagement based grading is essentially meant to make class more like a crash course workshop on improving writing and less focus on grades, so if you want an easy A you can do that, or you can actually really learn writing. very caring, accommodating, happy to meet in OH, very interesting class topic.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Unlike my other UWS Professor, Elissa actually understood we were college freshman and not leonardo fricking davinci. (I still didn't learn anything)

Professor Jacobs is great.She makes a mandatory university writing course interesting by incorporating thought provoking questions.She is also very understanding regarding deadlines/circumstances and is very easy reach and gets to know students.Though grading for this class is mostly on completion, she gives extensive and helpful feedback on papers
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Nice, helpful, and very smart.

Best UWS professor at Brandeis, hands down. 37A has such interesting concepts that I found myself drawing on what I learned in this class (beyond just how to write an essay) throughout my time at Brandeis, even as a bio major. One of my favorite classes.

Professor Jacobs is great. As someone who is not a great writer, she made me feel really comfortable in expanding my writing abilities. She cares a lot about participation in class so be sure to do it!

Dr. Jacobs was a really great professor and I feel like my writing improved after taking her UWS. She was very passionate + enthusiastic about the material and made classes engaging + a very welcoming environment. Helped me a lot throughout the writing process whenever I was lost, would recommend going to office hours. Made UWS a good experience.

She knows her stuff and she knows how to teach and keep you engaged. One of the most understanding and considerate teachers I've had. She's quick on her feet and very witty with comebacks. She can keep you engaged and is incredibly helpful when grading your work. Got really lucky to be matched into her class and I would take her class again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Elissa Jacobs is one of the nicest professors I've had. Her class is challenging if you don't like writing, but she'll work with you to make sure your writing improves. Her grading criteria is very fair, and she's very upfront with how papers will be graded. Definitely one of the best UWS profs.

Professor Jacobs integrated biology and writing in UWS37A, making UWS very interesting. She is extremely passionate about all the topics she covered in class. She is caring and would love to help you learn. All assignments are returned promptly with comments on improvement. You will truly learn about writing and would never regret taking her class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She's amazing! Great lecturer, super accomodating and caring especially for international students in different time zones! Incredible experiences with such an immense wealth of knowledge! The course is especially interesting and I never got bored. She gives constructive feedback and is a fair grader! Willing to help you improve and is such a gem!

Professor Jacobs is amazing. She is really passionate about science and that makes UWS way less tedious than it usually is with other people. She is fair with grading, and she will give you really good feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Jacobs is honestly a really really awesome professor. She rewards hard work, so as long as you put in effort, you will do fine. She made UWS enjoyable, which is far from a simple task. Definitely wish I could take another class with her.

Although she is new to this school, she is such an amazing professor. UWS is typically something dreaded by students here but she actually made it genuinely interesting. Being a scientist herself, she knows her field SO well and is more than happy to go out of her way and spend time with a student to help them figure out a direction of their paper.

Honestly, maybe I wasn't the audience for this class, but I was miserable 3x a week for 50 min. The texts are cool, but the teaching is inaccessible, and unless you're deeply familiar with 500 years of literature and history, you will not understand 80% of what is happening. Burt cares about his students, a freshman course isn't meant for him.

I see that some have criticized Professor Burt for being scattered, but in truth I have found his scatteredness particularly generative for independent deliberation and, most importantly, reflective of his passion. He has been a joy to speak with during office-hours, and his feedback on papers and reading reflections were incredibly detailed.

Burt is the embodiment of what a professor should be. This guy cares. He is brilliant, funny and CREATIVE. I emphasize his creativity becuase this is usually long gone with so many adults and professors of Burt's age. He has his spark. Burt is the type of guy you would want to sit next to at Thanksgiving.
Simply the best. Such a kind man and so knowledgeable about mid-1800s American Literature. Genuinely so enthusiastic and a pleasure to learn from. Recommend 100%

Professor Burt was enthusiastic but his lectures were confusing most of the time. He does not give clear instructions for his assignments and expects you to be sone kind of expert for all the books that you read. He doesn't really care about student opinion if you don't say exactly what he wants. I would not recommend this professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Very smart, tends to ramble and go off on tangents. Kind of a quirky personality. Super knowledgeable but tends to talk AT students, not with them. Not very many written assignments in total, but still lots of reading along the way, though there's not much accountability for actually doing thorough readings; I got away without doing a whole lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Burt knows so much about history, English, and politics. I learned so much about the world in general from his class. He talks a lot and goes off on a lot of tangents, but you learn a lot from those too. The reading is pretty fast-paced but it is definitely worth it.
-brilliant, devoted, bardic
Very funny, kind, intelligent.  Lenient on deadlines.  Tends to ramble but he's fun to listen to.
I took both romanticism one and two with Burt and was always amazed to see at his ability to free-associate.  He's hilarious, energetic, and truly loves his job.  He's a lousy poet, though.
Brilliant, funny, eccentric lit teacher, very knowledgeable, fair grader, challenges your thinking, he wrote a great recc for me as his advisee

Lectures were wild adventures.  He made poetry pure fun.  He had an adventurous and unrushed attitude, and the best laugh I ever heard.  He's also a fine poet.  It was an unstressful class which taught me some things that stick years later.
No Comments

Fascinating lecturer though prone to tangential ramblings.  Made romanticism seem even more mystical.  Very helpful outside of class, though had to be approached as he did not make effort to know his students.  Has good sense of humor.
Good class, sometimes hard for me to follow. Homework in all linguistic classes tends to be a lot and on the harder side.

Professor Malamud is very kind. Her lectures were often hard to follow and information was not laid out in a straight-forward manner. The problem sets are not as intense as the ones in LING 110 (Phonology) or LING 120 (Syntax), but still very challenging.

The course material was pretty tough, but she's super accessible outside of class and places a lot of value on improvement and communicating with her, whether that's via email or going to her OH or making an appointment.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Malamud is an amazing human being, and on top of that an amazing teacher. A lot of the material was boring at first but got really difficult halfway through, but the way she explains everything (although incredibly fast) is insightful and incredibly helpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing professor who puts great effort into making sure students understand everything, even if that requires more work on her part. She is one of the smartest and most knowledgeable people I know and she has an incredible talent for teaching. She is really kind and interesting and funny and just great to be around, and always available for help!

Prof. Malamud is very knowledgeable and extremely kind. While the class is by no means an easy one, she is always available to help and will sometimes even reach out to a student before they ask, which is unheard of at most schools. The workload is rough, with a 16+ pg final paper and many readings per week, but it's manageable if you ask for help!

Great professor - extremely knowledgable and kind. She talks and teaches in an efficient manner, she tells you exactly what you need and answers your questions very thoroughly in a way you can understand. She also gives extensions fairly.
Terrible at answering any questions you have about the homework or take-home tests. Boring lectures that are just going over a hand-out.

Sophia is a great professor. She expects a lot of her students, but if you make an obvious effort she will respect you and grade accordingly. She is always available outside of class to help with course material as well as other issues. Extremely intelligent, friendly, funny, and interesting.
Easy class, just do all the homeworks and try to keep up with the readings.  Super nice teacher, sometimes dry lectures.

Very difficult material to understand, but interesting (sometimes anyway).  Malamud really cares about whether or not you understand (even though most of the time, subject matter goes right over your head).  Fair grader, for the most part.  Very intelligent, expects high intelligence from students as well.  This was not an easy class.
No Comments
Expects way to much out of a beginning level course:  a conference presentation, a take-home final, and a final presentation.  In addition to weekly homework.
No Comments
Really sweet woman and a great teacher. She assigns a lot of movies and most of them are really good (if you actually watch them). The class is straight forward, and she is a generous grader.
The class was pretty easy but I was very interested in things and I did learn a lot.  She is also very helpful out of class and a lot of fun to talk to.  Very sweet and motherly!
excellent! very dedicated, skilled, and kind.
outstanding! very dedicated profesora
One of the worst professor's I've ever had
Olmanda is awesome!
No Comments

I love this woman!! Outside of the classroom she is truly wonderful to spend time with, which makes her class worth it regardless.  The other comment leavers are right, however, in that she is just a teeny bit crazy.  Good discussion leader & prof.
Really cares about students!
No Comments
One of the most helpful professors I ever encountered.  So friendly and always truly invested in your learning.
what a nutcase!! if you plan on learning spanish, don't take her class.
The class was utterly unbearable. Grading was completely random. There is absolutely no reason to take this class. Avoid Olmanda at all costs.
Very nice woman, kinda loca though. Speaks exclusively in spanish even for intro. classes.

He makes physics lab a comptuer science class for literally no reason and it's the most infuriating class I have ever taken at Brandeis in my entire time here. Makes me think about dropping out every day.

Professor Fraden is a nice professor. He makes a good effort to make his lecture fun and entertain all his students. Physics is a challenging topic, which is why I think some people might find him tough, but I mean, if you are not smart or diligent enough, it is not the professor's fault.

Dr. Fraden is a little out of touch with both his TAs and his students. 
He expects his students to do a lot more than what makes sense, and does not communicate enough with his TAs even. 
The labs can vary from pointless to incredibly difficult. 
Lectures are incredibly long and the important material is sometimes lacking / difficult to find.

Doesn't care about undergraduates. Didn't have for intro physics, but as a cross-departmental research option for credit. On no more than a superficial level did I ever feel that Fraden was invested in my growth as a researcher. I often felt misunderstood, slighted by something he said which suggested that he had no real confidence in my abilities.
great guy, good professor

Fraden is not only the most ineffective lecturer ever, he is also the most clueless human being. He never mentioned the poor performance of the entire class and failed to guide the class to success. Fortunately, he was forced by the department to change the entire structure of his class b/c they realized how inefficient he is at teaching.

Physics is hard I'm not going to lie. This year Fraden tried to change up the learning approach to intro to physics and I give him credit for that. However, he doesn't seem to care about teaching it. The averages are consistently low (38%), the recitations confuse the students more, there are no review sessions, etc. It shouldn't be that difficult.
Physics is hard. Now this is not Fraden's fault. I thought he was  just fine and spent a lot of time outside of class trying to help students.
All the other reviewers are probably upset because they did poorly. He is a strong lecturer and takes time to meet with his students.

Good god, the only reason why the department never hears bad review about him is because all the non-genius students dropped out before they can rate him. How did man got his job in the first place is still a miracle to me. Make the people who hired him to sit through one of his lecture  to see the person they hired. completely incompetent,AVOID!!!

he gave his lectures mostly to the blackboard.  i personally think that all the professors of the physics department of brandeis are genuinely bad teachers.  they might great researchers, but man, they canNOT if their lives depend on it.

He is a really bad lecturer and spends lots of time on minute points that people understand, and not enough time on the actual material. His exams are way too hard - our final had very little to do with the the material from class or the problem sets.
fully agree with the first review.
Seth Fraden is, by far, the most uninteresting, unhelpful, and all-around un-qualified instructor at Brandeis.  I graduated a few yrs ago and hope he doesn't still "teach" there!

A lot better in 2024. Lectures (recorded!) are beautifully timed & well-prepared, cover everything you need to know, no need to self-study from textbook. 1hr to do APB/BMA quizzes w/ 3-4 tries per question type, exams are open-book + take-home. She gives lots of example past questions. TONS of office hour options: drop in, scheduled, recitation

Pretty nice and approachable, but not the most confident lecturer.

Teaches a lot of concepts that are very useful for the MCAT, but will not show up on her quizzes. Good course for premeds

Very stressful all-or-nothing grading scheme. Grades for written paper's feel somewhat subjective and inconsistent.

Definitely not as bad as some make her out

This is a bizarre class. There would constantly be topics not covered anywhere in lectures on the weekly tests. No other study materials were given. You can't even study if you want to. As others have said, this class is very unorganized. You never know where you are regarding the course; everything is chaotic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class is tough. She packs a lot of material in the class, and it is very overwhelming when you have other courses. The BMAs are every week, except for exam weeks. You have 15 min for the BMA. The exams are take home, and they take all weekend to finish. Then on Monday morning, she asks if you had a "wonderful weekend". Do not recommend it.

Dr. Westover's course was too big-- felt like she was intimidated. She rarely got through all her slides. Would frequently test material that was not covered in her weekly BMAs, which were difficult. I took it online mostly

In my experience, Professor Westover is very unclear when explaining complex concepts. I often find myself going back to lectures and repeating a certain topic numerous times as well as going to the textbook just to figure out what she is saying. She often stumbles on her words and gives minimal detail.
I kinda freaked out after reading the past reviews for her on ratemyprof... She definitely went easier for our class (Fall 2021). Had no exams & quizzes (aka BMAs) were online & open-notes.
Such a nice lady. Class is tough make sure to stay on top of lectures and know your material. You really have to stay on top of it to do well on her exams.
Class is a little disorganized, but she is really nice and overall a great professor.
This class is only hard because of the professor
I have never seen such a disorganized course in my life. Take it over the summer; avoid this professor at all costs. Few As given

Worst professor Ive had at Brandeis by far. Repeatedly has to re-explain herself because she makes so many mistakes during lecture. Her lecture notes are not clear. Does not curve at all even with low exam averages. Very rude and dismissive when you ask questions.

Very challenging course, but Dr. Westover really wants you to succeed. I made it through by attending office hours and rewatching lectures on the Echo360 because the tests are lecture heavy so reviewing them all again was pivotal to my success. Recitations were TA run so if they are helpful depends on the TAs, for us they were not so nobody went
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Westover's covers everything you need to know for exams in class. That being said, it is difficult to judge what will be asked on an exam because she rushed through them in class. Her exam questions are not usually very clear, so make sure to ask if you have any questions. She makes an effort to help students with difficulty memorizing info.

While Westover definitely is good at putting all of the information necessary for tests in her lectures, it sometimes feels like she quickly rushes through the most important information for tests. Her tests are inconsistent in difficulty too, and I could never predict what my grade was going to be on them.

He is a talented lecturer and was able to keep me interested through even the most boring parts of chemistry. Sometimes he can get off track but these diversions are always fun. A fair test giver and grader. Frequently available to talk about material, and great at explaining difficult concepts.

Petsko is great! His class was tough, but make sure you read the textbook and you should be fine.  Class is optional which is nice because you can get away with not going if you are clear on the topic for that day.  He's incredibly busy, yet still wants to be helpful to students and makes himself available when he is able to. Very funny guy too!!

He manages to make a huge tired lecture hall laugh hysterically ("I will throw the chalk THROUGH you."). Not the most comprehensive lecturer, but the textbook is great. Very accessible; we had lunch with him once. And he's just an amazing person: president of the American Society for Biochem, etc. Very cool dude. CONVERT TO MOLES!

I hate him. He thinks he's the greatest thing since sliced bread, and ok, I can get over that, but then he doesn't teach!! His lectures are all over the place and he talks about global warming more than chemistry. You NEED to know your stuff to pass his tests. I loved it when Dr Novak taught. She should have taught the class the whole time.

This guy is arrogant and sarcastic. That being said, he is hilarious and extremely intelligent. He knows what he's doing and is a great teacher. His tests are straightforward and without any trick questions. GREAT teacher.
He is really sarcastic. It's funny. And he teaches, as opposed to Epstein. I want to take biochem because HE is going to teach it. If he taught any other classes, I would take them ALL!
AWESOME. Makes you WANT to take BIOCHEM
He rocks.
This guy is the man.  Best professor in chem I've ever had
Petsko was awesome. Great lecturer. Brilliant researcher.
X-ray crystallography.
I agree entirely with the review below. He indeed does justice to teaching.

The lectures were probably as fun as possible for general chemistry lectures.  Ask him about his research -- he's doing cool things and cares about his students more than he appears to in class.  His lectures teach a lot and his course is well organized.

Not only a really nice person but he's an interesting professor and clearly passionate about what he teaches. He takes an interest in his students and he is very appreciative of any classroom participation. Also, he's the foremost KKK expert in the country. You'd never know it because he's very modest, but a movie is being made out of his book.
Excellent teacher-- always in touch with what students want and need...

I wasn't impressed with the intro class at all. I didn't think his teaching style was particularly interesting. The grading was up to the TAs and he seemed to have separated himself from the students of the class. I must say though, he had really awesome shoes.
Nice guy, interesting class. The grading done by the TA's is EXTREMELY subjective.
cool guy. class is REALLY easy. take it if you want an interesting GPA booster.
He is so interesting and his energy about topics is infectious. Plus, he is absolutely gorgeous. I want to try to take a class with him every semester.
Best prof in the department. Took class in fall 04 and had the best TA ever!!! Interesting lectures and great discussion class. I loved prof Cunningham and Duncan!

Professor Cunningham is the gem of the Brandeis University Sociology Department.  Not only is his research fascinating, he still loves to teach.  Down to earth, helpful, funny, and incredibly smart.  Amazing professor!
Loved youth subcultures and comm structure, very interesting.  And boy is he nice to look at.
best teacher i've had at brandeis.  explains everything clearly, is fair and makes the material interesting...so hot too!
Professor Cunningham is a great teacher. This class was interesting and fun. The teaching aids were great as well.
Very interesting. Please take this class
Great professor.  Learned alot about protests and group mobilization. :)

This is the worst class I've taken because our class resources page was disorganized.  Literally just drop links in untitled folders and it would be a headache every night to try to figure out what I was supposed to read. To make matters worse, he was not receptive to feedback. He definitely needs a teacher's assistant!
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Breen is an amazing lecturer. His essays are short - but also very fun (surprisingly!) to write. He creates very crazy law scenarios and you essentially create your own conclusion to determine what would be an appropriate action. Your fellow grades your paper and you do have to go to their weekly discussion. Some of them are tough graders.
Honestly the best teacher on campus. Super knowledgeable and has the most entertaining lectures that are very informative. LGLS 10a is a must take class.

Best professor in the world! Everyone should take a class with him. So incredibly interesting, engaging, funny, and really cares about his students. I learn so much in all his lectures and he's so kind and helpful in office hours too. He can make any topic interesting and worth remembering! Absolutely will take all his classes if I can.

Prof Breen is an absolute legend. His classes are always engaging and he inspires interest in the subject mater through his brilliant lecture style. Would 100% recommend. Grades however are given by the TA's.

Daniel Breen puts his heart and soul into every lesson and cares deeply about the subject and his students. He is so knowledgable and that becomes effortlessly clear even in the most simple conversation. When taking a class with Breen there is never a dull moment and you will leave smarter and with more questions than you came in with.

Amazing! Best professor ever! SUPER interesting, each lecture was like a story and it was always incredibly engaging and never boring. Essays were kind of tough and there were definitely specific things he wanted included that weren't always obvious. Midterm/final not as hard. Really funny, accessible, caring, definitely wants students to do well.

this is for science on trial 138B!!! - This class ruined my 4.0. Technically, there is no prerequisite, but intro to law would be helpful. His lectures are great but he goes incredibly fast. He definitely grades based on how he feels the case should be settled rather than the strength of your argument.

THE BEST PROFESSOR AT BRANDEIS (at least for the legal studies/American studies departments). His lecturers are like podcasts -- he turns law and history into stories. You might have to adjust to his lecture style in the beginning (aka learn how to take notes on only the important things), but after that his classes are so so enjoyable.
You don't need to read and still understand everything that is going on just going to the lectures (if you are good at taking fast notes/writing essays).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: AMAZING Professor. He already impress me from the first day of class. His lectures are amazing and inspirational, as he turned them into fascinating stories instead of boring law and principles. However, a majority of your grade came from essays (graded by TA) that ask you to apply principles from lecture which can be overwhelming and stressful.

Professor Breen is an absolute beast. When he isn't cashing checks, he's breaking necks. The way to succeed in this course is by completing the essays EARLY and sending them over to him. Likely in the same day (or the same hour) he will provide amazing feedback for your essays (which are worth a pretty substantial part of your grade).

Breen is THE BEST prof I have ever had at Brandeis. There are a lot great profs but no one is like him. I loved his class and enjoyed every single minute of it, especially given that it was during covid so you know how great his lectures were. If you are here bc you are thinking about whether to take his class or not, do it, you won't regret

I want to clarify: this isnt about Breen. He is awesome, and by I am here is to say THIS CLASS IS NOTTTTT AN EASY A. If you get the wrong TA you will not get an A no matter how hard you work. Thats all, please take this seriously, I came in for an easy A, but I also worked really hard and wrote well, but I had the hard TA and came out with a B :(
I <3 DNA damage

Miserable, pathetic rude ****. Exam expectations were totally unclear. Worst lecturer ever! Never finishes complete sentences so taking notes is frustrating as hell. His exam was awful! He barely reviewed half the stuff on the exam and it wasn't even in the book! I studied my ass off and it was practically all for nothing. Avoid him at all cost

Posted lecture notes to webct - very helpful. The first exam had a range of 2-100 with an average of 50. He definatey knew his stuff. It was easy to get by if you studied the material and did practice problems.

He is the most ridiculous teacher I have ever had. He is a complete jerk who doesnt care about anyone but himself. He emailed a bunch of people a drop coe after the first exam even if it was slightly below the curve. He gives horrible advice and makes students feel bad about themselves. If you can get out of taking this class with this professor pl

He is the most rude, condescending, dishearteing professor I have ever met or had!  While there is no doubt that HE knows what he is talking about, he doesn't care about his students at all and his tests will kill you...if you can avoid taking him than do immediately!
Interesting, very smart guy.  This class was super hard, with a bizillion papers to read.  Exams were fair, however.

Took two classes with him. He's amusing, goes off on angents, but know his stuff. He types up notes summary after each class, which is extremely helpful, still using those in grad school. he's a nice and funny guy. Exam questions can be unclear, but ok.
final should not be worth 60% of your grade
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
interested in what he teaches, sometimes goes off on tangents
No Comments

She is AMAZING! She is nice, but also will be very honest which can be both a good thing and a bad thing. As long as you read and participate in class, and you work hard, you will get an A. This is truly a class where you get the grade you deserve, and Berhane is awesome.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Prof Berhane is a wonderful professor, but the thing is, to get any worth from her class you MUST work for it. You need to participate all the time, do the case studies. But she's a kind grader, so if you don't prioritize her you'll coast by with a solid B. But if you put in the effort it's so worth it.
Lecture heavy, difficult to do well. Would recommend going for office hours as much as possible and talking to people who have taken classes previously with the Prof before enrolling

Extremely enthusiastic about everything she teaches and really wants her students to succeed! Highly recommend going to her office hours just to talk about life and your future. She offers really helpful feedback, so you can learn and improve. She definitely can be a tough grader but hoping she'll focus on the effort we put in at the end.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If given the opportunity to work with Professor Berhané, take it. What a wonderful opportunity to be in the presence of a professor who so deeply cares about the welfare of the individual. She is that professor who, if you give the opportunity, will teach you proficiently the field of business while also mentoring you in non-business matters.

I had a fantastic experience working under Professor Berhane, she was incredibly energetic and is one of the smartest teachers I've ever had the pleasure learning from. Her energy in the class really rubs off on the students, including myself, as she was able to get everyone involved and thinking about the topic at hand. All-around great teacher.

Berhané is one of the most challenging and inspirational teachers I've had at Brandeis. The class itself can be harsh; you should heavily prep for each class. Berhané herself is always available and extremely supportive (try going to office hours)and has been more than helpful in supporting me in and outside the class! Would recommend!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: While this course is difficult, Berhane would never allow you to fall behind. She is truly an incredible woman that is passionate to share her extensive knowledge of how to succeed in the real world. Such a worth while class where every day I walked away feeling like I had learned something to further my future. If given the opportunity, take her.

Professor Berhané is the most responsible professor I had ever met in Brandeis. The class is very inspirational, and Professor Berhané treats us like adults and teaches us the skills and virtues we need to have in order to get future success in Business. The classes are highly competitive since participation matters, be prepared to push yourself.

Professor Berhané is excellent and enthusiastic. Whenever we need help, she's always there giving feedback. Cases are explained in detail and paradigms are applied to cases so that these really contribute to our knowledge. Professor Berhané also curves our grades and gives extra credits. It is one of the classes that I can't even consider missing!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Berhane is an excellent professor. She really cares about her students a lot and would go out of her way to help succeed in their careers. This is easily the most difficult, in terms of work, and most rewarding class I've ever taken in my college career. It pushes you out of your comfort zone and really makes you think deeply.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Sava Berhane is a wonderful professor who cares deeply about her students. The course is structured in a way that allows you to think about the Business world in a strategic fashion. She's well organized, and her assignments and case studies are on point. I've learned a great deal from working with her and deeply respect her work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational
