Charles is super cool especially when he's teaching his niche interests. Interesting and engaging discussions each class. LOTS of readings though, lots of time spent on the same idea (Kula trade, anyone?), and we switched to students leading/teaching the class halfway through the semester. Taken Spring 2019.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I took this class mostly out of interest. The lectures were always interesting and the reading relatively light. Tests and papers are surprisingly hard, although Prof. Golden was always accessible and understanding. Not the class for an easy A, but definitely a must if you are interested in Archaeology at all.
Extremely engaging professor who clearly knows his stuff. Really interesting lectures, but make sure to take notes. Best course I have taken yet at Brandeis.
Love him!

For an intro class, I didn't expect him to want us to know practically every tiny detail for the exams. But lectures are really interesting, and the readings are useful. I would recommend taking anth5a (Human Origins).

His lectures are all power points that he posts on latte, which is very helpful for visual learners like me. I didn't do the readings, and my grade suffered do to it. If you pay attention class, you can still pass, but just barely. He loves what he does, and I loved his teaching style.
Interesting subjects, though his classes are wildly difficult.  He's so nice that it kills you not to try hard.  Also: the man is gorgeous.

While this class was not what I expected it to be, Professor Golden's enthusiasm and involvement made all the dry anthropological reading palatable. You can tell he genuinely cares about his subject, and is incredibly open to helping students. Plus, he's incredibly attractive!

I didn't like history or antebellum thought so I wasn't expecting to like her class. Ended up being my favorite class of the semester. She's dynamic, energetic, and hilarious. One of my favorite, if not my favorite professor at Brandeis. Take her class!!!

great prof.
very knowledgeable
a lot of reading/analyzing, but the work is generally worth it. 
wants students to succeed and provides great input to guide improvement.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: By far one of the best teachers I've ever had. She keeps her lectures engaging, sprinkled with relevant personal anecdotes and related historical facts that I found scribbling down in my margins because they were so interesting just to know. Straightforward exams and papers never try to trick you, just do the reading and pay attention.
She is a wonderful teacher, one of the best I've ever had!
She's a remarkable professor who I would recommend to anyone
Professor Farrelly is fantastic. She's why you come to a school like Brandeis.

Professor Farrelly is by far one of the most wonderful Professors/ people I have ever met. She is strong, inspiring and amazing all around. I would strongly recommend taking her class even if you are not from America/ have limited knowledge about American studies. She makes everything fun, and encourages diversity of thought in a multitude of ways.

A tough professor indeed, but definitely knows her stuff and is a great lecturer. Keeps students engaged. Don't take her class if you aren't prepared to work hard; however, she isn't out to "trick" you. Do the reading, go to class, and you will do well.

Professor Farrelly is one of the most brilliant people I know. She cares tremendously about the success of students, though she makes everyone work for their grades. She will challenge you to think critically but leaves you feeling all the better for it. One of the best teachers I've had at Brandeis.

She knows her material, and her lectures are interesting and pertinent, with randomness tossed in. I adored her religious history class, but she does grade fairly. Be prepared to work if you take her class.
What a queen

Hard class but amazing professor. Georgia knows a lot of random things which she links all together and makes relevant for us. Stay back after class for extra tangents and stories. She expects you to do a lot of work though, but she makes your writing better and you can tell she really cares about that. It's hard to get an A.

Hilarious but sometimes talks SO fast, she gets so excited! Class is a mix of learning to ignore the 5 para formula, and then analyzing musicals, books and plays. She did extra music, poems, stories, paintings not on the syllabus with us to show us more about what we were learning about. Class discussion was good but lectures were the best part

I wish she taught more than UWS, I would take all her other classes! Dr Luikens is a weird mixture of funny and serious, kinda tough but also cares about her students. She wants you to do well in her class and did lots of extra office hours. It wasn't an easy class but it was definitely my favorite this whole year
She is really dedicated and serious about helping students improve their work. She will also stay after class to answer extra questions or just to talk about the topic more if you want to.
She is tough and no-nonsense, but she is a good teacher and really helps improve your writing.

She's cool. Tough but fair. I learnt a lot, she's funny but takes students really seriously. She spends a lot of time on office hours. They are really helpful. Go to office hours! They will save you. Lectures are very fast, learn to take notes. She likes participation and it will affect your grade. Read the syllabus, she treats it like a contract!

so this was actually a music class not english (she is in music) and it was really good. I had her for another class too when i was a freshman and it was also very good, better than my friends uws. i loved her class. she's leaving (or has left already?) but literally every one would take another class with georgia if she had stayed

Loved the class she is very helpful and also super fun. She talks fast and she jokes but is also serious too and I learned heaps. We had the best uws which is funny because its always the class everyone hates but Georgia’s was the best one ever.
Awesome teacher, favorite class even tho we had to take a writing class it was so good

Definitely a great professor. She cares about students and what she is teaching. Lots of new insights in explaining the CRT, fairly hardcore for international students who never lived in the United States. It's sad that I am unable to take her classes for next semester and the next school year.

Great energy and personality and she really cares but I honestly feel like I didn't learn much that wasnt either just a repeat of high school history/news headlines. I think this was more a problem with the curriculum since she relied so much on us just learning from the books alone so lectures were more just conversations. Some students were rude.

Prof. Cooper is very bubbly and kind. She has good politics but will need to be pushed from time to time. Defiantly take her class if you want a conversation focused class with lots of discussion. Take her class if you want to share ideas. If you want to sit and not be speak, dont take her class.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Cooper is a real gem at Brandeis. Her wealth of knowledge and willingness to listen and share make her really shine. Any student, interested in History or not, would benefit from taking a class with her.

Professor Cooper looks at history through unique lenses and questions the ways in which we have been taught history in the US. She is passionate and wants her students to learn and be involved in the class. She is wonderful!!
Prof. Coopers great. There were some lectures but mostly its discussions based off the readings
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: incredible prof. amazing lectures. then we hash it all out in discussion. intense & passionate, she teaches from a deep knowledge and then just riffs. definitely unorthodox. a true ally. she welcomes creativity and different learning styles. don't leave Brandeis without taking Prof. Cooper.

Extremely enthusiastic and passionate about teaching. Really dedicated herself to making the course discussion-based where everyone loved contributing. She really wants students to get the most out of her class, so graded assignments are more like opportunities to demonstrate knowledge rather than "gotchas." Excellent professor, excellent class.
Amazing!
Very unusual style that took me all semester to get used to. Professor Cooper is nice, but not the best at Brandeis, or even the best in her department.

I had an incredible time learning from Professor Knight. He is super liberal, hilarious and actually very nice so make aure to stay and talk to him after class and go to the after-class psychotherapy tape sessions. Tests are hard but your grade can be saved with the extra-credit paper. Also requires a lot of work.
Brilliant man. Riveting to listen to. Intense, frank, and funny. Difficult grader with high expectations.

Wonderful and gifted lecturer, enthusiastic about the subject and teaching, always helpful and available for questions and clarifications. The class requires hard work, but it is ultimately very rewarding. Highly recommended!

He's such an interesting guy and has so many stories to tell. Having said that, he's not a great lecturer. Slides are dense or confusing and he is VERY unclear. Tests are long and mystifying. WRITE THE PAPER. It's worth your time.

Incredibly brilliant, a wonderful lecturer, and always open to help students. Expect to WORK HARD in his classes. His exams are fair but difficult, and he expects a lot. I have nothing but respect for him, and cannot recommend his classes enough! Tests & Measurements is essential for anyone interested in research or clinical work. Awesome prof.

Difficult classes, but you'll learn more than with any other professor.  His exams are extremely difficult, but he's available to help and will always respond promptly with detailed answers to e-mailed questions.  One of my favorite Brandeis professors.
unfortunately, he has narcissistic personality disorder.  but i like the lectures.
No Comments

i adored listening to his lectures, but his exams were absolutely unfair (with questions like "what would professor knight think of blah blah blah")  he needs more quizzes and he needs to be a little less narcisissitic
brilliant brialliant brilliant guy but expects too much from undergrads
The worst teacher Ive ever seen Worst lecturer with low score

He can be funny but mostly his classes are boring and off topic. It's definitely not a hard class but you probably won't learn very much. Gordon goes on a lot of tangents, rarely gives good feedback, and takes forever to give notes on papers. Just do the work (which really isn't that much) and skim the readings and you'll be fine.

His comp class is currently my biggest burden in my first semester, with unclear expression, sarcastic conversation and confusing scientific papers which he himself doesn't fully understand. If you write your argument out of his expectation, he gives you a C. So bad that I couldn't choose which comp class to attend, or I will definitely DROP it.
The professor is just very confusing. Lectures are boring. Unclear feedback. However, attendance and effort matter and he is not a hard grader.
charming
He is not only a tough grader but also expects homework. The homework requires a lot of reading to do in sciences which is not my cup of tea. He is not even clear with what he says.
Gordon is the nicest Professor I have had at Brandeis! He really wants to get to know his students and is always willing to help you success... Also he is great as a composition teacher!

Prof. Ruesch is the man! Really nice guy, chill, and funny a lot of the time. He can sometimes be a little confusing, but the assignments and essays are straightforward. He takes the time to meet with students individually, something many professors would never do.

He's a nice guy, and he tries hard to be helpful to his students, but I don't always know what he's talking about. Be sure you know the subject of the class is Ethics and Innovation (science stuff) thats not always clear on the registar.
Great guy! Awesome professor.
he is very hard to talk to/access outside of class. nice guy but not a great teacher. will latch onto topics he personally is interested in during class a LOT.

Such a lame professor who has little cares to his students, he cares only about his own research)
 kick the students off the office because he said he don't have time, talking nonsense on class, what he teach is 100% different with what he is testing about. 

who has a bad quiz with no rules in the grading system, RUN!!! Trust me!!!

Terrible when teaching class materials. Treat uni students like small children and always command student on small things such as close the laptop etc. will not cover anything in the first half hour of the class because he is talking nonsense. He emphasizes on how important his research is and how little effort he can put on the class. RUN!
GOOD!

Really interesting lectures/discussions. He made macro interesting by putting the models we were learning into the historical context of when they were created. Problem sets are tough, but graded on completion. Final and quizzes were much easier than problem sets. This guy does not want to speak to you or see you outside of class which sucks.

A smart and nice professor. He turns macro into something intuitively easy to understand. I would recommend to speak up during this class. He is quite hard to reach outside of the class (always busy with researches).

I loved taking class with Professor L'Huillier. He is an extremely intelligent person, and his enthusiasm and passion for economics is palpable and contagious. He is engaging and his teaching is straightforward. He places a lot of emphasis on class participation. I took this class during the COVID pandemic, and he was really accommodating. Love him

Cares too much about his own research; prioritizes it over student learning (e.g. complex and strict office hour rules, lectures devoted to his own work, cancelling a final review session to work on his paper). Poor job at teaching the material (when he gets to it). Quizzes are easy, problem sets are tough but completion grades. Would not recommend

Prof. LHuillier is very smart and intuitive. His lessons are avangard, the theoretical knowledge are interesting and the applications are pretty useful. I met with him in his office to talk about my prospective and he was caring and polite.

Hi is such a terrible professor, just avoid him as possible as you can. What he cares is his research. He will spend no time on your questions. If you ask him questions via email, he will get angry. He does not welcome students to come to his office hour. I try to make appointments several times but I failed. Sometimes he would make laugh at you...
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She's so caring and clearly wants all of her students to succeed.
Lectures, homework, projects, tests.
Nice class, not too hard.
Wei Laoshi slays. She is so funny, entertaining, inspirational, caring, great at teaching. 10/10 would recommend.

Wei laoshi is the best Chinese professor I've had in my 7 years of taking Chinese. I've learned more in a semester than in my high school Chinese classes. The daily mini quizzes aren't too hard, and there's minimal homework. There's also a lot of class participation during the powerpoints, but it is helpful with memorization.
Wei Laoshi is a fantastic Chinese teacher and full of energy every day! It's great to experience.
Professor Wei makes Chinese learning become super easy. Although I was starting, I do not struggling to learn this language. Her lecture are very fun and interesting too.

Learning Chinese is very challenging but Professor Wei makes it extremely manageable. She is very accessible and always willing to help and meet with students privately to explain any difficult topics. Be sure to show up to class and complete homework assignments.
Great class, great profesor!
Professor Wei is the best professor Ive ever met in the university. Although Chinese sounds hard, with Professor Wei, it is full of fun. Wish all the best to you Wei Laoshi.

Let's face it, 80A is a GPA booster. It's easy for Asian background student, and Prof Hang is humorous in class. He talks about Ma Yun & his Kong Fu dream hahahah. And TAs are great too. As for reading, just scan it. He gave 3 or 4 potential essay prompt for midterm & final, just prepare for each single of them, very easy A. Very little workload.

He's an awesome lecturer, and if you stay on track of his lectures, this course is not going to be too hard. Quizzes are fairly graded and so are midterm and final. I recommend checking the reading grades frequently, it's tentative. Overall, this course is very doable and has lots of interesting stuffs.

His class was pretty interesting, but didn't really get to the Modern part of the Modern China until basically the end of the class. It was more of a "History of China" class. There are a lot fo readings. 2 essays (mid-term and final). Would take him again. He's chill.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: 80a is a freshman class, so it's fairly easy grading-wise, but you either have to have a prior background with the material or do all the readings if you want an A, and there are a ton of readings. They're worth it, but it doesn't feel like it when you're doing them. Lectures are fun and fairly chill, though he tends to go over by a few minutes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Hang is very engaging when he lectures which is great, but there is a LOT of reading to do.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Hang is a fantastic lecturer and extremely thorough when explaining any concept, instruction, or expectation. He has a quirky sense of humor (but it's great) and a very engaging and eloquent style of speech. Highly recommend his class!

Professor Hang is a great lecturer and helps foster a real interest for the subjects he teaches. He's funny, sweet, and honest which are great qualities to have as a teacher. He's a fair grader and an understanding person who honestly just wants you to pass and learn something.

I took East Asian Pirates (1000% recommend b/c it's... about East Asian pirates...), and he's still working out how to balance lectures vs discussions, but his personality makes it a good class. Kind of awkward but in a funny way - at least 1 gem every class. Easygoing guy and passionate about history. Weekly readings (could get away w/o reading.)
It is obvious he really cares about history, and he'll work with you if outside problems are affecting your schoolwork.

The course has way too many tasks to do as an introductory course. Mandatory weekly online forum posts are simply torturing at times. The course has one mid-term and one final and a 10 page analysis paper. Not an easy grader.
Great instructor. Very clear and concise. Tries to get you to participate in the classroom. I found him to be nice enough as well. I did feel that his quizzes were pretty difficult.
Probably really smart, but so boring. Gives trivial examples, but grades strictly.
Teaches well but acts very very professional. Does not care for students.
Smart guy (very smart), but has a problem with bad assignments, and easy examples. The issue comes when you get the quizzes/tests and they're much more difficult than what you were studying :)
Was very nice.  Spent a little too much time on combinatorics.
No Comments
Super professor-my advisor- always available, very helpful. Clear explanations, and clever humour
No Comments
Very clear lecturer -- things just made sense the way he explained them.
No Comments

It's disappointing to reflect on my experience with Professor Rebecca. Her teaching style lacks clarity and coherence, leaving students confused. Instead of fostering learning, she exudes condescension and belittlement, shattering confidence. This toxicity pervades every facet of her instruction, making it deeply demoralizing.

Professor Gieseking is crazy organized and has amazing lecture notes. She communicates all topics clearly, and makes sure her standards for grading, etc. are very clear prior to you taking tests/quizzes. Review sheets were a godsend, and she was never too busy to answer my questions (even the smallest, simplest ones). Great teacher, great person.

Great organizational skills and effective, clear communication. You know what is on each exam and how it will be graded. Very fair grader. Deadlines and schedules are followed, and if there are changes, those are communicated quickly to students.

The best science experience I have ever had after 7 years of intense science classes. This was the first time I understood chemistry to a level beyond what I expected. The course is not difficult if you utilize the resources effectively and approach for help when needed, but if you are lazy/unprepared it can have its challenges.
DONT TAKE HER COURSE!!!

In my entire course time,I have not encountered a moment without confusion where I had to not revisit every line of work in order to get baseline understanding. This is not supposed to be the case, and especially with such difficult coursework.Pacing was uneven, and if you are a student who takes time to break down material, take the regular course

Overall an amazing lecture and research professor. Course material is hard but doable if you do the textbook reading and optional homework assignments. She is available outside of class time. For research, she is always understanding and considerate of her students. Honestly best professor for my first time in a research group!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Gieseking is a great teacher! She is very organized (posts all her notes/lecture recordings) and clearly knows the topic. She makes us feel welcome to ask questions during class. The content is just hard, but doable if you have a strong chem background or put in the weekly effort. Test heavy, but has a redemption session on the final.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Belittles student questions. Standards very unclear. Overall confusing and hard to communicate with. Her class was the worst experience of my academic life Everything I learned, I learned with my peers outside her class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Clearly knows her subject, but won't let us catch up. You'll be taught a lot more than expected (quantum stuff)- whether you'll actually understand/remember it is debatable. Absolutely do not take this class with her unless you have already taken AP Chem and intend to be a science major. Attendance is not mandator, but you won't pass if you skip.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He is very nice and his class is very funny!! The workload is not heavy and the circumstance in the classes is comfortable.

There are in class quiz and take home exams. They are not difficult. His lectures are very funny but easy, yet still worth taking as a general requirement or a GPA booster. He ordered pizza at the end of the semester.

Davy is a musical genius. He was able to make species counterpoint, one of the most dreaded topics in music theory, interesting if not bearable. The rest of the class actually feels boring in comparison. He is extremely funny and approachable as well. Ask him to balance the piano stool on his head when he plays or how to play five octaves at once.
He has at least 3 different types of melodica and writes Calvin and Hobbes comics about species counterpoint. 5 stars.

Davy is amazing!!! He's so passionate and hilarious that he really makes his lectures engaging and interesting. The workload is really light, but I spent a lot of time on his class simply because I wanted to and his passion rubbed off on me. You should definitely take one of his courses. He gave us pizza at the final exam!
DAVY!!!!!!
He is just brilliant!
Davy is the king of awesome!!!!
Davy is wonderful!
He's one of the best teachers I have ever had...and he's always amusing!

Unclear criteria for grading. Very little feedback. Course seems repetitive/ unnecessary after all of the other HSSP requirements;  would prefer more novel information be required for the major. Thinks more of himself than he should. Not very considerate. Only need the texts to write the papers.
Very helpful and interestedinteresting professor.
I liked what he talked about and how he presented it.

Peter was a terrible teacher.  I found him tremendously unhelpful.  After taking the class I became aware of a whole body of literature he should have referred me to when we met to discuss my papers, but he never did refer me to it (and certainly would have known about it given his training and expertise).
Great lecturer and wonderful man, truely one of the best overall professors that I've had at Brandeis, even if the content of course and assignments wasn't particularly interesting to me.
ok
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
great lecturer - interesting subject.  tough grader but made me a better writer!
so condescending and redundant...very disappointing experience

Those who only listen to him lecture and never talk to him outside of class seem to be rubbed the wrong way by Teles. However, if you do chat with him, or even e-mail, he is incredibly responsive and helpful. He'll elaborate or give advice on assignments, and he is very interested in his students, and their thoughts.

Took some amazing classes with him and really learned about American politics. Towards the end class was disappointing and didnt think he was that into teaching. Not that helpful to students outside class.
Steven Teles is an arrogant man without much quality to support his arrogance. His classes are full of jargons and trivial talks that virtually makes sitting in his class a waste of students' youth.
Killed my interest in politics.

Teles is the best.He is a true educator who cares about his students,values their opinions,and won't down-grade if you don't agree with him, which is rare here.He challenges students to really think, not just to regurgitate info.He is demanding even in large lectures, but encouraging @the same time.
One of the coolest professors ever! We read some fascinating books. I was a little bummed he didn't let us go to the ice cream social. He has the same voice as Tom Hanks.
Painfully boring and annoyingly uses the word 'right' after EVERY god darn sentence.
super nice professor, class its self mids

Uretsky definitely knows a lot but the lectures are pretty disorganized and repetitive, and a lot of the discussions seem to just be the same few students saying the same few things. A lot of activities seem designed to waste time, and there isn't really much groundbreaking info presented beyond what one could learn just by reading the news.
Taking a class on pandemics during a pandemic was a bit much. Uretsky enjoys talking a lot, and I am not sure if I actually learned much from her course.

Uretsky managed to make the entire field of medical anthropology seem like a sham in this class. She was far more interested in advocating an ideology than fostering discussion, and even insulted a guest presenter behind their back for their profession. Avoid her if you want to learn about medical anthropology from a nuanced perspective.
Really relaxing for her to have students presenting for more than an hour and she just talks for like twenty minutes every class. Not recommending it at all.
BEST TEACHER EVER! IF YOU EVER HAVE THE CHANCE, TAKE A URETSKY CLASS!

The class was often discussion based, where she would say a few things at the beginning and then encourage people to share their own thoughts. (Would lead to quite a few awkward silences.) She is very experienced in the field of anthropological medicine. LOTS of readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly one of the best professors I've had! Course work is super interesting and she has an obvious passion for the subject! Her lectures are great, and she really knows what she's talking about! I would gladly take more classes with her!

While she seemed to know her information and was usually pretty interesting to listen to, having every class be lead by students for an hour and 20 min was rarely interesting, and I didn't feel like it was super conducive to learning. I think it would have been nice for her to guide the conversations more and introduce each section with a lecture
Easy and boring

Omg.... He sucks... The worst math teacher I have ever met... He just doesn't know how to teach!!! I'm pretty good at math but just can't understand what he is talking about... I rather study with book on my own... However, he is a nice person...
Difficult to understand and often more absorbed in his own ranting than in his students' education. Easy material made hard due to poor communication.
horrible teacher.  doesn't explain anything, does way to many proofs without explaining anything, and homework and tests are way beyond the scope of the class.  avoid at all costs.

He's a nice guys and loves teaching and math, but sometimes he's vague and hard to follow. His slides in class aren't to helpful, but the hw can easily be done with just the textbook. Alright teacher.

man is a complete and utter nut!! my academic adviser even told me not to take a class with him, but i just wanted to take care of the science requirement without a hardcore science. Long story short he's an awful teacher, he gets too absorbed in the subject sometimes and it sounds like he's just teaching himself. Going to his office hours confused

He's definitely a tough teacher. a lot of work and quizzes.  if you keep up with it you should be fine though being forced you to keep up with the work all year = less cramming b/f finals.  A very very genuine and nice person though.  It's obvious he loves to teach cares very much for the students is more than willing to provide aid i learned a lot
very hard grader and a very hard class

I went to his office hours when I was totally confused and he cleared everything up. He is a good teacher. Also, he randomly interjects his political views into the class, which is highly entertaining. He's a weird guy; it's fun.

A professor who would clearly rather be writing books than teaching. His classes were disorganized and dry, and he seemed not to care whether or not we were learning anything.  The class was a real disappointment especially considering how great the actual music was.

I thought this was going to be a course comparing Romantic literature to Romantic music.  Often, it felt like an excuse for him to play the piano in front of us twice a week.  Though I do feel like I learned a lot, especially from the papers, he never stuck to a syllabus and lectures were hard to follow.
No Comments
Chafe is waaaaay boring...I dropped this course toward the end of the semester because I couldn't stand it anymore.

He is arrogant and extremely closed-minded. If you do not agree with him he will dislike you and talk about you to other students and professors. He treats women like objects and favors men with accents. He teaches his opinions as facts.

I took music of composers of Romantic/post romantic period. He is a great lecturer, very interesting, great guy. His grading is strict, but he only has one paper and one final. You will learn a lot, he is very knowledgeable.
His class is SOOO boring, but I need it for my major, so I have to take it.
No Comments
No Comments
He's the best. The course is of course difficult but he makes it understandable. Besides, he is a generous grader!

Roberts is one of the best professors ever. He cares about his students and is willing to help improve. Tests are tough but he curves really well too so has no intention of being hard on his students. Great lecturer and very clear.
Prof. Roberts' class was clear and especially interesting

Professor Roberts is one of the few professors I've seen who is genuinely excited to teach. He taught Advanced Introductory Physics in my freshman year and had so much fun teaching. His enthusiasm for the subject is infectious, and his ability to create personal relationships with students is unparalleled. He learned every students' name.
Clear lecturer, fair grader. Great class.

An interesting and fair professor who genuinely cares about his students.  Exams were an incredibly accurate representation of the material covered in the course.  The website accompanying the book was helpful, too.
Passionate lecturer, cares that students understand and enjoy the material.  Gives diverse examples in class, challenging but rewarding problem sets, very reasonable exams.
I loved the Physics 15 sections.  His lectures were usually very clear, but sometimes he got into some weird imaginary number stuff that nobody understood.
No Comments

Loved Politics of Russia and the Post Communist World! Super funny and interesting lectures, also very accessible in office hours and would always really try to help students. The essay assignment was not super difficult and the quizzes were very straightforward and only tested the big ideas from class. Would definitely recommend!

I absolutely loved Professor Wilson. His lectures were always so intresting and easy to understand. We never had a midterm because he would have "miniterms" every two weeks or so that only covered a small bit of information, which I loved. Super caring, funny, assigns a lot of readings, but they are always relevant, helps understand material better

Dr. Wilson is an AMAZING professor. I took Russian Foreign Policy with him. Although I'm not particularly interested in international relations, I had a great time. He's hilarious, caring, flexible, and gives great feedback. He's also accessible outside of class. He does assign long readings, but they're skimmable and he goes over them in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Online Savvy

comment: one of my fave classes and fave professors. Wilson is funny & helpful, lectures went by so fast because they were so interesting. workload super manageable, readings are long but I didn't have to do them except to summarize main idea in preparation for midterm/final. would take any class just to have Wilson again tbh

Best prof ever! This class was fascinating, and so timely considering the war in Ukraine. Make sure to participate a few times every class and do the readings and you'll be fine. Reasonable grader for essays, no midterm/final. He has incredibly interesting lectures and is extremely knowledgeable on anything related to Russia. Definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: I loved Wilson!! You should absolutely take one of his classes if you can. So interesting, amazing lectures, learned so much. Lots of reading assigned in an intro class, 50-100 pages per class, and it was hard, but really helped me improve my overall skills and get ready for upper level courses. I'm so glad I took this class! Hard but worth it.

Wilson was a good prof, imo not for intro courses. Dry lectures & provides specific texts to read on specific topics. One in-class essay for midterm & another for final exam. 3 750 word essays on a prompt. About 50 double-sided (100 total) pages of reading per class, required to understand the general argument to summarize on essay tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I have taken a few classes with Prof Wilson and he makes anything he teaches super interesting and accessible for students whether they have experience in the topic or not. He is a fair grader, a kind and interesting lecturer, and very down to earth. Cant recommend taking a class with Prof Wilson enough!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Wilson is a really engaging lecturer. I could sit in his classes all day and listen to him speak! Class is graded mostly by a few essays so beware of that.

Professor Wilson is such a great professor. He goes above and beyond for his students, is super passionate and knowledgeable about the material (which is ever relevant and interesting), and has great, classic dry professor humor! Definitely take a class with him, he embodies everything great about Brandeis and the Politics department.

She is very passionate in teaching the subject, and explains the material very clearly. Your entire grade is dependent on quizzes and tests however and this makes the class hard to enjoy. Course material is not hard. Some questions on quizzes are more challenging than HW, be good at math, or you will not get a very good grade.

It's not a great class to learn macro. To be honest way too much on the analytical side of looking at economic indicators and less on understanding markets and the macroeconomic outlook. Lectures are not worth it. Class material is not difficult, but she does not write good quiz/exam questions. Be good at math, or you will fail.

She really changed her teaching style completely. 100% of the gradings depend on quizzes and exams. No more participation grade or homework grade. There is also no curve. She said that the quizzes would be almost the same as the problem sets, with only numbers changing. However, that's not the case. Is it even possible for anyone to get an A?
Purposely hard to work with and not good at presenting concepts
Easy to get A. But you won't learn anything about econ. I honestly think I learned more in the introductory macro class than this one.
It's not difficult to receive A if you do all the homework and attend her class. She really change a lot about her teaching style and the grading is great. Recommend to take it
Easy to get high grades if finish the question set in time, but barely understand anything related to econ.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Horrible. She teaches the class maths instead of economics. What she should've done is teach economics with the support of maths not the other way around. She tries to explain everything in maths and basic calculus knowledge is required for this class. Her powerpoints are horrible and her lectures are too long. Homeworks are hard, exams not really.

She teaches Economics like a math class. I asked what NPV meant and, to quote, "I'm not sure what the net means. I think it's just present value." She then tried to answer the question using math. Math is to be used to model economic theories. She uses PLENTY of math, but there is ZERO economics to be found. Absolutely horrible professor.

Multiple readings (including full books at times) daily. Sometimes made us read a whole book on a whim. Poor time management. Last minute changed our presentations from 10 minutes to 4. Made it obvious if he thought your discussion point was stupid. Employed great TAs and was certainly passionate about the material.

very kind - made us cookies, brought us treats. Birth of a nation was handled poorly from a race perspective. I never did the readings - you really don't have to. I did participate sometimes but mostly just sat there very bored. his slides are scary looking. kind and gave extensions though

JP is a great professor! He really knows his stuff but the class is engaging and heavily based on discussion. His assignments can be a bit unclear and it's a lot of reading, but overall I would consider it worth it. I always enjoyed class and got a lot of good insights into whatever we were reading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Plotz did a great job with Eng 1A. He was extremely invested in the course, displayed clear knowledge of the material, and enabled discussion in a setting of 70 students. I however disapproved highly of the reading material and didn't find him too accessible. Well-done class overall, but now I'm no longer interested in the English major

An interesting guy, with a laid-back and inquisitive demeanor. He loves to listen to students' comments, and he's very easily read when you're talking. He's excited about the material and has a sense of humor about it.  The course itself was loosely structured enough to be baffling, but I liked the atmosphere and level of interactivity.
I don;t even know where to begin... Plotz is a wonderful person, a good man, and even a better teacher.

One of my favorite Brandeis profs - knows his stuff, but doesn't have to rub it in all the time, and also genuinely cares about students.  Discussions were always really engaging.  Also kind of adorable in a skinny, balding kind of way.  Plus we got to read a graphic novel for class, which is always a plus.

Great professor,truly engaging and helpful.Bad class, i cannot wait for it to be over.Big lecture does not really identify with the nature of the class and it feels more like a book club than a serious English class.I would definitely recommend Professor Plotz though,brilliant guy and the nicest professor at brandeis.

Easily one of the best profs at brandeis--always kind, clear, passionate and helpful.  Cares deeply about student's success, and works tirelessly to promote it.  A great teacher and a wonderful person...

Prof Joyce really knows what she is talking about and although the class can be tough just stay caught up on readings and key terms. Offers many opportunities for extra credit, this semester if you attended all or most sessions you would be getting a separate extra credit grade. Lots of readings and lectures, but overall great quality + good class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: The professor is very unprofessional towards students who happen to disagree with her opinion. Her teaching style mostly focuses on her own pro-military opinions. Spends a lot of time emphasizing memorization instead of interactions with course material. This class singlehandedly ruined my interest in IR.

By far one of the worst experiences I've ever had with a professor. The whole course feels like propaganda for the military and US government. This professor does not know how to teach in an unbiased manner and instead pushes her own views ahead of the learning aspect of the course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I loved Prof Joyce! She is a hard grader and expects a lot out of her students, but she's fair and accessible outside of class if I needed her. She is lecture heavy but I found them to be very interesting! It is hard to get an A in this class, but if you pay attention, take good notes and study a lot before her tests you should be fine.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Joyce is knowledgeable, however the structure of her class is dry. This class is unfortunately too focused on the textbook readings which makes it unengaging. Instead of looking at IR as an applicable and developing subject, it is focused on ideas and principles that feel dated and irrelevant in many contemporary contexts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: As an ex-student of Pol165a (taken in Fall 2022), I believe Prof. Joyce is an amazing Professor. Her course is demanding, with lots of reading and writing, and you have to be prepare to discuss. Yet the in-class discussion is very interesting. She also give lots of good feedback for your writing materials, which helped me to improve a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: she only has 4 grades, 3 of which are in person exams. the content is really intense especially in comparison to intro igs which is at its core the same concept

Prof. Joyce was one of my worst educational experiences. In class she emphasized memorizing authors rather than learning material and interacting with it in a critical and interesting way. I greatly enjoy international relations and can honestly say that this class with its lack of guidelines, and terrible lectures almost ruined the subject for me.

Prof. Joyce is an absolutely incredible educator, she's really intelligent, has so much experience, and so many amazing connections in the diplomacy/security world. You have to work hard for her (and read a LOT) but discussion is always scintillating. She's not afraid to let discussions take their course+and she puts a lot of care into her classes

Great professor that is very passionate about his work. Will have difficult problems sets and exams that you will have to work and study hard for, but Professor Hall prepares you well and is always willing to help students understanding the work through office hours and meetings.
Wonderful Professor! Wonderful Class lecture! Wonderful Class Slides ! Wonderful Problem Set! You would get frustrate midterms to fail!
Took econ161 with him. Hall is super caring and professional and delivers good lectures. Focus on his lectures is essential for a good grade. Also, he's a kind and nice person to be with.

this is for econ 161:
he lets you see the world through economist perspective: very interesting content and acceptable teaching style

This was quite a difficult class in that the topics covered were highly abstract and required some grinding to get right. Intuition was very difficult to grasp and Professor Hall knew full well that this was the case. Despite the difficulty, I believe he did a great job teaching the course to us. Overall, was a very interesting upper level class.

Professor Hall definitely cares about his students and never fails to attempt to impart some non-economical wisdom. Instead of just teaching you how things are, he truly goes into the deeper, abstract, and intellectually stimulating question of why things are the way they are and the intuition behind it. It's very important that you understand why.

I think Prof. Hall did an amazing job incorporating news into the lecture, which has been particularly helpful to stay informed during covid 19. My major takeaway from his lecture is to think critically and thoroughly of the government policies and always keep up to date with news.

Had him for an intermediate course as well as an advanced one. Easily one of my favorite professors at Brandeis. He's extremely intelligent and really gets excited about the material, but sometimes moves far too quickly. He's really great though, cares about his students and wants them to understand the material and succeed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Gives good lectures. He teaches high level courses so you should expect to work for it.

Ellen inspires the class with her lectures and the way she leads discussions. When a student has something to say, she actively listens and excitedly responds. Myth and Ritual is a lecture based course, with multiple discussion postings about the readings as well as two long papers (8 pages and 12 pages).

Very kindhearted lady who is always willing to listen to what students had to say. She made class interesting with the guest lecturers. There was too much reading that we rarely actually got to in class as she goes on tangents, and she did not leave grades for several assignments, but I feel like I learned a lot and enjoyed my time in the class.

Lots of readings but as long as you pay attention to the main ideas you can do okay on assignments. Great discussions but the professor is a bit unorganized, regardless she's eager to help students and answer questions. Don't expect to ever see the ppts uploaded on latte though
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: She obviously cares about anthropology very deeply. That being said, she is completely incompetent when it comes to digital technology, and completely unable to get anything done on time - she submitted final grades almost 3 weeks late, and many students in my class did not receive any grades other than their final grade and the first assignment.

While she is very disorganized and not tech savvy in any meaning of the word, Schattschneider is very sweet, caring, and obviously cares deeply for the material. Due dates often come "quicker than expected" for her so many times due dates have been pushed back. Readings are definitely high quality if you're interested, but are unnecessary.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Schattschneider is one of the most caring and compassionate professors at Brandeis. The readings are incredibly interesting and class time flies by. She's available outside of the classroom and is willing to talk to you about anything. She can be a bit disorganized. I would take a class with her every semester if I could!

Ellen is absolutely amazing. Super scatterbrained but the sweetest person ever. She has awesome discussions and lets students lead. She assigns a lot of readings but you quickly realize that you don't need to read most of it. She's a super easy grader (as long as you do it... A!). she also loves to talk about cool ideas she likes from your papers

She asks good questions and assigns good readings. While the materials she chose is certainly intriguing and stimulating, her lecture style is not very efficient. Letting students dominate the classroom for 80min and never cut them down so rarely go through readings on time. But if you do the assignments proplyim sure you will get an A.
Prof Schattsneider is one of the sweetest professors I have ever had. She cares about her students so much and she is an awesome and interactive lecturer.

He's well versed in economics, and makes lectures enjoyable with memes, but as a student with a disability, I did not feel respected. I tried to use my accommodations, and he basically said no. I averaged in the 90s on assignments, but 50s on exams. Curved, so I ended with a B. Dont take unless you learn well in traditional testing environments.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This review is for Sa's Econ 82b. Very math-based and solid. You will learn a lot. Don't feel bad because of bad exam grades since there are huge curves. You expect to get an A/A- for 70/100 on exams.

I love that Prof Sa always teaches economics from a solid mathematical standpoint which makes sense in a very strict manner. Some people find it hard to comprehend but I don't. He always uses chalk to conduct all the induction so be prepared to take a lot of notes. Grading is exams and homework-based. Sounds hardcore but I learned a lot.
Very Very kind and Very Very nice !!!!!!  i learnt many thing from his class and i would say Professor Sa really let me interested in economics and even let me want to major in economics

Looking back on my experience at Brandeis, I think Sa was the best professor I had. It was really challenging for an intro, but you get such a solid understanding of the basic concepts in economics. His lectures had me on the edge of my seat, they were so good.
The best Econ professor at Brandeis University. Don't miss out if you really want to learn something.
homework, lots of homework, hard exams, lots of hard exams, crazy curve, very crazy curve, nice guy, super nice guy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Sa's class inspired me to major in Econ. He knows how to make otherwise dry lectures engaging by connecting content to current events. His passion and extensive knowledge of Economics are evident every time he teaches. Although assignments and exams can be challenging, I felt that I left the class with a deep understanding of the concepts

I've taken both Intro to Macro and Micro with Professor Sa and he, without a doubt, is one of the best professors I've ever had. While his tests and quizzes may be challenging, they're incredibly helpful in the long-run. His lectures are very engaging and his skits are hilarious, showing how much he cares for his students.
Very good Professor

Spring 2021. Bellin is an okay professor. Occasionally rude or politically incorrect during lectures, but is a good lecturer overall. The class is a lot of work, you don't have to do all of the readings but you should do a majority to help with the essays. Exams were only on lecture material. Difficult but not impossible for an intro course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Bellin is widely respected, super knowledgeable, and intent on helping her students become better political scientists. She's not easy, but not too tough; most of the work is reading (of which there is a lot), although you don't have to do all of it. The electives she teaches are more enjoyable than the intro classes.

Bellin is a very good lecturer and packs a lot into one class, but during 2020/2021 she doesn't care about online students! She did a terrible job of adapting for me online in a "hybrid" class. She ignores online students, and gave us a completely different test. Hundreds of pages of reading per week, and you need to read it all for the test.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great first experience in the Politics department! Her lectures and notes are clear and concise, while also detailed and engaging. The course is very reading heavy, and they're necessary for doing well on the papers and in-class discussions. Bellin's few personal anecdotes made her even more likable - really, she's awesome.
Great lecturer
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Bellin is awesome! She was super organized and it was always clear what readings you should do, but you didn't really need to do them as she goes over them in class. She was an engaging lecturer, and clearly is passionate about the subject and her students. Her office hours were great, and especially cool given how respected she is!

Professor Bellin has a very organized and structured class which is nice and she is approachable and nice. She assigns a lot of reading and has a moderately difficult grading policy, but it is a fun and interesting class and she is super respected in the field which is cool.

I absolutely love Professor Bellin! Her lectures were interesting and indepth for the most part! Her tests can be a little hard to study for, but if you go to class, take good notes, and pay attention, getting an A is really not impossible. She assigns a lot of reading, but it's not 100% necessary to do because everything's really lecture based!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Passionate, supportive, she gets students to think outside their boxes.  She opened up my eyes in looking at art and awakened my need and desire to make art.  She connects all this to your major subject and so enriches that immensely.  Take her class.

By far the best professor I've ever had.  Incredible experiential teaching style. Wicked effective pedagogy.  Very open-minded and always eager to help her students.  I just wish she taught more classes here!
Wonderful class - inspirational teacher! Best class I took at Brandeis!

Wow, this is probably my favorite professor ever. She is an inspiration. Takes art and turns it into daily life. Makes it relevant. She connects politics, art, social issues, history, together and empowers you to become a "maker." Take anything she offers.
I learned a lot from this class and recommend it to anyone who is interested in education, art, or learning.
This was probably my favorite class, and I learned a lot about art that I still remember years later.  She is great!
wonderful! wonderful!
Absolutely amazing.  Such a wonderful person, teacher, artist.  And the class was unbelievable.  Such a great experience!

Best teacher ever, supported me through declaring a theater minor and get me more involved with other productions. Super helpful and responsive, even outside of class. Leads great class discussions and grades fairly easily. Just pay attention and participate and she'll like you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: She's one of the most caring professors I've ever encountered. She's a really easy grader and wants her students to succeed. She gives really detailed feedback that is helpful in doing well in the course. She's really accessible outside of class. She encourages students to take risks and rewards them for their attempts. She's absolutely lovely!

Professor Cleary was one of if not the best professor I have had at Brandeis. She cares deeply about each of her students and wants everybody to succeed. She fosters a supportive environment and clearly outlines her grading rubric. Overall, she is a fun professor who I would recommend to anyone at Brandeis, regardless of their majors or minors.

Excellent professor. Lots of activities and discussions in class- if you can't make it to class consistently, don't take her. Incredibly accommodating, as long as you ask ahead of time. Genuinely cares about all of her students and makes it a point to get to know everyone. I took this class for the CA gen ed req and it was the perfect choice.

Jen is just such a kind person who genuinely cares about the well-being of her students both in and out of the classroom. She even made a Zoom class into a collaborative, comfortable space. She also just radiates joy, which has been especially helpful during the time of COVID.
This woman is AMAZING! She truly knows what being an educator is all about. I can't say anything negative about her. Taking a small class with her was an amazing experience!

Public speaking w/ Jen- one of the best classes I've ever taken.  I hated public speaking before this class and was bad at it too.  Now it doesn't scare me so much and I'm pretty good at it.  It's a small class and you have to attend because feedback from your classmates is incredibly important, but it's so worth it. It's a class you want to go to!

AMAZING PROFESSOR! She is so knowledgeable and really truly cares about her students. Unfortunately, there were a lot of non-theater people in this class, and as an experienced Stage Manager, I felt that it was entirely too easy. That being said, she teaches to make sure that EVERYBODY understands what is going on and is available outside of class.

Loved him as a professor the the University Writing Seminar. Engaging classes, clear grading criteria, and graded easily. Good guy to talk through your ideas with (even if you're having trouble figuring any out). Obviously writing heavy because that was what the course was for.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: I love how flexible and understanding he is, and he works with everybody individually to make sure you are comfortable and have the tools to write the assignments.
He's the best professor I ever had in Brandeis.
He is a great professor, and made a required class actually interesting. Highly recommend taking a class with him

Super kind dude, as long as you did the assignments with some effort you would get a B+, but you needed to do extra credit for an A. I found UWS as an idea to be annoying because I took AP Lang in high school and this felt easier than that class but he made it way less annoying.

As the person below me stated, I did not have many good expectations for this class. However, this class is way better than I imagined. The work is not graded based on how well you write which is amazing for someone who speaks English as their second language. He is also NICER than how he looks lol.

I had low expectations for this class, but Ethan is a wonderful professor and so passionate. This class actually improved my writing and taught me about research. Only complaint is you can't get an A by doing all of the required assignments, you have to do extra work to get anything above a B, but the extra assignments aren't difficult.

His classes are really nice and interesting. He's very understanding and nice to communicate with when you're struggling in class. One thing I like about the class is he doesn't grade on quality which but rather completion which takes off a lot of pressure and helps you to actually experiment with your writing. Very flexible

Prof.Storer is great! The lectures are very packed and the homework is pretty tough, but he and the TAs are very generous with grading and just want to see that you get the general ideas. Only downside is that they didn't record in person lectures because "it's not really his style" which seemed a bit silly to me.

Storer can move fast, but you can tell he cares about what he's talking about. While it can be a bit difficult to focus on lectures (Zoom certainly did not do that any favors), the lectures are packed with information - and thankfully released online so we can watch later.

Spends way too little time explaining the concepts, then spends way too much time on examples that assume we understood the concepts.  Problem sets are automatically graded A for effort, so we never know how we're doing on the written work until the quizzes worth 20% of our grade come around.
Hard wording. I studied with Youtube.
Not a bad professor, and quite clearly a great guy, but he gets a bit boring sometimes.  Also, he teaches from slides that have various mistakes (both spelling and conceptual), which is frustrating.
He is awesome! One of my favorite teachers!
Puts everyone to sleep, but if you are, in fact, awake, he's a pretty clear lecturer.
Bring a pillow

I really liked Prof. Tharaud! He chose great material for the course (though there were a LOT of readings) and made class interesting. He definitely makes the class a discussion, and your participation grade matters. He was a harsher grader than I expected him to be, but he's a very nice guy and will talk through your assignments with you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Tharaud is an engaging instructor with typically-exciting reading lists, however, he is also a harsh and uncompromising grader. Only take his courses if you are ready and willing to buy into the class and contribute to discussions multiple times on a daily basis.

I took him for Graphic Novels and Frontier Visions but they aren't here. He's amazing and relies heavily on class discussion. With that being said, relying on class discussion could be a double-edged sword as it could get boring depending on class participation. I loved his classes and would definitely take again, especially graphic novels.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment:
*I was in eng28a

I really loved this class. Prof Tharaud is easily one of my favorite professors at Brandeis- he was accommodating, kind, and started a lot of interesting discussions. The grading criteria were clear for each assignment. He also allowed essay revisions of the first paper and gave very concrete suggestions. Will be taking him again!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I loved Professor Tharaud! I only took this class to meet my humanities requirement and I'm so glad I did. I learned so much in this class and Tharaud is super kind and caring and made the discussions so interesting. I highly recommend taking one of his classes! Just make sure to participate a lot and you'll be fine.

Professor Tharaud is an okay professor. Participation is a huge grade booster, if you can write a decent essay and participate a lot you will get an A. The books are all very good, but he fails to recognize his white cis male lens when discussing diverse topics. He was not dismissive, but not very inviting of opposing views.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Really nice and willing to help students with questions

Prof Tharaud is clearly highly intelligent, and knows a lot about what he teaches. Funny in an unexpected and slightly unusual but delightful way. Very discussion heavy, so if you're in a small class, you better do your reading and come ready to talk. Utilizes more creative assignments as well past just your standard papers. Would highly recommend!

Professor Spry is tech savvy and has a YouTube channel for her students. My least favorite part of the class was the fact that we could not speak about our own experiences in a black politics course. It felt like such a missed opportunity to actually help students understand how what they're learning affects them in their daily life.

Amber Spry is an okay teacher. She always claims that she sticks by the syllabus & will never change anything. I had a friend who was in a different class & she got her 12-page final paper moved to about a week later & mine was still due after the Thanksgiving break. She needs to stick to her word and be fair to everyone; if you move 1 you move all
Dr. Spry is a great professor. She's not easy but you really learn

Prof Spry is a very OK professor. For lectures she just read off of the powerpoint, but refused to share her slides to help with exam prep. The class is graded off of 3 exams and 10% participation. The TAs were great, and definitely made this course much better. Grading is fairly lenient, but the class is still difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Readings don't matter that much, all of the info you need is in the PowerPoint used in class - however, this is not posted, and Prof. Spry tends to fly through it: good luck finding a balance of quick and thorough note taking. She's a badass though, very cool and good at breaking down concepts. Clear (but tough) grading criteria, TAs were excellent

The entire grade is made of 3 essay tests, which are graded harshly. The lectures follow the textbook religiously, and Professor Spry doesn't appear to understand much of the material herself since she reads lecture content off her computer screen. She also seems to think students need to practice taking notes and thus doesn't post slides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Spry has made it clear that in her classroom she is in charge, unfortunately, it is the only thing she is able to make clear. She consistently derives her slides from a textbook which should have been banned from the Geneva convention due to its exuberant length. This professor professes nothing, she only repeats.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Tons of reading from the textbook, which is pretty boring. Primary sources can be interesting but the lectures aren't and she mostly reads the slides. The entire grade is 3 tests, all essay questions. Refuses to take questions in class and doesn't put slides online or offer any resources besides the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Spry bases her lectures entirely on the textbook. She doesn't put slides online, yet her lectures are mostly paraphrasing what's on the board. The textbook is dry and always assigned (60+ pages a night). Discussion sections serve more as participation checks than actual learning. Don't recommendshould not be an intro class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a fantastic professor who really cares about her students and makes class both interesting and fun. There are a lot of case studies to get through in terms of reading and she is a tough grader, but she really brings out the best in her students. Attendance and participation count for a lot but she also gives extra credit opportunities.

Honestly, she's a decent professor and nice and approachable however she's simply a tough grader. Overall, I would recommend her class if you truly care about learning and understanding marketing however do not expect a super easy A. Lots of reading for each class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Really enjoying Prof Zimmerman's class right now. There are lots of readings, but her fun lectures/case discussions make the class go by really quickly and she pushes students to participate.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: i had zimmerman just as covid happened so I was there for both her in person class and zoom class. in person her class was always fun and entertaining and i loved doing her case studies. her hw was always difficult though but as long as you showed clear effort you were fine. on zoom she understood it was hard to participate and was more lenient
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Zimmerman always cares a lot about her students, and finds new and interesting ways to keep kids participating. She keeps the class fun and interesting for her students.

Not sure where all of the ratings went, but she is fantastic. She is nice and funny, but definitely has a sense of humor that some people may not appreciate (not bad or anything, just different). She makes her classes fun and interesting, though its not particularly easy. 100% take a class with her, you will not regret it
Amazing professor, really enjoyable classes & lectures. Is a tough professor but one of the best I've ever had!
good

He's a really nice guy, and I liked his class.  It's not too hard and the work is really just the tests and short essays that go with it.  It's an interesting topic, but sometimes the class is a bit dull.

Professor Watson's class IS SO EASY if you do the bare minimum: read the textbook, look over the slides. He does explain the slides well in class so I would suggest attending. He's also a funny lecturer and if you reach out to him, a very nice guy. You will fail his class if you do no reading--otherwise, easy A. He is reasonable. Do what he says.
very difficult

Gives clear lectures, funny, helpful to students.  He's personable, available outside class, and writes helpful comments on papers as well as rec letters if you've earned them.  One of my favorite profs in the Psychology department.

Very misleading professor. He makes you think you are doing well in the class, and then gives you a bad grade at the end. Does not grade in student's favor. Seems like a nice person at first, but is not helpful to students. Not easy tests!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Took for BUS130 but there wasn't option to choose that class. Amazing professor. Participation matters a lot, basically have to talk in every single lecture to guarantee an A. Super helpful outside of class. Should take, super easy course

Prof Wells was great! Participation matters a lot and be sure to read the case studies carefully. If you want to do well you have to be able to apply what you learned from the textbook readings to the case studies. Lectures are great and big curve. The excel quiz is a bit confusing though.

Wells is the best professor I've had so far (I'm currently a sophomore). His lectures are super interesting, and he is a smart and funny guy. He is a tough grader, but he curves! I will say some of the quizzes were random and sometimes on material that was only partially mentioned, but the curve makes up for this! All exams were open notes though!
I liked him. Very calming voice, engaging lectures. Mostly case studies, but I liked it. Fair grading, if you do the work and participate you will get a good grade.

Professor Wells is amazing!! The content was challenging for me and sometimes the lectures were confusing but he always holds office hours and does a good job at working with students to clarify everything.

One of the best Professors at Brandeis!! He is amazing and he makes class very engaging and a lot of fun. He is very passionate and knowledgeable about the material he teaches which makes the class even more enjoyable!

I ADORE HIM! He is the best Brandeis lecturer I've ever met. He is intelligent, funny, and compassionate. It is critical to participate actively in class because it accounts for a large chunk of the grade. I believe you will enjoy this class as long as you read the material and cases and participate in class discussions!! I strongly recommend him!

This class had challenging material, but I found office hours helpful when I struggled with concepts. He continued his office hours even when classes went online after the school shut down for COVID. This class definitely sucked, and Wells definitely lost half the class during his lectures, but office hours (and the TA) really helped.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: I'll be honest, Wells has no clue what he's doing. I don't know what happened when he chose to teach this class but something happened because it was a mess. His instructions for assignments were never clear and the midterm was so unfairly difficult it made a student cry. (He also told the class it was extremely hard before the test started)
Left me so clueless I never did the final paper and had to retake my UWS sophomore year.

Her class is very boring, and she always changes her schedule. The course syllabus is not valuable at all, and you will not get anything through her UWS. Better to choose other sections rather than hers!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She always complains about her life during class time, and you will get nothing. Better to choose other writing classes rather than hers. Her class schedule is totally not organized, and she always changes the plan.
Absolutely the worst professor ever. Never have I met someone w/ so little empathy and personal responsibility. Would rather bash my head in than take another class from this woman. 0/10

HORRIBLE! Never take one of her classes. Most disorganized person ever, kept changing due dates, didn't explain assignments fully, and made up excuses about not knowing the UWS class structure as a reason for her not doing things correctly. Took months to grade our first essay. Told way too many personal stories. Annoying, condescending, crazy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Prof ruined the class, would bash the UWS program each day, extremely disorganized. Complained about how strict & pointless the work she assigned was. Would trauma dump about her life at the end of each class. Did not find out our grades on essay 1 from Sept until the final exam period. Could be a good prof, don't take her for UWS

She is an amazing professor and will provide you feedback if you ask for it. She is honest, fair, understanding, and kindhearted. Be prepared to put in the work if you want to do well. Although her classes are work-heavy, the assignments do stimulate independent and critical thinking and I would take her again if I had the chance to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Literally just know your drop period. Prof loved to hand out busy work, incredibly scatter-brained and will change the syllabus and due dates on a whim, and takes absences very personally. Even if required for graduation, check and see if you can get a different prof
he kinda rude

Professor Donahue is one of the nicest professors at Brandeis. His lectures aren't always super interesting but he makes up for it in witty jokes and fun stories about his farm. Very long research paper, but you have the whole semester to do it. Overall great teacher and fun course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Donahue is an expert in Environmental History and it's evident but brags about his esteem a lot. He definitely sparks interest in the topic but can also be a bit dry. Sometimes tries to show the class that specific students aren't that prepared.Tough grader and harsh about writing style. Lots of reading. You'll need good notes for the essays.

You MUST do the readings for this class or you will be so lost! I didn't do the readings and the class was hard because of it. The material was fairly straightforward, but also somewhat boring. He's a good teacher, but only take a class with him if you are really interested in the topic or you will be bored. If you like it, you'll probably love it.
a bit boring and the class size was too large for meaningful discussions. learned most from readings and some lectures. The professor is best in smaller settings... or better yet in the forrest.

Professor Donohue is really nice and helpful, but not such an inspiring teacher. Food and Farming in America sounded interesting on the course description, but it turned out to be totally lackluster. Even the field trips were dull.
awesome guy, lumberjack like
Brian doesnt so much talk to you as he stares into your soul.  Dont expect a smile from this guy, he is consumed by environmental history...possibly something else too.

The workload is heavy.  After it is too late to help your grade he won't let you know but will let the academic advisor know you are in danger of failing.  For weekly discussions, he rarely posts anything to help the discussion.  He is not the professor to start your Master's program if you want to do well!

Please don't take this professor's class. If you need to take this class, try other professors. This guy is worthless and does not have anything to offer. If you want to learn something and not lose interest in course, don't for this guys course. He does not provide proper feedback and does not help students learn the subject.

Prof. Hassey should more likely be an English professor. He does not provide much insight into the subject and expects the students to learn by themselves. I wonder if he knows the concept of teaching and not sure how he got qualified. Grading, although explained, is useless since the requirements of the assignments are unclear.

Overall, I found the class to be very well executed. His instructions were clear and his participation was consistent and frequent. Any time I had a problem, he was there ready to help. He kept the discussions interesting with his insights. Overall, it was a good course.

My experience with Professor Hassey was very positive.  The reading and workload was heavy, but it is definitely manageable.  Jim was always accessible online, and provided thoughtful comments throughout the semester.  Overall, he provided a very rewarding learning experience for about a subject I had little knowledge about.

Prof. Hassey does not provide useful feedback and fails to highlight the important areas needed to succeed on the assignments.  His ability or willingness to answer questions is non-existent; his responses are not useful in the context of the course.  Grading, although explained, is useless since the requirements of the assignments are unclear.
He gets paid for doing nothing. Nice gig.

I literally don't know where to begin with how much I loved having Eric Olson as a professor and mentor.
