He goes above and beyond helping students succeed, and is SO passionate about what he teaches.  That verve definitely translates onto his students.  Take his classes!  You will be so happy you did.
Such an involved and amazing teacher. His main concern is actually making his students learn and become interested in the subject matter. The most intelligent and fun professor I've had.
One of the best professors in the world. Guru in many fields of natural science. Great tree climber. Spacy.
Best prof. i have ever had. The class was interesting, fun and engaging. I have yet to meet a prof. who spent as much time as Olson does trying to help his students learn.
Nice guy, very little work. Lectures can be long and a bit boring, but other times they're very interesting.
Great person but not the best lecturer. It was hard to tell what he wanted from the students and his TA graded unnecessarily  hard.

Olson is a truly kind & interesting intellectual person. Class was a breeze; lots of writing on one organism of your choice, but if you choose something you really like it's a joy. I used the text a total of once, so find someone to share with if you can. Lectures are long and occasionally dull, but often very interesting, & he brings specimens! =D
One of the best professors at Brandeis, I highly recommend her classes

Professor Kellman is an amazing teacher! Lectures are highly interesting and varied. Assignments are clear and specific, they take time, but are not hard. And you learn a lot! She goes out of her way to help her students succeed, and is very available outside of class. I very highly recommend taking YDSH 10, my third favorite class at Brandeis.

I love Professor Kellman. Her classes are so joyful and insightful. She is a sweet, caring, compassionate professor who is very understanding with disabled students and gives all of her students ample time outside of class to clear up understanding. Great professor!

Professor Kellman is great.  She really cares about her subject and uses her passion to inspire her students.  She is very available outside of class, and the singing especially makes the class very fun and enjoyable.

I had a hard time following what she expected of us as a class, and often times her lessons completely lacked structure. However, she is a very nice person, if you take the effort and approach her, you'll find that she has a lot to offer.
I love professor Kellman. She is a kind, caring  teacher who loves the subject and the students she teaches!

No logical flow to her teaching, so it feels just like a regular high school language class (=BAD!!).  There's much more potential... if only she knew how to teach the subject.  However we do sing songs, which is pretty cool...

He cares about attendance and participation a lot. Lots of scripts to read and lectures are always abstruse. Not a recommended class if youre not interested in theater arts and only want to complete the creative art requirement. Group projects (acting) are required. Paper grades are unexpectedly good since I seldom do readings. Not a hard grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: My favorite thing about Ryan as a professor is his enthusiasm for theater. He comes in and clearly has a huge passion for what he does and that, more than anything else, is why I like him as a professor. My only complaint is that I wish the whole class was more of a conversation than a lecture. I don't think he will be teaching this class again.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I loved this class! I came into playwriting with practically no theatre experience and no playwriting experience and I found that my writing became better for each assignment. McKittrick really knows his stuff and shows you a lot of different ways to write a play instead of forcing you to use one method. He gives you helpful comments.

Condescending, rambles on and on, but it's only factoids you could find on Wikipedia or by watching a documentary or two.  Really didn't bring much new material.  Sometimes made us think in new ways, but otherwise negative experience.  And I got a good grade, too.

I loved that my homework for this class was reading at watching musicals, but the lectures sometimes felt stagnant, like he was reading straight off the paper.  Overall, though, it was completely worth getting up for a 9AM time slot.  Also really great assignments!

While the above class is no longer in existence (actually, they might have given it a new number) I decided to rate it because I liked the professor a lot and wanted to start him off with a good rating.  He made us do a couple of writing-intensive projects, but they were sort of fun.  Overall, a pretty good professor despite teaching at 9AM.
His Playwriting class is definitely worth taking. He's one hundred percent helpful with every project, and also an extremely nice guy.

She is honestly the best professor. She is engaging, sweet, attentive. I only took one class of hers, and although you might be intimidated by the title of her long class' name, I promise you she will make approach different topics with different teaching styles, like solo work, group work, presentations, slides, lecture, ect. You will learn.
LOVE LOVE LOVE HER. Best professor

Professor Reyes de Deu was very good at managing discussion time for individual input while still covering all of the necessary material. Her feedback and exercises were genuinely helpful for me, and I was able to improve both my written and spoken abilities. Very encouraging of students and quick to respond to emails/inquiries.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Profe Reyes is an amazing lecturer. She's super nice and understanding too. Very little homework. The only assessments are oral (presentations, projects), written, and listening. Super low-stress and fun, but you'll still be learning a lot of essential speaking techniques and Central/South American culture.

She was such a sweet professor who cared about her students and made sure they were confident and comfortable. There was a lot of homework but it was manageable. We did a lot of speaking with partners in class so we had practice talking with each other and I always felt well prepared for the check-ins and assignments we had.
I genuinely feel like her class was the first Spanish class I'd ever taken that actually made me a better writer.

Professor Lucia is one of the best professor I've met since I enrolled in Brandeis. Since this is a writing intensive class, she gave a lot of informative suggestions to every student's writing. I feel like I've learned a lot from the class and had a huge improvement on my writing skill. She made my love learning Spanish.
Professor Doolan is so awesome and interesting. 100% would take again.

He's a really nice guy and he's really committed to teaching. His lectures are really engaging. There's a conversational flow to it with students heavily involved. Just show up and be prepared and you'll do fine. There's lots of homework but just skim through, the movies are fun to watch. And the final project was really flexible and fun to do.

Doolan is great! I took AAPI/HIS-171A with him and enjoyed the course. He does give a lot of readings, but you do not need to read everything, rather skimming the readings is recommended. His grading criteria is clear, and you have a lot of opportunities for extra credit. You do have to participate to get an A, but as long as you skim you are ok.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: love him sweetest man class seminar discussions were v interesting and u can tell he cares about his students and the class. some of the readings were long af tho but skim it and u'll survive tbh. not many assignments but not a terribly hard grader put in some effort and it all works out u'll be fine. he's a silly funny little man too love mans

Took Asian American History in Spring 2023. Class + discussions were interesting. Many readings but as long as you get the main points you're good. Graded on latte reflections, participation, 2 in class writings that you prepare ahead of time, and a final project. Content was eye opening + Professor Doolan was great and really nice, pretty easy A.

Prof. Doolan is the BEST. The nicest person ever and extremely smart! His class is super interesting and thought-provoking, and even if you're not a humanities major I highly recommend a class with him. Probably one of the best professors at Brandeis. Most of the work in his class comes from the readings, but they are all worthwhile and engaging.

Prof Doolan is AMAZING! He's so engaging and you can tell he's really passionate about what he teaches. There's a lot of reading for Performing Asian Women, but you can manage if you skim them. Participation definitely matters, and the group project isn't too bad! I def plan on taking another class with Prof Doolan. Do it! You won't regret it

Prof Doolan is an absolute GEM. His Performing Asian/American Women On Screen and Scene was incredibly eye opening, and I'd take it again in a heartbeat. If you have the opportunity to take a class from him, do it!!

Professor Shulenberger is an amazing lecturer and has very readable notes that she posts at the end of class. She organizes her lectures in a very orderly manner that's clear to understand. CHEM15a is very test-heavy and requires a lot of studying. Doing the homework, going to office hours, and completing the study sheet will help you succeed.

Professor Shulenberger is a good lecturer and stays organized throughout the period. Her grading criteria are clear, but the tests are pretty challenging. However, if you prepare well for the exams, you can do well in the class.

The lectures are mostly just her talking and writing on her tablet. She posts the notes usually within a few days after class. She checks in occasionally about what we like/don't like, are understanding/not understanding. Chem 15a content is like AP chem but with quantum stuff (uncool). Use the group office hours, she is very approachable and nice!

Very nice person, but doesn't explain things very well verbally. Went unnecessarily deep into quantum mechanics and deriving calculations when I am only interested in knowing what is on the test (IMO, derivations and stuff should just be a separate module oNLY for those who are interested). I did like her grading structure tho

I took 15a over 11a because I heard how terrible Novack was, and found her grading style to be much more reasonable. She is a very understanding woman if you don't understand a concept, and will review it with you because of her background in physical chemistry, she often glosses over basic concepts and goes super fast. Do the readings though!

Since this is her first year teaching, a lot of things are very disorganized, and many topics are often explained in a more complicated way as if we are chemists and not college freshmen. She is a nice person and def way nicer than you know who, but she is not good at teaching. Even my paid/unpaid tutors have said she explains things strangely.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Highly Recommend!! This was her first year as a professor and our entire class loved her. Excellent lecturer, very easy to understand and the homework she gives is very reasonable about 8-12 problems a week. Holds review sessions before every test. Her tests are very fair, reflects what she teaches and are not crazy difficult. Super kind grader!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: If you are a student who needs a learning accommodation be mindful. You may find someone sitting in your seat.

She is a nice person who certainly cares about her students. Very traditional approach to teaching (forces the quiet students to speak and won't allow the talkative ones to participate as much). She has high expectations for what seem like very easy and not intellectually challenging assignments. Discussion of readings not interesting.
Dr. Levenson is a very intelligent, thoughtful professor, and she helps out if you need it. If you're struggling in her class, have a meeting with her and she will help you out. Great professor!

Professor Levenson is obviously a very intelligent teaching professional and brings up many thought-provoking subjects during class. However, she assigns a lot of unnecessary reading. Overall good professor.
No Comments
Dr. Levenson is wonderful. She is extremely intelligent, knowledgable, fair, reasonable, open, helpful, and caring. A very special prof.
Wonderful professor!

Tried her best to be encouraging (as this wasn't strictly an art class and many students were not artists) but you could tell her heart wasn't in it. If you don't immediately show good skills, get ready for a lot of silent disappointment. Did give a lot of helpful tips for beginner artists though

She is one of my favorite professors at Brandeis. Doing work for her class was difficult, but it didn't feel like work. She is one of my favorite people on campus and is interested in her students even when they're no longer in her class. She is a wonderful person and a really passionate professor.
Amazing professor, loves art, made me almost change my major to fine arts.

She obviously loves painting, but I didn't feel comfortable around her. Her advice wasn't particularly helpful and I felt like unless you were extremely gifted, she didn't have very high hopes for you. I never knew what she wanted/expected from me. It seemed very vague. I do enjoy painting, though.
Great teacher and painter. Passionate about her work and her students. Love this teacher!
No Comments

Seemed like she would rather be somewhere else while she was teaching. Advice wasn't very helpful, and some of the homework assignments were boring. Stopped caring about me and my work after I got sick and missed 2 classes. She put down some student art.
Sara is funny and entertaining. Taking a high-level hebrew class with her is fun because so much of it is conversational. Grading could be more clear (rubrics, etc) but Sara is kind and flexible.

Big Sara fan. She's quite strict and pushes you, but really she's a sweet lady underneath the tough exterior and I did manage to make her laugh. Compared to every other Hebrew class I've taken in life, it was surprisingly difficult to score A's by doing my normal thing. Sara is full of life and personality.157
I loved this class. Sarah is an excellent teacher and very passionate about creative reading in Hebrew.

Grades easy on content, but cares ALOT about neatness/presentation... you'll score points for clean, neat, and legible written work.  Inconsistent policy on late work... basically get in all assignments within *reasonable* amount of time and you're fine.  She encourages enthusiasm above all.  Just put yourself out there.  A fun light class overall.

Great class! The class is long (6 hrs a week) so a good professor is key, and Prof. Hascal did this well! Class encouraged group work, but still allowed you to do your own thing. Follows the same format as most basic HBRW classes (few HW assignments collected, midterm, final). great for learning the basics and support is there if u need it
the class can be fun but is often boring. very generous grading.
Sara is very sweet and a very fair grader.  This class can be boring at times, especially if you're not too fond of Hebrew (or other) poetry.  :-)

As someone who has since won awards for poetry, Professor Broumas with other Brandeis creative writing professors nearly convinced me I was talentless due to valuing conformity over teaching students to do the best of their ability. She compared my work to "mud" and "porn" in front of the class on separate occasions. Not constructive at all.

She can be nice but she can also be very cruel and will tell you to your face that your work isn't good enough for her standards. Not appropriate for a teacher, it doesn't help a student learn and better themselves if they're told that they aren't good enough.

Such a talented writer! I'm studying her work in another class this fall. I just loved her soothing manner and the way in which she was able to calm down my class, which happened to have some clashing personalities. She has a way of letting comments flow freely while still keeping control.
Hands down my favorite class at Brandeis, and the most helpful. I wrote much  more and much better under her.

Very -out there- and free spirited... What other writing professors has you do breathing exercises before the seminar? The class felt more like a therapy session than a writing workshop: Tears were shed by Olga and at least three students each week.

She knows her****, no doubt.  She encourages you to find YOUR VOICE.  I just loved the way she read poetry and the way she would sit with her eyes closed as she listened to you read yours.  I saw her years later and she remembered me.  She was one of my favorites...along with Klein.
Can be amazingly encouraging and supportive, especially if she likes your writing. The only downside is that she's rarely critical, which hinders improvement a little...

She knows her stuff, but don't expect to get good grades in her class. Her grading style is anal and if you don't say what she wants you to say then you're S.O.L. No matter how hard you work or how many times you meet with her about papers, nothing pleases her.

I found Professor Lanser to be saccharine. She treats her intro class like high school students. There's the whole "let's sit in a circle so we can look at each other" mentality. She's a ridiculously easy grader, however.

Dr. Lanser is simply an amazing instructor.  The readings are interesting and evoke lively discussions.  Dr. Lanser does a good job engaging the class.  The readings were extensive but the writings were modest.  She is a fair grader although her essay prompts can at times be challenging.  She is quite approachable.  I highly recommend Dr. lanser.
Very caring and passionate about her class, really cares about hearing everyone's voice. Amazing amazing class, set my experience off on a whole new course.

Great professor, this was the first ever college level English class i took and after this class i solidly decided on doing an English Major.  Very helpful and engaging, and really interested in student opinions.  If you want a class in which you do not have to participate DO NOT take this class, she makes sure everyone participates.
incredible teacher, really great at fostering discussion when she's not giving her own lectures (which are also amazing); really interested in helping you mature as a reader
No Comments

This man is not only a genius, hes engaging, funny, and a fantastic teacher. Despite my only class with him being a huge lecture it was one of my favorites at Brandeis. Missed dearly since he left for Berkley.
Great speaker and great talks
A friggin HOUSEHOLD NAME..
AMAZING.  It's a shame he's leaving for Berkeley.  He will be missed.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Professor Brooten is the best professor I have had at Brandeis and her Intro to Christianity was a fantastic class that I would definitely take again if I could! She presents interesting texts and encourages multiple viewpoints and discussions based on texts. She also is super understanding and helpful -- her feedback on papers is great!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Brilliant and very kind professor.

Overall, the course was disorganized. The lectures were not delivered in line with the syllabus. In addition, the professor went off on tangents that had no relevance to the subject matter. The professor expected us to understand the course material before we even took the course!

Prof. Brooten is a fantastic scholar and a wonderful person.  Her keen intellect is tempered with one of the kindest dispositions you will ever encounter.  The class was probing and comprehensive.  Sign up for the class and get ready for a treat.

Prof. Brooten is not only the most nicest professor I've ever met, she's incredibly smart and well versed in a variety of fields.  She works with her students to help them understand the material and she has a very open mind to debate and discussion.  If you want to learn and be exposed to one of the nicest people alive, take a course with Brooten.

I had her for my USEM and for my adviser before getting one specific to my major. She was horrible as both. As a freshman in the first week of college I did NOT need to be told that I would "fail out" because I was taking too many classes. Her class was boring, and discussions forced. Stay away if possible.
Class lectures and discussions can become dull very quickly, but Prof. Brooten is a really, genuinely nice professor who cares that her students are learning.

Two of his classes were easily some of the best classes I took in my 4 years. Incredibly interesting topics that changed the way I think about conservation and environmental issues. Some readings are dense, but so worth it for what you'll gain from class discussions!

He's such a gem of a human! Really sweet, super accommodating, nice, and willing to bend over backwards to help his students because he genuinely cares for his students. He is a bit boring and slow but, really intelligent and articulate. He does assign a LOT of reading but, is a fair grader and generous with extensions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: such an amazing professor who is beyond passionate about his material. do not take this class if you are not truly interested as the readings are long and heavy. I put in a lot of work to get my grade but I genuinely learned so much.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: He's great, smart, nice, super accommodating, and so articulate. But he gives a LOT of reading and he's a bit boring and slow. He's not an easy A and will make you work for it but, he will push you to the next grade if you've worked hard for it.

Professor Schroeder is such an understanding teacher. Although his lectures can be a bit boring at times, he still tried his best to interact with the class. He has such a pure soul and the TA was really chill as well.

An amazing professor. I think everyone should take ANTH55a; it's SO interesting, engaging, and important. You read several books and write several essays, but you automatically get an 85 for if you fully participate and turn everything in on time. Other points are awarded as "style points," which are usually given in multiples of 1 or 2 on essays.

Shroeder is nice and very smart, but his lectures can be so boring. He wastes a lot of time with filler words and doesn't provide much detail about anything in class. You'll mostly learn from the readings and videos. The database research projects are a huge waste of your time but it's like the only thing besides the mid term and final exams.
She is so nice, the class was very easy and she was very supportive. The feedback was very useful. I recommend taking the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She's so bad. Do not take her class!

Don't take this class unless you love getting useless feedback for your writing that you have put a lot of effort into. It's no use to spend your precious time in this class because she will give you a B+ anyway.
Absolute worst class I have taken at Brandeis. Fischer is a terrible professor who is extremely boring and grades harshly.
She commented on my final paper saying it's "a waste of her time", and Sarcastically she's one who always emphasizes "professionalism" in the class.

A lot of miscommunication with this professor. She thinks her class is the most important. Probably not the worst professor, but considering this course is for just fulfilling a requirement, try your best to avoid this professor and get one that is more reasonable. However, I'm not the stronger writer as well so that influenced my experience.

She takes off a lot of points for small errors. If your paper isn't perfect, you won't get an A. Very nice, but the class is dry, she assigns a ton of useless homework, and she is very intense about small things that other professors don't care about. She teaches "by the book," & if you don't do everything perfectly, your grade goes down by a lot.

She is a very nice person but grading and feedback are rough. She grades very strictly, and she will tear your whole essay apart without giving you any constructive feedback. I naturally struggle with writing, and I have lost the little confidence I had in my writing ability due to her class.

Jen is so caring, helpful, and cute! Lectures are not difficult, and she is always willing to help her students during her office hours. On the other hand, if you don't have a strong background in mathematics, I will recommend you to take PHIL 6 A Symbolic Logic before taking her Mathematical Logic course.

I found the way she explained things to be pretty confusing and overly complicated, so it was mostly self-taught. Don't rely on cheatsheets for the tests even though it has the formulas, learn the stuff. I think would have been easier with more of a logic background as opposed to math (my major). Dropped because I was taking too many classes.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Great
The best philosophy teacher! She truly cares about her students and is willing to work with them to help them succeed.

Jennifer is a great teacher, she is obviously very interested in her field, and it shows! I really enjoyed taking philosophy of perception with her, she made it extremely interesting. I would definitely take her again! No complaints!
She was really sweet and friendly and did a good job explaining difficult philosophical concepts and keeping people engaged in the class. She also did lots of demos involving snacks!
Clear, incisive and insightful comments. Not too harsh a grader if you put in effort. Helpful and willing to help outside the class.

prof scott teaches the intro class as if students have prior knowledge, which makes the subject feel really inaccessible at first. she's also very disorganized, which doesnt help  the latte page is a mess, and lectures need to be supplemented with the textbook. a bit uptight and pretentious, but she does ultimately want the best for students
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Scott is an art teacher, not an Enlgish teacher. She grades like she is grading a grad students thesis. She has little to no knowledge in English profiecency skills and loves to talk all class period. If you have other options to get an art credit such as pottery, I would advise you to take that class.

Nancy is quite nice and respectful, but expects tons of prior knowledge to course material as well as excellence in writing. If you are not extremely knowledgable in art history do NOT take her classes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Nancy loves to take you on museum trips! She also loves to get a bit off topic and distracted. You don't have to work super hard in her courses but she will grade you accurately.
Little disorganized but really knows her stuff. Plus, she's such a sweet lady. really enjoyed her classes.
No Comments
No Comments
94+ receive A, 92+ receive A-, and below 92 receive B+. Very tough grading. Not recommended at all.
Doesn't teach you a thing during lectures (just so useless). You are expected to learn all the models/math yourself. You feel so painful when you self-study and try to do your homework.

Ballantine puts important things like graphs and numbers for us to learn but never really teaches how these things come from and he hardly defines terms and variables. During lectures, he just does walk through Yahoo finance and looks up news everywhere on the internet which is very unorganized. Very confusing class. Nothing learned. AVOID.

He is a really sweet person but talks all over the place. He does not know how to teach and the grading criteria is super unclear! If you don't need this class do not take at all. You will not learn a single thing.

Avoid him. Does not teach any of the material during lectures. You are expected to learn everything on your own through very confusing slides online. Grading criteria was very unclear. Note that grading is a lot tougher than the syllabus suggests.
Terrible professor. Very confusing
Very knowledgeable about current topics of International Economics. He chooses relatable examples that make the course easier.

Professor Warner goes above and beyond for her students. She is incredibly intelligent and passionate about the classes she teaches. Her grading criteria is very clear and her assignments increase your understanding of the topic. Overall, I feel she's one of the best professors at Brandeis.

Prof. Warner is awesome, you should definitely go to office hours! The class does a good job of giving a general understanding of the causes of climate change and the positive feedback loops created by climate change. That said, this course is super easy for people who have an environmental studies background.

Prof. Warner is super knowledgeable about the subjects she teaches but also caters well to her audiences and explains the material very clearly. Workload is well paced throughout the semester and she sometimes does hands on activities. Easily one of the best professors in the Environmental Studies department.
Prof Warner is probably my favorite professor at Brandeis. She is super caring and responds to emails really quickly. Her workload is not heavy and the assignments were really fun.

-asks for student feedback and is willing to make changes -gives assignments that are actually useful/meaningful, not just busy work -has very clear directions for assignments and reminds students before they are due (no surprises) -is also a very nice person, not just as a professor!

Professor Warner is an incredible teacher with a passion for her work. She does a great job a delivering material in an accessible way as well as keeping lectures interesting. She actively seeks out feedback from students and listens to us. I would 100% recommend taking her class.

This was Professor Warner's first semester at Brandeis and she has already created a learning atmosphere parallel to Jim Morris. Clear lectures, engaging energy, so devoted to students. She does stuff like ask for anonymous mid-semester feedback *and then she listens to it*, or include us in extension decisions. It's crazy and she's great.

The kindest professor I had at Brandeis. Casey goes out of his way to help you understand the topics as each build on one another. I take every course that Casey offers and I learn more from him than any other prof at Brandeis.

Professor Casey is really generous and kind. He helps at any time and is very understanding of students who do not have English as first language. Will always meet to help to make sure that you are doing okay.
caseys the best philosophy professor in the department. ive taken everycourse he teaches. I wish he was a professor not just in the summer and taught courses other than logic. definitely recommend!

I took intro with casey at UW. I was disappointed at first because we did no ethics or political philosophy but by the end of the class I cared if tables or numbers exist. The course is lecture heavy but it is made better by Casey being charming and often times hilarious. He is also really cute which can be distracting
Casey is great! They explain all the material really well, are always accessible, and offer a lot of support. Definitely recommend!
I have never had a professor care for students as much as Casey does. Makes abstract material very clear.

I took two courses with Casey and he is great. He goes out of his way to help you if you ask for it and he is an extremely generous and understanding grader. His classes are interesting and thought provoking while also being an easy A. Highly recommend!

I loved Professor Niehaus. I have had her for a few semesters and have never had any problems. She is super caring and the amount of work is reasonable. Always makes sure you are well-prepared for exams and lectures/activities (even though are in fully French) are very easy to comprehend. Would take again for sure.

I took French 10a this semester; honestly, it is a fun class. Expect to complete in-class activities with partners or in teams. Madame Niehaus is an extremely lenient grader for tests. The weight of assignments is extremely balanced. Her homework assignments and lessons genuinely will make you a lot better at French, and her feedback is amazing.

Content felt similar to HS french classes so it was relatively easy for me (placed into 105 but schedule conflicts). She often didn't post homework until the last minute, if at all, or changed the homework last minute. Assessments were easy but she was super unorganized. Participation and attendance matter though!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: She was really understanding and caring towards me. The homework was easy to do and exams weren't difficult as long as you did the quizlets and work. Honestly had such a fun time and had genuinely considered continuing to take French because of her. Bonus: she also likes it when you participate as much as possible!
She is nice! She doesn't require much work and she is always happy to help.

Yeah don't take her class unless you want to be extremely frustrated 24/7. Does not really teach and expects you to just know things based on the workbook pages (doesn't go over them in class). Final assignments are confusing and not planned well. Does not really communicate with students and doesn't seem to enjoy her job. We play charades though!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She was always unclear about instructions and made me not want to speak French again. She would post homework two days before it was due but would tell you about it earlier so you couldn't get ahead. She was always unclear about project outlines and formats of tests or what would be on them.
She takes herself and the class way too seriously, its just an intro to writing dont make me write 20,000 words for this class (not kidding)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Rourke is a nice person but not that great of a teacher. She doesnt give your grades out until very late in the semester, so it is difficult to know where you stand. I did not learn much from this course, so if you want to, I would consider taking a different UWS. Creativity is not encouraged - follow her guidelines exactly to score remotely well.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Dr. Rourke is a very caring and funny person. UWS is a hard course, but she made it not that boring, We analyzed an episode from House for second paper. This course is tough, but I really learnt a lot from her class. She is also very accessible after class. Go to her office hour if you run out of ideas for your paper.

Expect lots of writing since it is an english class. Lots of side assignments to go along with the final essays, but they make the writing process much easier. Grading rubric is clear, but she is overly-picky at times when grading. Interesting course and essay topics. Overall enjoyable for a required writing class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class is not engaging and the professor is incredibly dull and does not allow students to stray from the cookie cutter method she adheres to. She has also on occasion redirected student perspective by outlining their theses and telling them what to write about. If you want an engaging class that is worth taking, try another professor

Class was pretty writing intensive but it was perfectly paced and all instruction was very helpful. Class can be somewhat repetitive at times but nothing too serious. Teacher is fun and very energetic.

It's a writing class, so you have to do the readings. She's very good about meeting with you about your papers and she's very nice. She hands out and follows a grading rubric, so you know just what to expect. The class is straight forward and I enjoyed it.

MY FAVORITE!!! I love her so much, it's my third class going on the fourth!! Basically a minor in Prof. Theobald. I absolutely adore her and cannot recommend her enough. I took 106b just because I didn't want to lose a lot of my French skills but couldn't get enough of her teaching style and how nice she is :)

Professor Theobald always encourages question asking and class participation.  You get to practice conversation with the people around you, and you study with a friend from class before the tests.  The homework isn't too difficult, and the tests are straightforward.  She's super helpful and really nice!  Haven't met someone who dislikes her.

She's not bad but she asks for a lot and doesn't leave room for accommodations when students are having a tough time. her class isn't accessible through zoom she doesn't alter any assignments even when you say you're having a hard time. no extensions. found she tries to be "woke" when it comes to nonbinary pronouns but still mis-pronouns people

J'ai pris deux cours avec elle. Elle est très gentille et parle parfaitement le français. Elle donne beaucoup de devoirs et elle note durement, mais c'est une excellente enseignante. tellement mieux qu'un prof de français au lycée !
Professor Theobald is the best professor I had at Brandeis! I would do anything to take her class again and is one reason Im super sad to graduate :(

She's a great teacher with very high standards for her students, sometimes a bit too high but language is something quite difficult to teach but she does it well. As long as you actually study the main concepts and conjugations, the tests arent TOO hard. Challenging but good class.
Incredible teacher.
Amazing, so funny and engaging. i would die for her
She is very nice and energetic, and always encourages students! I highly recommend her Japanese course. Best language teacher in this university!!!

Fujiwara Sensei is the GOAT. She is the sweetest human being ever, and she makes learning Japanese feel so special and enjoyable. Yes, there is daily homework, but none of it is "busy work" --- it is simply to help you learn. Language learning requires constant practice in speaking, reading, writing, and listening, and she helps you balance it all!

Prof. Fujiwara is one of my favs out there. Very kind and funny. Japanese can definitely seem daunting as it is a hard language to pick up with no prior knowledge but she makes it very fun. She is very thorough with ppts and latte page so no jump scares with assignments/quizzes/tests. Very positive energy and I looked forward to class everyday!!
Excellent professor!

Professor Fuijiwara is an incredibly enthusiastic and fun instructor, which made Japanese--one of the more challenging languages to learn--probably one of the best classes I have ever taken. Her personality (and small stature) makes her quite an adorable person, and she is always willing to go the extra mile to help her students to succeed.

She is extremely funny and helpful. Her classes are always fun. Her lectures aren't hard but as Japanese is tough in its own right, not having any previous engagement with Hiragana could make the lectures overwhelming at first. Mind you, be keen on learning new vocabs, she goes easy at first, but towards the end of the course, it gets harder.

I am currently taking Dr. Arrom for History 71a. She is a good instructor who knows the material well.  Her presentations are clear.. and the discussion sections are lively.. she is a fair grader.. although at times she isn't clear with what she expects..I highly recommend her for those who are remotely interesting in Latin Am History..
She knows the material really well and is very organized in how she presents it to the class.
She's nice. I agree that she's straightforward.
Ive had better high school teachers.
Very straight forward, sort of scary at first, but if you actually make an effort to get to know her and go to her office hours and such, you're grade will reflect your effort.
No Comments
No Comments

Sad to see Seth leave. He is knowledgeable, inspiring, funny, and seems to care a lot about his teaching.  One of the best professors I've had.  The group projects made you think creatively and were VERY entertaining.  Also enjoyed talking to him after class.  Brandeis will miss him.
A truly talented professor who cares about the students and has a good sense of humor. One of the best teachers I have had during my time at Brandeis.
Good
Great guy and great teacher. Clearly passionate about what he does.
One of my favorite professors. He's really helpful and patient with you if you don't understand something. A really nice guy both in and out of class.
A great teacher who really cares about the students.
Probably the nicest guy around.
Great class on kooky topics at the interface of chemistry and biology.

Best class ever. You get what you put into the class. The class is difficult, but Isaac has made it easy. He is great at explaining stuff. Problem set corrections are in front of him so you would fully learn those stuff. Still, do not take if you are not willing to learn about organic chemistry.

An amazing teacher, Lecture flies by. Lots of work, LOTS of learning. This is a hard class that is made easier by the prof. Extremely helpful in office hours, but you will have to do a lot of extra reading for the homework. Extremely funny and exited about chemistry. Worth taking.

Very quirky, amusing, and funny. Super, super, super excited about chemistry and it shows in his teaching. He cares a lot about students' learning but is unkind to the lazy ones. Lectures are intense, quick-paced, and very dense with information. Exams are purely based on notes. KNOW YOUR NOTES. Oh, and buy the 5-subject notebook.

Krauss is a talented chemist by trade. He greatness as a teacher is subtle , I didnt really appreciate it until the end of the semester. His lectures are a little bit jumpy (not enough to actually confuse a good note taker) and his exams are extremely fair ; if you take good notes and work hard you can prosper. Also review your notes regularly.

Notes are messy. He does a very good job explaining the material, but does not write it down. So you have to try and write down everything he says. He goes fast. Also his stars are annoying. They are materials you need to look up on your own, predictions of product, or resonance. He is helpful, and wants you to succeed. Weekly Quizzes are hard.
Decent professor.
He is tough but he knows the subject well and cares about his students.

Professor Zinner is a great professor. All of the lectures are very interesting, engaging, and really gets the students thinking about healthcare and all of the nuances associated with it. Participation matters. Participate, do the readings, and stay engaged, and you'll get an A. Zinner is really smart, so ask questions; he'll have answers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Take this class. I am now considering becoming an HSSP major because of him. He has a deep interest in the topic and has an amazing way of sharing that interest. He's kind, cares for his students, and is very flexible. The cases taught in this class are interesting and he allows for great discussion. There are no tests in this class, all papers.

Perfect class if you're interested in healthcare today, especially the business side of it. Very reasonable professor (he gives you all the Harvard Business school case studies rather than having you pay for each). He really likes data, so use numbers and figures to support your arguments. Do the short readings and participate.

Zinner is BRILLIANT... and he knows it! This will be the best class you take at Brandeis. You will need to work to keep up and do well in the class, but re reword for being prepared and being able to participate and discuss during class will be well worth the 1 hour of preparation for each class. I Promise!
Great class combining health policy and business. Its actually run more like a business class. Zinner is great.
AMAZING...one of the best professors I've ever had!

First year professor and I hope he stays forever.  I have never been interested in this topic in the past, but Professor Zinner just brings it all to life for me.  It doesn't hurt that he is so hot as well...hee, hee!  Honestly, he is the best and most inspiring professor I've ever had.

It's not common that a professor is extremely passionate about their subject, but when they are you can tell. Every single lecture was extremely interesting to me, and I could tell that he was always excited to teach as well. The work was easy as long as you did all the readings and went to every class.
Took 130b last year. Great professor. Passionate about what he teaches.

Professor Wang is so funny!!! He is one of my favorite teachers! His class is interesting and the film he picked is engaging. The workload for this is not a lot and is easy to handle. I could feel his passion for Chinese film and society!
Great professor. Inspiring, changed my view of the world... Wont say hes an easy grader, but his class is enjoyable compare to many other classes Im taking.

Good professor. His lectures are pretty funny. You do have to do a presentation, but it's relatively easy. There are a lot of readings, but honestly you do not need to read all of them. Just read the readings you plan to use for your essays (one mid-term essay, one final essay), and for your presentation. This class can be pretty easy if you want.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class was a lot fun.  The professor is really funny and he is easy to talk to.  Do the homework & go to class.  An great way to knock out the Non-Western requirement.
The worst class experience. He made the class extremely hard and very tricky. NEVER TAKE HIS CLASS!

**SOC124A. Professor Vijayakumar was so kind and caring. She offered opportunities for creative assignments and we also went on a field trip to a museum which was awesome. There are a lot of readings but they are interesting and you can get away with skipping one.
For SOC124-A: Professor Vijayakumar is awesome! Super caring and kind. A lot of readings which are usually very interesting. Would totally take again.
Super empathetic and understanding. Inclusive and respectful of all ideas and perspectives.

Readings are easily digestible, not too long and actually make sense, and she ties them into stuff in class. Essays and projects are more involved than plain analysis, and there's enough stuff that no one assignment will kill you. Plus during covid she lets you miss 8 whole classes without excuse with no penalty which is rad

I love Prof. Vijayakumar! She is kind, brilliant and cares a great deal about her students. She does a great job of intentionally choosing to lift up scholars other than white men to study in class and is just as thoughtful about her assignments. Would definitely take again!

Gowri is one of the most understanding professors I have ever had. Participation really matters in this class, but you can just participate in your discussion section. She is a fair grader and if you go to her office hours that is helpful. There's a lot of reading, but the lecture covers the readings very well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Her lectures are boring, we are in the middle of the COVID-19 pandemic and she is taking attendance in Zoom? Thats not very considerate.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Vijayakumar is the best professor I have had at Brandeis. She is obviously passionate about the subject. There is not much reading each week yet each assignment is interesting and well thought out. Very helpful at office hours or over email.

Awful. Very minimal preparation for class, all of class is him writing down proofs from his notes without really any explanation or reflection on their significance. Held a couple minutes of office house twice a week from 9:30pm to 10:00 pm and was entirely unavailable for questions otherwise.

The "textbook" is really just a workbook with problems in it. Only instruction is the notes that he copies down during class which he DOESN'T POST, so good luck passing if you don't show up. Rarely available after class, will not explain concepts outside of class. The one good thing about this class is that there is very little HW, 2 hrs/wk max.

Uninterested. Copied proofs from his notes word for word on the screen and pretended that the students could follow along. Answered questions cryptically and lazily, had no set office hours, shafted us on the midterm, didn't post notes, textbook was a workbook, and he threw two extra chapters onto the final that we never even covered in class.

This guy is a mediocre teacher. I had him for proofs and classes pretty much consisted of him writing proofs and students trying to follow. He does the absolute bare minimum in terms of trying to give intuition. It seems like he doesn't really care all that much for teaching. After having Keith, I was a bit disappointed.

Get ready for lots of self-studying because you will not learn much in class (I'm not a fan). He basically copies the book on the board and reads it aloud. HOWEVER, his exam is really straight-forward and he answers questions in a very caring way - which shows respect and I appreciate it. Depends on your study style.
appropriate amount of homework, very detailed notes, the test is no hard as long as you take notes and read books carefully.
great

Actually took PHYS 15a and he was absolutely incredible. Very kind grading policy (hw graded on getting a reasonable answer, final exam grade replaces midterm if better, lowest 2 quizzes and hw scores dropped, quizzes are very chill). Very available and helpful in office hours. Great at answering Qs. Recorded lectures. No attendance. Loved him.

Got a 2 in AP physics back to hs but immediately understood everything if you try. I just finished the final exam n after checking the answers with the professor I'm pretty sure I have a 90% getting a A- or above. The keywords are slow pace, delicate explanation, and caring. The grading is also very kind as long as u put work n equations on paper.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Genuinely one of the best physics professors. His lectures are good, and you can tell that he's really passionate about physics. Overall, super engaging and insightful.

He's a fantastic professor! He explains things in a way that is easy to understand, and is very patient with students even when they ask basic or repetitive questions. His lectures are easy to understand and follow, and understanding the practice problems he gives in class and in the homework is imperative in doing well on quizzes and exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: He made mathematical mistakes every single lecture that would lead into 20 min side tracks between him and one other student. Disorganized through and through. The TAs that taught recitation were god awful, but that's not his fault.

Mistark is a fantastic professor, one of my favorites ever! He wants everybody to understand the material. He will answer any question, even if it's a question the student should know. He believes that good grades mean he is doing a good job, so exam averages are fairly high, usually A-. Take any class he teaches. He loves teaching, and it shows.
He taught the lab so that it was clear, understandable, and very doable. He is nice and cares about the success of his students. He is new to teaching, relatively, but acts like a pro
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: HISP 32A with Professor Turpin was a learning experience, but wasn't really enjoyable and pretty boring. The grading criteria is a bit confusing, with many assessment tasks, but she is accessible outside class which is nice. If you are taking this for the language requirement solely, you will find it pretty pointless for most of the work assigned.

Prof Turpin is such a wonderful and sweet prof!! I came into the class trying to fulfill the language requirement but ended up really enjoying the class. Pretty sure I also learned more Spanish in that one semester than in all of my high school classes combined.

She is absolutely amazing, and her class was the most fun out of all my first semester courses. She's so kind to students even when they make mistakes, and the workload is very reasonable. I felt like I could really do well in this class and wasn't afraid to try new things, and I'm going to miss it the most. I can't recommend her enough.

Spring 2021. Prof Turpin is very kind and a great educator. The course is a decent amount of very easy work. If you do the homework and show effort you will get an A. Graded on many small assignments, unit reflections, and a few (easy) oral exams.
She is the nicest person, the class isnt too hard as long as you practice from time to time.

Professor Turpin is amazing. She really cares about her students and as someone whose first language isn't Spanish, she really knows how to make the class approachable. Super realistic grader. Taken Fall 2018.
Prof. Turpin is a great teacher, and a realistic grader. She's also super approachable if you ever need help.

Most of the difficulty from the class comes from the fact that Japanese is a fairly difficult language. Nakano sensei does an amazing job at accommodating this and helping students with any struggles they have with the material. She's also a pretty lenient grader and was incredibly accessible outside of class. One of the best professors I've had.
Lectures, projects, groups, hw.
Super interactive. Super helpful for learning Japanese. Best teacher, always considerate and insightful facilitator of the class. Very approachable, kind, and everybody loves her and JAPN30a.

Good teacher. Doesn't always get what you're trying to say in Japanese, and will give the occasional "what the hell is going on with you?" look, but honestly cares about her students. Will offer support/extensions if you talk to her about what you're struggling with. Double check LATTE every few days as she frequently puts new stuff up.

Nakano-sensei is an incredible teacher. She makes Japanese accessible and interesting, taking care to have everyone contribute and to make the class interesting. I've learned so much Japanese in my two semesters with her!
Did a great job at organizing group activities and making sure everyone was speaking and practicing everyday.  She was helpful, flexible, and approachable
Nakano sense is super nice and easy to talk to. Her class can be a lot of fun and it's easy to do well if you just pay attention and participate in class

Schoenle is an amazing professor who truly has a great understanding of macro, and how to teach it at an intermediate level. The covered content was all very conceptual, and made me love the subject even more.

Prof. Schoenle tries very hard to instill a way of economic thinking to students by giving a lot of exposures to understanding and processing economic data (mostlyl economic indicators or macroeconomic readings published on Fred, BLS...). Sadly, he might not be the best lecturer; you need to put a lot of efforts and times studying the materials.

I wish all econ classes were like this. Lots of hands on projects and real world applications using computer programs. I learned how to find data and analyze with Excel, a super useful skill in my internship. Schoenle emphasized more on making us understand topics and concepts than stressing us out over tricky exams. Hard final, but fair.

Schoenle is super smart. He's extremely qualified as an economist, but he's probably the worst teacher ever. He's painfully boring, and CANNOT convey concepts to students even though he does try. That being said, his quizzes and test are all open note and easy as long as you do the practice exams. You won't learn anything, but you can get an A.

This prof is one of the worst in Brandeis. Weird pronunciation and bad explanation. His quiz are so easy so you can only get B when you get 92 out of 100. So ridiculous. His final is nightmare. Even though you studied it for 3 days, you can only get a B!!!!!!
Professor Schoenle is great, really interesting easy class, and he loves macro so it is easy to learn from him.
Very good teacher. Really enjoyed the class. He is professional, polite, and kind.

Rudolph Binion's lectures are packed with information and insights. He was the best professor I had in college. His knowledge, interest, and enthusiasm regarding European and American political, social, and cultural history is unsurpassed.
Seems to talk to himself more than he talks to the class.
Extremely experienced professor with unique and unparalleled mastery of his subject.
Prof. Binion is a tremendously able and fascinating teacher of European cultural history. You will learn a lot in every lecture.
No Comments
Incomprehensible, arrogant, senile.

Professor Lucken was a very kind and understanding professor who consistently made herself available to students. Definitely do the readings; they're very interesting and will help you with the final paper for the class. I consistently felt she cared about her students' success and experiences, even if at times she didn't understand.

Overall did not get what I expected from this class. Lectures felt like they were read off the slides, and most of the assignments revolved around a site visit. Opportunities to talk with religious leaders who came in as guest speakers were very insightful. Was not a challenging class though, and Professor Lucken does care for her students deeply.

She's pretty great. Stimulating discussion and interesting assignments. She definitely has a very positive view on religion and I didn't necessarily feel comfortable offering criticism of certain beliefs. However, the class was still very interesting and I think she would have been open to discussion had I spoken up.

Such a great teacher, keeps classes engaging, and is very reasonable. She cares about students and is understanding of all circumstances. I would definitely take another one of her classes in the future! Definitely recommend one of her classes even if the subject matter is out of your comfort zone. One of my favorite professors by far!
Professor Lucken is amazing. She really cares about her students and she really knows what she's talking about. The class isn't easy, but it's totally worth it. Taken Spring 2019.

Professor Lucken is awesome. She treats religion with dignity and respect, and covers every major base out there, including nonbelievers. She is genuinely devoted to her students' success, and her compassion and subtle wit make the class a pleasure to attend. Best professor I've had so far.

Aparna is an excellent lecturer! This course doesn't have a rigid structure or very many assignments, which takes a lot of pressure out of the equation and makes learning the material easier and pretty enjoyable. Aparna is very reasonable and laidback, but shows a real interest in helping students truly understand the material.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Aparna cares a lot about giving physical pictures to help her students form the correct intuition. Also she knows exactly where math will get ugly and abstruse and she will try her best to mush it up. Her lectures are so enjoyable that you won't notice the passage of time. Will definitely try to take anything she will be teaching in the future.

Easily the best professor at the university. Kind and compassionate, funny and charming, and a fantastic lecturer. She really made learning physics fun from the bottom up and every class was a joy. I'd take any Aparna class!
Aparna is amazing!
Quantum is going to be really difficult. Aparna is a clear teacher who works hard to do a good job and succeeds.
Aparna we all love you! She actually make quantum easier
T
Just the best
What an Incredible professor and person. Rachel is the absolute best, and I'm not sure where I would be if I hadn't taken her class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: She's a nice woman and I did find the readings very interesting.  I liked that the class had discussions and was mixed up in style.  The assignments weren't always clear, but Rachel was flexible in accepting all assignments.
One of the best professors that I have had at Brandeis!

Certainly cares a lot about the topic of the course and is very knowledgeable about the content. She is not very organized which led to confusion as to the requirements for assignments. The projects were interesting. The readings were long and fairly necessary to do well in the course.
I loved this class, Professor Donlan was one of my favorite professors
No Comments
She is a sweet person, but definitely tough on attendance and getting in your work. Tests are usually pretty easy, mostly because you've had SO MUCH HOMEWORK to practice.
The class was a little disorganized, and the tests tended to contain material not covered in class or on homework.  A reasonable background coming into the class definitely helps.
She's a cool person, but kind of mean as a teacher.  She's not very understanding.  She gets mad if you're absent, even if you were sick.
SHE IS SO HOT! That is the only reason i enrolled in the class. I HATE FRENCH--but I LOVE HER!

Albert was great! There are a lot of essays (3 shorter ones and 1 very long one) but he wasn't a tough grader and the papers were very straightforward and pretty easy to get through. He does care about participation so make sure you talk a couple times per class. Overall very nice and explained concepts well, I feel like I learned a lot from him.

Professor Albert is great! I enjoyed his Politics of Policymaking class and thought he was really knowledgeable. The class has a LOT of writing but Prof. Albert was accessible if you wanted to talk over your paper with him, and I thought he was a very reasonable grader.

Professor Albert is one of the best lecturers at Brandeis! I can't recommend him more. However, when it comes to grading, he will always base everything on his rubrics. Even if you write an incredible paper, but it's missing one section of the rubric, you will be receiving a B for your work at the absolute best. Love the guy though
He's a great professor that really knows his stuff and is excited to share it with his students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Professor Albert for Political Parties and Systems at UMASS online. While the class was asynchronous, the Professor was always accessible outside of class and recorded informative and entertaining lectures. Learned a lot about the subject. If you keep up on the weekly work and put solid work into the final paper you will get a good grade.

Professor Albert gives great detailed timely feedback on every single assignment. You can tell this guy is really sharp. He speaks super clearly, explains ideas simply and gets right to the point. He is very much willing to help you outside of class. He was very reasonable with extensions and late work.

This class really is for people of all skill levels. Joe is hilarious and never judgmental. Don't procrastinate- you really do need to work outside of class. Definitely wish he was more accessible outside of class, but he is great and this class is so fun.

Very great professor and lecturer. He is super funny and truly loves his students. He is great at creating meaningful relationships with his students. He does as you to do a ton of work and he really pushes your skills as an artist. I have learned so much from him though and I feel like I am actually good at art now.

Gave really good feedback for the projects, graded fairly. Required a lot of out of class time working on certain pieces, but the end portfolio is really cool to look back at to see how much youve improved. Class is interesting because it explores different art styles in a way you can learn from them.
Very nice guy. Guides you along well with your projects, doesn't try to inject his own personal preferences into your art. Easy class, learned a lot of new techniques.
He was pretty and that was about the best I could say for him.
No Comments
all around kinda meh.

There is absolutely no reason to go to class if you have the textbook, which you need. The tests and quizzes are word for word from the textbook so make sure you memorize the whole thing. Peavey is a funny man and the curves are crazy. Literally there is no way you won't pass the class if you just read the book and take the tests.

I literally cannot take Peavey seriously 'cause his lectures and tests are written with so little care. The questions don't make sense and I'm forced to guess, and then get a bad grade. SO many people get Q's wrong that he curves like half the test; this is a sign of a badly made test. Lectures are a waste of time, just read the book word for word.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Peavey is very hard to take seriously and always speaks in vague questions. During lectures he kinda rambles about nothing and asks confusing questions- all the material is from the book and not him. You need to read the text chapters word for word in order to not miss some random fact that will be on the quiz or test. I hate him :(
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Peavey is very accomplished (he worked for the EPA) and knowledgable, but he isn't very passionate about teaching; he jokes that he is already retired. His lectures can be pretty dry, but you'll do well in the class if you actually read the textbook.

He's fascinating to listen to.  He's super concerned about the environment and really wants to inform everybody about the dangers we're putting our planet in.  Class notes + book  tests.  Don't stress too much about the tests.   Seriously.  Show up early for the sign-up for the final presentation.  Easy way to obtain a chemistry minor.
He was the worst professor I had during my entire time at Brandeis.  I do not believe he cared about me, his other students or our futures.

Easy class with people floating in and out.  The grade relying on a 25pg memoir not given much attention other than mention of its existance is somewhat annoying.  Brown is cool, very nice guy, but certainly somewhat aloof.  Class can be fun, but so is chilling w/friends - they're about the same.
Never showed up for class 'cause the government needed him for something.  Beyond that, he's very smart.
I took 2 courses with him.  He's an extremely nice guy and invited people to his house for a bbq.  Very nice, but the classes were boring.
funny
If this professor had any grasp of the subject matter he chose never to share it with the class.  Should have been listed as one of Dante's three rings in hell.

Took her class at Nashua Community College. Interesting and funny, uses a lot of interesting examples to really help you understand the material. Participate in class discussions, she does a great job guiding them and really wants to hear your opinion. Was also very helpful when I was struggling.
Worst class in four years of Brandeis. Self-indulgent lectures, stupid exams. I learned nothing except to steer clear of the Anth. dept.
very very interesting lady, and a fun teacher
Very helpful, one-on-one.  At times, the lectures were a little unstructured.
A fun class, fun tidbits of knowledge, weird music, mostly fun to listen to.  Annoying class time.  Better if you have at least some musical ear and/or training.
The class  would be spectacular if the teacher would teach something!

LONG RAMBLING LECTURES. He obviously loves what he's talking about it and wants you to also. if you're super interested in the subject you would probably love him, but it was clear that more than half the class was bored out of their minds, zoning out and on social media. I skipped half his classes and did fine because your entire grade is 3 essays

While very experienced in his field and not a bad lecturer, Burg ruins an otherwise interesting topic by slamming you with as much work as possible. He teaches his class as if it's the only one you're taking: refusing to grant extensions, moving up deadlines, etc. Do not take his classes if you lead a busy life.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Burg is a knowledgeable and helpful professor with lots of experience in the field of ethnic conflict.  He's a really good lecturer and I highly recommend taking a class of his.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Burg is a very good professor (especially with regards to ethnic conflict). He is very qualified to teach the class and makes the lectures highly informative.
Brilliant and excellent teacher.  Cares about the class and the students.  Class is difficult, he expects his students to work, but rewards them if they do.

Burg is AMAZING.  He is the best professor I've had thus far at Brandeis.  He analyzes readings so effectively, and effectively communicates his thoughts to the class.  He is also an incredible moderator, synthesizing students thoughts into coherent, effective points that explain the material.  His class is not easy, but it's well worth it.
The course materials are awesome and the lecturers are chill. But I don't like her personally because I felt that I was discriminated and not be given enough attention.
Take as many classes with her as possible. She truly cares about the subject and her students.

Sweet, caring, knowledgeable professor.  Env Law and Policy was extremely easy & enjoyable all around including guest lecturers and a mock trial. She cares about her students, course material, and that students enjoy/learn.  She is extremely busy and involved in her field and will likely open your eyes to social injustice and your role in Waltham!

Prof. Goldin is an amazingly talented and intelligent professor.  She is kind, compassionate and truly cares not only about the issues in her curriculum but also about the students.  I would take any class she taught!
She is so informative and smart! Very sweet and caring, everyone loves her.  Her classes are extremely interesting, she obviously works hard to make sure her students enjoy the material.
This was my favorite class ever, she rocks!

Amazing professor, does a phenomenal job in explaining the concepts. Genuinely cares about student comprehension. Homework varies in difficulty, but exams are generally fair and test the concepts appropriately.

Bensinger does a fantastic job of explaining counter intuitive concepts and connecting them to the math he presents in class. His homeworks can be long, but they are fair and relatively easy. Occasionally he doesn't emphasize the importance of critical concepts enough, but other than that he is fantastic!
Although it's hard to understand his lectures, if you can meet with him one on one you will be astounded at how much you can learn in 20 minutes.
Boring and doesn't care
Do all of the problems.  All of it.
He's a good professor, but the class is tough.

honestly very nice person and understanding / easy to work with , stats will be hard so try to do groupwork or have 1 person u can do assignments with , accent might be hard to understand so read before class , overall very helpful and resourceful , always willing to help re-explain and always professional
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: Great teacher and difficult class.

Brilliant guy, tough class. Learned I liked coding through this class; the satisfaction after figuring out a code after the head-scratching frustration during the process is immense. Definitely not a class where you can procrastinate and start HW last-minute though. Clear guidelines. Accent was not a problem for me. Very accessible outside of class

Dr. Liu is brilliant and really cares about students' learning--always there to help.  His lectures focus on statistical models/underlying quantitative basis first and then the conceptual explanation. Reading the text BEFORE class makes his lectures much more clear.  Lots of SPSS/R based assignments but you can work together.  You'll learn a lot.

Really nice, smart prof with a good sense of humor, but really difficult to understand, both because of his accent and because the class is just hard. I did great in a previous stat class but really struggled in this one because there's a gap between the type of questions that you practice, and those that you're tested/graded on later.
I really enjoyed his class. Statistics is a difficult topic to learn, but he went out of his way to make sure I understood everything.

He's honestly kind of a nice guy.  So hard to understand.  He uses syntax in SPSS, but it seems he expects people to know what he's talking about as if they are on his level of stats knowledge.  His slides are muddled & confusing, and he talks a lot about things that you never end up using in the class, making it more confusing.  Avoid if possible!
She's cool but the class content is boring.

This is for UWS34A. Professor Nourse is inspirational and she cares about her students a lot. UWS is hard and it does require a lot of readings. But I feel like this topic is very interesting and I love all the lectures professor gives. Definitely, it is one of the enjoyable classes that I took in Brandeis.
I took her CSEM class last semester. She was very kind and caring. Would definitely recommend taking any class she offers.

She's such a sweet lady. She was such a breath of fresh air to have in my first semester when I was taking a lot of weed out classes. She just made me happy! 
UWS sucks but hers is the least sucky option. She grades a lot easier than many of the other UWS teachers,
I feel very lucky to have taken the environmental literature option. Go Marsha! :)

She is probably the nicest professor I've ever had, one of the nicest sweetest people I've ever met. Her environmental literature UWS was interesting at times, but also pretty boring at other times... unless you're into reading and writing on ecopoetry. Be warned, she has a tendency to go on tangents/talk about her life. Fair grader, not too harsh
Just show up to class and she will love you. She is a sweetheart.

i took SAS10A w/ her and i LOVED her! sometimes i struggled w/ comprehending the assigned reading but the lecture made it make sm sense. she made the content very interesting and intriguing to learn so i genuinely enjoyed it. she was also super understanding to the needs of students and gives extensions if needed. very candid and caring professor!
She's a very sweet and caring person! She was helpful outside of class, easy to contact, and her lectures were interesting. You could tell she really cared about the subject :)

Ulka Anjaria is one of the most brilliant professors I have ever had. She managed to made the class's incredibly difficult texts much easier to understand and engage with. She is also brilliant at directing class in a meticulous way that ensures that all that is said is tied into the topic at hand. Definitely recommend her

Anjaria is a great professor! His class discussions were interesting and she didn't let them get too off topic. She's nice, smart and helpful. When I was an overwhelmed freshman, she was understanding and helpful.
She didn't help me out when I needed it. She refused to grade me fairly. She seemed very smart but distant and uncaring.

Ulka is amazing! One of the best professors I have had at brandeis. She is incredibly smart, nice, and really funny in class. Every class lecture/discussion was enjoyable and interesting, definitely take a class with her if you enjoy english/ writing!

This was a really fun workshop class and it's pretty realistic for what students will face in the real world and real work. Prof. Arellano is really passionate about art and helping students understand what art is (and isn't). He's so kind and compassionate, I would totally take another class with him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: I really did not enjoy this class. The material we read was more interesting than the actual class. Literally months after we learned a concept, he would still be going over it again, so the pace of the class was really frustrating. Easy A, at least. Taken Spring 2019.
lots of reading, a good teacher but not the best at getting students to participate sometimes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Lots of readings but they are not too hard - the class is pretty easy even if you don't do them. However you may not be able to participate in the discussion as well which is important. Good teacher, very nice and helpful to students, but not the best at leading discussion sometimes
Amazing professor

Smart professor, but his discussion questions are often hard to follow, making the class  fairly confusing. However, if you do keep up with the readings  and aren't afraid to go to his office hours then you will be fine. Although class discussion didn't flow as smoothly as other classes, it certainly challenged me to think in new ways.
Nice and caring. Really an easy A if you show up every class and do all the works. I am not an ART  person but really learnt a lot of drawing techniques after his class.
He is super helpful and goes out of his way to help students.
really great professor. he explains concepts and techniques in really interesting ways that stick. very helpful in explaining how to improve your work
Sean is great.  He's adorable and encouraging and his paintings are brilliant.
No Comments
Sean is a great guy. He's really cute and very careful to not insult your work, even if you are not an artist. I love him.

Im quite certain that someday Ill be telling people I once took a class with Dr. Hua and they won't believe me because she will be such a big star. Ive never met any professor with more compassion, courage or determination to make the world a better place. She truly makes math learning what it should be. The best thing Brandeis has to offer

Highly recommended, intriguing lecture style and always engaging. I'm not particularly a math person and had to take this class but she really helped me through it. Concepts are explained clearly and I felt like I really learned a lot. Do expect to spend quality time on learning the class though. Overall definitely a very positive experience.
Amazing!
Great professor, super nice person. Occassionally brings very good foods to class.
Shes amazing! She is always so helpful during the office hour. Her lectures are clear and straightforward, and her tests are fair. Highly recommended!
Good prof!
