He's an amazing professor who wants his students to succeed. He sets clear expectations and helps students brainstorm ideas for papers. The class content is rich, interesting, and detailed. There are a lot of readings but he helps you narrow down the key ideas for all of them. He can be a bit intimidating at first but he's actually a chill guy.
I love Professor Gillespie, he is so passionate and his class is super chill and informative.
Read the materials and you'll be fine. Enjoyable seminars in which everyone gets to talk. Try not to skip classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Gillespie made my semester! This is my first rating, but I really needed to shoutout this great course. It gave me completely new perspectives on the topic. Gillespie is nice and caring and wants you to succeed. There are quite a few readings that you need for papers, but they are not difficult and worth it. Would definitely take again!!

Prof. Gillespie really engages his students and spikes interest in the topics we discuss. Class is mostly based on readings and discussion, with three fairly graded papers spaced throughout the semester. He's understanding, knowledgable, and honestly very chill.

Chris is the most understanding professor I've ever had. Very lenient and remembers what it was like to be a student. His classes are completely discussion based, the readings are interesting, he's a very easy grader, and he's absolutely hilarious and adorable. super knowledgeable about the sociology of health and is very insightful. fave prof!

I would not recommend Prof. Güvenç's course unless you already are planning on studying architecture. It is not a good introduction to architectural studies or art history. The exams are not comprehensive of all the content however count for most of your grade.
The most inspiring class ever at Brandeis! She is an amazing and most caring professor. And she has a great taste in fashion!
Class is super easy and can be counted for a lot of general requirements

She is an extremely accomplished woman, and that as well as her passion for housing is definitely seen. I however did not care for her lecture style and found it difficult to keep up. Her policy and attitude towards her presentations were a little ironic due to the emphasis she placed on writing things down. Also, her fashion sense is incredible

Muna is a really wonderful professor. She is not overly demanding but definitely expects her students to work. She's not afraid to call out things but provides very helpful feedback. This was my second course with her and I look forward to my third. She is available outside of class and very supportive of her students performing well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Muna is HARDCORE. She has an engaging and vigorous teaching style that might be intimidating for some. Absolutely well-read, well-spoken, and articulated. She takes no BS from anyone, so if you're good at making excuses and not putting in any work, don't take her classes. She is very amicable and has an amazing sense of humor. Don't waste her time.
He's really funny and his lectures are pretty interesting. Cool guy and would take a class taught by him again.
Fun, engaging lectures, interesting assignments and overall strong class energy. Would take his class again
be prepared to do a lot of reading, but it's worth it. the assignments are really interesting, as are the lectures, and i am very glad i got the chance to take this class.
My favorite professor ever. So sweet and cares about his students. Lots of reading and small writing responses, but they're graded super easily. I sign up for every class he teaches.

Currently taking Literature in the Age of Mass incarceration; it's clear this prof doesn't really know what he's talking about and rambles A LOT without really saying much. There's a lot of arbitrary readings and small assignments (frequent latte posts, short papers, etc).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: I really struggled with writing essays and whenever I went to him for feedback, he was never helpful. He would tell me to go the campus writing center instead of explaining anything to me. He did allow re-writes for some of the papers, which helped, but this was by far the hardest humanities course I've taken at Brandeis.

I admire Professor Sherman perhaps more than any other professor I had in my first semester. He really does treat us like adults, and in a cerebral english course, was receptive to everyone's ideas. The readings he assigned were a blast, and his feedback was super helpful. Take a class with him if you possibly can. He's tough, but you'll improve.

Wonderful professor. He definitely knows what he's talking about and is incredibly engaging and encouraging. The readings he assigns are also fantastic. Definitely one of the best professors I have ever had.
He's adorable! He is very into his topic and because he loves it, it's infectious and you end up loving it- I did

A decent professor. Knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and committed to engaging with students. Classes are usually lively, with a lot of discussion. On the negative side, he does tend to ramble somewhat. In addition, he gives Cs for average work, so you may get a lower grade than you're used to getting.
a perfect professor

very fun, engaging and entertaining professor. He actually tries to learn you're name and get to know you. and has and extremely helpful TA. Very easy grader too. all you have to do is answer his questions that he provides without superfluous language
Lectures are captivating and he presents a ton of information in an approachable manner. Phenomenal professor who has won Brandeis' teaching award.
Very nice, funny, entertaining lecturer... easy grader... good but no the best
LOVED TODD'S CLASSSSSS!!!! He was really helpful and I love art now

Prof Pavlisko is an amazing artist and teacher. I really liked his class. Prof Pavlisko opened the door to a new world of art I didn't know was there. I became a minor in sculpture because of him. I can't wait to take his class again. The best art prof at Brandeis
Professor Pavlisko was alot of fun. Professor Pavlisko made me think and I am not an artist.

Todd was seriously cool and the classs was too. I liked how Todd talked to me and how he got me interested in art. I am a Computer Science Major at Brandeis. Todd always seemed happy to be there and helped us in and out of class. He gave to much work sometimes and expected a lot from me I didn't always have time to focus on art coming from C.S.

Todd is the smartest Art teacher I have ever had. I hated his pop art class until I started to see his vision. He is wicked smart and knows everything about art. His approach to art was different and new and he expected a lot out of me and everybody in class. Really demanding guy but he is a serious artist. Shows all over the world. made me think
She's a great teacher who clearly knows her stuff. The class covers a monstrous amount of material though, and she's very focused on lecturing.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: uploads the powerpoints online before the lecture. lectures never go over anything not already on the slides (lots of people skipped). interesting but tough/detailed material. exams were hard but fair. has a kinda cold demeanor and isn't very approachable or friendly, but is not a bad person (ie: she cares about you but doesn't show it very well)

interesting subject, but lectures were SO boring. rarely used images and never used videos in powerpoints  just text. slides were packed, used unclear phrasing, and were visually disorganized. spoke in a dull voice with only the occasional quip. material was very in depth and detailed. pretty tough for a class with a "high school bio" requirement
Nice professor. You'll do well if you show up and take careful notes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Terrible, focus on minutia instead of the big picture.

An amazing professor, especially by PhD student standards. Charismatic, caring, and genuinely a great human being, he was my favorite professor freshman year and I was always excited to come to his class. Even though I went on to study completely different things (CS&ECON), this class was an important stepping stone in my general writing abilities.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: He was my favorite professor. Hes super real. Hes very understanding and accommodating of peoples situations. The class was a lot of work but I genuinely enjoyed going to class. You dont NEED to participate if you dont want to but its a lot more fun and beneficial when you do. Highly recommend!!!

He was so invested in each students research design. Along with a relevant and interesting topic, his class was actually engaging, despite everyone else warning me of how dreadful UWS is supposed to be. Not too easy not too hard and I learned a lot about my writing along the way.
10/10. My fav teacher so far at Brandeis

Jacob Burg is that cool millennial professor that is actually self-aware and hip. His workload is not so bad and his assignments actually matter for you to learn. He keeps class interesting and almost everyone in my UWS class loves him.
she explains things in a way that's easy to understand and is very approachable if you have any questions. you can tell she cares about and knows a lot about what she teaches.

Professor Miller teaches her class at what I believe is a very slow pace. She takes feedback from the class on how to improve her lectures and how to help us succeed in her class. She is always available outside of class for office hours in the library and she is great at telling us exactly what to study and how to study it.

Professor Miller often provides numerous practice problems during class sessions, aiding in students' comprehension of the subject matter. Self-study through the textbook is also advisable. The grading system might seem ambiguous, as your precise grade remains uncertain until the final grades are released. However, she is a fair grader.

Genuinely cares about her students. It can be a bit annoying how she'll answer the same question six times from the same person, but it comes from a good place. Easy class if you need your quantitative reasoning credit.

Prof. Miller is a math major and she also taught Statistics, so you must expect your class (and test) to be filled with equations and hand-drawn curves, which can be intimidating or unfamiliar with what you have learned before. Besides her math-heavy approach in a social science, I believe she is a great professor who cares about her student.

Professor Chaudhry is an incredible instructor.  It was one of the most inspiring, challenging, and eye opening courses that I have ever taken. I learned about many incredible authors like Cathy J. Cohen who I still follow and read to this day.

SO MUCH READING, easy A if you keep up with what is happening in the class. things that are graded are mostly reflective and in response to things discussed in class / readings. prof is very accommodating.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: They are so caring, considerate, and sweet. They really care about their students and want them to succeed. The reading is interesting however, there is a lot of reading and it is very dense. There are also a lot of assignments and it is important to keep track of assignments. However, they grade fairly. The assignments are also a lot of fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Amazing professor!! It obvious that he genuinely cares about his students. Assigns meaningful readings, and discussions are very interesting and alive. He teaches some of the best classes at Brandeis!

Prof Chaudry is the absolute best!! His course taught me so much, and he's such a deeply good person. The topics covered are relevant, interesting, and important to learn about in today's world. If you get the chance, take his classes!!!

I liked her as a teacher. I found her very nice and it really felt like she enjoyed what she was teaching and wanted you to understand. But class was only twice a week and 80 min so I never retained information as well as I could have--but that's not on her. If you ask her questions she always seemed happy to help.-- Although not the most engaging.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing learning proofs with Prof Yun Shi, she is super nice and accessible after class/Office Hours. Eager to help you learn. This may be unfamiliar material for people with no higher math background. You will need to allocate a lot of time reading/HW.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: She's really nice and understanding, but she never taught this class before. Lectures went over the textbook at a fast pace and left many confused. Don't worry about grades too much as there is a curve.

Homework was relatively easy and worth 40% of your grade, the other 60% was the midterm and the final. The midterm went terribly (it wasn't clear at all what we needed to know) but the final was better. Lectures were very hard to follow, almost no one was left in class by the end of the year. She's sweet but the most disorganized prof I've had.
Very lecture heavy and few class interactions.

I took film and the holocaust which was a group setting and was very discussion heavy. The films were interesting and we had interesting discussions. The grading was not clear though and based on 2 grades the whole semester the first we didnt get a grade until the end of the semester two weeks before finals. Overall I recommend!

Professor Rivo seemed to rely more on watching films than giving lectures as part of the class. This structure created greater difficulty in understanding the course material. Her grading instructions were not clear in the slightest. I'd primarily recommend this class for an easy A.
Very unclear in her instructions. If you know nothing about film she will not help you at all.
Rivo provides an informative and interesting class -- she is great!

Professor Rivo is a wonderfully warm woman who always has something brilliant to say.  I took Film and the Holocaust from her, which was an incredibly interesting class.  She had a way of making students feel very comfortable expressing their views and participating in discussions.
Hands down one of the best professor at Brandeis. Really cares for his students and and really wants you to do well, also a great person to talk to outside of the classroom.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Ahmad is awesome. Not only is he super knowledgeable, but he really cares about his students, and will spend time making sure you understand everything. Definitely one of the best professors I've had. His office hours are great!

He's definitely what a teacher should be. He challenges you to be the best writer and analyzer you should be. Good and generous grader. As long as you show dedication and you speak to him you should be fine. Def recommend going to his office hrs/following his feedback. He's a cool guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Prof. Ahmad's class was fantastic, all economics majors should take his economic history course. I thought it would be dry but made me appreciate much more the models I studied in other classes. He cared a lot about his students (go to his office hours, he wants you to learn!). The problem sets were challenging but the exams were pretty fair.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Shameel was a great teacher, he cared about the subject and provided comprehensive data about how the class did on graded assignments. The curve was generous and he was responsive to emails.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He is such a bad lecturer in my opinion. I'll be sitting in class and just baffled by how poorly he speaks and explains things. The heavy french accent does not help.
Very mids professor. He goes really fast during lecture and is difficult to understand. Exams were very difficult. I would not say that the problem sets prepared me for the exams.

This review is for Math 36a Probability. 
Touboul is one of the best prof in Math dept at Brandeis both in terms of his superb academic knowledge and organized and clear lectures. Hard homework and hard exams but with large curves (like 60 curves to 85). Come to his class if you really want to learn something.

Jonathan is a great professor and he knows his stuff well. His class will be hard and you should be prepare to do a lot of work. However, he is a generous grader and he recognizes individual work & progress. He is one of the best profs!
Best professor at Brandeis

Prof. Lee doesn't know how to structure a good language class. She goes through the motions, but it's unengaging and there is almost no real-life application. We covered all the material, but the learning process was slow and clumsy. That being said, Prof. Lee is really kind, and she knows the linguistics and grammar of Korean in extreme detail.

Professor Lee is a good professor, she knows how to work with everyone's weaknesses. We are all here to learn, and she doesn't expect everyone to pick things up right away. However, for our group project I felt it was a bit unfair how she grouped students. All native speakers, were in a group, and all the non-Asian students were placed in a group.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Lee runs the class in a way that worried me at first, I'll admit, it felt fast-paced and intimidating, but I quickly learned what she expected and how to meet it. She is accommodating and kind, and hearing her break into surprised laughter during class always lightened the mood. Study hard and focus and you will learn so much so quickly!

She is so kind and is an amazing teacher. She cares a lot about her students and make sure that they are learning Korean instead of making students stress about grades. I took her class during the semester when the campus shut down because of covid 19 and she was the most understanding teacher and made accommodations for everyone that needed it.

she gives a lot of workbook homework. She gives 2 midterms. One written, one oral. She's very nice, and really cares about the students. Her small group settings help people make friends in the class. Hard, but fun class!

Absolutely horrible professor. Doesn't respect his own words. Very disorganized. Every time you go to his office he'd be speaking with his family in Spanish, and he tells you he's not available. He did that to me probably 5 times. Also, he doesn't answer emails. 

I'd stay away if you want to enjoy your program. By far one if the worst.

Xavi is definitely not an easy teacher, but he is one of my favorite teachers at Brandeis. He tells you that if you can pass the midterm you will get a good grade in his class, and he keeps his word. Everything in my course was open notes open google, which helps but its still difficult. Overall a very caring professor who helps as much as he can.

Xavi is a great professor, he expects a lot out of his students because he gives a lot to his students. He will meet with anyone at any time outside of class and schedules as many extra classes he needs to teach what he thinks students need to learn . You should learn python before taking the class though, makes it a lot more fun. -Masters student

He didn't know what to teach. The class was extremely disorganized. Having a syllabus or a written guideline didn't mean the class was organized or the purpose was clear. 15 classes in total, he only taught real things for 4 classes. Half of the class time was his random speech of what students thought of him. Who cares, really.

Probably the worst professor I have ever had. I am a master's student, and this person is terrible to teach or to be a professor. He doesn't honor his words, very disorganized, very rude, very bad at teaching, and extremely careless. He doesn't care and is so stubborn. One advice, don't let things go with him otherwise he will stay the same.

At first I was really excited about his class. The syllabus and the excerpt of what his class would entail drew me in, but I was so very wrong. He wasn't helpful, he was really bad when it came to relaying the content of his course correctly, and when I asked for help, he didn't even try to help. Beware!

I took his class "Writing the Nation" but it's not listed here. Amazing professor and incredibly smart. He is incredibly nice but he talks so smartly --almost in poetry-- so I felt super intimidated whenever I spoke. He's a tough grader and makes you work to get a good grade. However, mathematically I should've gotten an A- but he gave me an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I took a class about Black Vampirism with Prof. Callender and it was so amazing! He genuienly knows so much about the subjects he teaches, and he is a great resource. The class was difficult at times, and we had a lot of reading to do (5 novels plus occasional articles and a handful of movies to watch) but most of the content was very interesting.

obviously is very passionate about his material and knows a lot about what he's talking about; very enthusiastic and entertaining to listen to. having said that, he does assign a LOT of readings etc. it's better if you keep up with them, but if you can't, he never forces you to speak in class so you'll live. v strict when it comes to attendance.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Accessible outside class

comment: amazing, kind, mesmerizing, extremely approachable, and helpful. you'll feel better if you keep up with the reading but if you don't, you go over specific sections and I found I could still participate when I fell behind. Teaches exactly how he wants your writing which is very helpful. My grades weren't amazing but ended with an A? I'll take it!

It is apparent from your first class with him that he cares about this material deeply. However, our group was quiet. Prof. Callender really didn't know how to work with that and so the class suffered. He recognized this about half way through and said he would send a survey multiple times but never followed through.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Encouraging and perceptive- read me like a book on assignment 1. Gives GREAT recommendations, I loved everything she showed me. Just memorize your lines and don't blow off everything, and you'll do well.
One final paper- super easy. Adrianne is awesome! Highly recommend.

I love this woman so much, she is the best teacher that I have ever had. She is honest and helpful and so encouraging. She cheers on mistakes just as loudly as she cheers on successes. She makes students feel comfortable around her. I truly have no complaints and would love to have her as a professor again.

Adrianne is a wonderful teacher. She likes to introduce students to abstract methods of acting and presenting ideas, and always listens to student input in discussions. She also cares about each individual that enters her classroom.
Adrienne is an amazing woman. She can really get into your mind and helps overcome a lot of fear. She pushes your limit, but does it in a mothering, caring way. She's the best
Best lecturer ever at Brandeis. Passionate enough to keep you interested and don't want to miss any of his classes.
TWM is the man. A must-have professor for any Brandeis student. Hopefully 'Deis will hire him after he finishes his PhD. He has already impacted so many students' lives. :)

TWM is ridiculous, very interested in the course material and his lectures make you think. The only problem is it's hard to get in alternative interpretations to his views because they're so comprehensive. Great Professor overall.

Easily the best lecturer that I have had at Brandeis. Hiring him as a full time professor would be a terrific decision on Brandeis' part - he is extremely engaging and helpful. And it is quite clear that he loves politics, and leaving his class, you can't help but feel the same way.

Very enthusiastic professor that goes out of his way to prepare lectures that actively engage students.  I personally learn a lot from this class and I loved the discussions. Also, he is SUCH a hottie

I liked this class and felt like Brainerd was willing to work with students. She does a great job of making material applicable to real world. However, I've heard that other professors grade easier. My word, if you want to learn the material and are willing to put it the work take it with Brainerd but if you want an easier professor don't.

Very difficult class and difficult content however I believe Professor Brainerd does a fantastic job at teaching and being patient with students. Attendance counts towards your grade but I'd imagine not going to class makes the content that much more difficult to understand. Loved Professor Brainerd, would take again!

She makes lectures mandatory but she justifies this with her excellent teaching. Explains material in a comprehensible way and gives fair problem sets and exams. There is a lot of work to put into this class, but if you do all the work it will pay off.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: I loved having Professor Brainerd as a teacher. A real no nonsense type of professor. If you are serious, you will do fine.

Professor Brainerd taught Econometrics very well. She attempted and succeeded in purveying the information towards us in an extremely precise and clean way. It is a rarity to have a professor to really be that clear despite the occasionally complicated concept to understand. A real no nonsense type of professor. If you are serious, you will do fine

Madame Voiret truly cares about her students. She may occasionally be disorganized, but she isn't a malicious professor. She wants students to do well in her class, and if you reach out to her, she will go above and beyond to help you. You do have to keep up with the work in her class.

Overall a really bad teacher, she is extremely spacey and can barely even remember the students names let alone how to teach. as long as you can teach yourself its easy to do well but if you looking for great language learning experience voiret isnt it.

While a very nice person, she is an extremely frustrating teacher. She barely teaches the grammar she assigns, expecting us to learn it ourselves but then testing us on things we've hardly gone over. She's all over the place, and hard to follow. She also assigns us very difficult readings and hw that takes way too much time. Difficult to understand

I hated her class. She made us read about feminism and global warming in a class about how to speak French. Then she made us study a play no one cared about. Also, she would explain 1st grade French in English and hang us out to dry with other parts.

Mme. Voiret is SO NICE. She's helpful but occasionally spacey. She's VERY respectful and accommodating and she appreciates effort. She can be a little hard to follow sometimes but overall, if you reach out to her, she'll help you out.

I think that Prof. Melnicove is an amazing teacher. She is very helpful and will spend her time editing with you one-on-one. She also is so experienced in the field of broadcast journalism and knows a lot. However, do not take this class if you are not willing to work!

I really enjoyed this class. Unlike all the other journalism courses, we learned such practical skills. I found the assignments to be very rewarding and I appreciated the guidance the prof. provided. Prof. M was very knowledgeable, caring, and very willing to assist students. I highly recommend her as a prof. for journalism.
she was the meanest professor i've ever had...played favorites constantly...no respect for anyone!!!!
No Comments
WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!!!!!
Really great prof. Really cares about his students and wants you to learn. Very interesting too.

Interesting class.  Paper topics were moderately easy.  Not much work involved.  Take home essay was SIMPLE...if you knew your stuff!  He is a very nice person and meets with students.  THE TA (Casey) WAS AMAZING, AMAZING!
Likes texts and his papers are informal and fairly easy to write. He doesn't really answer questions in class, but he's a really nice guy!
Wonderful man and very helpful.
If you want a class where you can just regurgitate the readings and not read anything past 1976, take this class.

Honestly, hated this class so much because of her. Yoga is supposed to be relaxing and peaceful, but with her, it's confusing and stressful. She also touches you (to move you in the right position in poses) without asking or telling you which is incredibly uncomfortable. She sometimes cold calls when asking about the formation of a pose.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Find another PE class, and another teacher who actually wants to teach that said class.
She is absolutely a horrible lady who loathes in self pity. I did well in her class but its time for her to retire, so that yoga can be a good experience and not a time of complete despair.

Had her for yoga last sem. Not a bad instructor, but doesn't have the "yoga" personality. Don't be late or walk loudly! A bit anal about where/how things are placed too. I don't particularly like her, but it's a good class to take to get a basic understanding of yoga.
so so yoga teacher. so so woman. you need to show up or you will get thrown out of her class.

Good Professor. I love how we are encouraged to only speak Spanish in class; its awesome when everyone in the class is joking around in Spanish. His combination of class and small group discussion/work does get a little tedious, but its nice to always know what to expect from class.
Best Spanish teacher ever. He is so much fun and makes going to class interesting. He is my favorite professor I've had yet.
Best Spanish professor ever. He is hilarious and the work is very easy, and yet somehow i learned more spanish with him than with any of my other 6 spanish teachers.
The best spanish professor I have ever had.  I learned more in his class in one semester than I did in 6 years of high school/middle school
Doesn't go over grammar or vocab on class, but is on exams.  Exams are extremely difficult.  No English in class.
So knowledgeable in her field. Very kind and accommodating.

Professor Ratzlaff seems daunting at first, but she's pretty great! There are a lot of readings but you can get away with not doing them if you're short on time. Her tests aren't too bad, just use the study guide and you'll be fine. With the papers and the tests it's clear she just wants you to show that you learned something.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Such as easy class. You don't even need to take notes because she posts all of the powerpoints online, as well as making study guides out of the powerpoints for the tests. (This is at BU)

teaches in the archaeology department at Boston University. lecture AND discussion are mandatory. material in discussion is practically the same as lecture so I really did not understand why its mandatory (its so dumb) only pros were slides were posted and had all the material needed. otherwise the design of the course is whack.

Professor Ratzlaff is a very talented educator who cares about her students. The topics covered in class were very interesting and furthered my appreciation of Ancient History. Would definitely recommend, even if you aren't a humanities major.

Easy class! She cares about students and her lectures are easy to understand. Quizzes and tests were online when I took the course, and relatively easy. She also gave lots of time for those. She offers extra credit, which boosts your grade a lot too.

She makes it her priority to understand how her students feel in class, whether its keeping our attentions or trying to make the sections of psych more interesting than they actually are. Also her exams are open note so as long as you attend and take notes you should do great!

Ann Berry is a really fun teacher to have. The class is very lecture heavy, but that's to be expected in a big intro class. She uses personal anecdotes to teach which makes it more interesting. The best part was that you didn't have to go in person (just stream online) and still get attendance credit. Overall I'd suggest the class!

She's a bit new to teaching and I took this course in Spring 2021 when it was completely online. The questions were a bit vague and weirdly worded but the assignments and attendance and extra credit were a HUGE grade booster. She's nice but she's not the greatest professor but, she knows her material and will help you if you ask for it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: she's new to teaching, so her class is rough around the edges. lectures can be hard to follow, as they lack structure/flow, and she tends to use ambiguous language. 10a is easy enough that this isn't a huge deal, plus you can always study from the textbook. she's a very kind person; im confident that she'll be a wonderful prof with more experience!

She's really nice! Super easy grader and she is very accommodating with extensions and she's really knowledgeable and witty and funny! She cares about her students. She is very chatty and loves to know more about her students. Easy GPA booster. The class is interesting but has a lot of dense readings so be prepared to work hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She's really nice! Super easy grader and she is very accommodating with extensions and she's really knowledgeable and witty and funny! She cares about her students. She is very chatty and loves to know more about her students. She can get slightly moody and testy but, she is a really great professor! Take this class in the summer! Easy GPA booster

Sam is so lovely! She is sweet, cares about her students' learning and is incredibly understanding if life does not go perfectly, contrary to many older and more experienced professors. She is kind, she does expects you to read, but does not force you to participate if you don't want to. Highly recommended!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: So sweet and accommodating. Really easy grader too

Sam is the sweetest professor ever -- she truly cares about her students and the content that we learn. She emphasizes an open classroom, as in everyone's voice is valued but does not force people to speak. The content is well presented and incredibly interesting, highly recommend taking her class!
Absolutely the worst professor at Brandeis
Gross prof and made weird comments towards women
Horrible professor
Worst professor. Doesnt care about students

I took a studio course form him. He's very interactive in class which is fun. When presenting projects (final drafts) you just need to do what's expected (since it's architecture this can sometimes be tuff) to get a decent grade. He's part time. the class was very small so no office hours or recitations, mostly just gives you feedback on projects.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: I'm surprised by the reviews on here. I took this class last year, and it was one of my favorite classes. She keeps it small on purpose, so that she can interact with her students on a more intimate level, and has integrated very interesting and relevant material into her discussions... bc they aren't lectures, they're round-table discussions!

She's not a good lecturer. I came into class really passionate about personality psychology, but after attending class just a few times, I felt my passion dwindling. I didn't go to any other classes except for tests, and I still got an A. You can just read the textbook and do fine, because her lectures aren't particularly special.
Boring class, nothing here that cannot be read in a cursory review of a wikipedia article. Also wastes class time with youtube videos.
Very boring lecture, tough tests, nonetheless she gave us a few points of extra credits.
Really bad lectures. Shes super boring.

Noble is a passionate professor who cares about the well-being of her students. Her grading is very generous as long as you show her you've put in effort. Much of this class relies on in-class discussion. You get to watch/read interesting pieces of media and there's even a mock trial. Overall, this is a pretty cool class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Absolutely love her. It can be a lot of work, but its rewarding. She is a lenient grader who focuses more on your effort. A great class for those who are anxious about class discussions because, even though she expects you to speak often, there are clearly no wrong answers. She is very enthusiastic and sweet about anything students say. LOVE HER.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Noble lectures a lot, which can get to be a lot, sometimes. But she really knows what she's talking about and can explain things thoroughly. Expects a lot from her students, but still a pretty moderate grader.

I loved this class and this professor. I found almost every class reading fascinating and she was great at leading class discussions. You do need to participate on the days you are assigned to be a "discussant" but if you do the reading and the assignments you will do well in this course.
Very personable easy to talk to great teacher

Professor Eissenberg teaches World Music, and I was originally excited to take it as both a percussionist and anthropologist. However, her abilities to communicate effectively with students and make them feel heard and respected could use QUITE a bit of work. She has next to no sense of cultural sensitivity or equality in her classroom. Avoid.

Intro to World music was an easy and not stressful way to get rid of a creative arts and nonwestern class for a science major.  It had no tests except one very easy quiz at the end of the semester.  The class ended 2 weeks before finals.  The only thing was there was a quite a bit of writing but it is easy to work hard and get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Caring

comment: A couple short responses and 3 long responses. Easy grader and a great person

At first the class is difficult, so students can drop. Through the semester- gets easier. You have small responses that will be 70% of you're grade. For responses, do the reading, add quotes, answer question add your opinion. Some responses are short 300-500 words and some are 500-1000 words. Three quizzes, no tricks, exact quiz posted before hand.
Great lecturer, but I felt like her personal opinions colored her view of the material excessively. She brought in great performers in concert.
Incredible professor, probably my favourite in my time here at Brandeis. There is a lot of reading for the class, but it's all more than worth it
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Gulley is such a dynamic professor. He truly respects students' opinions and values their voices. His seminar is 3 hours long, but totally worth it.

This class really made me think outside of the box and definitely expanded my horizons.  Along with this broadened perspective, however, comes Professor Gulley's opinions, which sometimes can be confused with the information in the lectures.  Overall, though, a really interesting and fun class!
No Comments
No Comments
Greatest professor I've ever had!

Susan Dibble is the sweet heart of the Theater department. She is creative, funny, and delightful. Her class is a nice addition to the week, it is not too early and really makes a difference in your body. Many days I wish I was back in Susan's class for a nice stretch and some movement. She is the best!
One of the most kind and thoughtful professors at Brandeis. It was a real pleasure taking her dance courses.

The course was about choreography. The grading is mainly based on attendance. She's really a master. She breaks it down into certain elements, that anyone can understand. She's fun and nice. After the class was over, we all gave her hugs. I've never seen that happen before. She's just so sweet and popular with students.
Susan is awesome! If you give into her vibe, she'll take you on a journey you won't soon forget. Definately worth taking - you'll be shocked you're getting graded for something so creative.

Don't take this class if you are not very comfortable with proofs. He is very intelligent, but will not clarify if you do not understand the original way he explains things and is extremely harsh is you ask a question he doesn't like.

Bong Lian is one of the smartest professors I've encountered, no doubt. But his class has no structure. It was difficult to know what we were talking about at a given time, and no textbook was given to follow long with the class structure outside of class. He is a very harsh grader, and puts the burden of understanding content on the student alone.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This class is hard to handle, especially so for ones with a weak background in algebra, so it's unnecessary to push yourself into this class if you find the texts too difficult. Homework is tough, so the exams. The professor gives clear explanations to the matters and is accessible at his office hours, but the level of difficulty is a restriction.
Prof. Lian is a clear lecturer. Homework is kinda hard. Tests are slightly easier. Lecture notes are extremely important.

Intelligent man and great lecturer. He expects A LOT from his students. Tests require you to go beyond merely providing an acceptable answer; DEFINITELY go to the review sessions. Don't be deterred by a poor grade in the onset of the course; he grades on effort and improvement

What a fabulous professor. He's wicked funny and very intelligent, definitely an expert in his field. His lectures can get complicated, but they're always clear and he's EXTREMELY helpful outside of class. Very understanding to disabled students and puts tons of time into his class. I adore him.

Fantastic professor. Very clear, very consistent, always interesting. Will make science fascinating for the liberal arts major. Definitely available outside of class, and goes above and beyond what is required of him in making his students feel comfortable, capable and motivated. Take his class.

Professor Wangh's lectures were thoughtful and interesting to me.  He made himself available to me after class, and was appreciative that I sought him out to ask questions.  It's one of my favorite classes of my college career.
This guy is CRAZY. Hard to understand, but his lectures make for great stories to tell friends and family.

Self-absorbed, sucks out all the life of the material. Talks during the entire class, prohibiting discussion and interactions. He has no interest in his student's opinions. If you ask for help, he will rant about the proper use of semi-colons. I advise that you do not take a class with this man.
I really enjoyed Professor kaplan's class. It's true he can be a little boring but he is an amazing person, and he really does care about the students

this guy is brilliant. hes written like a million books. the class is kinda boring, but the essays and guest speakers are actually fun. hes very helpful, always willing to meet with you and assist you. great class!
very unclear; doesn't actually care about involving students in the class and only wants to hear himself talk
ehh, really****ty class.

This man is a terrible teacher. He is hard to understand because English is not his first language. Plus he writes his own homework and they do not make sense because he does not know how to write with clarity in the English language. I don't understand how he is allowed to teach at a university in America.

He definitely means well, but he was incredibly hard to follow. I learned the most by going to the T.A.'s. Granted, it is Psych Stats, so it's very difficult to begin with, but he is kind of confusing as well. Most of the people I spoke to said they spent most of the class just swooning over him anyway. Nice guy, but hard to follow.

He is very dismissive--either he sees that a student understands the material or not.  It seemed like most of the class was clueless toward the end, but he keeps on going without pausing to discuss concepts.  He is rather intimidating in this sense, to the point where  no one really asked questions in class. It starts out easy, but gets much harder
Professor Fiser is the very worst Professor I have encountered during my whole career at Brandeis. I may change my major because of him.

Although English isn't his first language he still makes himself understood pretty well and gives clear and concise lectures.  He has a good teaching style, and tries very hard to stimulate discussion.  He has a pretty good sense of humor and a lot of patience, as well.

If you're looking for a easy 5th class or a non-western gen-ed course, POL 144 is it. Hindley was passionate about the material, and seemed to care about his students' learning. I did not approve of the unstructured syllabus and consistent ramblings: must improve organization! Overall, easy A/decent course: only graded material is midterm/final.
Gets off topic and rambles but has amazing life stories that relate to the subject.  Virtually no homework.  Good lecturer, although he says very non-PC things sometimes but he's really a nice guy!
his lectures were a bit rambling and hard to follow, and he said really non-PC stuff quite often!  kind of a crazy bat!
Professor Hindley is entertaining and passionate. The lectures are great and the material is fascinating.

he has been at brandeis for over 40 years and is very dedicated to the place and his students. He is very passionate about his subject, and will do anything in his power to help you get it if you want to understand. getting through his class is a breeze, but his lectures are very interesting. great guy to just talk to.

Professor Sherman is a very nice guy and is very reachable outside of class. He is willing to make an appointment with you during small vacations in the semester, even for two hours, and is willing to reply my email, answering each of my question with great patience and details. He is an amazing helper if you take his course seriously.

I had a hard time focusing in class lectures were very boring to me and the students sitting in the row next to me. He types notes up during the lectures which he makes available to everyone. Difficult and boring class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Sherman is a very nice guy, but his lectures are dry and boring. He is also very unclear as everything he says and class and any answers he provides to student questions are extremely philosophical and not clear-cut at all.  He is a reasonable grader. A lot of the grading for his class is done by the TA's. He is very passionate, though.
great guy, great class
Great Professor
The easiest professor to take 80A with. Exams are really similar to mock exams. Easy A
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Hawkins is easily one of my favorite professors. Econ80a was interesting yet challenging; if you like math and social science, you will love the class. Anyone can do well if they put in the work. I also made many friends in the class while doing problem sets and studying.

Powerpoint slides are super clear which makes reviewing on your own time very easy. Class is math heavy and Prof Hawkins does a good job of explaining the steps in class during lecture as well as on the powerpoint slides. Overall really thought the class was taught well for a difficult concept.

Professor Hawkins is a great lecturer and fair grader. Her slides are so clear and detailed, it's AMAZING. You will get an A as long as you carefully read her slides and do the HW. She made a theory class comprehensive, rigorous, and fun. More professors should adopt her teaching style. Having a strong math background will be an advantage

Super interesting class. Young teacher-- she just hasn't gotten it down yet. I expect she'll be a great teacher one day. Too much info per slide which she goes through too quickly. Too much content covered in course at not enough depth. She's super passionate about subject and if she can't answer your Q in class she'll email you a detailed answer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She is ok. Very sweet and nice but not that great with teaching. The class and Powerpoint slides are very unorganized and unpolished. Too much information crammed into one class. A lot of work (weekly reading responses and monthly problem sets?). The course content is very interesting. Hope it gets better
Given the challenges posed by remote learning in a pandemic, Professor Musegades did her best to ensure we had a positive and stimulating experience. She's knowledgeable, nice, and accommodating.

I was never bored during her lectures for protest through song. I loved how she prioritized engagement and was open to different perspectives and voices. Its an easy A class if you put in the effort she demands.

Professor Musegades is the best. She is passionate about her subject and cares about her students. She learns everybody's name very quickly and values participation to the point that each student feels valued. The nature of her classes allow students with prior knowledge about the subject to dig in, but also makes space for those who are new to it.

I took History of Rock n' Roll with Professor Musegades and she is the coolest professor I have ever had.  She has a rich and comprehensive knowledge of music history that she delivers in engaging lectures full of musical recordings and videos.  No matter what class she is teaching, just take it.

Professor Musegades is an absolute joy to have. She is the sweetest professor I had in my first semester by leaps and bounds (to the point of bringing homemade cookies to class twice) and her lectures were fascinating. The class was very easy for sure, but an absolute blast. Exactly what I wanted out of my social science requirement.
Subject was challenging as a freshman but she is a realy good teacher.

I ended up dropping this class at the last minute, but Professor Abbott was very willing to work with me.  I would not have passed, but that has nothing to do with her quality of teaching.  I think this class is definitely worth taking if you're interested in math, but otherwise I could skip it.  The only reason I wouldn't take her again is math.

I ended up dropping the course because it was too hard for me and I ended up not needing it.  But Professor Abbott was very helpful and explained things in an understandable way.  She was available outside of class to meet with students, even outside office hours, and she's a great teacher.  If she didn't teach math, I would want to take her class.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: One of my favorite professors I've had. She breaks down the material in a way that is simple to understand, very patient when students are confused. Lectures are very well organized and well paced.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Very easygoing and ready to help with confused students. Class notes are very clear and consistently marked with highlights. 10 out of 10 prof.

Cashman is one of my favorite professor at Brandeis. He's really nice and cares about students. Rather than teaching how to code, he really wants us to connect something with real world. This is a fun class and easy to get a good grade
Good lecturer, explains things really well. Would take again. He is very patient and his active teaching style really clicked for me and helped me finally understand a lot of Java.

While Cashman is a pretty good lecturer, in this class at least, only about 60% of the lectures are actually useful. A lot of people end up cutting class. You will get an easy A on the project as long as you understand Javascript and how to use GitHub.

Not the best prof, lectures are kinda pointless and just wasn't a fan of the class but he's a nice guy and if you like the course subject you might have a better experience. I just didn't really learn anything, wasn't very useful to me.

The professor is genuinely a good lecturer. What he's teaching is clearly challenging for most people (like myself) who haven't had prior coding experience, but he tries his best to break down code and make learning an active experience. His Programming assignments are HARD but very good for learning. Very understanding person if you reach out.

Cashman is a very friendly, approachable professor who is clearly passionate about the material and connecting with students. He gives good feedback on tests and projects and explains all of the material clearly. 21A is a hard class, but as long as you put in the effort you will get a good grade.

Really great guy, wants to see his students succeed. Group work can suck because he likes giving group projects and a lot of people have issues with team members who don't participate, but he's an engaging lecturer and really passionate about the subjects he teaches. Grading (in 116) is pretty lenient most of the time.

Dylan is really sweet and easy to talk to about stuff. He does go pretty fast during the lectures, so be prepared to go through the slideshows again. 21 is a notoriously hard class, but overall he does a good job and is very easy to reach outside of class. Would recommend.

No matter which professor you take at Brandeis, COSI 21A is a very difficult course. However, Professor Cashman is a great prof to take it with if you have the opportunity. He's very nice, gives great lectures, teaches the material well, and provides good examples. He's also accessible right after and outside of class during office hours.

Alfredo is an amazing professor and person. His lectures are inspiring, and he is extremely accommodating to you if you need an extension on something. He is always open to your ideas, and I learned a lot from his class. Do NOT procrastinate on the projects! There is a decent amount to work on, especially if you are majoring in other subjects.

One of the most passionate and kind teachers I've had at Brandeis! If you have the chance to take a class with him, do it, do it, do it! He genuinely has interest in his students and their lives/wellbeing, always checked in with us at the start and end of class.

Alfredo is one of the most passionate people I have ever met when it comes to drawing and fine arts in general. He is patient and a good teacher. I would recommend his intro to drawing class to anyone who is interested in drawing. There is a sketchbook requirement that can sneak up on you if you aren't careful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Alfredo is fantastic.  He can be lofty sometimes, but his enthusiasm for art is inspiring and contagious.
No Comments

Fantastic teacher, organized lectures. She's also very accessible outside of class, and is very understanding of different student situations. Happy to help out a struggling student, and very thorough in her explanations. You can tell she cares about students and the subject.
Super nice and helpful. I'm amazed when she can understand me through my lack of tones. . Homework can be tough sometimes, but she gives enough time. Lectures are fun to follow along.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She expects the typical things from a student: attention, attendance, and a willingness to learn. However, even if you don't show up to class and you need help, she will help you willingly and she is incredibly patient. I had never been insanely interested with learning Chinese back in high school, but she definitely made the class fun.
XI WEN LU IS THE BEST!!! :)
No Comments

Dr. Ross is an excellent prof. He is very down to earth, friendly, and approachable, and clearly knows his material inside out and upside down. He knows all the big names in European integration, and is very involved personally in the EU bureaucracy. Studied under Kissinger, drank beers with Chirac, knew Eric Hobsbawm... need I say more? Hat's off!

One student made a terrible comment.  He chose not to address the issue that she raised.  It was a missed opportunity.  Stopped attending class as he did not really know how to facilitate discussion around this issue.
Assigns way too much reading, lectures are unclear and unorganized.  He's better in small sections than lecture classes.  There are alot of good guest lecturers though.
George is the nicest and most engaging professor at Brandeis. He's very smart but also know how to make class fun.
Favorite professor at Brandeis by a landslide. He knows everything and is extremely passionate about his lectures.  He is an easy grader and all together a fantastic professor.

Polonsky is possibly the most intelligent person you will ever meet. He is passionate about his subject, and he wants you to be too. He is not strict, and he is open to new ideas. Best professor I had at Brandeis.

Polonsky knows everything-- about his subject, and about the world.  He compacts so much information into his lectures, but he designs his classes in a way in which each student can focus on what he or she finds interesting.  He is extremely helpful and friendly-- and a great resource.
Polonsky is the man!  Take all of his classes!  seriously... He rocks!

There is no syllabus. No one can hear Herman past the first couple of rows which is frustrating because the class is so big. The actual labs are a joke, but the final exam was really quite difficult. There are no midterms, so if you screw up the final, youre pretty much screwed.  This class taught me to how to use Excel.  Pretty much a stats course
Funny, caring, kind.  A great professor.

Sure, he seems like a nice guy. But he cannot teach for his life. This class seems more like it's teaching you excel and useless equation derivations (using arbitrary variables in place of standard ones that you see in equations) than physics. The final literally comprised of 1/3rd physics and then non-physics stuff. Take the advanced physics lab.

His grading policies are arbitrary (to say the least), and he doesn't even put out a syllabus. You will receive a grade and you will not know how or why you earned it. He mumbles in lecture and the PDFs of the labs have typos which render them unusable until corrected by a TA. This man teaches physics, but thinks he teaches statistics. Avoid.
Oliver is irrelevant.

His goal was for discussions to be only amongst students, while he sat on the sidelines. There are pros and cons to this. Pros: it DOES foster confidence and competence in our ability to speak up about our own ideas. Cons: we didn't learn anything new from hearing from other students talk about readings we also read. What about his ideas?

He couldn't answer a lot of our questions! He's a great teacher when he's comfortable with the material, but we once spent an entire 1hr 20min class trying to figure out one question. He has sent out incorrect information and doesn't like to admit he's wrong. He's funny and helpful when you go to him, but going to class seems pointless sometimes!

He's crazy but super smart and stimulates great discussions.  Definitely a bit of a wild professor, though.  Expects a lot of participation and really challenges students, but is fair with grading.  Tough, but fair.  I asked him to be my advisor, so I really really like him
Prof Jefferson is very nice, and commited to his students. However, his lectures weren't the best, and I wasn't particularly inspired by the subject matter.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Very smart and very laid back, Jefferson is probably the best professor I had at Brandeis. He comes across as shockingly self-aware as well. I am not an economist, but if you're bored in his class, that probably means that you shouldn't be studying economics. I found the material he taught fascinating and he presented it in a very clear manner.
Such a boring professor. He is reading the powerpoint all the time. During his class, he likes to walk from one end to the other, never stops. In his class, you just feel sleepy and dizzy.

Jefferrson is really pretty easygoing and the class is really not very hard if you show up and skim the assigned readings.  On the plus side, he does actually speak Chinese, unlike some economists who study the chinese economy
She is friendly and professional.
She breaks down the materials really well and goes through everything slowly and patiently.
Nothing special but not bad.  Sticks to the textbook for lectures and test material.
She knows all her students names which is nice, but when it comes to adapting to conflicts in scheduling she reacts poorly
Didn't understand concepts at first but he explained everything in office hours
Very hard, but I managed to understand the concepts.
Good teacher. Tests are much harder than exams but they prepare you well. Teaches basic concepts pretty well.
He's much better than several of the other 10A graduate student teachers. Would recommend taking his class though his tests are really hard.
The best professor Ive ever seen. The problem is challenging but interesting as well. Could be hard for most of students but not for me
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: He made easy concepts hard and was seemingly all over the place when explaining concepts. The exams were never what we thought they would be. I wanted to study math before I took this class, and he unfortunately turned me off to that.

Good all-around professor. Very knowledgeable and conscientious about teaching. Keeps students well-informed about what's happening in the class, chooses good homework and review problems. Recommended.
Favorite professor yet.  He teaches hard, but he teaches well.  Perhaps it was the difficulty of the class, but thats a class you want to be difficult.  Very little arithmetic requirement.

Professor Hanning is a great teacher. Her class is mostly discussion-based, so finish the reading assignment is really important. The course is not easy, but as long as you put enough effort into reading materials and class discussion, you will really enjoy it.

Amazing. Brilliant. Perfect. Smart. Beautiful. On top of being an incredibly smart and capable professor whose class blew my mind and engaged me (my favorite class I've ever taken), she is genuinely interested in you and developed a great course for your learning. Not a hard grader but care you put thought into the work you present.

She is the kind of professor that everyone loves. Her grading is tough, but fair and she is always gives specific feedback. Her class discussions are great and she really facilitates them and keeps things moving and keeps everyone engaged. You have to do the reading to get a lot out of classes but if you miss a few readings it's no big deal
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Anita is the type of professor that keeps you interested the entire class. Although it is a discussion based class, she provides amazing insight and research. She is very knowledgable and caring I would highly recommend taking any of her classes. A lot of reading but the material is interesting.

Definitely recommend this course as intro to Fixed Income. He is both serious and interesting. Besides, get ready to use Excel for modeling in this course. Bergstresser will show you how to build models in the classroom and you will be tested to answer questions using excel in the exam, which I found pretty helpful.

As he worked in HBS, Barclays at their Fixed Income trading desk, and many other research jobs, prof. Bergstresser is insanely knowledgeable in the fixed income and options market. You'll learn way more than typical two finance courses combined. What makes him distinguished is that he always pulls up his bloomberg terminal and walks us through.

Plain does not know how to teach. His notes and presentations are wildly different from the textbook that he made us buy. Excel sheets are so complicated (80% of which he does not teach) that you will go through it once and try to drop them. Do not recommend it.

Professor Bergstresser delivers all of the information clearly and in a concise manner and is definitely one of the better teachers out there. Simply teaching properly is perhaps surprisingly hard to come by, but you can find it here with this professor.
Huang is excellent. His homework is tough though, but the exams are much easier. Very friendly to me both as a learner and a student.

Prof. Huang is great and is willing to discuss a lot interesting topics outside the class. Though the HWs are little bit tough, but exams are really fine and he is trying his best to get you a decent socre.

Professor Huang does an excellent job of teaching difficult subjects. His assignments are hard, but they will greatly add to your understanding if you think through them. Tests are worth a lot, but they are much easier than the homework. Additionally there are numerous opportunities for extra credit including on all of his tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Assignments are difficult and tests are even more difficult. A mid-term is 30% of your grade and final is 40%. If you get a bad grade on one of them, you are going to fail. The professor's OH is usually an hour before an assignment is due, so it is not that helpful if you don't know how to do a problem.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This professor should stick to research. Although I don't doubt that she knows her Econ, teaching is definitely not her forte.
This is not a very difficult subject...but she makes it about as unclear as possible. She's also not very helpful during office hours...her answers often contradict one another.
She is one of the worst teachers i have ever had.  The class was fairly easy, but she made it completely not fun.  Try to stay away from her if you can. Go Coiner
Unclear Assignments, Unfair Teacher, Intimidating Personality, Usually not helpful in explaining topics, unclear grading procedures, not prompt on grading
Great class. Great professor. Great Man.
Great class
Prof. Is a very influential figure and has helped me determine my goals in life.
Interesting course

He is really smart abt everything. He talked about economics, biology, physics and arts, etc. during the differential equations class. His lecture note was very helpful although it was not clear that much. He was an easy grader too, but you had to show him your hard work beforehand. Overall, he is the one of the best professors I have at Brandeis.

Mayer is hard as hell and very unclear. That said, I still kind of liked him. He can be entertaining at times and he is actually passionate about math. I recommend him if you want to challenge yourself and see what it's like to be taught by someone who simply doesn't give a crap (about you).
He is an extremely smart guy, but I believe that he should devote himself to researches rather than teach students. However, he is not tough in grading.
Never come to this teacher's class. Otherwise you will regret for it.

Does not care about students at all and is extremely disrespectful.  One time he got into an argument with a student in the middle of class. Often fights with students if he doesn't like them. If you don't participate you are almost guaranteed a bad grade. In short - do anything you can to avoid taking a class with him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you take his class, get ready to read and reflect deeply, like very deeply. His classes are mostly lectures but include some discussions. The grade you get for his class depends heavily on how the TA grades you because Professor Kashwan doesn't do the grading but it would be EXTREMELY difficult to argue grades. He checks AI use for everything.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Incredibly awful, boring lectures and unclear when talking. Talks about how difficult the subject is, dumbs it down, then complains that you don't understand the topic because the explanations he gave in class aren't actually correct.

Absolutely awful.  Hours of senseless ramblings.  Few people in the world can be such bad teachers.  Professor cannot explain what is required.  Oral instructions contradict written instructions.  Disrespectful to students during office hours.  Dropped the course mid-semester.  Waste of time.  Will never take anything again with this professor.
For a professor who stresses that grades are not the purpose of learning he grades very difficulty. Long boring lectures that just don't engage

Very approachable and friendly. Helpful in office hours. The course is a lot of work but he's probably a lenient grader, because if you show effort in your work he will give points. Would take him again in another class. Many students agree he's awesome, just be ready to be work hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Dr. Gongol is far and away one of the best professors I've had. The nature of the program means there are no traditional lectures, but the Topic Notes he provides are thorough and well-detailed, if a bit dense. He's kind, considerate, and more than generous with his time. There are two professors I wish I could continue to take, and he's one.
Though his lecture notes are very dense, he's more than willing to help you if you reach out to him. Very nice person in general.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: This professor did not make any effort to teach the students in his class RBIF-111 Biomedical Statistics using R. He is an ad-hoc professor and simply hosts the course rather than teaching it. No office hours, lectures, or resources other than dense and complicated notes file.

I really enjoyed this class but the grading is tough. Class is a review of a case study so there's about 45 mins of hw for every class. The material isn't too difficult, but you can talk every class and still get a B in participation. Thomas does genuinely care about students and creates a fun class environment, but grades tougher than other profs

Do not take this class with this professor. Unclear outlines on homework, lack of feedback and overall a mean person. Most homework is up to personal interpretation and the quality of your hw and participation is up to the subjective discretion of the TA. If you need this for the requirement, choose the other section/professor.

Prof. Thomas was trying hard to provide a good class and she was well-prepared for each lecture. However, her expectation of the assignments were always uncleared and students adored by her would get more opportunities to speak up on class.

Professor Thomas is a decent teacher, but she is very ambiguous, meaning that she'll give an assignment with minimal instruction at best and it is up to you to determine what she is looking for. Therefore, your grade is based on how well you interpreted her instructions as well as what she is looking for (which, is also, not very clear).

Professor Sylvain is hands down my favorite professor of all time. I would always look forward to class with him. Some days you will stick to discussing interesting readings he assigns while other days you have deep conversations. No matter what, you will learn a lot and be inspired. He is knowledgable, energetic, approachable, funny and kind.

Professor Sylvain is an incredibly kind and intelligent teacher. He lets you be creative and as long as youre working hard and writing well you will get an A. Does not strictly abide by deadlines, so if you need/want an extension you can ask and will most likely get it. He often brings in chocolate for birthdays!

Patrick is a fun & knowledgeable professor. He cares about engaging with students and makes the class interesting. He gives good feedback on essay drafts, but his expectations aren't always clear at first. Hard readings (looking at you Kristeva), lots of writing, and randomly changed due dates. He brought chocolate to class though! Taken Fall 2018.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Participation matters--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Sylvain is a pretty funny guy and he makes talking about morality and Freud (and the womb - dear lord) interesting. He gives good feedback on papers and is helpful in flushing out your topic. Also, he loves chocolate and will definitely give you some :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Kaye is funny and knowledgeable, but disorganized and waits until the last possible minute to grade assignments. It is clear he cares about the well-being of his students, but his lateness is unprofessional and anxiety-inducing. The class was worth it but keep that in mind.
Professor Kaye is so nice and funny! His class had a lot of readings, but I was able to keep up with the work. I highly recommend taking a class with him if you have the opportunity.

Really nice and caring, and great at listening to and accepting all students' ideas. Definitely goes on tangents and didn't get through all the lecture material, but I still learned a lot. Final is worth a lot and notes assignments extremely time consuming and tedious. Overall, interesting class but could have been better with more organization.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Kaye is one of NEJS's best professors. He really cares about his students, and will respond to emails promptly. He gives highly engaging lectures, and although he goes on tangents sometimes, they just show how passionate he is about his area of study. If you show any interest in the subject outside of the course, he will be thrilled.

Professor Laski is a phenomenal teacher who clearly cares about her students and the material of the course. She sets clear expectations for work quality, grades assignments in a clear and consistent manner, and is always available for her students outside of class. If you have the chance to take one of her classes, you shouldn't miss it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Anne taught one of the best courses I've taken at Brandeis. She made sure to be accessible, going above and beyond to help each student succeed. She had a talent for making complex concepts approachable and enjoyable. She assigned a substantial amount of work in the style of a finance internship, helping us practically employ concepts from class.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!She gives mean comments, extremely hard to work with, gives insanly low grades and do not curve. The mean of the class was B- and it is impossible to get an A. She was reported by quite a few students due to the unreasonable grading. Worst lecturer in my entire college life.
The class is Unreasonable difficult
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: He is ok. Is pretty helpful when you approach him in OH, but overall the class was really difficult to follow. The class is really just a coding class, more than understanding machine learning itself, so it made it hard to do HW assignments sometimes, and not flexible with the work. He's a nice guy but not a very good lecturer to be honest.
gg
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This professor is good at making powerpoints. He is also generous at grading.

Lectures hard to pay attention to-- something about the way he speaks makes me zone out. But everything I needed to know I could learn from his slides. He does plenty of practice problems in class and recitation. Exams were difficult, but fair. In short, not the most engaging professor, but he gives you all that you need to succeed and learn.

This was a fun class!  Its not hard and we talked about lots of random and interesting things.  Bonit is very nice, and she was okay with just going along with what the class wanted, as long as it was in hebrew.  and on the last day, she brought Latkes, how cute is that!!

When she explained things, she explained them well, but we spent a lot of time in class talking about completely irrelevant subject matter. It was relaxing and fun, but I don't think the most efficient use of my time in terms of learning Hebrew.

She is an amazing teacher, and so nice and understanding. I had her my first term at Brandeis in the intro honors course, and now I have her in the writing and conversation class. Participate in class and do the homework, and you will get a good grade. Take a class with her.

The best Hebrew Professor I have EVER had, and the best language prof ever too! She's also really nice and helpful and she literally wrote the book on Hebrew (i.e. one of the authors of Brandeis Modern Hebrew). TAKE A CLASS WITH HER!!!!!

Being my 1st FA course, I didn't know what to expect. Professor Ankori is undeniably an expert & very interactive. Highly recommend the class, especially if you're comfortable with an eccentric approach. In essence, I've never found a class more relaxing, a professor more dazzling, nor a subject(Kahlo) more captivating. Learning is again enjoyable!

Her writing assignments are vague/unclear which makes it confusing for students. She doesn't care for others opinions if they aren't lined up with hers. She wants you to see art through her lens & if you share a comment & she doesn't care she'll say "anyway" and move on/say that it's not relevant.  Very repetitive, knows content, can't teach AT ALL

Her classes are very easy, and she is very nice, but her instructions on written assignments are unclear and confusing. The good thing is, even still if you don't know what is going on but you put together fairly decent work, you will be able to get an A.

I had high expectations of Prof. Ankori's class. I heard many good things about it,but it wasn't very good. She was very disorganized for the first half of the course. She also kept on changing her assignment expectations. She also expects the students to agree with her opinion on the reading of art. I didn't enjoy her teaching method.

I love her. such good class banter and I feel like I learned the most french from her out of all my french profs. Her tests and oral exams weren't even too bad. Great teacher, so so sweet and funny. I felt like I was given the tools to succeed
