Consistent participation and engagement are things that she takes seriously in the classroom. Tutoring outside of class is a little inaccessible. Her corrections can be a little confusing sometimes and her caring personality truly shines. Her style and humor is remarkable!

Professor Nenciu is great. She has a great personality, very funny, very open with students. Class is pretty straightforward; if you do the work you ought to be fine. Really, she's just a fun, relaxed professor and you will have a good time if you care about learning French! She's also knowledgeable about French culture and current events.
She is soo nice!!! She cares a lot for her students. Since French 10a it was an introductory course, she gave very good grade and encouraged us to study! She is very helpful after the class also!

Castro is a wonderful professor who clearly wants to create a kind space for students to continue Spanish. I was worried about getting back into Spanish after a gap year, but Castro has been very encouraging and enjoys having all students participate at least once during each class.

Really caring and kind professor! She tries her best to be organized, but sometimes it can get a little hard to keep up. I hadn't taken a Spanish class in so long and she was very understanding. I recommend this class for sure.

Class- 104B. Professor Castro is a great professor. She really cares about the students. She wants people to participate and engage in the course. Her LATTE directions are sometimes unclear, so make sure you know what you are doing. She is very sweet and wants her students to do well.

Zoila Castro is a good professor for people who want to improve their Spanish abilities. She's a tough grader but as long as you show consistent effort you'll get a good grade. My only real complaint is that she isn't tech savvy so be prepared to have to look in 3 different places for course materials.

Professor Lu is a caring and patient teacher and takes her time when going over topics. Overall class was wonderful and would take again. She cares a lot about each individual student, don't be afraid to go to her for extensions, absences, or difficulties in the course.
She is one of my favorite Chinese teachers! She is a great teacher, and such a nice person. She has quizzes every day in class, but they are very easy if you understand the material.
The best Chinese teacher I have ever had!!!
I love her!
a good guy with some teaching skills
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Mediocre. Try not to skip class though attendance is not mandatory
what a nice guy, like the way he taught us during class. Homework is more difficult than lessons. Only a few quizzes.
nice and helpful although speaks poor english... quizzes slightly more difficult and complicated than other sections
Teaches you how to be a scientist.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Seems too busy to meet with students, maybe things are better this year, though.

This class is absolutely phenomenal. It is PhD level, so unless you work in a research lab, you will find it quite difficult. The class is based mostly on participation which is great if you are familiar with cell bio lab techniques. The quizzes are not difficult at all and he tests exactly what he says he will. Love love love this class.

This is the best professor I have ever had.  He's brilliant and can really engage a class in discussion.  He doesn't just lecture AT you but lectures WITH you.  He demands excellence, but that is also what he teaches.  I learned more from this class than any other biology class I have taken.  You pay a lot for college, take good professors.
Perdomo is great. She is incredibly nice and willing to help. She is great at explaining everything in a clear way that is easy to understand. Would definitely recommend her.
She will challenge you, but in a good way. Way better than these other ratings imply.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a nice professor, however she teaches directly from the text book. Class is usually spent doing activities in the text book. Tests can be rather difficult because they are often very long and it can be hard to finish in time.

She's alright. Nothing special. Teaches directly out of the textbook, very little lecturing. Most of class is spent doing assignments in the textbook with a partner. All the homework is online but does not take long to complete. Pretty easy class.

Great class! Whit is funny and you learn a lot.  Not strict with attendance and is engaging.  His falsetto and lyrics to counterpoint are priceless.  He also has student sing and play their instruments in class.  Great teaching style. One of my favorite classes.
Whit is the man. He is funny, clever, dedicated, understanding, and has no problem explaining things in and out of class. I cannot recommend Whit's class enough. It is FANTASTIC!
great job mr. Black!

He honestly is the best music theory teacher I've ever had. He is absolutely hilarious and breaks out into falsetto randomly. There isn't a lot of work because he spaces it out and explains it well. Go to class, take notes, pay attention and you will be fine. TAKE THIS CLASS!!
No homework, no attendance requirement, curves greatly (he claims to be texas curve but it was actually more than that), literally a free A. just read his slide before the quiz and you will be fine.
GREAT professor, he throws his course material into the recycle bin the second when his class ends. His course is degrading year by year because he doesn't really want to teach lol.

Terrible professor, don't listen to the other reviews. This was a lab class and he never knew what we were actually doing in labs. Lectures are very (very!) loosely related to what we actually did in lab. Each lecture was 80 minutes about him rambling about random applications of the materials without actually talking about how they worked. 0/10

Doctor Xu is a very kind professor who is helpful to students who show that they care. There is no homework and no required textbook readings in the class, and the quizzes and tests consist of stuff that is entirely taught in lectures and on the slides. Difficult class, difficult tests and quizzes, generous curving at end of semester for undergrads
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: She's an incredible professor. The topic was always engaging, and she gives great feedback. She's super  into the topic which makes it even better. Also she's very understanding of her students.

She's one of the nicest professors I've ever known, and her office hours were a joy to attend. I wish I could attend another class by her, she made Anthropology interesting even though I had no prior interest in it. Would rate more than 5 if I could.

Lauren Satini was one of my favorite professors I've taken. It was during this 2020 crazy pandemic year and I have yet to find a more caring and understanding prof. She really truly cares about the material she is teaching and cares about making sure each student knows they have worth and value in the scientific world.

Energetic teacher. The content of ANTH 5A is not very intriguing but she tries to make it an interesting class. Not necessary to do all the readings but must take class notes; she has pop quizzes about slides content. Merciful grader. Exams are not extremely hard but are about memorization. You have to review her study guide and recite the notes.
Nice guy to talk to, and he really cares. He knows his stuff and will help you out.

I took Free Weights/Nautilus. Basically, he explains to you how to use the equipment in the weight room, then let's you do your thing for the rest of the semester. He DOES do attendance, so show up or drop the class. There is no cardio involved, just building arm and leg strength through lifting weights. He's a very kind & helpful man.
Coach Coven RULES!  The nicest guy at Brandeis.  Let's GET HUGE!
A very understanding and friendly guy.  The funniest teacher!  He makes working out fun.

As a non music major, I loved Professor Keiler's Beethoven class. It was intriguing and he did an excellent job helping the students understand Beethoven's innovations and context. Probably my favorite class I've taken at Brandeis. Can't recommend it highly enough.
Great guy but kinda boring.

Great class for people who have a musical background.  My friends without basic music knowledge struggled.  Music majors get extra work.  Keiler's a bit unorganized, but he is a brilliant lecturer.  Sitting in his class, hearing him speak, learning from him - it was a pleasure.

The course was USEM Opera as Drama.  His lectures were not completely organized.  You have to write what he says and then organize it later.  Encourages student participation and deeper understanding of the material.

Professor Shavarini is simply wonderful. She cares deeply about her students and even employs tactics such as changin the seating arrangement of her classes to make them more engaging. She is incredibly knowledgable- I would recommend going to her office hours to speak with her in depth and reading her book 'Desert Roots' because it is amazing
Best professor I've ever had.
She's creative with the material. Makes you be engaged when on the face of it I wouldn't normally think it would be.

She's a great lecturer. She always adapts to the class dynamic. This is good and bad. It's good to be in tune with the atmosphere set by the students. Sometimes I wish she pushed the class a little more- made them talk about more controversial topics.

Professor Gould was the most approachable and caring individual I have experienced while learning Spanish. She was always incredibly flexible, understanding, and made taking Spanish neither daunting nor unapproachable. She is really a gem in the language department.

By far the best class I've taken so far. Professor Gould places lots of value on speaking, which puts you out of your comfort zone but helps you learn so much faster than any other way. She is always in a good mood for class and will go out of her way to make sure you understand. Don't be afraid to ask questions, she never makes you feel stupid.

An extremely warm, funny, and kind woman who earns respect as a caring teacher for her students. Classes are really well structured and engaging, just remember to participate and keep up with the homework and you will do great.

Professor Gould is incredibly kind and works hard to make class interactive. Fall 2020, learning a language on zoom could have been a nightmare, but she made it very enjoyable. She is accessible outside of class. For this class you just need to show up and do the quick homework assignments and you will pass.
This is an extremely interesting class, and it is especially helpful if you want to do research.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: This class is doable but you have to understand how she wants material to be learned/used. It's a difficult subject and I think her teaching style is pretty polarizing but personally I loved it. If you really enjoy neurobiology, absolutely take this class.

We have extremely hard readings assigned every lecture, nobody understands it meanwhile we are asked to write an analysis based on the reading in class right after a useless discussion on the paper. The Quizzes are meaningless as well, we spent hours preparing and earn a grade make me question myself if I am that stupid. Nothing learned.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Come to class with unorganized lecturing. Asked for student advice but never improved. Do not consider student background and make quizzes very hard. Wasting class time to make students write open book analyses and quizzes. Tell us not to panic but make things even worse. Difficult for undergrads to survive.

Unorganized lectures. Confusing slides with pictures from somewhere else and no bullet points of key takeaways. The papers she assigned to read were extremely hard for students with no or some background in neurobiology. Quizzes were hard too because you don't get quizzed on what you learned in the papers. FYI, you can't drop a single quiz.

Doesnt care about students. Will not listen to your concerns. Will happily drop your grade for the whole semester off of one assignment and not do anything to help you. Clearly a very smart woman, but not a teacher.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's knowledgable, but difficult to learn from. She wasn't very receptive to student questions, and would sometimes opt to say "that's a bad question" and then continue her lecture without answering. When I took her class the lectures were disjointed, she frequently went off topic, and it was very hard to predict what would be a fair exam question

a truly excellent teacher - no powerpoints, just black board an chalk. she is very happy to go answer every question thoroughly, creates a very nice and comfortable class environment. but GO TO EVERY CLASS and you must take good notes - I recommend recording her lectures. exams are tough, but do-able.
No Comments

Her lectures are where it's at -- don't miss class, take good notes, and you'll be spared having to sift through the huge textbook. There's a lot to learn in this class and some of it is hard, but she knows what she's doing and tries to make things run smoothly. I learned a LOT.
She is bad mumbles throughout lesson, make sure to know half of all material before going into class.

English is her second language so I tried to be understanding about how bad this class was but she barley explains key concepts that are on quizzes. If I didn't take calc in high school I would have failed. Sometimes its hard to understand her accent and she also has bad handwriting. She will help you if you ask and give you extensions but thats it

We do nothing in class, she talks for ~5 minutes, and then we do practice problems and leave early. If asked questions, she just restates your question. Take her class if you seek to gain no further understanding of mathematics, like wasting your time, love Khan Academy, and also already know Calculus 1 and 2 content. If that's not you, run away.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Ideal for learners who want to be their own professors. If you don't know what she should teach in the lesson, she will graciously advise you not to enroll in her course.

Souba will tell you himself that you have to do the practice problems to feel comfortable with the logical rules and thrive in this class. If you do, though, this class is very enjoyable and I would look forward to it despite the later timeslot. Souba is hilarious and doesn't want to overwork you, he just wants you to get it.
Office hours are a must. Go to them and you will understand.

What he was doing in every class was reading the definitions on the textbook at an incomprehensible speed. If reading definitions is the only important thing for understanding all the concepts, why don't we just read the textbook? If that's the case, why do we need him? 
Having his lecture is like throwing my brain in a laundry machine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: What a cool guy. May come across as a little intimidating at first, but he clearly cares very deeply about his students and strives to make sure that everyone understands the material (which can be tricky at times). I sincerely hope that Brandeis does the right thing and offers him a full-time faculty position. Highly recommend his class!

(I took MATH 15 not 16)
I am upset by how little engagement there was. He talked down to us and was very inaccessible. He had office hours twice a week from 12-1, peak lunch hour. There should have been a TA for the class who we could talk to about homework answers and grades. I never understood the reasons behind some of the points off that I got.
I took 37a with him. Very easy course in general. He taught it in a very straightforward way. And the material makes sense. Good for people who want to learn differential equations.
Great lectures, helped me a lot to improve my coding skills and learn about Python. Would definitely recommend to everyone.

Asynchronous class that has lecture videos meant to teach coding, however, it's definitely not an intro class and is false advertised as such. Grading isn't too bad, just picky like all computer science people.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: helpful patient and engaged in lectures. lectures are inspiring and widely-covered. the only thing that I suggest is : be more humorous... you seem a little serious :) overall, he is really nice (bangbangda).
Terrible. Learned nothing in class. Homeworks are super difficult

This professor uses outdated ppt, assignments, and textbooks. This course has a relatively heavy workload but you actually learn nothing new from this course/professor. Worst professor ever in Brandeis!

Do not recommend! He reads off of an outdated ppt authored by the book, which you can find for free on Google. HW goes beyond what is covered in class. I am down for the challenge, but would like to receive support. I asked if we could have tutorials on the new technologies and packages. He always responded with: you can Google it.

Good teaching. The slides are well-structured as well. The homework need effort but worth it. There are extra-credits for each homework and free late days. Quiz is not difficult and no final. The final project is great which can be added to your resume.
Go to his lecture. Take good note and it will help you to understand all the material.

Fantl is an incredible lecturer. For a person who has never taken a philosophy class, going into a non-intro class was a little intimidating, but his lectures are so clear and interesting, I got right into it very quickly. Superb!
Amazing teacher. He clearly loves philosophy and his excitement for it makes it a really fun and interesting class. Definitely recommend taking it.

Music Hist. 1 is a great survey course of Early Music!  Sarah knows the material well and is enthusiastic about sharing her passion with her students.  If you don't like the music the class will be tough, but as of 2012 she has changed her grading style to be easier on students.  The class was a lot of fun!
This class was painfully difficult.

This music history course was A LOT of work.  Professor Mead didn't let us know about assignments more than a week ahead of time.  Grading was also difficult.  However, I felt like I learned a lot and ended up with a good grade in the end.
Just no.
hty
No Comments

A lovely man. Helpful, pleasant, engaging. But class quality always depends on the quality of your classmates, since all interesting ideas come from discussion. Mapps supplies the statistics and the themes, you figure 'em out. Make sure you're in it with intelligent friends. He's just so wonderful, though.

a really nice guy, but awful lectures that were repetitive and didn't have focus. the syllabus seemed interesting overall, but ended up being a big letdown and could have been better. class was canceled all the time (7 total) for lame reasons. lenient grader, but not always clear.
Prof. Mapps is so hot. Oh, and the class was good too.
He's amazing
He is an amazing professor! Very interesting and brings his life experience into the classrooms. I don't know where the negativity is coming from, he is a little disorganized, but overall fantastic!
The teacher can be confusing, constantly going off on tangents. Too many class readings, too little discussion.
He is awesome

Interesting class, but what a jerk Full of himself, rude, inappropriate, unfunny... just a jerk A very unpleasant classroom experience  I loved the content of the class, just loathe the guy who taught it

I'm not gonna lie, I'm obsessed with Kyle. He's hilarious and so passionate about what he's teaching! He's really smart and his classes are really interesting and fun. If you can take one of his classes, please do!! You really won't regret it.
Love Jane! He is so supportive and wonderful all around!
Jane is a fantastic professor! His lectures are interesting, engaging, and inspiring. He really loves his field and imparts that on his students. FYS was by far my favorite class.
He's understanding of certain things when it comes to deadlines. The only thing is he might be more enthusiastic about the material than you may be. But overall, he's a good teacher.
Professor Souleles was an amazing facilitator of critical thinking as well as a deeply compassionate, caring, and invested person who worked diligently to foster his students' success.

Great class, great professor. He's extremely smart but also relatable. Easy A but also a class you actually go to because it's interesting. He tries to keep it interesting and change things up! Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Really chill class. Great opportunity to  learn a lot without the pressure of needing to work insanely hard to get a good grade. Allows rewrites on all essays.

Absolutely terrible. Her grading was extremely unfair, failed just about everyone on every assignement and doesn't believe in giving perfect scores/100's. She is extremely rude with emails and any online interactions. She also ATE HER MOTHER'S ASHES ON CAMERA AND POSTED IT ON VIMEO. Extremely weird, rude teacher would absolutely never take again.
Had her at Northeastern. She's a nice person but she gave bizarre assignments, generally ran the class poorly, and I hardly learned anything. Would not recommend her class.
Very unfriendly yet demanding. Only interested in finding flaws in your work rather than helping you improve your work. Most importantly, plays favorite.
The course content is not easy and grades are dependent on test grades, but Professor Jackson is one of the most caring professors with an extremely entertaining lectures!

She's a very sweet and funny lady, but she cannot figure out technology for the life of her. Class starts a half an hour late because she can't work Zoom, even though its the end of the semester. Her PPTs are messy, have lots of typos, and pretty disorganized. Don't take this class if any part of it is online, it's not worth the frustration lmao

Memorize the slides.  I made my own practice exams based off EVERY possible question I could think of on the slides information.  My own practice questions were often identical to her test questions.  She is hysterical.  The subject material is fascinating!  Favorite class ever!  Don't worry if the class is full; she gives out consent codes.
He likes to talk about his personal success and weird Chinese jokes, the others are fine. Not too much work.
Cleary knows a lot about Computer Science, but often difficult to understand and spends too long on very niche details.

It is very difficult to understand what he says. He does not teach anything in class that can be used for the programming assignments and also does not tell students what topics the quiz is going to cover. Very inflexible with attendance and deadlines.

Worst professor I have had at brandeis. I cannot understand a word he says, he doesn't record any lectures (I wanted to watch in .5 speed) and said he expects at least 15 hours of work outside of class time. Also spends a majority of every class talking about how successful him and his research are.
Carmelinda is a very nice woman. This class is a fairly easy A, but just treat her with respect and do the online activities and voice recordings and you will do fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Super sweet and not a very tough grader.
Really clearly cares about students: she has great energy and was super accessible and helpful.

Davide is an excellent professor: smart, funny, relaxed and great at explaining even the most difficult concepts. He makes econometrics doable, and even fun, because he understands the difficulty of it. Expect to work hard in the class, but know that Davide will be helpful with any questions or concerns you have.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Professor Pettenuzzo did a great job of stimulating interest in the subject matter. His lectures were always clear cut and interactive. He was very respectful of student ideas and questions and his stock market game was a great hands on way to learn the material
He is an ok professor. His personality is not very nice.
Unorganised. Picks favourites. Unfair grading system. Class is basically taught by the students. Rude and condescending to students. Do not recommend this class.
course is okay, she's a nice person.

Garnick is truly a great professor. She is really knowledgeable about the course material, and if you're at all interested in the subject matter, you will love this class. She really values student feedback and getting to know her students. The workload is manageable and she is a very fair grader. Highly recommend!
Good teacher, able to meet on flexible schedule outside of class
I am a student who struggled with AP calculus in high school; professor Jill patiently helped me go through every concept I had problems with. Her office hours are genuinely wonderful.
Professor Jill is super sweet! There was some confusion on how grading would work, but overall, she is a great teacher!
The class was awesome. Just make sure you know how to use all of the rules/laws and you're good to go!

One of my favorite professors so far. Had him for both 1a and 17a and you can tell he cares more about his students understanding the material than strict grading. Most of the work came was participation and super short quizzes, and occasional essays. He's engaging, accessible, explains things well, and I'd definitely recommend a class with him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Eyal is an awesome professor. He is fun, engaging, and unlike other professors, the focus is on learning rather than testing and grades. He makes the class interesting, and he is always an email away.

Professor Lackner is the best, pretty funny and really nice, impressive lecturer. I didn't know much about space flights before taking the class but it was really inspirational. Taking notes during class is important. If you can focus for 3 hours sitting in the classroom, go for this class!!
Mandatory health class. Lots of lectures with so many slides, but his personality helps you get through it. Lots of online tests, some with incorrect right answers. I hate the online tests.

Man In Space: Lecture outline for each class is clear. Professor speaks slowly to make sure students understand the concepts presented. If you take good notes and attend every class (3.5 hours ), you can end up getting a good grade for this class. I would recommend this class to anyone who needs an upper level elective course for psych major :)

Very caring and kind teacher. If you really enjoy and love sociology you should definitely choose her class. My suggestion is that keep touch with her after class, she would kindly help you most of need include but not limited like help with homework, extensions with reasonable reasons, confusion.... I really like her.
Really understanding and passionate about their work
Super understanding professor who is very passionate about their class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Genuinely awful professor. She has a complete disregard for the success of her students and will actively go out of her way to make your life a living nightmare. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

very clear and interesting lectures, a genuinely nice professor. getting an A on an exam is very attainable, but you do have to review your notes thoroughly. no textbook use at all. not a very big workload at all either - just one presetation
Incredibly clear lectures. Uses both power point and  black boards...never a boring delivery.  Her genuine enthusiasm is apparent every class.  Definitely take something with professor Birren!

Good class and I definitely improved my writing, but prof said multiple times he didn't care about his job. He did seem to care about students though, and was a lot better in office hours than in class. Very insistent on students printing out work so be prepared to pay for printing (and it's a lot).
Such a great professor for workshops.  Gives incredibly helpful feedback and really cares about his students' writing.  Definitely recommend for writers.
McCauley is THE BEST! He is super caring, made my writing so great, and made every class fun. Def one of the best professors at Brandeis he's dope! Plus he cares about his students well being.

Professor Khashaba is one of the best professors I have ever had! Very, very organized and always more than willing to go the extra mile for her students when they aren't understanding the material. There are a lot of tests and quizzes, but you are able to make them up! Highly recommend taking her class if you are interested in Arabic language.

She is one of the most passionate teachers I've had. She cares about what she's teaching you and wants to make sure you get the most out of her class. She will hold you accountable for your work and effort and is not someone to mess with. She's really funny, a reasonable grader, and will explain things over and over again if need be. I recommend.

She's a great person who cares for her students. She tries different ways to teach and wants to make sure we understand the topics she's trying to convey. There is a textbook and it's important to have. It's important not to miss class and to study, as there is a lot of material, but she tries her best to make it interesting and interactive.

Professor Pei was an incredible instructor. He was always available to meet after class and clarify any questions you have. Econometrics is a hard course, but professor Pei did a great job of making it more manageable.  He's also one of the few professor at Brandeis that I would want to hang out with.
Awesome guy, great class. Made one of the "hardest" classes in the econ department simple.
Professor Pei really knows his econometrics and it shows in class.  He relies on the book for problem sets which are really not too difficult.  Love the class and he teaches it very well

She's a crazy old lady, but I love her. She assigns 3-10 pages of reading to each person and all we do in class is say what happened in our pages.It is VERY boring, but you don't need to do the reading.She is a stickler about grammar, so edit your papers.She tells stories about the DNA people she met and does NOT shut up. Listen and she'll like you
Dr. Cohen was an enthusiastic, caring, and entertaining professor. I loved her classes and learned a tremendous amount.
Is a great scientist but a horrible professor
Least favorite teacher, maybe ever. Negative orientation to feedback. Not particularly helpful.

Its mean to point out her physically. Nevertheless, I found her terribly annoying ,super discouraging and awfully disorganized. My hopes of writing were patronized by her condescending nature.. I felt ! I was forced to drop her class and LEARN BETTER ENGLISH ! Even though she teaches cool topics ... I suggest go for someone else !

Professor Farren was disorganized and often unprepared. She was very critical of her student's writing andher class was hard to perform well im. Yes, you do become a better writer, but its a struggle to get there and its not good for your gpa. Go with someone else. herleg has fungus too!!!

I have no idea what i was supposed to learn from this class.  He's a nice enough guy, but the topics were very up in the air, and I felt like i was listening to Business story-time than taking a class.  When it comes to assignments, I had no idea what he wanted from us because we didn't actually learn anything substantial.
No Comments
Probably the coolest dude...ever.
Professor DiBlasi is one of the most amazing and caring professor that I have encountered at Brandeis. She cares so much about students and has such a passion for organic chemistry!
Dr. DiBlasi was very helpful in office hours and her exams were pretty straightforward with the material that was covered in lecture.
Amazing professor. She truly cares about her students. Very nice and Helpful, thought organic chem. was going to be hell on earth, but she really made it enjoyable and interesting. Love her!

This is one of the best professors I've ever had at osu. She truly cares about what she is teaching and has fun doing so. This class was really hard but she made it understandable. She creates an environment where students aren't afraid to ask questions. She is not afraid to say when she doesn't know something.

She expects a lot out of her students and she's definitely difficult, but she is more than willing to help and she can explain the concepts better than anyone else I've ever met. She also tried to keep things fun and maintains a sense of humor during lectures, labs, office hours, etc.

Professor Thomas is a difficult teacher. I had her for inorganic chemistry and it was by far the most difficult course I have ever taken (harder than quantum and organic put together). She is a great teacher though and she's very helpful. As long as she see's that you're trying you should do fine.
If you're interested in combinatorics, this is the class that you can't miss!
Great professor! Organized course materials and lecture topics. Fair grading.
Clear lectures, helpful review sessions, frequent quizzes, and  easy exams
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Highly rec to take this class !!!!

I took his English 102 class, he is a very genuine instructor who values student's individual growth and interest. He is very understanding when it comes to deadlines, or anything really. Very respectful, and the class was fun and engaging but still challenging and mentally stimulating. W prof.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Pretty sick prof, cares about the subject and the students
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: pretty pretentious but they definitely care about students and our ideas. classes were a total waste of time doing worksheets and other busy work. they were never able to generate good discussion about readings, but to be fair the readings are boring to begin with. values creativity, so essays prompts are fairly broad to let you do your own thing

Very patient with the class, and motivates every concept with a logical progression of ideas. Starts with the basics, builds up to a theorem or definition, then goes over a few examples to show you how to actually do it. Very nice person.

Honestly I wish I had taken a class with this professor sooner. She is very understanding, and she strives to make sure you do well in her class. Her feedback helps you learn, and her lecture notes are very helpful. She goes over tough problems in class, to prepare us for exams and homework assignments. Model professor!

Literally the best professor I ever had in math!! So easy to reach out to her during office hours and has the most precise notes for every lecture. She was always fair in giving extensions especially when people are sick. I cannot wait to take another class with her!
Pretty easy mandatory class for business majors.

THE BEST! A boring class made fun! he talks a lot about his own experience which is way better than the textbook. This is an easy course with Lee. he cares about his students. Laid back and really engaging with students. I was never bored because its discussion based. Beware 30% of your grade is participation but you can say anything to get credit.

The worst professor, that i ever seen in my 12 year eductation.  hard grader also he got a really awful and bad teach assisant. usually give people he don't a f and 0 credit on particpation which weight 30 percent for the total grade.

He is going to teach you who should pay for the wall. Homework will be handed in class, so going to class is actually mandatory if you want to receive the homework assignments. Classes are clear but somewhat slow.

The content of this course could have been squeezed into half the time it took since most of it were repetitive. Quite often classes end early and you can tell that the professor did not prepare enough materials. The professor could show a little more focus since he frequently makes mistakes with illustrations, making his lecture notes confusing.

Although he is a nice guy and helpful, he should not be teaching with powerpoints of his dissertation. Classes were conducted with the same topics repeated multiple times and obvious lack of preparation for the class. His lack of caring for teaching, at least this class, is too apparent to be acceptable.

Great prof, cares a lot about students doing well, ensures you succeed as long as you put in the effort. He gives a decent amount of homework, but it isn't too time-consuming and it's always directly related to the course material. Really sweet and fun guy.

Professor Desiado is a very responsible teacher. When we are confused about course material, he will slow down and explain everything for us. He gives a lot of homework for us to practice, but these assignments are pretty helpful.
This class has a lot of homework, but he is very responsible and cares about his students. Recommend to take his class.
One of the worst professors I have ever had. I can't believe they let this man teach.
No Comments
No Comments

Prof. Zincavage is awesome. She challenged me to think out side the box and helped me gain confidence. She also really helped with my writing, great comments and suggestions on papers. I wish all my profs were this cool.
best class i have had at brandeis!
So disorganized, always late, never gives A's (to anyone!), nothing good to say about her except sometimes she brings snacks

First of all, the woman did not know how to run a discussion. Second of all, she was anything but respectful of student's opinions. She would tell us all how to interpret the readings and what to think of them. If we asked questions, she derided us and if we disagreed with her, she would make us sound like bad people. This was years ago, though.
Wonderful professor!

She is one of my favorite professors I have ever taken at Brandeis.  She is kind and respectful in regards to how she interacts with the students, and brilliant and observant in how she interacts with the texts.  Truly one of the best professors at Brandeis!
Great lecturers. Very knowledgeable.
Professor Paradis knows her stuff. She's super enthusiastic and friendly. She tends to repeat herself, and that can get frustrating over a long lecture.

For epidemiology she prints out all of the powerpoints. And I asked to take the test on a different day and she let me, no questions asked. In general she's very straightforward about what you have to learn. I love that we get cheat sheets for tests!

She is very understanding and helpful. She often asks the class if there is any confusion or questions and takes her time to go over them. Her tests are not difficult and she does curve when needed. Great person and professor

By far one of the kindest teachers I have had yet. Although not the most amazing lecturer, she tell you what you need to know and give many resources to learn on your own as well. All lectures are recorded. If she wasn't able to cover something during lecture then it won't be on the test, she is fair with grading and drops the lowest quiz grades.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: she's an adjunct professor and it shows. this lady does not know how to teach or make tests. you'll lose points on tests for the silliest things. it's a lot less about knowing the information and more about understanding what she's asking.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She focuses on graphs.
Mediocre at explaining the material but awful to try to get help from. Not helpful at all in person. Reminded me of a high school substitute teacher, not an award-winning college professor.
Grumpy old lady who will give you attitude for not getting it the first time. Not enthusiastic at all.

Prof. Kabrhel is an extremely knowledgeable person. Yes, her lectures are interesting and engaging, however, she is also amazing outside of the classroom. You can talk to her about anything and she truly does care for her students and their well-being. If you can, I would highly recommended taking one of her classes.

Prof. Kabrhel is the reason I am interested in Legal Studies! She is passionate about justice system reform, and works with incarcerated individuals. Prof. Kabrhel has so much knowledge to share with her students. Law & Psychology was a lecture based course, but she included multiple opportunities for discussion which I really enjoyed.

Professor Kabrhel is amazing and passionate about what she teaches. She's also extremely involved in so many things at Brandeis, so I recommend reaching out to her if you want to get hear more about the programs she runs/knows of.
Great course, but I would be careful of the group project at the end. Hold your group members accountable!!!

Prof. Kabhel is awesome! She's understanding about deadlines, gives constructive criticism when grading, is a fascinating lecturer, and brings in interesting guests for the class! Incredibly knowledgeable and papers were even sort of fun to write. Definitely take advantage of her office hours and get to know her- she's amazing!
Great professor. Very clear lectures, and very nice person.

Great professor. He explains things in a very understandable way, even when students stupid questions. And he is easy to reach out to outside of class or office hours. Genuinely cares about his students.

He is one of the most accommodating, supportive, and helpful professors. The lectures are clear and concise. He's mindful of student's private situations and is easily accessible after class for discussions or queries.

Aaron is the best. He is intelligent and caring and combines care for the subject matter with care for his students in every class. Students' thoughts are respected and, at times, respectfully challenged to help us learn. Take a class with Aaron and you'll be glad you did!!!
One of the best professors I've had at Brandeis. The class was super interesting, and Aaron did a really great job of leading the discussion and making sure everyone was heard. highly recommended

The best class I have ever taken at Brandeis and was taught by the best professor I have had here so far. This class was amazing. I felt like I actually learned without struggling so hard that it made me want to give up. If you want to be challenged comfortably when it comes to public speaking for litigation purposes, this is the class to take.

This was my first anthropology class and way out of my expertise/subject of study, but I learned a lot. Professor Horton is an amazing lecturer, deeply cares for his students, and taught me new perspectives about the world!

Cannot say enough amazing things about Prof. Horton. He was amazing and so passionate. The readings are tough so be prepared to compare yourself to others in the class, but he really values everyone's opinion. Participation is important, but he recognizes that people participate differently. Super understanding and knowledgable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: One of the most amazing professors I've ever had. His lectures are so engaging and entertaining. He cares immensely about his students and it shows in his teaching. My only complaint would be that the content he teaches is very difficult to understand. You gotta work for that A.

At first, I didn't like his lecturing style. It might take a bit to get used to but once you do it is completely fine. Homework is very hard, however, you get a lot of time to do it and he is very accommodating to help outside of class, and also doesn't get annoyed if you ask him questions during lectures. Very helpful in and outside of class.

Seemed a little strange at first, but he grew on me. A nice guy and a decent lecturer. Sometimes it's hard to follow him, but the material that he covers is very good. Homework is kind of hard, but he lets you resubmit problems so it's not that bad.

I took two classes with him. Gleb is a good lecturer. He explains things very clearly and his notes are really helpful! The homework might be a little difficult and require some more efforts. But you can always come to his office hours or TA's office hours with your questions. You can learn a lot and he is very patient.

Professor Ambrus is great, he is very knowledgable about all aspects of film, I learned a lot. He really cared about everyone's project, gave me feedback to every task I submitted, and at the end of the semester took us to watch our own films in the cinema with popcorn. He teaches and also shows what it's like to be a film professional.

The professor is very knowledgable about how to make films and videos, I learnt a lot. He is not strict in grading but gives readings and assignments. The difficulty in his courses are the video making tasks but he explains the technical details very well and gives great feedback and guidance. He also shares cool stories about his work on sets.

I think he's a filmmaker first and teacher second. This class was really easy but also super fun. He's knowledgeable and has some excellent insight into the process of filmmaking , but he just doesn't know how to teach. No grading criteria, and he doesn't give any feedback or grades on any individual assignments, no rules basically. Decent.

For the first half of the course her first response to questions was to google it. This resulted in spending 3 - 5 hours a night reading and figuring out how to do the homework for a course where the expectation was spending 10 to 15 hours a week on readings and homework. All the readings were sparse google docs that linked to outside sources.

Speaks in broken English. Has great difficulty understanding your question. Answer to questions are "just google it." HW instructions are vague and changes the grading criteria on day its due. Posts a disorganized overview document lecture. Does not teach python coding. Will fail if you do not have python and bash scripting experience.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The programming homework has very vague instructions. If you ask Shen a question to clarify it, she does not understand the question and does not answer the question. You will get a completely different answer. Sometimes she refers to the syllabus. English is not her strong suit. Her responses are difficult to understand. Avoid.

I did enjoy the class, but his lectures were dry at times and uninteresting. However, he did make up for it in other aspects of the class. His humor is nice and he knows his stuff but it is not his area of expertise.
The class had the potential to be really interesting, but he made every day extremely boring. His manner of teaching is incredibly dry. Not fun to go to his class.
he has definitely grown on me. he is very willing to help with essays/assignments...smart guy

it's a great opportunity to work on your creative writing and get great feedback from a published writer. she focused on poetry rather than prose for a lot of the semester, and workshopping and discussion was encouraged.  the atmosphere was so respectful and loving, i made one of my closest friends in this class!

As a creative writer, taking a class with Professor Bradfield is the best thing you could do here at Brandeis. The classes are good but the real magic happens during her office hours. When you show her your work and what you seek to improve, she will give PRACTICAL advice to make you be where you want to be. She's extremely kind.

Liz keeps the whole class engaged and excited to learn more about writing. We have writing prompts each week and review in class. I highly recommend this class, it is by far my favorite this year, and I wish Professor Bradfield taught more classes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: I took Liz's Poetry Workshop class and everyone in it who I've talked to has said the same thing - we love Liz. She's chill and willing to help you / talk to you about poetry (or anything) in class and out. She gives pretty insightful feedback on your poetry and is good at running workshops. The workshop was so awesome for my poetry.

The beat teacher I've ever had at Brandeis. I've learned so much from this writing class and to say I've been inspired by Liz would be an understatement. She has fueled my passion for poetry into something more meaningful than anything I could ever possibly ask for and I am so incredibly grateful. The workshops are small so participation is a must.

Podorefsky is a great professor because he takes the time to make sure the class knows the material. At times, the class is boring because he teaches slower so everyone understands the lesson, but he goes slower for the topics that will appear on the exams. If you participate frequently, you will do very well in the class. Tests are straightforward
Really difficult material and the lectures are boring so it's hard to pay attention. Participation counts for a lot so make sure he knows you
Podorefsky wants you to understand the material and makes sure you do before continuing on. He keeps you interested in the material.

I really loved Prof Rosenberg. He's very knowledgeable and makes everything relevant and interesting. He has high expectations, but he also really cares about his students and is great at leading discussions and making complex concepts/readings accessible. He makes the most of his class time, so it's def best to show up & on time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This was a fun class - the homework was to watch movies to discuss in class, and the 3 tests were take home essays (5 pages max, two essays), plus a final essay.  I found him to be an easy grader, but it depends a lot on your level of Spanish. The class wasn't always riveting but I chalk that up as much to other students not participating as to him

One of the most pompous professors I have ever had. He is very knowledgeable and bright but makes students feel intimidated and doesn't show a genuine care for his students. Beware before you take a class with him even if you are more than proficient in the language. He is not helpful.

Professor Chad Williams was extremely knowledgeable about the history and study of African and African American Studies. I was sometimes confused about the grading criteria, but his office hours were insightful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Mr. Williams is great, he really has a knack for connecting with the students, and making class somewhat enjoyable. I took his Hip-Hop course and he even performed a rap for us. The class included many engaging activities such as graffiti, freestyling and more. The classes can be a bit long, but not much homework outside of group discussion.

He's so nice! I really liked him. The class could be a bit boring at times but overall pretty good, and a very important topic. The only bad thing about the class is it requires a research paper based on a photograph, which is a bit weird. I recommend AAAS 5a especially for fulfilling the DJW requirement.

One of the gems of Brandeis in the African Studies dept. He's a very well respected and kind professor and cares for his students. Makes you think! Some may find his class challenging (3 to 4 on a scale) but if you do your part and write good essays and reflections you'll do great. Do the readings (they're interesting) and Don't procrastinate.

I had a pretty good time in a UWS course, which judging by the experiences I've heard from everyone else is at the very least statistically improbable.  She gave good and very clear presentations about some stuff that we never really talk about when it comes to writing, as well as the typical stuff like how to write a conclusion.

Lots of assignments, but she is very understanding about giving extensions. If you want more specific feedback, she is accessible outside of class. The topics of this class weren't my cup of tea, but I did find that my writing skills improved. The workload was tough but you learn a lot about writing techniques and resources at Brandeis.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: She tried to teach us how to better our writing but all I learned was how to do a new form of citations. gives poor feedback on writing. when she's asked for clarity on something she can never explain what she means. gives way too many homework assignments. not very passionate about what she's teaching. you should avoid taking her class.

A ton of reading. It's very easy to just show up and pass, because the whole thing is self-graded. He's a really nice teacher, and the class dynamic is cool because he's big into small seminars and a lot of participation. However, a lot of people take the classes just to fill a requirement, so the discussions often aren't stimulating.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Amazing professor. Very low work commitment.
Most amazing class. Self-graded. So much support. Highly recommend

Kind, smart, and really cares about teaching and engaging students. Would recommend her class simply because of how patient she is with teaching students and overall class wasn't too difficult either. 10 out of 10, would take again
Had operations management with her. She was goated.

Prof Nemutlu is super sweet and knows the course material well. Make the effort to go to her office hours if you're ever confused and she'll help you out really well. Overall, amazing professor, and as long as you put in the effort, the course won't be hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Worst professor ever. Is not even a professor.

Amezquita has consistently released his students half an hour early every single class (except for the one time when we had a quiz that took about 20 minutes). That is an entire hour lost of instruction for immunology, a course that needs lots of instruction in order to actually be digestible for students, every single week 
PART 1, READ FOR PART 2
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I get it's his first time teaching and he has a day job but he does not know how to teach undergrads. He expects us to read hundreds of pages of a Ph.D. level textbook instead of lecturing, and also hasn't honored any of the feedback students have given him about slowing down the pace. Even top students want to drop, totally not worth the headache
Frustrating
Very difficult. Hard to reach out to.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Hates grading (as a concept and a task) so you will get an A in his class if you show even the slightest bit of effort. Challenges you to think critically and will ask the guiding questions you need to get to the answers on your own. He is an encyclopedia of economic and banking knowledge and has the resume to back it up. Really funny too.
This professor is the worst I have ever had. He gives no guidelines when giving instructions and so unclear

Most of class was spent playing on our laptops while he talked about things that had nothing to do with the class. He compared my essay to a third grader and never gave any constructive criticism - just criticism. Would not recommend taking a class with him.

I wrote two full papers in this class, and one of them was hard-capped at 1250 words. How was 9th grade Humanities orders of magnitude harder than a college-level writing course? Asks no significant work of students besides 250-500 word filler prompts which can be autopiloted each week and mean nothing. I did nothing, learned nothing, and got an A+

Very intelligent and knowledgable, just wished he spent more time on this class as opposed to other responsibilities. Tests were fairly easy, but HW did not correspond to lectures and tests did not correspond to HWs, which made it very stressful. I really liked the content, but unfortunately a lot of this class is figuring it out on your own.

Course material is tough! If you wanna learn get ready to read a lot of theoretical mathy stuff. Prof.Pustejovsky is a great lecturer and is very understanding. Most of the work is projects which you don't need to pay attention in class for. The TAs cover them during recitation. The few quizzes are pretty tough but everything is on the slides

Never thought such theoretical and abstract topics could be explained so clearly right in class. Never thought I would be interested in Computational Linguistic - Now I am considering independent studies and employment in this field. Besides being an awesome teacher James is also a running encyclopedia and world leading in his research.
Incredibly open to student comments and feedback, and an easy grader

Ilana Szobel is why I attend Brandeis. She is insightful and prepares for each class discussion. I have yet to space out for any significant portion of class, furthermore, she is super engaging and reaches students regardless of their previous knowledge on the subject. She is perhaps the only person in her department that knows how to teach.

Professor Szobel is an amazing teacher. She definitely knows what she's talking about and is very considerate of her students. She is by far the most understanding teacher I have ever met. Her Israeli Lit/Film/Culture class is largely discussion based so do the readings and come prepared with your own analysis/opinions/questions.
A great professor. Made class interesting and funny, plus he really wants to help students.

Thomas Barnet-Lamb is a great professor, definitely the best math teacher I've ever had.  He made multivariable calculus fun, and is always willing to help.  His jokes are good in a lame way, and his class in general is very enjoyable.  His class isn't easy, but if you work hard, you'll get the grade you deserve.
Well prepared and Excellent lectures.Funny jokes.~ Strong British acctent. Also don't miss any class cuz he'll cover tremendous amount of information at each class.
He is a wonderful lecturer. If you are still considering about Art, take his class and you will have your final decision! Best class.
He goes by his first name, Chris. He is a very keen professor and makes classes extremely engaging and informative. A very encouraging and cool guy.

Excellent professor. Concepts and projects are interesting, stimulating, and well-thought-out. He is very approachable and willingly available for questions and help, even outside of class. Cool dude, too. Quirky sense of humor. Rates you based on YOU and how hard YOU try, rather than some crazy standards. Loved him. :)
Great Professor, very knowledgable and easy to learn from
Great!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I took "Genocide and Mass Killing in the 20th Century" Super interesting class. Very relevant and a good discussion topic. I enjoyed this class and liked the assignments I received.

Really kind guy, great lecturer. Lots of readings and homework, but he's not a tough grader. If you show that you care and it's clear that you're putting in effort, you'll get a good grade. He's thoughtful and balanced, and will play devil's advocate to ensure you understand your own argument. Super smart guy, really informed & well-read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Incredible lecturer

Ive had Prof El-Tobgui for a year of Arabic thus far. He certainly makes a difficult language even harder by emphasizing minor grammatical elements, but ultimately I know its for the best. Hes very serious in class but will loosen up a bit if you encourage him. He makes you work extremely hard and holds high expectations, but its worth it.

Professor Diouf definitely had a good heart, but her class structure was confusing and our course resource page was disorganized. This led to our class receiving several unnecessary lectures about doing assignments incorrectly. When the problem was the foundational materials we received. Definitely a good class topic, but executed poorly.

I took class 170A, which was a huge mistake of mine. The lectures are dull and boring. Prof. Diouf drones on and on, simply reading words from a presentation. She does not facilitate discussion, if by chance, you get lucky enough to voice your opinion...she shuts it down, or talks over.  Take this class if you have trouble sleeping.

Professor Diouf is brilliant and the readings and her lectures were really interesting, but she couldn't facilitate discussions at all, assignments were sporadic, and grading expectations were confusing. Interesting and easy, but ultimately kind of disappointing.

Prof Diouf is interesting but very confusing. You'll get an A just for submitting assignments but it is obvious she genuinely wants you to learn. Her discussions can get get quite confusing and can seem like she's talking in circles.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: No tests, just papers. The prof is very good at giving feedback and is knowledgeable in different topics. Made me think in new perspective. We took bi-weekly 3-hour walks, sometimes in rain/snow. If you don't like walking, this class might not be for you, but the prof is great. Some readings were quite interesting to read, but there was a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Accessible outside class

comment: As long as your writing is clear and concise, you should be able to get a good grade in class. He also really appreciates your input and participation matters a lot!! Professor Menoret is knowledgeable across many fields. Hands down one of the best professors I've had at brandeis. I loved his interdisciplinary approach to ecology and society.

The class was interesting, I learned a lot, and he didn't just lecture the whole time. However, be aware that if you get a B on a single assignment (even one worth 10% of your grade) then you cannot get an A in the class due to the points system that he uses (but doesn't tell anyone he uses until the end of the semester).

Simon is not a professor but the most amazing person in the department. I went to his tutoring sessions for MATH 10a every week and he was so much more helpful than my actual professor. You can tell he deeply cares about his students, as he puts in so much effort to get to know them. He is a great person and great teacher. Thank you Simon!
He is not a professor but he is so supportive and helpful! Easy grader and so caring. Attendance not really mandatory but I still go to class. He is so chill 100/100

It was an easy class to begin with, so not bad. However, I liked him. He was a graduate student, but always went through a problem if you ever understood it. His explaining can be a bit hard, b it if you try to understand and work with him youll get it

His lectures are filled with real world examples, and he does a really good job explaining concepts in a straightforward way, and spends a lot of time explaining graphs. His lectures were also quite participatory which is a usually tough to accomplish, especially during an online class.
Very Chill

He is a cute guy and is able to make the boring&hard thing interesting. Tests and HWs are hard but the curves are heavy. The lectures are interesting and you'll pass if pay attention in class. I've been to his office hours only twice was he was always helpful. You'll like him if you get his sense of humor:)
ask him to give extra credit for writing the midterm cheatsheets on a pumpkin
i love aram

Apyan is a lovely and well respected in the field. He just started teaching, so he'll probably get better at it. Tried to make the class engaging, but not the best lecturer. He puts too much burden on the students to learn the material by giving ridiculously difficult HW, and only talks about theory in class. Take him but maybe not for intro

Professor Gable is one of the funniest, most understanding/respectful, and most humbly intelligent professors I've ever had. I had her for UWS: Zombies, and the assignments were very thoroughly explained and supported by the activities we did in class. The professor was very flexible about individual work pace as long as you did the work.

Had her for UWS Zombies and Society and I found the class really fun. The class was based off of some weekly assignments and two essays and the workload was really light. Professor Gable was really accommodating with deadlines and was usually available to meet outside of class. Would definitely recommend a UWS class with her.
I had so much fun in UWS Zombies and Society: Reading and Writing the Undead! Great class and fantastic teacher!

Amazing class and great professor. Important to do reading and show up, but text is great and grading criteria are clear. Guive cares earnestly about students doing well and gives people every chance to succeed. Difficult to find a professor who puts more thought into his syllabus. This is the kind of class you can discuss during job interviews.
One of the best professors in Brandeis. Nice grader. Very knowledgable and inspiring.
Professor Russo Garrido is an amazing professor. No one has been more attentive to her students. If you have a chance to take a class with her, please do so. You will not regret it.

excellent Professor, very helpful, very approachable. She will look at your essays and gives you feedback before you submit if you ask, I am amazed she is such a caring professor, because not many professors in Brandeis are willing to do extra works.
king of all kings
Extremely helpful and points out pros and cons of project. Very approachable and really cares about students. love him!

Prof. Zinner is amazing. He is passionate about the subject; makes the lectures simple and is flexible towards students. The TAs and he provide great feedback for exams/assignments. Furthermore, if you need some time or can not make it due to a reasonable reason, he will provide extra time and work alongside you to remove stress. He is caring.
Great professor and great class, very easy to engage in class, just make sure to do the reading. He is very nice and is a great lecturer. I would recommend anyone to take his class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's a very well respected teacher with a great sense of humor (be aware). Going to his office hrs and doing research helps in his class. Hw is fairly challenging so prepare for that. Helped me a lot with my health policy pursuits. His lectures are never boring and he's very enthusiastic and caring towards students.

Really seems to enjoy what he teaches, II liked how he went into the philosophy of it. He's a bit monotone and often ends class late, but still makes it engaging. There's no easy w(A)y out of this course, so all things considered he's a solid pick.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Get ready for the most interesting math class of your life. Okay, so he isn't the most charismatic lecturer in the world. Welcome to the math department. But is he clearly in love with the subject matter? Yes. Does he manage to somehow impart that love onto his students? Yes. Does he teach math in the most interesting way imaginable? Yes.

This was quite honestly the worst class I've taken at Brandeis in my three years here. The professor is so unorganized and incredibly rude. I was taking notes and she refused to hand back a test because she thought I was messing around. She gives no useful feedback, and has the most boring lectures I have ever been to. Do not take.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Hedstrom is a deeply knowledgable, engaging, and interesting professor, even in BISC 8B, a science course for non-science majors. She is able to provide clear explanations of complex topics while encouraging student participation.
lectures are crap but the tests are easy
Awful lecturer. She uses pdf notes which are difficult to understand and super BORING. I didn't learn much from her and ended up teaching myself.

Professor Levisohn is very nice and makes a real effort to get to know his students. Make sure you take tons of notes on the class conversations! Although you may not think it matters, you will definitely regret it when it comes to the midterm and final.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you like working insanely hard and still getting a bad grade, this professor is for you. He gives an insane amount of work and is beyond unclear about grading policies and then gives you a bad grade. He is a very inefficient lecturer. You will be bored in his class, not because the information is boring, but because he is a bad lecturer.

Cathy is truly amazing and so inspirational. Amazing artist and creative thinker. Extremely supportive and gives words of encouragement and validation when she notices you are a hard worker. She could do a better job at being at being reachable out of class and responding to emails, it is also a professor's responsibility to do so.

Cathy's the most incredible teacher I've ever had. She's so passionate about the material and genuinely wants her students to learn and grow as artists, which I did, immensely. If there was ever something complex or difficult I wanted to add to my piece, she never asked me to tone it down, but instead found a way to make it happen. Cathy's amazing!
Good professor

Just stay away from this class unless youre the type who can just read overly complicated math equations and understand. That all the lecture is, low effort slides ripped from the book with equation after equation. The homeworks however are mostly programming thats gone over in recitation taught by TAs. So lectures are just a waste of time
One of the kindest people you will ever meet. He has a lot of knowledge to share, and his class is always enjoyable, as it provides a safe space to have difficult conversations.

Prof Sampath is probably 1 of my top 3 favorite professors at Brandeis. It's very obvious that he has great regard for humanities and ethical topics, and he's very caring for all of his students. He is genuinely interested in the things that you have to say and is more than willing to discuss and help out with our careers. He is a great mentor.

very surprised there aren't more ratings here , one of the best in psych department , currently on maternity leave but very sweet and down to earth , easy assignments and does her best to make sure lectures are interesting and engaging , she makes the class environment feel cozy , very great to work with
This course was in the morning, and she allowed us to just watch it from online, even though attendance was recommended.

Psych 10A with Prof Clark is quite easy. I never went to lecture and landed an A-. Quizzes are asynchronous and open note/internet. Prof Clark seems nice. Some grading TAs are tough though so make sure you turn in homework on time and do a thorough job on papers and open responses.
She is very kind. This course is not very hard.

It was an okay class, I honestly feel like I learned a lot, but it can get pretty boring quick as we quickly settle into a rhythm of doing Pair Work textbook activities every class. Good class content though, just monotonous. Homework is a time sink, she assigns so many easy worksheets from the workbook, they require no thought but so much time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment:
She's really understanding and would often extend deadlines to help students out.
She truly cares about her students. One of the most caring profs I've had :)
She is sooo kind. She has an accent. The lecture slides are pretty detailed, but sometimes she may say something that explains them better though.

Very sweet professor. She cares about every one of her students and makes it known. There are a total of three examsThey are all manageable if you pay attention and stay on top of things. First exam is very easy it is the same as the classwork questions and textbook questions. She tells u which questions to study. The second and final exam are hard
Dont turn in anything late, def tough with grading.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Interesting material but you move so fast through it that to learn it all is incredibly difficult. Tests are hard but only 3 in the semester. TA does all the grading on the HW and Soroush grades the tests. Easy enough to meet with him and he can be helpful one on one.
Very inconsistent teaching with no real guidance and support from instructor. Assignment instructions always unclear and feedback never provided substance. I would NOT recommend this instructor.
Course focuses on posts rather than content.  More like a community college public speaking class rather than a graduate level.  Look for other professor.
Good guy, class was easy as long as you actually read the books and handouts. Always willing to help you revise your papers.
No Comments

This class got a very bad reputation, but if you work hard and reach out for help when you need it, you can do well. Go too lecture and office hours. Talk to your TA when you need help and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The tests don't contain any of the formulas you need, so the tests are very memorization heavy. While Professor McGregor doesn't contribute much to the class your class experience depends primarily on your TAs.

A really nice prof and usually gives you a lot of encouragement even if you're not doing well. Will give extra credits sometimes but don't expect too much from it, try to do well on the exams and homework in stead. Everything on the exam are taken almost directly from the study guides so review it carefully and you will get at least a 80%
Awesome teacher.  Learned really well in his class and he really got me into the math major.
Great guy! Easy tests! Super helpful!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Get ready to read

comment: Physics was so reasonable and tests are so fair. Great lectures and easy to reach on office hours

She's the best! Speaks to us mostly in Spanish so that we will learn, but encourages us to ask questions about anything we don't know. Be ready to participate in class, because she truly does want you to learn the language. She's very nice and friendly!

Literally just reads out of the book. Not engaging at all. I feel like I've fallen behind due to the lack of engaging material. Literally spend this whole class watching the clock. She is very confusing and hard to deal with. Planning on switching languages next year as I have heard that the other language departments here are much better.

Coming from Rus-10a I was very excited for this class. Unfortunately, Curt managed to kill my enthusiasm (and my classmates) for learning Russian. Not only is he, at best, a boring lecturer but he also seemed to have very little consideration for the duress of his students, piling an entire unit into the last two days of class. Stay away.
Professor Woolhiser is an excellent teacher, and the Russian department at Brandeis is truly phenomenal.

Professor child is honestly such a gem in the AAAS and history department at Brandeis. His classes are fun and engaging covering topics like the history of graffiti and resistance and revolutions across Latin America. He is hands-down the best professor I've ever had because he cares about what students need in order to learn Meaningfully.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Childs is an incredible teacher who is deeply knowledgeable about black global history in Latin America, the Caribbean, and Africa. His lectures are thorough, engaging, and creates a dynamic with the class that ensures everyone is following and clear about the material. Would highly recommend :)

He was a ver harsh grader for essays but only gave minimal feedback and never explained the grade he gave you. His slides were confusing and he refused to post them after class making it very hard to take notes. He also lacked motivation and excitement and missed multiple classes. He class page was extremely confusing.
One of my best professors. Super caring, and makes it clear that as long as you engage in class you'll do well. Made anthropology really interesting. Looking forward to his other classes!!
One of the best professors I have taken at Brandeis. The Introduction to Anthropology course was amazing. We got to read some cool stuff and the class discussions were amazing.
He is a great professor, super engaging and he brings cupcakes occasionally- so come to class!

Assigns a lot of reading and classes are very discussion-based.  Offers a lot of opportunities to ask questions and go over things.  Really good at facilitating discussion, but if you don't like to talk, I'd look for a different class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: His class is extremely unstructured and he expects his students to be very independent. However, he is very caring and helpful if you require assistance. He also gives a lot of opportunities for students to improve their grades and is very honest with his students about their progress. If you do what he asks of you, you will certainly succeed.

His class is pretty unstructured, which was daunting because I was unsure how I was doing in the class, but his obvious passion for the subject, his kindness, his energy, all make up for this. He can be forward with feedback, but not in a rude way. His work is not difficult, and we got to choose how our work progressed, and he was there to support.

It is evident that Professor Wallace is passionate about teaching others. He is very strict about deadlines and about formatting your papers. Trust and believe that after this class, you will know how to write and apply feedback given to you. Extra brownie points for him because he brought us treats from Jamaica for our final class together.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Take this class.  Trust me.  There just aren't better professors around and the subject matter is really eye opening.

Wallace is the best prof I've had here. Absolutely infectious with energy, I've got hella ADHD and still managed to get through his class well. Doing pedagogy, he also gets how to make learning a good process that isn't just depositing knowledge into empty minds. Also, made sure all the readings were available free online so we didn't have to pay
